quote: 'Age' is the acceptance of a term of years. But maturity is the glory of years.
author: Martha Graham

quote: 'Beauty is truth, truth beauty,' - that is all ye know on earth, and all ye need to know.
author: John Keats

quote: 'Dallas' hit a chord back in the late Seventies and Eighties because it was the age of greed: here you have this unapologetic character who is mean and nasty and ruthless and does it all with an evil grin. I think people related to JR back then because we all have someone we know exactly like him. Everyone in the world knows a JR.
author: Larry Hagman

quote: 'Evil men have no songs.' How is it that the Russians have songs?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: 'Handsome' means many things to many people. If people consider me handsome, I feel flattered - and have my parents to thank for it. Realistically, it doesn't hurt to be good-looking, especially in this business.
author: Richard Chamberlain

quote: 'Healing,' Papa would tell me, 'is not a science, but the intuitive art of wooing nature.'
author: W. H. Auden

quote: 'Home Alone' was a movie, not an alibi.
author: Jerry Orbach

quote: 'Men have forgotten this truth,' said the fox. 'But you must not forget it. You become responsible, forever, for what you have tamed.'
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: 'No Child Left Behind' requires states and school districts to ensure that all students are learning and are reaching their highest potential. Special education students should not be left out of these accountability mechanisms.
author: Dianne Feinstein

quote: 'Pure experience' is the name I gave to the immediate flux of life which furnishes the material to our later reflection with its conceptual categories.
author: William James

quote: 'The time has come,' the walrus said, 'to talk of many things: of shoes and ships - and sealing wax - of cabbages and kings.'
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: 'Therefore' is a word the poet must not know.
author: Andre Gide

quote: 'Til the infallibility of human judgements shall have been proved to me, I shall demand the abolition of the penalty of death.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: 'Tis always morning somewhere in the world.
author: Richard Henry Horne

quote: 'Tis best to weigh the enemy more mighty than he seems.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: 'Tis better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: 'Tis easy enough to be pleasant, When life flows along like a song But the man worth while is the one who will smile when everything goes dead wrong.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: 'Tis education forms the common mind just as the twig is bent the tree's inclined.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: 'Tis healthy to be sick sometimes.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: 'Tis skill, not strength, that governs a ship.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: 'Tis the business of little minds to shrink but he whose heart is firm, and whose conscience approves his conduct, will pursue his principles unto death.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: 'Tis the last rose of summer Left blooming alone All her lovely companions Are faded and gone.
author: Thomas More

quote: 'Tis very certain the desire of life prolongs it.
author: Lord Byron

quote: 'Tis well enough for a servant to be bred at an University. But the education is a little too pedantic for a gentleman.
author: William Congreve

quote: (On seeing a former lover for the first time in years) I thought I told you to wait in the car.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: 15 minutes a day! Give me just this and I'll prove I can make you a new man.
author: Charles Atlas

quote: 1988 I also received from the city of Vienna the cross of honour for art and science. These titles and the various honors mean a great deal to me, most of all for the reason that they would mean a great deal to my parents too.
author: Leon Askin

quote: 90 percent of my time is spent on 10 percent of the world.
author: Colin Powell

quote: 90%, 100% are going there to hear the singing. The story is another thing. Nobody's interested in the story. Happiness is happiness.
author: Cab Calloway

quote: A 'scream' is always just that - a noise and not music.
author: Carl Jung

quote: A Bill of Rights is what the people are entitled to against every government, and what no just government should refuse, or rest on inference.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: A Boss in Heaven is the best excuse for a boss on earth, therefore If God did exist, he would have to be abolished.
author: Mikhail Bakunin

quote: A Code of Honor: Never approach a friend's girlfriend or wife with mischief as your goal. There are just too many women in the world to justify that sort of dishonorable behavior. Unless she's really attractive.
author: Bruce Jay Friedman

quote: A Conservative Government is an organized hypocrisy.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A Conservative is a fellow who is standing athwart history yelling 'Stop!'
author: William F. Buckley, Jr.

quote: A God without dominion, providence, and final causes, is nothing else but fate and nature.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: A James Cagney love scene is one where he lets the other guy live.
author: Bob Hope

quote: A Libertarian society of unfettered individualism spreads its benefits to virtually everyone - not just those who have the resources to seize political power.
author: Harry Browne

quote: A State without the means of some change is without the means of its conservation.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: A University should be a place of light, of liberty, and of learning.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A am a great friend of public amusements, they keep people from vice.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: A baby is God's opinion that life should go on.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: A bachelor's life is a fine breakfast, a flat lunch, and a miserable dinner.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: A bad book is as much of a labor to write as a good one, it comes as sincerely from the author's soul.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: A bad book is the worse that it cannot repent. It has not been the devil's policy to keep the masses of mankind in ignorance but finding that they will read, he is doing all in his power to poison their books.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: A bad man is the sort who weeps every time he speaks of a good woman.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: A bad peace is even worse than war.
author: Tacitus

quote: A ball player has to be kept hungry to become a big leaguer. That's why no boy from a rich family has ever made the big leagues.
author: Joe DiMaggio

quote: A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it.
author: Bob Hope

quote: A battle lost or won is easily described, understood, and appreciated, but the moral growth of a great nation requires reflection, as well as observation, to appreciate it.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: A belief in hell and the knowledge that every ambition is doomed to frustration at the hands of a skeleton have never prevented the majority of human beings from behaving as though death were no more than an unfounded rumor.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: A bell's not a bell 'til you ring it, A song's not a song 'til you sing it, Love in your heart wasn't put there to stay, Love isn't love 'til you give it away!
author: Oscar Hammerstein II

quote: A better world shall emerge based on faith and understanding.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: A bird doesn't sing because it has an answer, it sings because it has a song.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: A blank wall of social and professional antagonism faces the woman physician that forms a situation of singular and painful loneliness, leaving her without support, respect or professional counsel.
author: Elizabeth Blackwell

quote: A blessed thing it is for any man or woman to have a friend, one human soul whom we can trust utterly, who knows the best and worst of us, and who loves us in spite of all our faults.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: A book has got smell. A new book smells great. An old book smells even better. An old book smells like ancient Egypt.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: A book is a fragile creature, it suffers the wear of time, it fears rodents, the elements and clumsy hands. so the librarian protects the books not only against mankind but also against nature and devotes his life to this war with the forces of oblivion.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: A book is good company. It is full of conversation without loquacity. It comes to your longing with full instruction, but pursues you never.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: A book is sent out into the world, and there is no way of fully anticipating the responses it will elicit. Consider the responses called forth by the Bible, Homer, Shakespeare - let alone contemporary poetry or a modern novel.
author: Chaim Potok

quote: A boy's story is the best that is ever told.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: A broad margin of leisure is as beautiful in a man's life as in a book. Haste makes waste, no less in life than in housekeeping. Keep the time, observe the hours of the universe, not of the cars.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: A building has integrity just like a man. And just as seldom.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: A business absolutely devoted to service will have only one worry about profits. They will be embarrassingly large.
author: Henry Ford

quote: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
author: Henry Ford

quote: A car for every purse and purpose.
author: Alfred P. Sloan

quote: A careful inspection showed them that, even if they succeeded in righting it by themselves, the cart would travel no longer. The axles were in a hopeless state, and the missing wheel was shattered into pieces.
author: Kenneth Grahame

quote: A caricature is putting the face of a joke on the body of a truth.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: A casual stroll through the lunatic asylum shows that faith does not prove anything.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A celibate clergy is an especially good idea, because it tends to suppress any hereditary propensity toward fanaticism.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: A chain is no stronger than its weakest link, and life is after all a chain.
author: William James

quote: A chair is a very difficult object. A skyscraper is almost easier. That is why Chippendale is famous.
author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quote: A change in the weather is sufficient to recreate the world and ourselves.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: A chief event of life is the day in which we have encountered a mind that startled us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A chief is a man who assumes responsibility. He says 'I was beaten,' he does not say 'My men were beaten.'
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A child is owed the greatest respect if you have ever have something disgraceful in mind, don't ignore your son's tender years.
author: Juvenal

quote: A child of five would understand this. Send someone to fetch a child of five.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: A child who is allowed to be disrespectful to his parents will not have true respect for anyone.
author: Billy Graham

quote: A child's education should begin at least one hundred years before he is born.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: A child, from the time he can think, should think about all he sees, should suffer for all who cannot live with honesty, should work so that all men can be honest, and should be honest himself.
author: Jose Marti

quote: A city is a place where there is no need to wait for next week to get the answer to a question, to taste the food of any country, to find new voices to listen to and familiar ones to listen to again.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: A civilization is a heritage of beliefs, customs, and knowledge slowly accumulated in the course of centuries, elements difficult at times to justify by logic, but justifying themselves as paths when they lead somewhere, since they open up for man his inner distance.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A civilization is built on what is required of men, not on that which is provided for them.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A civilized nation can have no enemies, and one cannot draw a line across a map, a line that doesn't even exist in nature and say that the ugly enemy lives on the one side, and good friends live on the other.
author: Thor Heyerdahl

quote: A civilized society is one which tolerates eccentricity to the point of doubtful sanity.
author: Robert Frost

quote: A claim for equality of material position can be met only by a government with totalitarian powers.
author: Friedrich August von Hayek

quote: A clever, imagination, humorous request can open closed doors and closed minds.
author: Percy Ross

quote: A cloudy day or a little sunshine have as great an influence on many constitutions as the most recent blessings or misfortunes.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: A coldly rationalist individualist can deny that he has any obligation to make sacrifices for the future.
author: Garrett Hardin

quote: A comedian's body is funny as well as his mind being funny, his whole personage is funny.
author: Bobby Darin

quote: A comfortable house is a great source of happiness. It ranks immediately after health and a good conscience.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: A comfortable old age is the reward of a well-spent youth. Instead of its bringing sad and melancholy prospects of decay, it would give us hopes of eternal youth in a better world.
author: Maurice Chevalier

quote: A commitment to human rights cannot be fostered simply through the transmission of knowledge. Action and experience play a crucial role in the learning process.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: A committee is a group that keeps minutes and loses hours.
author: Milton Berle

quote: A company is only as good as the people it keeps.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: A company is stronger if it is bound by love rather than by fear.
author: Herb Kelleher

quote: A competent and self-confident person is incapable of jealousy in anything. Jealousy is invariably a symptom of neurotic insecurity.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: A complacent satisfaction with present knowledge is the chief bar to the pursuit of knowledge.
author: B. H. Liddell Hart

quote: A compliment is something like a kiss through a veil.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A conqueror is always a lover of peace.
author: Karl Von Clausewitz

quote: A conservative is a man who just sits and thinks, mostly sits.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: A conservative is a man with two perfectly good legs who, however, has never learned how to walk forward.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: A conservative is someone who makes no changes and consults his grandmother when in doubt.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: A conversation goes sometimes into personal things and that's nicer. You look to each other and you have a different picture, you get into a relationship.
author: Maximilian Schell

quote: A conversation is a dialogue, not a monologue. That's why there are so few good conversations: due to scarcity, two intelligent talkers seldom meet.
author: Truman Capote

quote: A couple of weeks is a long time in American politics.
author: Peter Jennings

quote: A coward is incapable of exhibiting love it is the prerogative of the brave.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A creative man is motivated by the desire to achieve, not by the desire to beat others.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: A critic is a man who knows the way but can't drive the car.
author: Kenneth Tynan

quote: A cult is a religion with no political power.
author: Tom Wolfe

quote: A day spent praising the earth and lamenting man's pollutionist history makes you feel like a superior, sensitive soul.
author: Russell Baker

quote: A day spent without the sight or sound of beauty, the contemplation of mystery, or the search of truth or perfection is a poverty-stricken day and a succession of such days is fatal to human life.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: A decision once taken brings peace to a man's mind and eases his soul.
author: Mika Waltari

quote: A definition of poetry can only determine what poetry should be and not what poetry actually was and is otherwise the most concise formula would be: Poetry is that which at some time and some place was thus named.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: A democracy which makes or even effectively prepares for modern, scientific war must necessarily cease to be democratic. No country can be really well prepared for modern war unless it is governed by a tyrant, at the head of a highly trained and perfectly obedient bureaucracy.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: A democratic government is the only one in which those who vote for a tax can escape the obligation to pay it.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: A designer knows he has achieved perfection not when there is nothing left to add, but when there is nothing left to take away.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A desire to be in charge of our own lives, a need for control, is born in each of us. It is essential to our mental health, and our success, that we take control.
author: Robert Foster Bennett

quote: A desire to resist oppression is implanted in the nature of man.
author: Tacitus

quote: A difference of taste in jokes is a great strain on the affections.
author: George Eliot

quote: A diplomat is a man who always remembers a woman's birthday but never remembers her age.
author: Robert Frost

quote: A discipline I have observed is an attitude of love and reverence to people.
author: Bessie Head

quote: A dog barks when his master is attacked. I would be a coward if I saw that God's truth is attacked and yet would remain silent.
author: John Calvin

quote: A dog is the only thing on earth that loves you more than you love yourself.
author: Josh Billings

quote: A dream doesn't become reality through magic it takes sweat, determination and hard work.
author: Colin Powell

quote: A dream is a scripture, and many scriptures are nothing but dreams.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is a reality.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: A dream you dream alone is only a dream. A dream you dream together is reality.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: A dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A drinker has a hole under his nose that all his money runs into.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A drunkard in the gutter is just where he ought to be, according to the fitness and tendency of things. Nature has set upon him the process of decline and dissolution by which she removes things which have survived their usefulness.
author: William Graham Sumner

quote: A durable, long-term U.S.-China strategic relationship is even more important now than in previous decades. The relationship will continue to grow and prosper to the mutual benefit of all peoples.
author: Alexander Haig

quote: A face is too slight a foundation for happiness.
author: Mary Wortley

quote: A face to lose youth for, to occupy age With the dream of, meet death with.
author: Robert Browning

quote: A fact is a simple statement that everyone believes. It is innocent, unless found guilty. A hypothesis is a novel suggestion that no one wants to believe. It is guilty, until found effective.
author: Edward Teller

quote: A fact must be assimilated with, or discriminated fromm, some other fact or facts, in order to be raised to the dignity of a truth, and made to convey the least knowledge to the mind.
author: Henry Mayhew

quote: A fact never went into partnership with a miracle. Truth scorns the assistance of wonders. A fact will fit every other fact in the universe, and that is how you can tell whether it is or is not a fact. A lie will not fit anything except another lie.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: A failure is not always a mistake, it may simply be the best one can do under the circumstances. The real mistake is to stop trying.
author: B. F. Skinner

quote: A fairly bright boy is far more intelligent and far better company than the average adult.
author: John B. S. Haldane

quote: A faith is a necessity to a man. Woe to him who believes in nothing.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A faith is something you die for, a doctrine is something you kill for. There is all the difference in the world.
author: Tony Benn

quote: A family can develop only with a loving woman as its center.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: A family on the throne is an interesting idea. It brings down the pride of sovereignty to the level of petty life.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: A family with the wrong members in control that, perhaps, is as near as one can come to describing England in a phrase.
author: George Orwell

quote: A family's photograph album is generally about the extended family and, often, is all that remains of it.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: A fanatic is one who can't change his mind and won't change the subject.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: A father may turn his back on his child, brothers and sisters may become inveterate enemies, husbands may desert their wives, wives their husbands. But a mother's love endures through all.
author: Washington Irving

quote: A fellow oughtn't to let his family property go to pieces.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: A film is - or should be - more like music than like fiction. It should be a progression of moods and feelings. The theme, what's behind the emotion, the meaning, all that comes later.
author: Stanley Kubrick

quote: A film is never really good unless the camera is an eye in the head of a poet.
author: Orson Welles

quote: A filmmaker has almost the same freedom as a novelist has when he buys himself some paper.
author: Stanley Kubrick

quote: A financier is a pawnbroker with imagination.
author: Arthur Wing Pinero

quote: A firm, for instance, that does business in many countries of the world is driven to spend an enormous amount of time, labour, and money in providing for translation services.
author: Edward Sapir

quote: A flower cannot blossom without sunshine, and man cannot live without love.
author: Max Muller

quote: A flower falls, even though we love it and a weed grows, even though we do not love it.
author: Dogen

quote: A fool and his money are soon elected.
author: Will Rogers

quote: A fool's brain digests philosophy into folly, science into superstition, and art into pedantry. Hence University education.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A free America... means just this: individual freedom for all, rich or poor, or else this system of government we call democracy is only an expedient to enslave man to the machine and make him like it.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: A free economy is as essential to society as democratic political institutions. A strong market-based economy is the fertile ground for democratic freedoms that we think are important.
author: Lee R. Raymond

quote: A free press can, of course, be good or bad, but, most certainly without freedom, the press will never be anything but bad.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A frenzied passion for art is a canker that devours everything else.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: A friend is one who walks in when others walk out.
author: Walter Winchell

quote: A friend is, as it were, a second self.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: A friend may well be reckoned the masterpiece of nature.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A friend to all is a friend to none.
author: Aristotle

quote: A friend who dies, it's something of you who dies.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: A friendship founded on business is better than a business founded on friendship.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: A friendship like love is warm a love like friendship is steady.
author: Thomas More

quote: A friendship that like love is warm A love like friendship, steady.
author: Thomas Moore

quote: A functioning, robust democracy requires a healthy educated, participatory followership, and an educated, morally grounded leadership.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: A garden is a complex of aesthetic and plastic intentions and the plant is, to a landscape artist, not only a plant - rare, unusual, ordinary or doomed to disappearance - but it is also a color, a shape, a volume or an arabesque in itself.
author: Roberto Burle Marx

quote: A garden must combine the poetic and he mysterious with a feeling of serenity and joy.
author: Luis Barragan

quote: A garden requires patient labor and attention. Plants do not grow merely to satisfy ambitions or to fulfill good intentions. They thrive because someone expended effort on them.
author: Liberty Hyde Bailey

quote: A gentle word, a kind look, a good-natured smile can work wonders and accomplish miracles.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: A gentleman is simply a patient wolf.
author: Lana Turner

quote: A genuine leader is not a searcher for consensus but a molder of consensus.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: A gift consists not in what is done or given, but in the intention of the giver or doer.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: A gift, with a kind countenance, is a double present.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A girl phoned me the other day and said... 'Come on over, there's nobody home.' I went over. Nobody was home.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: A girl should be two things: classy and fabulous.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: A girl's legs are her best friends... but even the best of friends must part.
author: Redd Foxx

quote: A gloomy guest fits not a wedding feast.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: A god who let us prove his existence would be an idol.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: A good artist should be isolated. If he isn't isolated, something is wrong.
author: Orson Welles

quote: A good boss makes his men realize they have more ability than they think they have so that they consistently do better work than they thought they could.
author: Charles Erwin Wilson

quote: A good conscience is a continual Christmas.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A good cook is like a sorceress who dispenses happiness.
author: Elsa Schiaparelli

quote: A good decision is based on knowledge and not on numbers.
author: Plato

quote: A good deed never goes unpunished.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: A good education is usually harmful to a dancer. A good calf is better than a good head.
author: Agnes de Mille

quote: A good face they say, is a letter of recommendation. O Nature, Nature, why art thou so dishonest, as ever to send men with these false recommendations into the World!
author: Henry Fielding

quote: A good film is when the price of the dinner, the theatre admission and the babysitter were worth it.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: A good garden may have some weeds.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A good government implies two things first, fidelity to the objects of the government secondly, a knowledge of the means, by which those objects can be best attained.
author: Joseph Story

quote: A good historian is timeless although he is a patriot, he will never flatter his country in any respect.
author: Francois Fenelon

quote: A good husband is never the first to go to sleep at night or the last to awake in the morning.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: A good husband makes a good wife.
author: John Florio

quote: A good indignation brings out all one's powers.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A good laugh is sunshine in the house.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: A good man can be stupid and still be good. But a bad man must have brains.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: A good man would prefer to be defeated than to defeat injustice by evil means.
author: Sallust

quote: A good marriage is one which allows for change and growth in the individuals and in the way they express their love.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: A good marriage would be between a blind wife and a deaf husband.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: A good novel tells us the truth about its hero but a bad novel tells us the truth about its author.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: A good painting to me has always been like a friend. It keeps me company, comforts and inspires.
author: Hedy Lamarr

quote: A good photograph is knowing where to stand.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: A good picture is equivalent to a good deed.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote: A good plan violently executed now is better than a perfect plan executed next week.
author: George S. Patton

quote: A good politician is quite as unthinkable as an honest burglar.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: A good scientist is a person with original ideas. A good engineer is a person who makes a design that works with as few original ideas as possible. There are no prima donnas in engineering.
author: Freeman Dyson

quote: A good teacher must be able to put himself in the place of those who find learning hard.
author: Eliphas Levi

quote: A good way I know to find happiness, is to not bore a hole to fit the plug.
author: Josh Billings

quote: A good wife is one who serves her husband in the morning like a mother does, loves him in the day like a sister does and pleases him like a prostitute in the night.
author: Chanakya

quote: A good writer possesses not only his own spirit but also the spirit of his friends.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A government for the people must depend for its success on the intelligence, the morality, the justice, and the interest of the people themselves.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: A government is invigorated when each of us is willing to participate in shaping the future of this nation.
author: Barbara Jordan

quote: A government is the only vessel that leaks from the top.
author: James Reston

quote: A government must not waiver once it has chosen it's course. It must not look to the left or right but go forward.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: A government of laws, and not of men.
author: John Adams

quote: A government that robs Peter to pay Paul can always depend on the support of Paul.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A government, for protecting business only, is but a carcass, and soon falls by its own corruption and decay.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quote: A graduation ceremony is an event where the commencement speaker tells thousands of students dressed in identical caps and gowns that 'individuality' is the key to success.
author: Robert Orben

quote: A grain of poetry suffices to season a century.
author: Jose Marti

quote: A grandchild is a miracle, but a renewed relationship with your own children is even a greater one.
author: T. Berry Brazelton

quote: A grave blockhead should always go about with a lively one - they show one another off to the best advantage.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: A great age of literature is perhaps always a great age of translations.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: A great architect is not made by way of a brain nearly so much as he is made by way of a cultivated, enriched heart.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: A great artist is a great man in a great child.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A great artist is always before his time or behind it.
author: George Edward Moore

quote: A great building must begin with the unmeasurable, must go through measurable means when it is being designed and in the end must be unmeasurable.
author: Louis Kahn

quote: A great chef is an artist that I truly respect.
author: Robert Stack

quote: A great city is not to be confounded with a populous one.
author: Aristotle

quote: A great city is that which has the greatest men and women.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: A great city, whose image dwells in the memory of man, is the type of some great idea. Rome represents conquest Faith hovers over the towers of Jerusalem and Athens embodies the pre-eminent quality of the antique world, Art.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A great deal of intelligence can be invested in ignorance when the need for illusion is deep.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: A great deal of talent is lost to the world for want of a little courage. Every day sends to their graves obscure men whose timidity prevented them from making a first effort.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: A great empire, like a great cake, is most easily diminished at the edges.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A great fortune is a great slavery.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: A great man is always willing to be little.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A great man is different from an eminent one in that he is ready to be the servant of the society.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: A great man is made up of qualities that meet or make great occasions.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: A great many people think that polysyllables are a sign of intelligence.
author: Barbara Walters

quote: A great many people think they are thinking when they are merely rearranging their prejudices.
author: William James

quote: A great many things which in times of lesser knowledge we imagined to be superstitious or useless, prove today on examination to have been of immense value to mankind.
author: Lafcadio Hearn

quote: A great memory is never made synonymous with wisdom, any more than a dictionary would be called a treatise.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: A great mind becomes a great fortune.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: A great part of courage is the courage of having done the thing before.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A great photograph is one that fully expresses what one feels, in the deepest sense, about what is being photographed.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: A great pleasure in life is doing what people say you cannot do.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: A great revolution in just one single individual will help achieve a change in the destiny of a society and, further, will enable a change in the destiny of humankind.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: A great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: A great social success is a pretty girl who plays her cards as carefully as if she were plain.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: A great thing can only be done by a great person and they do it without effort.
author: John Ruskin

quote: A great truth is a truth whose opposite is also a truth.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: A great value of antiquity lies in the fact that its writings are the only ones that modern men still read with exactness.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A great wind is blowing, and that gives you either imagination or a headache.
author: Catherine the Great

quote: A grocer is attracted to his business by a magnetic force as great as the repulsion which renders it odious to artists.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: A group or an artist shouldn't get his money until his boss gets his.
author: Bobby Darin

quote: A guilty conscience needs to confess. A work of art is a confession.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A happy family is but an earlier heaven.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A happy life is one spent in learning, earning, and yearning.
author: Lillian Gish

quote: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: A happy life must be to a great extent a quiet life, for it is only in an atmosphere of quiet that true joy dare live.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: A happy marriage is a long conversation which always seems too short.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: A hard man is good to find.
author: Mae West

quote: A harmful truth is better than a useful lie.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: A hatred of failure has always been part of my nature.
author: Paul Getty

quote: A healthy attitude is contagious but don't wait to catch it from others. Be a carrier.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: A healthy vision of the future is not possible without an accurate knowledge of the past.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: A heart is not judged by how much you love, but by how much you are loved by others.
author: Frank Morgan

quote: A heart makes a good home for the friend.
author: Yunus Emre

quote: A heart well prepared for adversity in bad times hopes, and in good times fears for a change in fortune.
author: Horace

quote: A hero is born among a hundred, a wise man is found among a thousand, but an accomplished one might not be found even among a hundred thousand men.
author: Plato

quote: A hero is someone who has given his or her life to something bigger than oneself.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: A home without books is a body without soul.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: A horse is a thing of beauty... none will tire of looking at him as long as he displays himself in his splendor.
author: Xenophon

quote: A hospital bed is a parked taxi with the meter running.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: A house is a machine for living in.
author: Le Corbusier

quote: A house is no home unless it contain food and fire for the mind as well as for the body.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: A house is not a home unless it contains food and fire for the mind as well as the body.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A hug is like a boomerang - you get it back right away.
author: Bil Keane

quote: A human being has been given an intellect to make choices, and we know there are other food sources that do not require the killing of a creature that would protest being killed.
author: Mary Tyler Moore

quote: A human being has so many skins inside, covering the depths of the heart. We know so many things, but we don't know ourselves! Why, thirty or forty skins or hides, as thick and hard as an ox's or bear's, cover the soul. Go into your own ground and learn to know yourself there.
author: Meister Eckhart

quote: A hypocrite despises those whom he deceives, but has no respect for himself. He would make a dupe of himself too, if he could.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: A jealous lover of human liberty, deeming it the absolute condition of all that we admire and respect in humanity, I reverse the phrase of Voltaire, and say that, if God really existed, it would be necessary to abolish him.
author: Mikhail Bakunin

quote: A joke is a very serious thing.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: A journey by Sea and Land, Five Hundred Miles, is not undertaken without money.
author: Lewis Hallam

quote: A journey is like marriage. The certain way to be wrong is to think you control it.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: A judgment about life has no meaning except the truth of the one who speaks last, and the mind is at ease only at the moment when everyone is shouting at once and no one can hear a thing.
author: Georges Bataille

quote: A junkie is someone who uses their body to tell society that something is wrong.
author: Stella Adler

quote: A just and reasonable modesty does not only recommend eloquence, but sets off every great talent which a man can be possessed of.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: A kind heart is a fountain of gladness, making everything in its vicinity freshen into smiles.
author: Washington Irving

quote: A kiss is a lovely trick designed by nature to stop speech when words become superfluous.
author: Ingrid Bergman

quote: A kiss is a rosy dot over the 'i' of loving.
author: Cyrano de Bergerac

quote: A kiss makes the heart young again and wipes out the years.
author: Rupert Brooke

quote: A kitten is in the animal world what a rosebud is in the garden.
author: Robert Southey

quote: A lady's imagination is very rapid it jumps from admiration to love, from love to matrimony in a moment.
author: Jane Austen

quote: A large income is the best recipe for happiness I ever heard of.
author: Jane Austen

quote: A lawyer I once knew told me of a strange case, a suffragette who had never married. After her death, he opened her trunk and discovered 50 wedding gowns.
author: Marguerite Young

quote: A lawyer without history or literature is a mechanic, a mere working mason if he possesses some knowledge of these, he may venture to call himself an architect.
author: Walter Scott

quote: A leader does not deserve the name unless he is willing occasionally to stand alone.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

quote: A leader is a dealer in hope.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: A leader who confines his role to his people's experience dooms himself to stagnation a leader who outstrips his people's experience runs the risk of not being understood.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

quote: A leaf fluttered in through the window this morning, as if supported by the rays of the sun, a bird settled on the fire escape, joy in the task of coffee, joy accompanied me as I walked.
author: Anais Nin

quote: A lean compromise is better than a fat lawsuit.
author: George Herbert

quote: A liar begins with making falsehood appear like truth, and ends with making truth itself appear like falsehood.
author: William Shenstone

quote: A liberal is a man or a woman or a child who looks forward to a better day, a more tranquil night, and a bright, infinite future.
author: Leonard Bernstein

quote: A liberal is a man who is willing to spend somebody else's money.
author: Carter Glass

quote: A liberated woman is one who has sex before marriage and a job after.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: A library implies an act of faith.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A lie gets halfway around the world before the truth has a chance to get its pants on.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: A lie which is half a truth is ever the blackest of lies.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: A lie would have no sense unless the truth were felt dangerous.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: A life is not important except in the impact it has on other lives.
author: Jackie Robinson

quote: A life of leisure and a life of laziness are two things. There will be sleeping enough in the grave.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A life spent making mistakes is not only more honorable, but more useful than a life spent doing nothing.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A life which does not go into action is a failure.
author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quote: A lifetime of training for just ten seconds.
author: Jesse Owens

quote: A little group of willful men, representing no opinion but their own, have rendered the great government of the United States helpless and contemptible.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing Drink deep, or taste not the Pierian spring.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: A little learning is a dangerous thing, but we must take that risk because a little is as much as our biggest heads can hold.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A little learning is not a dangerous thing to one who does not mistake it for a great deal.
author: William Allen White

quote: A little learning, indeed, may be a dangerous thing, but the want of learning is a calamity to any people.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: A little less complaint and whining, and a little more dogged work and manly striving, would do us more credit than a thousand civil rights bills.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

quote: A little nonsense now and then is relished by the wisest men.
author: Roald Dahl

quote: A little philosophy inclineth man's mind to atheism, but depth in philosophy bringeth men's minds about to religion.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: A little sincerity is a dangerous thing, and a great deal of it is absolutely fatal.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A little thought and a little kindness are often worth more than a great deal of money.
author: John Ruskin

quote: A live concert to me is exciting because of all the electricity that is generated in the crowd and on stage. It's my favorite part of the business, live concerts.
author: Elvis Presley

quote: A lot has been written about Tony Perkins and myself and I figured, Let's get it straight. I had a relationship with Tony for two to three years, but those are only threads in the tapestry of my whole life.
author: Tab Hunter

quote: A lot of Jews are great friends of mine.
author: Billy Graham

quote: A lot of country music is sad.
author: Willie Nelson

quote: A lot of football success is in the mind. You must believe you are the best and then make sure that you are.
author: Bill Shankly

quote: A lot of guys go, 'Hey, Yog, say a Yogi-ism.' I tell 'em, 'I don't know any.' They want me to make one up. I don't make 'em up. I don't even know when I say it. They're the truth. And it is the truth. I don't know.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: A lot of movies are about life, mine are like a slice of cake.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: A lot of music is mathematics. It's balance.
author: Mel Brooks

quote: A lot of people like snow. I find it to be an unnecessary freezing of water.
author: Carl Reiner

quote: A lot of people say I'd miss show business if I quit. I'd miss some of it. Now it's the only life I know.
author: Loretta Lynn

quote: A lot of the fun lies in trying to penetrate the mystery and this is best done by saying over the lines to yourself again and again, till they pass through the stage of sounding like nonsense, and finally return to a full sense that had at first escaped notice.
author: Anthony Hecht

quote: A lot of the high-level sports are really in your mind.
author: Ronald Graham

quote: A love of nature is a consolation against failure.
author: Berthe Morisot

quote: A lover tries to stand in well with the pet dog of the house.
author: Moliere

quote: A loving family provides the foundation children need to succeed, and strong families with a man and a woman - bonded together for life - always have been, and always will be, the key to such families.
author: Jim Bunning

quote: A loving heart is the beginning of all knowledge.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: A loving heart is the truest wisdom.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: A major advantage of age is learning to accept people without passing judgment.
author: Liz Carpenter

quote: A major power can afford a military debacle only when it looks like a political victory.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: A major source of objection to a free economy is precisely that group thinks they ought to want. Underlying most arguments against the free market is a lack of belief in freedom itself.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: A majority is always better than the best repartee.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A man acquainted with history may, in some respect, be said to have lived from the beginning of the world, and to have been making continual additions to his stock of knowledge in every century.
author: David Hume

quote: A man always has two reasons for doing anything: a good reason and the real reason.
author: J. P. Morgan

quote: A man always remembers his first love with special tenderness, but after that he begins to bunch them.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: A man at work, making something which he feels will exist because he is working at it and wills it, is exercising the energies of his mind and soul as well as of his body. Memory and imagination help him as he works.
author: William Morris

quote: A man can be happy with any woman, as long as he does not love her.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A man can be himself only so long as he is alone.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: A man can be short and dumpy and getting bald but if he has fire, women will like him.
author: Mae West

quote: A man can live and be healthy without killing animals for food therefore, if he eats meat, he participates in taking animal life merely for the sake of his appetite.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: A man can no more diminish God's glory by refusing to worship Him than a lunatic can put out the sun by scribbling the word, 'darkness' on the walls of his cell.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: A man can only attain knowledge with the help of those who possess it. This must be understood from the very beginning. One must learn from him who knows.
author: George Gurdjieff

quote: A man cannot be said to succeed in this life who does not satisfy one friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: A man content to go to heaven alone will never go to heaven.
author: Boethius

quote: A man desires praise that he may be reassured, that he may be quit of his doubting of himself he is indifferent to applause when he is confident of success.
author: Alec Waugh

quote: A man doesn't know what he knows until he knows what he doesn't know.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: A man filled with the love of God is not content with blessing his family alone, but ranges through the whole world, anxious to bless the whole human race.
author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

quote: A man growing old becomes a child again.
author: Sophocles

quote: A man has a property in his opinions and the free communication of them.
author: James Madison

quote: A man has a tendency to accept you the way you are, while most women immediately start to pick flaws and want to change you.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: A man has no religion who has not slowly and painfully gathered one together, adding to it, shaping it and one's religion is never complete and final, it seems, but must always be undergoing modification.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: A man has to live with himself, and he should see to it that he always has good company.
author: Charles Evans Hughes

quote: A man in love is incomplete until he has married. Then he's finished.
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quote: A man is a fool if he drinks before he reaches the age of 50, and a fool if he doesn't afterward.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: A man is a god in ruins. When men are innocent, life shall be longer, and shall pass into the immortal, as gently as we awake from dreams.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A man is born alone and dies alone and he experiences the good and bad consequences of his karma alone and he goes alone to hell or the Supreme abode.
author: Chanakya

quote: A man is educated and turned out to work. But a woman is educated and turned out to grass.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: A man is ethical only when life, as such, is sacred to him, that of plants and animals as that of his fellow men, and when he devotes himself helpfully to all life that is in need of help.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: A man is given the choice between loving women and understanding them.
author: Ninon de L'Enclos

quote: A man is great by deeds, not by birth.
author: Chanakya

quote: A man is in general better pleased when he has a good dinner upon his table, than when his wife talks Greek.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: A man is not old until regrets take the place of dreams.
author: John Barrymore

quote: A man is only as good as what he loves.
author: Saul Bellow

quote: A man is relieved and gay when he has put his heart into his work and done his best but what he has said or done otherwise shall give him no peace.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A man is rich in proportion to the number of things he can afford to let alone.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: A man is truly free, even here in this embodied state, if he knows that God is the true agent and he by himself is powerless to do anything.
author: Ramakrishna

quote: A man is usually more careful of his money than he is of his principles.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A man is usually more careful of his money than of his principles.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: A man knows when he is growing old because he begins to look like his father.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: A man loves the meat in his youth that he cannot endure in his age.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A man marries to have a home, but also because he doesn't want to be bothered with sex and all that sort of thing.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: A man may be a pessimistic determinist before lunch and an optimistic believer in the will's freedom after it.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: A man may devote himself to death and destruction to save a nation but no nation will devote itself to death and destruction to save mankind.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: A man may learn wisdom even from a foe.
author: Aristophanes

quote: A man may speak very well in the House of Commons, and fail very completely in the House of Lords. There are two distinct styles requisite: I intend, in the course of my career, if I have time, to give a specimen of both.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: A man must be both stupid and uncharitable who believes there is no virtue or truth but on his own side.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: A man must live like a great brilliant flame and burn as brightly as he can. In the end he burns out. But this is far better than a mean little flame.
author: Boris Yeltsin

quote: A man of courage flees forward, in the midst of new things.
author: Jacques Maritain

quote: A man of courage is also full of faith.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: A man of courage never needs weapons, but he may need bail.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: A man of eighty has outlived probably three new schools of painting, two of architecture and poetry and a hundred in dress.
author: Lord Byron

quote: A man of great common sense and good taste - meaning thereby a man without originality or moral courage.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A man of great memory without learning hath a rock and a spindle and no staff to spin.
author: George Herbert

quote: A man of knowledge chooses a path with a heart and follows it and then he looks and rejoices and laughs and then he sees and knows.
author: Carlos Castenada

quote: A man of knowledge lives by acting, not by thinking about acting.
author: Carlos Castaneda

quote: A man only learns in two ways, one by reading, and the other by association with smarter people.
author: Will Rogers

quote: A man reserves his true and deepest love not for the species of woman in whose company he finds himself electrified and enkindled, but for that one in whose company he may feel tenderly drowsy.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: A man should never neglect his family for business.
author: Walt Disney

quote: A man sits in his car at the traffic lights, waiting for them to go green.
author: Michael Frayn

quote: A man that does not know how to be angry does not know how to be good.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: A man that studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: A man to carry on a successful business must have imagination. He must see things as in a vision, a dream of the whole thing.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: A man travels the world in search of what he needs and returns home to find it.
author: George Edward Moore

quote: A man who as a physical being is always turned toward the outside, thinking that his happiness lies outside him, finally turns inward and discovers that the source is within him.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.
author: Mark Twain

quote: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: A man who has been the indisputable favorite of his mother keeps for life the feeling of a conqueror.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: A man who has never gone to school may steal from a freight car but if he has a university education, he may steal the whole railroad.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: A man who has nothing for which he is willing to fight, nothing which is more important than his own personal safety, is a miserable creature and has no chance of being free unless made and kept so by the exertions of better men than himself.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: A man who is good enough to shed his blood for the country is good enough to be given a square deal afterwards.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: A man who is not afraid is not aggressive, a man who has no sense of fear of any kind is really a free, a peaceful man.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: A man who says that no patriot should attack the war until it is over... is saying no good son should warn his mother of a cliff until she has fallen.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: A man who was completely innocent, offered himself as a sacrifice for the good of others, including his enemies, and became the ransom of the world. It was a perfect act.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A man who won't die for something is not fit to live.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: A man whose life has been dishonourable is not entitled to escape disgrace in death.
author: Lucius Accius

quote: A man will go to war, fight and die for his country. But he won't get a bikini wax.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: A man will treat a woman almost exactly the way he treats his own interior feminine. In fact, he hasn't the ability to see a woman, objectively speaking, until he has made some kind of peace with his interior woman.
author: Robert Johnson

quote: A man willing to work, and unable to find work, is perhaps the saddest sight that fortune's inequality exhibits under this sun.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: A man with money is no match against a man on a mission.
author: Doyle Brunson

quote: A man without ambition is dead. A man with ambition but no love is dead. A man with ambition and love for his blessings here on earth is ever so alive.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: A man would prefer to come home to an unmade bed and a happy woman than to a neatly made bed and an angry woman.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: A man's best fortune, or his worst, is his wife.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: A man's character may be learned from the adjectives which he habitually uses in conversation.
author: Mark Twain

quote: A man's country is not a certain area of land, of mountains, rivers, and woods, but it is a principle and patriotism is loyalty to that principle.
author: George William Curtis

quote: A man's face is his autobiography. A woman's face is her work of fiction.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A man's friendships are one of the best measures of his worth.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: A man's got to take a lot of punishment to write a really funny book.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: A man's growth is seen in the successive choirs of his friends.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: A man's home may seem to be his castle on the outside inside is more often his nursery.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: A man's kiss is his signature.
author: Mae West

quote: A man's love, till it has been chastened and fastened by the feeling of duty which marriage brings with it, is instigated mainly by the difficulty of pursuit.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: A man's real life is that accorded to him in the thoughts of other men by reason of respect or natural love.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: A man's respect for law and order exists in precise relationship to the size of his paycheck.
author: Adam Clayton

quote: A man's true state of power and riches is to be in himself.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: A man's work is nothing but this slow trek to rediscover, through the detours of art, those two or three great and simple images in whose presence his heart first opened.
author: Albert Camus

quote: A man's worth is no greater than his ambitions.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: A market is never saturated with a good product, but it is very quickly saturated with a bad one.
author: Henry Ford

quote: A marriage contract to me is as binding as any in business, and I have always believed in sticking to an agreement.
author: Paul Getty

quote: A marriage is no amusement but a solemn act, and generally a sad one.
author: Queen Victoria

quote: A marriage without conflicts is almost as inconceivable as a nation without crises.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: A master can tell you what he expects of you. A teacher, though, awakens your own expectations.
author: Patricia Neal

quote: A mathematician is a person who can find analogies between theorems a better mathematician is one who can see analogies between proofs and the best mathematician can notice analogies between theories.
author: Stefan Banach

quote: A mediocre idea that generates enthusiasm will go further than a great idea that inspires no one.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: A member must say that he is a member of the Unification Church and that he is the follower of Sun Myung Moon. If he doesn't have the courage to say it, he is not worthy of me.
author: Sun Myung Moon

quote: A mind that is stretched by a new experience can never go back to its old dimensions.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: A minute's success pays the failure of years.
author: Robert Browning

quote: A mission is a place where you ask nonbelievers to come and find faith and hope and feel love.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: A moment's insight is sometimes worth a life's experience.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: A monopoly on the means of communication may define a ruling elite more precisely than the celebrated Marxian formula of monopoly in the means of production.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: A morning-glory at my window satisfies me more than the metaphysics of books.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: A mother who is really a mother is never free.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: A mother's arms are made of tenderness and children sleep soundly in them.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: A mother's happiness is like a beacon, lighting up the future but reflected also on the past in the guise of fond memories.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: A nation devoid of art and artists cannot have a full existence.
author: Kemal Ataturk

quote: A nation is a society united by a delusion about its ancestry and by common hatred of its neighbours.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: A nation or civilization that continues to produce soft-minded men purchases its own spiritual death on the installment plan.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: A nation that continues year after year to spend more money on military defense than on programs of social uplift is approaching spiritual doom.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: A nation that destroys its soils destroys itself. Forests are the lungs of our land, purifying the air and giving fresh strength to our people.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: A nation that does not stand for its children does not stand for anything and will not stand tall in the future.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: A nation which makes the final sacrifice for life and freedom does not get beaten.
author: Kemal Ataturk

quote: A national legal organization is giving very serious thought to using The Betrayal of America as a legal basis for asking the House Judiciary Committee to institute impeachment proceedings against these five justices.
author: Vincent Bugliosi

quote: A national political campaign is better than the best circus ever heard of, with a mass baptism and a couple of hangings thrown in.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: A new father quickly learns that his child invariably comes to the bathroom at precisely the times when he's in there, as if he needed company. The only way for this father to be certain of bathroom privacy is to shave at the gas station.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: A new idea is delicate. It can be killed by a sneer or a yawn it can be stabbed to death by a quip and worried to death by a frown on the right man's brow.
author: Ovid

quote: A new scientific truth does not triumph by convincing its opponents and making them see the light, but rather because its opponents eventually die, and a new generation grows up that is familiar with it.
author: Max Planck

quote: A new sense of shared international responsibility is unmistakable in the voices of the United Nations and its agencies, and in the civil society of thousands of supra-national NGOs.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: A nickel ain't worth a dime anymore.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: A nickname is the heaviest stone that the devil can throw at a man. It is a bugbear to the imagination, and, though we do not believe in it, it still haunts our apprehensions.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: A novelist is, like all mortals, more fully at home on the surface of the present than in the ooze of the past.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: A painter paints his pictures on canvas. But musicians paint their pictures on silence. We provide the music, and you provide the silence.
author: Leopold Stokowski

quote: A painting that is well composed is half finished.
author: Pierre Bonnard

quote: A pair of powerful spectacles has sometimes sufficed to cure a person in love.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: A patriot must always be ready to defend his country against his government.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: A peace is of the nature of a conquest for then both parties nobly are subdued, and neither party loser.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: A pencil and rubber are of more use to thought than a battalion of assistants. To happiness the same applies as to truth: one does not have it, but is in it.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: A people and their religion must be judged by social standards based on social ethics. No other standard would have any meaning if religion is held to be necessary good for the well-being of the people.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: A people without the knowledge of their past history, origin and culture is like a tree without roots.
author: Marcus Garvey

quote: A people's literature is the great textbook for real knowledge of them. The writings of the day show the quality of the people as no historical reconstruction can.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: A perpetual holiday is a good working definition of hell.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: A person cannot love a plant after he has pruned it, then he has either done a poor job or is devoid of emotion.
author: Liberty Hyde Bailey

quote: A person however learned and qualified in his life's work in whom gratitude is absent, is devoid of that beauty of character which makes personality fragrant.
author: Hazrat Inayat Khan

quote: A person is a fool to become a writer. His only compensation is absolute freedom.
author: Roald Dahl

quote: A person is born with feelings of envy and hate. If he gives way to them, they will lead him to violence and crime, and any sense of loyalty and good faith will be abandoned.
author: Xun Zi

quote: A person isn't who they are during the last conversation you had with them - they're who they've been throughout your whole relationship.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: A person often meets his destiny on the road he took to avoid it.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: A person should design the way he makes a living around how he wishes to make a life.
author: Charlie Byrd

quote: A person that much interested in science is going to neglect his social life somewhat, but not completely, because that isn't healthy either. So one has to work it out according to one's own inclinations, how one wants to proportion these things.
author: Clyde Tombaugh

quote: A person who doubts himself is like a man who would enlist in the ranks of his enemies and bear arms against himself. He makes his failure certain by himself being the first person to be convinced of it.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: A person who is too nice an observer of the business of the crowd, like one who is too curious in observing the labor of bees, will often be stung for his curiosity.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: A person will sometimes devote all his life to the development of one part of his body - the wishbone.
author: Robert Frost

quote: A person with a new idea is a crank until the idea succeeds.
author: Mark Twain

quote: A person without a sense of humor is like a wagon without springs. It's jolted by every pebble on the road.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: A person's fears are lighter when the danger is at hand.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: A person, who no matter how desperate the situation, gives others hope, is a true leader.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: A petty reason perhaps why novelists more and more try to keep a distance from journalists is that novelists are trying to write the truth and journalists are trying to write fiction.
author: Graham Greene

quote: A physician without a knowledge of Astrology has no right to call himself a physician.
author: Hippocrates

quote: A picture is a poem without words.
author: Horace

quote: A picture is worth a thousand words.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: A picture must possess a real power to generate light and for a long time now I've been conscious of expressing myself through light or rather in light.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: A pint of sweat, saves a gallon of blood.
author: George S. Patton

quote: A place for everything, everything in its place.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: A plague on eminence! I hardly dare cross the street anymore without a convoy, and I am stared at wherever I go like an idiot member of a royal family or an animal in a zoo and zoo animals have been known to die from stares.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: A play should give you something to think about. When I see a play and understand it the first time, then I know it can't be much good.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: A poem begins as a lump in the throat, a sense of wrong, a homesickness, a lovesickness.
author: Robert Frost

quote: A poem begins in delight and ends in wisdom.
author: Robert Frost

quote: A poem is never finished, only abandoned.
author: Paul Valery

quote: A poem is true if it hangs together. Information points to something else. A poem points to nothing but itself.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: A poem might be defined as thinking about feelings - about human feelings and frailties.
author: Anne Stevenson

quote: A poet can survive everything but a misprint.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: A poet is, before anything else, a person who is passionately in love with language.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: A poet never takes notes. You never take notes in a love affair.
author: Robert Frost

quote: A poet ought not to pick nature's pocket. Let him borrow, and so borrow as to repay by the very act of borrowing. Examine nature accurately, but write from recollection, and trust more to the imagination than the memory.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: A policy is a temporary creed liable to be changed, but while it holds good it has got to be pursued with apostolic zeal.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A politician will do anything to keep his job - even become a patriot.
author: William Randolph

quote: A poor man with nothing in his belly needs hope, illusion, more than bread.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: A popular government without popular information or the means of acquiring it, is but a prologue to a farce, or a tragedy, or perhaps both.
author: James Madison

quote: A powerful attraction exists, therefore, to the promotion of a study and of duties of all others engrossing the time most completely, and which is less benefited than most others by any acquaintance with science.
author: Charles Babbage

quote: A powerful idea communicates some of its strength to him who challenges it.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: A priest is he who lives solely in the realm of the invisible, for whom all that is visible has only the truth of an allegory.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: A prisoner of war is a man who tries to kill you and fails, and then asks you not to kill him.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: A problem is a chance for you to do your best.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: A professional soldier understands that war means killing people, war means maiming people, war means families left without fathers and mothers.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: A professor is someone who talks in someone else's sleep.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: A propensity to hope and joy is real riches one to fear and sorrow real poverty.
author: David Hume

quote: A proverb is a short sentence based on long experience.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: A proverb is the wisdom of many and the wit of one.
author: Lord John Russell

quote: A prudent question is one-half of wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: A public expectation, it has to be said, not of poetry as such but of political positions variously approvable by mutually disapproving groups.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: A pure democracy is a society consisting of a small number of citizens, who assemble and administer the government in person.
author: James Madison

quote: A purpose, an intention, a design, strikes everywhere even the careless, the most stupid thinker.
author: David Hume

quote: A racially integrated community is a chronological term timed from the entrance of the first black family to the exit of the last white family.
author: Saul Alinsky

quote: A rare experience of a moment at daybreak, when something in nature seems to reveal all consciousness, cannot be explained at noon. Yet it is part of the day's unity.
author: Charles Ives

quote: A real Christian is a person who can give his pet parrot to the town gossip.
author: Billy Graham

quote: A real failure does not need an excuse. It is an end in itself.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: A real gentleman, even if he loses everything he owns, must show no emotion. Money must be so far beneath a gentleman that it is hardly worth troubling about.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: A really great talent finds its happiness in execution.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: A religion that takes no account of practical affairs and does not help to solve them is no religion.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: A remark generally hurts in proportion to its truth.
author: Will Rogers

quote: A retired teacher paid $62,000 towards her pension and nothing, yes nothing, for full family medical, dental and vision coverage over her entire career. What will we pay her? $1.4 million in pension benefits and another $215,000 in health care benefit premiums over her lifetime.
author: Chris Christie

quote: A return to first principles in a republic is sometimes caused by the simple virtues of one man. His good example has such an influence that the good men strive to imitate him, and the wicked are ashamed to lead a life so contrary to his example.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: A revival does two things. First, it returns the Church from her backsliding and second, it causes the conversion of men and women and it always includes the conviction of sin on the part of the Church. What a spell the devil seems to cast over the Church today!
author: Billy Sunday

quote: A rich man is nothing but a poor man with money.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: A rich man told me recently that a liberal is a man who tells other people what to do with their money.
author: Amiri Baraka

quote: A rise in the level of saving can reduce aggregate activity temporarily but only a sustained high level of saving makes it possible to have the sustained high level of business investment that contributes to the long-run growth of output.
author: Martin Feldstein

quote: A rock pile ceases to be a rock pile the moment a single man contemplates it, bearing within him the image of a cathedral.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: A rose is the visible result of an infinitude of complicated goings on in the bosom of the earth and in the air above, and similarly a work of art is the product of strange activities in the human mind.
author: Clive Bell

quote: A round man cannot be expected to fit in a square hole right away. He must have time to modify his shape.
author: Mark Twain

quote: A rude nature is worse than a brute nature by so much more as man is better than a beast: and those that are of civil natures and genteel dispositions are as much nearer to celestial creatures as those that are rude and cruel are to devils.
author: Margaret Cavendish

quote: A runner must run with dreams in his heart, not money in his pocket.
author: Emil Zatopek

quote: A rusty nail placed near a faithful compass, will sway it from the truth, and wreck the argosy.
author: Walter Scott

quote: A sad soul can kill quicker than a germ.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: A safe and nutritionally adequate diet is a basic individual right and an essential condition for sustainable development, especially in developing countries.
author: Gro Harlem Brundtland

quote: A satellite has no conscience.
author: Edward R. Murrow

quote: A scientific truth does not triumph by convincing its opponents and making them see the light, but rather because its opponents eventually die and a new generation grows up that is familiar with it.
author: Max Planck

quote: A screen actor is compensated in the knowledge that millions will see his performance at one time, where only hundreds will see it on the stage.
author: Bela Lugosi

quote: A sculptor is a person who is interested in the shape of things, a poet in words, a musician by sounds.
author: Henry Moore

quote: A second reason why science cannot replace judgement is the behavior of financial markets.
author: Martin Feldstein

quote: A self-taught man usually has a poor teacher and a worse student.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: A sense is what has the power of receiving into itself the sensible forms of things without the matter, in the way in which a piece of wax takes on the impress of a signet-ring without the iron or gold.
author: Aristotle

quote: A sense of duty is useful in work but offensive in personal relations. People wish to be liked, not to be endured with patient resignation.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: A sense of humor is good for you. Have you ever heard of a laughing hyena with heart burn?
author: Bob Hope

quote: A series of rumors about my attitude, as well as derogatory remarks about myself and my family showed me that the personal resentment of the Detroit general manager toward me would make it impossible for me to continue playing hockey in Detroit.
author: Ted Lindsay

quote: A serious and good philosophical work could be written consisting entirely of jokes.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: A sexual revolution begins with the emancipation of women, who are the chief victims of patriarchy, and also with the ending of homosexual oppression.
author: Kate Millett

quote: A short saying often contains much wisdom.
author: Sophocles

quote: A show that no one thought had a chance has just finished its fifth year: Charmed. I think it's tougher for the younger networks, so I think they have a little more patience for the sake of the show. But who knows?
author: Aaron Spelling

quote: A significant piece of the wealth that the NFL owners garner is a result of the enormous TV revenues they get - and those revenues are supported by a legislatively granted exemption from the antitrust laws that has been made applicable to sports leagues, primarily the NFL.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: A sincere and steadfast co-operation in promoting such a reconstruction of our political system as would provide for the permanent liberty and happiness of the United States.
author: James Madison

quote: A singer starts by having his instrument as a gift from God... When you have been given something in a moment of grace, it is sacrilegious to be greedy.
author: Marian Anderson

quote: A single conversation across the table with a wise man is better than ten years mere study of books.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: A single rose can be my garden... a single friend, my world.
author: Leo Buscaglia
