quote: But I think the real tension lies in the relationship between what you might call the pursuer and his quarry, whether it's the writer or the spy.
author: John le Carre

quote: But I, being poor, have only my dreams I have spread my dreams under your feet Tread softly because you tread on my dreams.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: But O, how bitter a thing it is to look into happiness through another man's eyes.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: But Socialism, alone, can bring self-determination of their peoples.
author: Karl Liebknecht

quote: But Vegas is really my first home.
author: David Copperfield

quote: But although all our knowledge begins with experience, it does not follow that it arises from experience.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: But an old age serene and bright, and lovely as a Lapland night, shall lead thee to thy grave.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: But are not the dreams of poets and the tales of travellers notoriously false?
author: H. P. Lovecraft

quote: But at any rate, the point is that God is what nobody admits to being, and everybody really is.
author: Alan Watts

quote: But because we in the United States finance our current account deficit by borrowing in our own currency, we can move to a more competitive dollar without the adverse effects that followed currency declines in other countries.
author: Martin Feldstein

quote: But blind to former as to future fate, what mortal knows his pre-existent state?
author: Alexander Pope

quote: But by the time I was 40, everything was winding down. It started after the war. On the plus side, there was more more products and technology. But for me the nightlife was winding down, the glamour, the fun.
author: Cesar Romero

quote: But communication is two-sided - vital and profound communication makes demands also on those who are to receive it... demands in the sense of concentration, of genuine effort to receive what is being communicated.
author: Roger Sessions

quote: But constant experience shows us that every man invested with power is apt to abuse it, and to carry his authority as far as it will go.
author: Charles de Secondat

quote: But courage which goes against military expediency is stupidity, or, if it is insisted upon by a commander, irresponsibility.
author: Erwin Rommel

quote: But does that mean that war and violence are inevitable? I would argue not because we have also evolved this amazingly sophisticated intellect, and we are capable of controlling our innate behavior a lot of the time.
author: Jane Goodall

quote: But every act in consequence of our faith, strengthens faith.
author: Anna Letitia Barbauld

quote: But every great scripture, whether Hebrew, Indian, Persian, or Chinese, apart from its religious value will be found to have some rare and special beauty of its own and in this respect the original Bible stands very high as a monument of sublime poetry and of artistic prose.
author: Lafcadio Hearn

quote: But every historical statement and legitimization itself moves within a certain relation to history.
author: Martin Heidegger

quote: But for my faith in God, I should have been a raving maniac.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: But friendship is precious, not only in the shade, but in the sunshine of life, and thanks to a benevolent arrangement the greater part of life is sunshine.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: But he is unworthy the name of a minister of the gospel of peace, who is unwilling, not only to have his name cast out as evil, but also to die for the truths of the Lord Jesus.
author: George Whitefield

quote: But he knew people and he was head writer for Have Gun Will Travel, and if you took those early Star Treks that we did and put us in a western wardrobe and put us on wagon train going west, we can say the same lines.
author: Majel Barrett

quote: But however measurable, there is much more life in music than mathematics or logic ever dreamed of.
author: Gabriel Marcel

quote: But human experience is usually paradoxical, that means incongruous with the phrases of current talk or even current philosophy.
author: George Eliot

quote: But if I have a lot of imagination, I could tell myself whatever I wanted, you know. I handle myself quite well. I'm kind of fascist with myself, you know. There's no discussion. There is an order. You follow it.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: But if nothing but soul, or in soul mind, is qualified to count, it is impossible for there to be time unless there is soul, but only that of which time is an attribute, i.e. if change can exist without soul.
author: Aristotle

quote: But if there's an erosion at home, you know, Thomas Jefferson warned about a tyranny of an oligarchy and if we surrender our democracy to the tyranny of an oligarchy, we've made a terrible mistake.
author: Pat Robertson

quote: But if you don't watch me, I will try and sneak in some humor. I see humor everywhere in life around me.
author: Marion Ross

quote: But if you want to know the truth, the weirdest thing that has happened has been my discovery that people who attend the conventions are filled with love.
author: William Shatner

quote: But in its final creation it was not the part of the Father's power to fail as though exhausted. It was not the part of His wisdom to waver in a needful matter through poverty of counsel.
author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola

quote: But in the end, in the end one is alone. We are all of us alone. I mean I'm told these days we have to consider ourselves as being in society... but in the end one knows one is alone, that one lives at the heart of a solitude.
author: Harold Bloom

quote: But inner experience is only one source of human knowledge.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: But it also became the experience, or was the experience, of the writers who were attracted to this kind of humor. They're all men or women who come from the same kind of experience in their own lives.
author: Norman Lear

quote: But it has, in addition, an even more precious quality - a consciousness of the human intelligence, the human spirit and that man is a social creature.
author: Norman McLaren

quote: But it is my happiness to be half Welsh, and that the better half.
author: Richard Cobden

quote: But it required a disastrous, internecine war to bring this question of human freedom to a crisis, and the process of striking the shackles from the slave was accomplished in a single hour.
author: Wendell Willkie

quote: But it was great, we sit in the same dressing room where, like, Johnny Cash sat and Willie Nelson and all those guys. That was in itself something amazing - I was on the same space these guys stood on, ya know?
author: Alan Vega

quote: But it was this tough little character part that I was playing, a very funny little guy that I invented over a weekend, because I realized I was not contributing to the humor of this thing. And I had to do something.
author: Dabney Coleman

quote: But love's a malady without a cure.
author: John Dryden

quote: But man has still another powerful resource: natural science with its strictly objective methods.
author: Ivan Pavlov

quote: But maybe music was not intended to satisfy the curious definiteness of man. Maybe it is better to hope that music may always be transcendental language in the most extravagant sense.
author: Charles Ives

quote: But men are men the best sometimes forget.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: But men are so full of greed today, they'll sell anything for a little piece of money.
author: Little Richard

quote: But men must know, that in this theatre of man's life it is reserved only for God and angels to be lookers on.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: But my dad also was a remarkable man, a good person, a principled individual, a man of integrity.
author: Sidney Poitier

quote: But my patriotism goes for something beyond what we have. We don't have something that I want to die for - anymore.
author: Jack Bowman

quote: But now I have come to believe that the whole world is an enigma, a harmless enigma that is made terrible by our own mad attempt to interpret it as though it had an underlying truth.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: But on second thought, after I decreed the state of emergency, I came to the conclusion that that was impossible to achieve without bloodshed because the street protesters were full of anger and nearly out of control. This is why I thought we needed to find another way out.
author: Eduard Shevardnadze

quote: But only art and music have the power to bring peace.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: But reason always cuts a poor figure beside sentiment the one being essentially restricted, like everything that is positive, while the other is infinite.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: But recently I began to feel that maybe I wouldn't be able to do what I want to do and need to do with American musicians, who are imprisoned behind these bars music's got these bars and measures you know.
author: Sun Ra

quote: But such is the irresistable nature of truth, that all it asks, and all it wants is the liberty of appearing.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: But suppose God is black? What if we go to Heaven and we, all our lives, have treated the Negro as an inferior, and God is there, and we look up and He is not white? What then is our response?
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: But take comfort in that I die at peace with the world and myself - not afraid.
author: Robert Falcon Scott

quote: But that citizen's perception was also at one with the truth in recognizing that the very brutality of the means by which the IRA were pursuing change was destructive of the trust upon which new possibilities would have to be based.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: But the Wisdom of God, which is His only-begotten Son, being in all respects incapable of change or alteration, and every good quality in Him being essential, and such as cannot be changed and converted, His glory is therefore declared to be pure and sincere.
author: Origen

quote: But the age of chivalry is gone. That of sophisters, economists, and calculators has succeeded and the glory of Europe is extinguished forever.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: But the attitude of faith is to let go, and become open to truth, whatever it might turn out to be.
author: Alan Watts

quote: But the deep desire for peace remained with the American people.
author: Paul Robeson

quote: But the fact is, no matter how good the teacher, how small the class, how focused on quality education the school may be none of this matters if we ignore the individual needs of our students.
author: Roy Barnes

quote: But the general welfare must restrict and regulate the exertions of the individuals, as the individuals must derive a supply of their strength from social power.
author: Friedrich List

quote: But the idea that I should be a teacher and a researcher of some sort did not vary over the years.
author: Amartya Sen

quote: But the issue is not only life and death but our existence before God and our being judged by him. All of us were sinners before him and worthy of condemnation.
author: Hans Urs von Balthasar

quote: But the love of adventure was in father's blood.
author: Buffalo Bill

quote: But the power of instruction is seldom of much efficacy, except in those happy dispositions where it is almost superfluous.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: But the problem is that when I go around and speak on campuses, I still don't get young men standing up and saying, 'How can I combine career and family?'
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: But the relationship of morality and power is a very subtle one. Because ultimately power without morality is no longer power.
author: James Baldwin

quote: But the same intelligence compels Germany to practise the same policy.
author: Pierre Laval

quote: But the scientific importance of a change in knowledge of fact consists precisely in j its having consequences for a system of theory.
author: Talcott Parsons

quote: But the true feminist deals out of a lesbian consciousness whether or not she ever sleeps with women.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: But there are too many people that make so much money at the cost of lives of other humans and for no reason but to make the money.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: But there comes a moment in everybody's life when he must decide whether he'll live among the human beings or not - a fool among fools or a fool alone.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: But there is a difference here: When Jewish children are murdered, Arabs celebrate the deed. The death of an Arab child is no cause for celebration in Israel.
author: Theodore Bikel

quote: But time growing old teaches all things.
author: Aeschylus

quote: But to me nothing - the negative, the empty - is exceedingly powerful.
author: Alan Watts

quote: But today we become aware of other readings of the human experience very quickly because of the media and the speed with which people travel the planet.
author: Chaim Potok

quote: But we don't have an example of a democratic society existing in a socialist economy - which is the only real alternative to capitalism in the modern world.
author: Peter L. Berger

quote: But what is Hope? Nothing but the paint on the face of Existence the least touch of truth rubs it off, and then we see what a hollow-cheeked harlot we have got hold of.
author: Lord Byron

quote: But what is after all the happiness of mere power? There is a greater happiness possible than to be lord of heaven and earth that is the happiness of being truly loved.
author: Lafcadio Hearn

quote: But what is all this fear of and opposition to Oblivion? What is the matter with the soft Darkness, the Dreamless Sleep?
author: James Thurber

quote: But what is happiness except the simple harmony between a man and the life he leads?
author: Albert Camus

quote: But what is liberty without wisdom, and without virtue? It is the greatest of all possible evils for it is folly, vice, and madness, without tuition or restraint.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: But what of black women?... I most sincerely doubt if any other race of women could have brought its fineness up through so devilish a fire.
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

quote: But what we call our despair is often only the painful eagerness of unfed hope.
author: George Eliot

quote: But whatever my failure, I have this thing to remember - that I was a pioneer in my profession, just as my grandfathers were in theirs, in that I was the first man in this section to earn his living as a writer.
author: Robert E. Howard

quote: But when I first got cancer, after the initial shock and the fear and paranoia and crying and all that goes with cancer - that word means to most people ultimate death - I decided to see what I could do to take that negative and use it in a positive way.
author: Herbie Mann

quote: But when I was twelve years old I caught my first strong glimpse of one of the fundamental forces of existence, whose votary I was destined to be for life - namely, Beauty.
author: Georg Brandes

quote: But when will our leaders learn - war is not the answer.
author: Helen Thomas

quote: But when women are moved and lend help, when women, who are by nature calm and controlled, give encouragement and applause, when virtuous and knowledgeable women grace the endeavor with their sweet love, then it is invincible.
author: Jose Marti

quote: But whether it be dream or truth, to do well is what matters. If it be truth, for truth's sake. If not, then to gain friends for the time when we awaken.
author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

quote: But whether the Constitution really be one thing, or another, this much is certain - that it has either authorized such a government as we have had, or has been powerless to prevent it. In either case, it is unfit to exist.
author: Lysander Spooner

quote: But while they prate of economic laws, men and women are starving. We must lay hold of the fact that economic laws are not made by nature. They are made by human beings.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: But with Christ, we have access in a one-to-one relationship, for, as in the Old Testament, it was more one of worship and awe, a vertical relationship. The New Testament, on the other hand, we look across at a Jesus who looks familiar, horizontal. The combination is what makes the Cross.
author: Bono

quote: But you know, my dad called me the laziest white kid he ever met. When I screamed back at him that he was putting down a race of people to call me lazy, his answer was that's not what he was doing, and that I was also the dumbest white kid he ever met.
author: Norman Lear

quote: But, I don't think any arranger should ever write a drum part for a drummer because if a drummer can't create his own Interpretation of the chart and he plays everything that's written, he becomes mechanical he has no freedom.
author: Buddy Rich

quote: But, alas! what poor Woman is ever taught that she should have a higher Design than to get her a Husband?
author: Mary Astell

quote: But, my dear sirs, when peace does come, you may call on me for any thing. Then will I share with you the last cracker, and watch with you to shield your homes and families against danger from every quarter.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: But, on the other hand, I get bored with racism too and recognize that there are still many things to be said about a Black person and a White person loving each other in a racist society.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: But, when the work was finished, the Craftsman kept wishing that there were someone to ponder the plan of so great a work, to love its beauty, and to wonder at its vastness.
author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola

quote: Buying books would be a good thing if one could also buy the time to read them in: but as a rule the purchase of books is mistaken for the appropriation of their contents.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: By 1969, when I celebrated 45 years in the music business, I also had 45 people in our musical family.
author: Lawrence Welk

quote: By Thursday morning, we'd gotten over the worst of it.
author: William Scranton

quote: By Time and Age full many things are taught.
author: Aeschylus

quote: By a continuing process of inflation, government can confiscate, secretly and unobserved, an important part of the wealth of their citizens.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quote: By adversity are wrought the greatest works of admiration, and all the fair examples of renown, out of distress and misery are grown.
author: Samuel Daniel

quote: By all but the pathologically romantic, it is now recognized that this is not the age of the small man.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: By all means, marry. If you get a good wife, you'll become happy if you get a bad one, you'll become a philosopher.
author: Socrates

quote: By and large, language is a tool for concealing the truth.
author: George Carlin

quote: By and large, mothers and housewives are the only workers who do not have regular time off. They are the great vacationless class.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: By and large, the critics and readers gave me an affirmed sense of my identity as a writer. You might know this within yourself, but to have it affirmed by others is of utmost importance. Writing is, after all, a form of communication.
author: Ralph Ellison

quote: By any reasonable measure of achievement, the faith of the Enlightenment thinkers in science was justified.
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: By cultivating the beautiful we scatter the seeds of heavenly flowers, as by doing good we cultivate those that belong to humanity.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: By deafness one gains in one respect more than one loses one misses more nonsense than sense.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: By definition, a government has no conscience. Sometimes it has a policy, but nothing more.
author: Albert Camus

quote: By education most have been misled So they believe, because they were bred. The priest continues where the nurse began, And thus the child imposes on the man.
author: John Dryden

quote: By experience we find out a short way by a long wandering.
author: Roger Ascham

quote: By failing to prepare, you are preparing to fail.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: By far the greatest part of those goods which are the objects of desire, are procured by labour and they may be multiplied, not in one country alone, but in many, almost without any assignable limit, if we are disposed to bestow the labour necessary to obtain them.
author: David Ricardo

quote: By gold all good faith has been banished by gold our rights are abused the law itself is influenced by gold, and soon there will be an end of every modest restraint.
author: Sextus Propertius

quote: By having a reverence for life, we enter into a spiritual relation with the world By practicing reverence for life we become good, deep, and alive.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: By indignities men come to dignities.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: By its very nature the beautiful is isolated from everything else. From beauty no road leads to reality.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: By means of microscopic observation and astronomical projection the lotus flower can become the foundation for an entire theory of the universe and an agent whereby we may perceive Truth.
author: Yukio Mishima

quote: By means of tracing-paper I transfer my design to the wood and draw on that.
author: John Tenniel

quote: By nature all men are equal in liberty, but not in other endowments.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: By nature, men love newfangledness.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: By plucking her petals, you do not gather the beauty of the flower.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: By polluting clear water with slime you will never find good drinking water.
author: Aeschylus

quote: By respect for life we become religious in a way that is elementary, profound and alive.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: By the age of 9 or 10, I knew that I had to cut my own cloth and make my own way.
author: John le Carre

quote: By the time I got home at night, my eyes were so chlorinated I saw rings around every light.
author: Esther Williams

quote: By the time a man gets to be presidential material, he's been bought ten times over.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: By the time a person has achieved years adequate for choosing a direction, the die is cast and the moment has long since passed which determined the future.
author: Zelda Fitzgerald

quote: By the work one knows the workman.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: By three methods we may learn wisdom: First, by reflection, which is noblest Second, by imitation, which is easiest and third by experience, which is the bitterest.
author: Confucius

quote: By trying we can easily endure adversity. Another man's, I mean.
author: Mark Twain

quote: By working faithfully eight hours a day you may eventually get to be boss and work twelve hours a day.
author: Robert Frost

quote: California is a fine place to live - if you happen to be an orange.
author: Fred Allen

quote: California must be all American or all Chinese. We are resolved that it shall be American, and are prepared to make it so. May we not rely upon your sympathy and assistance?
author: Denis Kearney

quote: Call it Nature, Fate, Fortune all these are names of the one and selfsame God.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Call no man happy till he is dead.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Came but for friendship, and took away love.
author: Thomas Moore

quote: Cameramen are among the most extraordinarily able and competent people I know. They have to have an insight into natural history that gives them a sixth sense of what the creature is going to do, so they can be ready to follow.
author: David Attenborough

quote: Campaign behavior for wives: Always be on time. Do as little talking as humanly possible. Lean back in the parade car so everybody can see the president.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Can I see another's woe, and not be in sorrow too? Can I see another's grief, and not seek for kind relief?
author: William Blake

quote: Can a mortal ask questions which God finds unanswerable? Quite easily, I should think. All nonsense questions are unanswerable.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Can anything be stupider than that a man has the right to kill me because he lives on the other side of a river and his ruler has a quarrel with mine, though I have not quarrelled with him?
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Can the knowledge deriving from reason even begin to compare with knowledge perceptible by sense?
author: Louis Aragon

quote: Can you imagine what I would do if I could do all I can?
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Can you imagine young people nowadays making a study of trigonometry for the fun of it? Well I did.
author: Clyde Tombaugh

quote: Canada is the homeland of equality, justice and tolerance.
author: Kim Campbell

quote: Cancer victims who don't accept their fate, who don't learn to live with it, will only destroy what little time they have left.
author: Ingrid Bergman

quote: Cannibals prefer those who have no spines.
author: Stanislaw Lem

quote: Capital is money, capital is commodities. By virtue of it being value, it has acquired the occult ability to add value to itself. It brings forth living offspring, or, at the least, lays golden eggs.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Capital is reckless of the health or length of life of the laborer, unless under compulsion from society.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Capital is that part of wealth which is devoted to obtaining further wealth.
author: Alfred Marshall

quote: Capital isn't that important in business. Experience isn't that important. You can get both of these things. What is important is ideas.
author: Harvey S. Firestone

quote: Capitalism has destroyed our belief in any effective power but that of self interest backed by force.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Capitalism is the astounding belief that the most wickedest of men will do the most wickedest of things for the greatest good of everyone.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quote: Capitalism is war socialism is peace.
author: Karl Liebknecht

quote: Capitalist production, therefore, develops technology, and the combining together of various processes into a social whole, only by sapping the original sources of all wealth - the soil and the labourer.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Cards are war, in disguise of a sport.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Caring about others, running the risk of feeling, and leaving an impact on people, brings happiness.
author: Harold Kushner

quote: Catastrophes are often stimulated by the failure to feel the emergence of a domain, and so what cannot be felt in the imagination is experienced as embodied sensation in the catastrophe.
author: William Irwin Thompson

quote: Cats are rather delicate creatures and they are subject to a good many different ailments, but I have never heard of one who suffered from insomnia.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: Cats don't like change without their consent.
author: Roger Caras

quote: Cats know how to obtain food without labor, shelter without confinement, and love without penalties.
author: W. L. George

quote: Cats seem to go on the principle that it never does any harm to ask for what you want.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: Caught up in life, you see it badly. You suffer from it or enjoy it too much. The artist, in my opinion, is a monstrosity, something outside of nature.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Cauliflower is nothing but cabbage with a college education.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Cease to inquire what the future has in store, and take as a gift whatever the day brings forth.
author: Horace

quote: Celebrity gives us delusion of self importance.
author: Al Goldstein

quote: Censorship is never over for those who have experienced it. It is a brand on the imagination that affects the individual who has suffered it, forever.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: Censorship, like charity, should begin at home, but, unlike charity, it should end there.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: Central banks don't have divine wisdom. They try to do the best analysis they can and must be prepared to stand or fall by the quality of that analysis.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: Certain I am, that Christian Religion does no where allow Rebellion.
author: Mary Astell

quote: Certain it is that a great responsibility rests upon the statesmen of all nations, not only to fulfill the promises for reduction in armaments, but to maintain the confidence of the people of the world in the hope of an enduring peace.
author: Frank B. Kellogg

quote: Certain thoughts are prayers. There are moments when, whatever be the attitude of the body, the soul is on its knees.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Certainly the best works, and of greatest merit for the public, have proceeded from the unmarried, or childless men.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Chains do not hold a marriage together. It is threads, hundreds of tiny threads, which sew people together through the years.
author: Simone Signoret

quote: Challenges of historic import threaten America's future. Action on the deficit, economy, energy, health care and much more is imperative, yet our legislative institutions fail to act. Congress must be reformed.
author: Evan Bayh

quote: Champagne, if you are seeking the truth, is better than a lie detector. It encourages a man to be expansive, even reckless, while lie detectors are only a challenge to tell lies successfully.
author: Graham Greene

quote: Chance gives rise to thoughts, and chance removes them no art can keep or acquire them.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Chance has never yet satisfied the hope of a suffering people.
author: Marcus Garvey

quote: Chance is perhaps the pseudonym of God when he did not want to sign.
author: Anatole France

quote: Change alone is eternal, perpetual, immortal.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Change alone is unchanging.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Change before you have to.
author: Jack Welch

quote: Change does not roll in on the wheels of inevitability, but comes through continuous struggle. And so we must straighten our backs and work for our freedom. A man can't ride you unless your back is bent.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Change happens by listening and then starting a dialogue with the people who are doing something you don't believe is right.
author: Jane Goodall

quote: Change in all things is sweet.
author: Aristotle

quote: Change is certain. Peace is followed by disturbances departure of evil men by their return. Such recurrences should not constitute occasions for sadness but realities for awareness, so that one may be happy in the interim.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Change is inevitable. Change is constant.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Change is not only likely, it's inevitable.
author: Barbara Sher

quote: Change is the end result of all true learning.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Change means movement. Movement means friction. Only in the frictionless vacuum of a nonexistent abstract world can movement or change occur without that abrasive friction of conflict.
author: Saul Alinsky

quote: Change of weather is the discourse of fools.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Change your life today. Don't gamble on the future, act now, without delay.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Change your opinions, keep to your principles change your leaves, keep intact your roots.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Chaos often breeds life, when order breeds habit.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Chaos was the law of nature Order was the dream of man.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Character cannot be developed in ease and quiet. Only through experience of trial and suffering can the soul be strengthened, ambition inspired, and success achieved.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Character develops itself in the stream of life.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Character is higher than intellect. A great soul will be strong to live as well as think.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Character is power.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: Character, in great and little things, means carrying through what you feel able to do.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Character, in the long run, is the decisive factor in the life of an individual and of nations alike.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Characters do not change. Opinions alter, but characters are only developed.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Charity begins at home, and justice begins next door.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Charity begins at home, but should not end there.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Charity never humiliated him who profited from it, nor ever bound him by the chains of gratitude, since it was not to him but to God that the gift was made.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Charlatanism of some degree is indispensable to effective leadership.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Charm, in most men and nearly all women, is a decoration.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Chastity is the cement of civilization and progress. Without it there is no stability in society, and without it one cannot attain the Science of Life.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Cheerfulness is the best promoter of health and is as friendly to the mind as to the body.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Chemistry itself knows altogether too well that - given the real fear that the scarcity of global resources and energy might threaten the unity of mankind - chemistry is in a position to make a contribution towards securing a true peace on earth.
author: Kenichi Fukui

quote: Chess is as elaborate a waste of human intelligence as you can find outside an advertising agency.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: Chess is not only knowledge and logic.
author: Alexander Alekhine

quote: Chess is the most elaborate waste of human intelligence outside of an advertising agency.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: Chicago's neighborhoods have always been this city's greatest strength.
author: Jane Byrne

quote: Childbirth is more admirable than conquest, more amazing than self-defense, and as courageous as either one.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Childhood itself is scarcely more lovely than a cheerful, kindly, sunshiny old age.
author: Lydia M. Child

quote: Children also have artistic ability, and there is wisdom in there having it! The more helpless they are, the more instructive are the examples they furnish us and they must be preserved free of corruption from an early age.
author: Paul Klee

quote: Children are God's Apostles, sent forth, day by day, to preach of love, and hope, and peace.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Children are amazing, and while I go to places like Princeton and Harvard and Yale, and of course I teach at Columbia, NYU, and that's nice and I love students, but the most fun of all are the real little ones, the young ones.
author: David Dinkins

quote: Children are educated by what the grown-up is and not by his talk.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Children are remarkable for their intelligence and ardor, for their curiosity, their intolerance of shams, the clarity and ruthlessness of their vision.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Children are the anchors of a mother's life.
author: Sophocles

quote: Children begin by loving their parents after a time they judge them rarely, if ever, do they forgive them.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Children born to teens have less supportive and stimulating environments, poorer health, lower cognitive development, and worse educational outcomes. Children of teen mothers are at increased risk of being in foster care and becoming teen parents themselves, thereby repeating the cycle.
author: Jane Fonda

quote: Children enjoy the present because they have neither a past nor a future.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Children have neither a past nor a future. Thus they enjoy the present, which seldom happens to us.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Children rarely want to know who their parents were before they were parents, and when age finally stirs their curiosity, there is no parent left to tell them.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Children say that people are hung sometimes for speaking the truth.
author: Joan of Arc

quote: Children under five are the poorest age group in America, and one in four infants, toddlers and preschoolers are poor during the years of greatest brain development.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: Children, I grant, should be innocent but when the epithet is applied to men, or women, it is but a civil term for weakness.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: Children, dear and loving children, can alone console a woman for the loss of her beauty.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Choice of attention - to pay attention to this and ignore that - is to the inner life what choice of action is to the outer. In both cases, a man is responsible for his choice and must accept the consequences, whatever they may be.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Choose a job you love, and you will never have to work a day in your life.
author: Confucius

quote: Choose silence of all virtues, for by it you hear other men's imperfections, and conceal your own.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Choose your companions from the best Who draws a bucket with the rest soon topples down the hill.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Choreography is mentally draining, but there's a pleasure in getting into the studio with the dancers and the music.
author: Alvin Ailey

quote: Christ does not save us by acting a parable of divine love he acts the parable of divine love by saving us. That is the Christian faith.
author: Austin Farrer

quote: Christianity taught men that love is worth more than intelligence.
author: Jacques Maritain

quote: Christians should be ready for a change because Jesus was the greatest changer in history.
author: Ralph Abernathy

quote: Christmas carols always brought tears to my eyes. I also cry at weddings. I should have cried at a couple of my own.
author: Ethel Merman

quote: Christmas is a season for kindling the fire for hospitality in the hall, the genial flame of charity in the heart.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Christmas is a time when kids tell Santa what they want and adults pay for it. Deficits are when adults tell the government what they want - and their kids pay for it.
author: Richard Lamm

quote: Christmas is not a time nor a season, but a state of mind. To cherish peace and goodwill, to be plenteous in mercy, is to have the real spirit of Christmas.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Christmas is over and Business is Business.
author: Franklin P. Adams

quote: Christmas is the time when kids tell Santa what they want and adults pay for it. Deficits are when adults tell government what they want and their kids pay for it.
author: Richard Lamm

quote: Christmas is, of course, the time to be home - in heart as well as body.
author: Garry Moore

quote: Christmas isn't a season. It's a feeling.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: Chum was a British boy's weekly which, at the end of the year was bound into a single huge book and the following Christmas parents bought it as Christmas presents for male children.
author: A. E. van Vogt

quote: Churchill was the canny political animal, very devious, bursting with energy and determination, learning as hard as he could.
author: Lord Mountbatten

quote: Cinema is the most beautiful fraud in the world.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

quote: Circumstances are beyond human control, but our conduct is in our own power.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Circumstances cause us to act the way we do. We should always bear this in mind before judging the actions of others. I realized this from the start during World War II.
author: Thor Heyerdahl

quote: Circumstances rule men men do not rule circumstances.
author: Herodotus

quote: Citizen Kane is perhaps the one American talking picture that seems as fresh now as the day it opened. It may seem even fresher.
author: Pauline Kael

quote: Civil strife is as much a greater evil than a concerted war effort as war itself is worse than peace.
author: Herodotus

quote: Civil war? What does that mean? Is there any foreign war? Isn't every war fought between men, between brothers?
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Civilisation has ever accompanied emigration and conquest - the conflict of opinion, of religion, or of race.
author: Alfred Russel Wallace

quote: Civilization advances by extending the number of important operations which we can perform without thinking of them.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Civilization as it is known today could not have evolved, nor can it survive, without an adequate food supply.
author: Norman Borlaug

quote: Civilization began the first time an angry person cast a word instead of a rock.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Civilization exists by geological consent, subject to change without notice.
author: Will Durant

quote: Civilization grew in the beginning from the minute that we had communication - particularly communication by sea that enabled people to get inspiration and ideas from each other and to exchange basic raw materials.
author: Thor Heyerdahl

quote: Civilization had too many rules for me, so I did my best to rewrite them.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Civilization is a movement and not a condition, a voyage and not a harbor.
author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quote: Civilization is built on a number of ultimate principles... respect for human life, the punishment of crimes against property and persons, the equality of all good citizens before the law... or, in a word justice.
author: Max Nordau

quote: Civilization is the order and freedom is promoting cultural activity.
author: Will Durant

quote: Civilization is the progress toward a society of privacy. The savage's whole existence is public, ruled by the laws of his tribe. Civilization is the process of setting man free from men.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Civilization is unbearable, but it is less unbearable at the top.
author: Timothy Leary

quote: Civilized countries generally adopt gold or silver or both as money.
author: Alfred Marshall

quote: Civilized men are more discourteous than savages because they know they can be impolite without having their skulls split, as a general thing.
author: Robert E. Howard

quote: Civilized society is perpetually menaced with disintegration through this primary hostility of men towards one another.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Class struggle: external peace, international solidarity, peace among peoples. This is the sacred slogan of international socialist democracy that liberates nations.
author: Karl Liebknecht

quote: Classic art was the art of necessity: modern romantic art bears the stamp of caprice and chance.
author: Max Eastman

quote: Classical plays require more imagination and more general training to be able to do. That's why I like playing Shakespeare better than anything else.
author: Vivien Leigh

quote: Clear thinking requires courage rather than intelligence.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: Clearly no one knows what leadership has gone undiscovered in women of all races, and in black and other minority men.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Clearly, if it is sensible to hold a referendum on independence, it is crucial that we have one on marriage. It is the only way the country can move forward on this issue. Let all those who have a view on this subject place their trust in the Scottish people and let Scotland decide.
author: Keith O'Brien

quote: Clever and attractive women do not want to vote they are willing to let men govern as long as they govern men.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Clever men are good, but they are not the best.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Cleverness is not wisdom.
author: Euripides

quote: Climb the mountains and get their good tidings.
author: John Muir

quote: Clinton's hands remain incredibly clean, don't they, and Tony Blair's smile remains as wide as ever. I view these guises with profound contempt.
author: Harold Pinter

quote: Close your bodily eye, that you may see your picture first with the eye of the spirit. Then bring to light what you have seen in the darkness, that its effect may work back, from without to within.
author: Caspar David Friedrich

quote: Clothes make the man. Naked people have little or no influence on society.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Clouds and darkness surround us, yet Heaven is just, and the day of triumph will surely come, when justice and truth will be vindicated.
author: Mary Todd Lincoln

quote: Clouds come floating into my life, no longer to carry rain or usher storm, but to add color to my sunset sky.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Clouds symbolize the veils that shroud God.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Cock your hat - angles are attitudes.
author: Frank Sinatra

quote: Coercion may prevent many transgressions but it robs even actions which are legal of a part of their beauty. Freedom may lead to many transgressions, but it lends even to vices a less ignoble form.
author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quote: Coercion, after all, merely captures man. Freedom captivates him.
author: Robert McNamara

quote: Collecting more taxes than is absolutely necessary is legalized robbery.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Collective fear stimulates herd instinct, and tends to produce ferocity toward those who are not regarded as members of the herd.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: College is a place to keep warm between high school and an early marriage.
author: George Gobel

quote: College was especially sweet because of the positive, hopeful atmosphere of a college campus.
author: Jerry Kramer

quote: Colloquial poetry is to the real art as the barber's wax dummy is to sculpture.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Color does not add a pleasant quality to design - it reinforces it.
author: Pierre Bonnard

quote: Color in certain places has the great value of making the outlines and structural planes seem more energetic.
author: Antonio Gaudi

quote: Color is a plastic means of creating intervals... color harmonics produced by special relationships, or tensions. We differentiate now between formal tensions and color tensions, just as we differentiate in music between counterpoint and harmony.
author: Hans Hofmann

quote: Come forth into the light of things, let nature be your teacher.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Come forward as servants of Islam, organise the people economically, socially, educationally and politically and I am sure that you will be a power that will be accepted by everybody.
author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

quote: Come live with me and be my love, And we will all the pleasures prove, That valleys, groves, hills, and fields, Woods, or steepy mountain yields.
author: Christopher Marlowe

quote: Come, come, leave business to idlers, and wisdom to fools: they have need of 'em: wit be my faculty, and pleasure my occupation, and let father Time shake his glass.
author: William Congreve

quote: Come, gentlemen, I hope we shall drink down all unkindness.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Comedians don't laugh. They're too busy analyzing why it's funny or not.
author: James Lipton

quote: Comediennes are the lucky ones, because if you're funny, you can be 125 years old and they will still accept you.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: Comedy has to be based on truth. You take the truth and you put a little curlicue at the end.
author: Sid Caesar

quote: Comedy has to be done en clair. You can't blunt the edge of wit or the point of satire with obscurity. Try to imagine a famous witty saying that is not immediately clear.
author: James Thurber

quote: Comedy is not funny. Comedy is hard work and timing and lots and lots of rehearsals.
author: Larry Hagman

quote: Comedy is simply a funny way of being serious.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Comedy, we may say, is society protecting itself - with a smile.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: Coming in solemn beauty like slow old tunes of Spain.
author: John Masefield

quote: Coming to understand a painting or a symphony in an unfamiliar style, to recognize the work of an artist or school, to see or hear in new ways, is as cognitive an achievement as learning to read or write or add.
author: Nelson Goodman

quote: Coming together is a beginning keeping together is progress working together is success.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Commitment means that it is possible for a man to yield the nerve center of his consent to a purpose or cause, a movement or an ideal, which may be more important to him than whether he lives or dies.
author: Howard Thurman

quote: Common looking people are the best in the world: that is the reason the Lord makes so many of them.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Common sense and a sense of humor are the same thing, moving at different speeds. A sense of humor is just common sense, dancing.
author: William James

quote: Common sense in an uncommon degree is what the world calls wisdom.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Common sense is genius dressed in its working clothes.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Common sense is in spite of, not as the result of education.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Common sense is not so common.
author: Voltaire

quote: Common sense is the collection of prejudices acquired by age eighteen.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Common sense is the measure of the possible it is composed of experience and prevision it is calculation applied to life.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Common sense tells us that the things of the earth exist only a little, and that true reality is only in dreams.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Communism has decided against God, against Christ, against the Bible, and against all religion.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Communism is a hateful thing, and a menace to peace and organized government.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: Communism is like one big phone company.
author: Lenny Bruce

quote: Communism possesses a language which every people can understand - its elements are hunger, envy, and death.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Communism, like any other revealed religion, is largely made up of prophecies.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Companies that pollute should be taxed so that a product's cost to society is reflected in the price of that product.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: Compassion alone stands apart from the continuous traffic between good and evil proceeding within us.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Compassion is a call, a demand of nature, to relieve the unhappy as hunger is a natural call for food.
author: Joseph Butler

quote: Compassion is sometimes the fatal capacity for feeling what it is like to live inside somebody else's skin. It is the knowledge that there can never really be any peace and joy for me until there is peace and joy finally for you too.
author: Frederick Buechner

quote: Competence, like truth, beauty, and contact lenses, is in the eye of the beholder.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Competition in armament, both land and naval, is not only a terrible burden upon the people, but I believe it to be one of the greatest menaces to the peace of the world.
author: Frank B. Kellogg

quote: Competition is the keen cutting edge of business, always shaving away at costs.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Complexity is one of the great problems in environmental design.
author: Christopher Alexander

quote: Compromise is the best and cheapest lawyer.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Compromise makes a good umbrella, but a poor roof it is temporary expedient, often wise in party politics, almost sure to be unwise in statesmanship.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Computer Science is embarrassed by the computer.
author: Alan Perlis

quote: Computer science is no more about computers than astronomy is about telescopes.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: Computers are like Old Testament gods lots of rules and no mercy.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Computers are to design as microwaves are to cooking.
author: Milton Glaser

quote: Computers are useless. They can only give you answers.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Computers make it easier to do a lot of things, but most of the things they make it easier to do don't need to be done.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: Computers may save time but they sure waste a lot of paper. About 98 percent of everything printed out by a computer is garbage that no one ever reads.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: Comrade Deng Xiaoping - along with other party elders - gave the party leadership their firm and full support to put down the political disturbance using forceful measures.
author: Li Peng

quote: Comrades, this man has a nice smile, but he's got iron teeth.
author: Andrei A. Gromyko

quote: Conceit spoils the finest genius. There is not much danger that real talent or goodness will be overlooked long even if it is, the consciousness of possessing and using it well should satisfy one, and the great charm of all power is modesty.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Concentrate all your thoughts upon the work at hand. The sun's rays do not burn until brought to a focus.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

quote: Concentrated power is not rendered harmless by the good intentions of those who create it.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: Concentration of executive power, unless it's very temporary and for specific circumstances, let's say fighting world war two, it's an assault on democracy.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: Concepts, like individuals, have their histories and are just as incapable of withstanding the ravages of time as are individuals. But in and through all this they retain a kind of homesickness for the scenes of their childhood.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Concerning God, freewill and destiny: Of all that earth has been or yet may be, all that vain men imagine or believe, or hope can paint or suffering may achieve, we descanted.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Concerning culture as a process, one would say that it means learning a great many things and then forgetting them and the forgetting is as necessary as the learning.
author: Albert J. Nock

quote: Conductors' careers are made for the most part with 'Romantic' music. 'Classic' music eliminates the conductor we do not remember him in it.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: Confidence is something you're born with. I know I had loads of it even at the age of 15.
author: Hedy Lamarr

quote: Confidence is that feeling by which the mind embarks in great and honorable courses with a sure hope and trust in itself.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Confusion of goals and perfection of means seems, in my opinion, to characterize our age.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Congratulations, you have a sense of humor. And to those who didn't: Go stick your head in the mud.
author: Jesse Ventura

quote: Congress, the press, and the bureaucracy too often focus on how much money or effort is spent, rather than whether the money or effort actually achieves the announced goal.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Conjugal love, or the friendship of spouses, can persist even after sexual desires have weakened, withered, and disappeared.
author: Mortimer Adler

quote: Conquest is not in our principles. It is inconsistent with our government.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Conscience is God present in man.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Conscience is the root of all true courage if a man would be brave let him obey his conscience.
author: James Freeman Clarke

quote: Conservation is a state of harmony between men and land.
author: Aldo Leopold

quote: Conservatism discards Prescription, shrinks from Principle, disavows Progress having rejected all respect for antiquity, it offers no redress for the present, and makes no preparation for the future.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Conservatism is a hard choice for a society that has become accustomed to big government and big entitlements promoted by liberals.
author: Jesse Helms

quote: Conservatives are not necessarily stupid, but most stupid people are conservatives.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Consider the fellow. He never spends his time telling you about his previous night's date. You get the idea he has eyes only for you and wouldn't think of looking at another woman.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Consider the momentous event in architecture when the wall parted and the column became.
author: Louis Kahn

quote: Consider this: I can go to Antarctica and get cash from an ATM without a glitch, but should I fall ill during my travels, a hospital there could not access my medical records or know what medications I am on.
author: Nathan Deal

quote: Consider your origins: you were not made to live as brutes, but to follow virtue and knowledge.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Considered now as a possession, one may define culture as the residuum of a large body of useless knowledge that has been well and truly forgotten.
author: Albert J. Nock

quote: Consistency is contrary to nature, contrary to life. The only completely consistent people are dead.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Constant development is the law of life, and a man who always tries to maintain his dogmas in order to appear consistent drives himself into a false position.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Constantly risking absurdity and death whenever he performs above the heads of his audience, the poet, like an acrobat, climbs on rhyme to a high wire of his own making.
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

quote: Constitutions should consist only of general provisions the reason is that they must necessarily be permanent, and that they cannot calculate for the possible change of things.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: Consult your friend on all things, especially on those which respect yourself. His counsel may then be useful where your own self-love might impair your judgment.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Contaminated food is a major cause of diarrhea, substantially contributing to malnutrition and killing about 2.2 million people each year, most of them children.
author: Gro Harlem Brundtland

quote: Contemplation and wisdom are highest achievements and man is not totally at home with them.
author: Gabriel Marcel

quote: Contempt for happiness is usually contempt for other people's happiness, and is an elegant disguise for hatred of the human race.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Content makes poor men rich discontent makes rich men poor.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Continuous effort - not strength or intelligence - is the key to unlocking our potential.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Contradiction is not a sign of falsity, nor the lack of contradiction a sign of truth.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Contrary to general belief, I do not believe that friends are necessarily the people you like best, they are merely the people who got there first.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Control your own destiny or someone else will.
author: Jack Welch

quote: Controversy is part of the nature of art and creativity.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Conventional wisdom notwithstanding, there is no reason either in football or in poetry why the two should not meet in a man's life if he has the weight and cares about the words.
author: Archibald MacLeish

quote: Conversation may be compared to a lyre with seven chords - philosophy, art, poetry, love, scandal, and the weather.
author: Anna Jameson

quote: Conviction without experience makes for harshness.
author: Flannery O'Connor

quote: Convictions are more dangerous foes of truth than lies.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Corruption is nature's way of restoring our faith in democracy.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Costumes and scenery alone will not attract audiences.
author: Anna Held

quote: Could I have but a line a century hence crediting a contribution to the advance of peace, I would yield every honor which has been accorded by war.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: Could I say that the reason that I am here today, you know, from the mouth of the State Department itself, is: I should not be allowed to travel because I have struggled for years for the independence of the colonial peoples of Africa.
author: Paul Robeson

quote: Could a greater miracle take place than for us to look through each other's eyes for an instant?
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Could it be that all those reports coming from our own intelligence that Bush ignored was right all along? Could it be that the UN was right all along?
author: Peter Schuyler

quote: Could we change our attitude, we should not only see life differently, but life itself would come to be different.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Councils of war breed timidity and defeatism.
author: Jack Kemp

quote: Counting is the religion of this generation it is its hope and its salvation.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Countries have lost their culture because what they wanted was money. Money became the running theme in every country and culture was sacrificed.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Country fans need to support country music by buying albums and concert tickets for traditional artists or the music will just fade away. And that would be really sad.
author: George Jones

quote: Country music is three chords and the truth.
author: Harlan Howard

quote: Courage - a perfect sensibility of the measure of danger, and a mental willingness to endure it.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: Courage and grace are a formidable mixture. The only place to see it is in the bullring.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Courage and perseverance have a magical talisman, before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish into air.
author: John Quincy Adams

quote: Courage conquers all things: it even gives strength to the body.
author: Ovid

quote: Courage consists not in hazarding without fear but being resolutely minded in a just cause.
author: Plutarch

quote: Courage is a kind of salvation.
author: Plato

quote: Courage is a mean with regard to fear and confidence.
author: Aristotle

quote: Courage is a special kind of knowledge: the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
author: David Ben-Gurion

quote: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of readiness to die.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Courage is being scared to death... and saddling up anyway.
author: John Wayne

quote: Courage is contagious. When a brave man takes a stand, the spines of others are often stiffened.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Courage is doing what you are afraid to do. There can be no courage unless you are scared.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: Courage is fear holding on a minute longer.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Courage is fire, and bullying is smoke.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Courage is found in unlikely places.
author: J. R. R. Tolkien

quote: Courage is grace under pressure.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Courage is knowing what not to fear.
author: Plato

quote: Courage is like love it must have hope for nourishment.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Courage is not simply one of the virtues, but the form of every virtue at the testing point.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Courage is often lack of insight, whereas cowardice in many cases is based on good information.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Courage is resistance to fear, mastery of fear, not absence of fear.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities - because it is the quality which guarantees all others.
author: Joseph Chamberlain

quote: Courage is rightly esteemed the first of human qualities... because it is the quality which guarantees all others.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Courage is the first of human qualities because it is the quality which guarantees the others.
author: Aristotle

quote: Courage is the greatest of all virtues, because if you haven't courage, you may not have an opportunity to use any of the others.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Courage is the ladder on which all the other virtues mount.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: Courage is the most important of all the virtues, because without courage you can't practice any other virtue consistently. You can practice any virtue erratically, but nothing consistently without courage.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Courage is the price that life exacts for granting peace.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: Courage is very important. Like a muscle, it is strengthened by use.
author: Ruth Gordon

quote: Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Courage is... the knowledge of how to fear what ought to be feared and how not to fear what ought not to be feared.
author: David Ben-Gurion

quote: Courage ought to have eyes as well as arms.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: Courage stands halfway between cowardice and rashness, one of which is a lack, the other an excess of courage.
author: Plutarch

quote: Courage that grows from constitution often forsakes a man when he has occasion for it courage which arises from a sense of duty acts in a uniform manner.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Courage to be is the key to revelatory power of the feminist revolution.
author: Mary Daly

quote: Courage without conscience is a wild beast.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Courage! I have shown it for years think you I shall lose it at the moment when my sufferings are to end?
author: Marie Antoinette

quote: Courage, above all things, is the first quality of a warrior.
author: Karl Von Clausewitz

quote: Courage: Great Russian word, fit for the songs of our children's children, pure on their tongues, and free.
author: Anna Akhmatova

quote: Courtesy is as much a mark of a gentleman as courage.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Courtship is to marriage, as a very witty prologue to a very dull play.
author: William Congreve

quote: Covetousness is both the beginning and the end of the devil's alphabet - the first vice in corrupt nature that moves, and the last which dies.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Cowardice... is almost always simply a lack of ability to suspend functioning of the imagination.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Cowards die many times before their deaths the valiant never taste of death but once.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Crazy Horse saw history as integrated in the present, incorporated into daily life.
author: Stephen Ambrose

quote: Creation destroys as it goes, throws down one tree for the rise of another. But ideal mankind would abolish death, multiply itself million upon million, rear up city upon city, save every parasite alive, until the accumulation of mere existence is swollen to a horror.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Creativity comes from looking for the unexpected and stepping outside your own experience.
author: Masaru Ibuka

quote: Creativity is a great motivator because it makes people interested in what they are doing. Creativity gives hope that there can be a worthwhile idea. Creativity gives the possibility of some sort of achievement to everyone. Creativity makes life more fun and more interesting.
author: Edward de Bono

quote: Creativity is the ability to introduce order into the randomness of nature.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Creativity is the power to connect the seemingly unconnected.
author: William Plomer

quote: Creativity requires the courage to let go of certainties.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Creativity takes courage.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: Credulity is the man's weakness, but the child's strength.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Crime and bad lives are the measure of a State's failure, all crime in the end is the crime of the community.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Crime is terribly revealing. Try and vary your methods as you will, your tastes, your habits, your attitude of mind, and your soul is revealed by your actions.
author: Agatha Christie

quote: Crimes against children are the most heinous crime. That, for me, would be a reason for capital punishment because children are innocent and need the guidance of an adult society.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: Criminals are never very amusing. It's because they're failures. Those who make real money aren't counted as criminals. This is a class distinction, not an ethical problem.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Criticism in the universities, I'll have to admit, has entered a phase where I am totally out of sympathy with 95% of what goes on. It's Stalinism without Stalin.
author: Harold Bloom

quote: Criticism is the art of appraising others at one's own value.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Criticism is the windows and chandeliers of art: it illuminates the enveloping darkness in which art might otherwise rest only vaguely discernible, and perhaps altogether unseen.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Criticism of government finds sanctuary in several portions of the 1st Amendment. It is part of the right of free speech. It embraces freedom of the press.
author: Hugo Black

quote: Cruelty is a tyrant that's always attended with fear.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Cruelty is the law pervading all nature and society and we can't get out of it if we would.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Cubism was an attack on the perspective that had been known and used for 500 years. It was the first big, big change. It confused people: they said, 'Things don't look like that!'
author: David Hockney

quote: Cultivation to the mind is as necessary as food to the body.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Cultural anthropology is more and more rapidly getting to realize itself as a strictly historical science.
author: Edward Sapir

quote: Culture: the cry of men in face of their destiny.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Cunning is the art of concealing our own defects, and discovering other people's weaknesses.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Cunning... is but the low mimic of wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: Cursed be he above all others Who's enslaved by love of money. Money takes the place of brothers, Money takes the place of parents, Money brings us war and slaughter.
author: Anacreon

quote: Cursed is the man who dies, but the evil done by him survives.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: Custom is our nature. What are our natural principles but principles of custom?
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Custom is second nature.
author: Augustine of Hippo

quote: Cynical realism is the intelligent man's best excuse for doing nothing in an intolerable situation.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Cynicism is humor in ill health.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Dad taught me everything I know. Unfortunately, he didn't teach me everything he knows.
author: Al Unser

quote: Dad went to Canada to learn how to fly with the Royal Canadian Air Force. He took me on my first airplane ride, where I could have a hand on the stick.
author: Wally Schirra

quote: Dad worked his entire career as an aviation technician. Mom was a legal secretary who became a teacher. We lived a simple American life.
author: Brian Sandoval

quote: Dad, I'm in some trouble. There's been an accident and you're going to hear all sorts of things about me from now on. Terrible things.
author: Edward Kennedy

quote: Daddy was real gentle with kids. That's why I expected so much out of marriage, figuring that all men should be steady and pleasant.
author: Loretta Lynn

quote: Dali had a good sense of humor - obviously you could tell just looking at him he was funny.
author: Joe Grant

quote: Dalton's records, carefully preserved for a century, were destroyed during the World War II bombing of Manchester. It is not only the living who are killed in war.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Dance, vaudeville, drama, movies - as a child I loved everything that went on in a theater.
author: James Broughton

quote: Dancing is the poetry of the foot.
author: John Dryden

quote: Daoist thought is the root of science and technology in China.
author: Joseph Needham

quote: Dare to be honest and fear no labor.
author: Robert Burns

quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate only love can do that.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Dates with actors, finally, just seemed to me evenings of shop talk. I got sick of it after a hile. So the more famous I became, the more I narrowed down my choices.
author: Hedy Lamarr

quote: De Sade is the one completely consistent and thoroughgoing revolutionary of history.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Dealing with global warming doesn't mean we have all got to suddenly stop breathing. Dealing with global warming means that we have to stop waste, and if you travel for no reason whatsoever, that is a waste.
author: David Attenborough

quote: Dear God! how beauty varies in nature and art. In a woman the flesh must be like marble in a statue the marble must be like flesh.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Death and life have their determined appointments riches and honors depend upon heaven.
author: Confucius

quote: Death and vulgarity are the only two facts in the nineteenth century that one cannot explain away.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Death be not proud, though some have called thee Mighty and dreadful, for thou art not so. For, those, whom thou think'st thou dost overthrow. Die not, poor death, nor yet canst thou kill me.
author: John Donne

quote: Death can't be so bad if mom went through it. It makes it easier for the child to follow.
author: Danny Aiello

quote: Death comes to all, but great achievements build a monument which shall endure until the sun grows cold.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Death destroys a man, but the idea of death saves him.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Death doesn't affect the living because it has not happened yet. Death doesn't concern the dead because they have ceased to exist.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Death doesn't frighten me now I can think peacefully of ending a long life.
author: Jeanne Calment

quote: Death ends a life, not a relationship.
author: Jack Lemon

quote: Death has a tendency to encourage a depressing view of war.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Death in itself is nothing but we fear to be we know not what, we know not where.
author: John Dryden

quote: Death is a challenge. It tells us not to waste time... It tells us to tell each other right now that we love each other.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Death is a commingling of eternity with time in the death of a good man, eternity is seen looking through time.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Death is a delightful hiding place for weary men.
author: Herodotus

quote: Death is a distant rumor to the young.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: Death is a fearful thing.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Death is a release from the impressions of the senses, and from desires that make us their puppets, and from the vagaries of the mind, and from the hard service of the flesh.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Death is a very dull, dreary affair, and my advice to you is to have nothing whatsoever to do with it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Death is an absolute marvel.
author: William Shatner

quote: Death is an absolute mystery. We are all vulnerable to it, it's what makes life interesting and suspenseful.
author: Jeanne Moreau

quote: Death is caused by swallowing small amounts of saliva over a long period of time.
author: George Carlin

quote: Death is delightful. Death is dawn, The waking from a weary night Of fevers unto truth and light.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Death is easier than a wretched life and better never to have born than to live and fare badly.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Death is less bitter punishment than death's delay.
author: Ovid

quote: Death is like an arrow that is already in flight, and your life lasts only until it reaches you.
author: Georg Hermes

quote: Death is no more than passing from one room into another. But there's a difference for me, you know. Because in that other room I shall be able to see.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Death is not an event in life: we do not live to experience death. If we take eternity to mean not infinite temporal duration but timelessness, then eternal life belongs to those who live in the present.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Death is not extinguishing the light it is only putting out the lamp because the dawn has come.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Death is not natural for a state as it is for a human being, for whom death is not only necessary, but frequently even desirable.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Death is not the worst that can happen to men.
author: Plato

quote: Death is nothing, but to live defeated and inglorious is to die daily.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Death is one moment, and life is so many of them.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Death is really a great blessing for humanity, without it there could be no real progress. People who lived for ever would not only hamper and discourage the young, but they would themselves lack sufficient stimulus to be creative.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: Death is softer by far than tyranny.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Death is the easiest of all things after it, and the hardest of all things before it.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: Death is the golden key that opens the palace of eternity.
author: John Milton

quote: Death is the king of this world: 'Tis his park where he breeds life to feed him. Cries of pain are music for his banquet.
author: George Eliot

quote: Death is the last enemy: once we've got past that I think everything will be alright.
author: Alice Thomas Ellis

quote: Death is the only pure, beautiful conclusion of a great passion.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Death is the solution to all problems. No man - no problem.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: Death is the sound of distant thunder at a picnic.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Death is the veil which those who live call life They sleep, and it is lifted.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Death is the wish of some, the relief of many, and the end of all.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Death may be the greatest of all human blessings.
author: Socrates

quote: Death never takes the wise man by surprise, he is always ready to go.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Death not merely ends life, it also bestows upon it a silent completeness, snatched from the hazardous flux to which all things human are subject.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Death solves all problems - no man, no problem.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: Death unites as well as separates it silences all paltry feeling.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Death used to announce itself in the thick of life but now people drag on so long it sometimes seems that we are reaching the stage when we may have to announce ourselves to death. It is as though one needs a special strength to die, and not a final weakness.
author: Ronald Blythe

quote: Death was like love, a romantic escape.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: Death will be a great relief. No more interviews.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Death's an old joke, but each individual encounters it anew.
author: Ivan Turgenev

quote: Death's in the good-bye.
author: Anne Sexton

quote: Death, like birth, is a secret of Nature.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Death, so called, is a thing which makes men weep, And yet a third of life is passed in sleep.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Death, the final, triumphant lover.
author: Bela Lugosi

quote: Death, they say, acquits us of all obligations.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Deceive not thy physician, confessor, nor lawyer.
