quote: For me working on the marriage and not making the easy choice of cheating was something that I could not do.
author: Al Goldstein

quote: For me, a page of good prose is where one hears the rain and the noise of battle. It has the power to give grief or universality that lends it a youthful beauty.
author: John Cheever

quote: For me, every day is a new thing. I approach each project with a new insecurity, almost like the first project I ever did. And I get the sweats. I go in and start working, I'm not sure where I'm going. If I knew where I was going I wouldn't do it.
author: Frank Gehry

quote: For me, however, that beloved, glowing little word happiness has become associated with everything I have felt since childhood upon hearing the sound of the word itself.
author: Herman Hesse

quote: For me, it is just the total experience - from the time I first started as an assistant coach until I wound up at the University of Texas for 20 years.
author: Darrell Royal

quote: For me, journalism has been more a matter of projecting a particular approach to covering policies, to covering issues. It was a continuation of what I tried to do in government.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: For me, life has either been a wake or a wedding.
author: Peter O'Toole

quote: For me, music and life are all about style.
author: Miles Davis

quote: For me, my travels have been the chance to go to a place that already exists in my imagination.
author: Hugo Pratt

quote: For me, prose walks, poetry dances.
author: James Broughton

quote: For me, the peculiar qualities of faith are a logical outcome of this level of biological organization.
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: For me, unemployment and poverty in the Greater Montreal area is not mainly a problem of structure, or design, or statistics. It is a profoundly human situation.
author: Kim Campbell

quote: For modes of faith let graceless zealots fight, His can't be wrong whose life is in the right.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: For most of history, Anonymous was a woman.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: For most of our history, Americans enjoyed both liberty and security from foreign threats.
author: Harry Browne

quote: For much of the female half of the world, food is the first signal of our inferiority. It lets us know that our own families may consider female bodies to be less deserving, less needy, less valuable.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: For my part, I consider that it will be found much better by all parties to leave the past to history, especially as I propose to write that history myself.

quote: For my part, I do not feel that the scheme of future happiness, which ought by rights to be in preparation for me, will be at all interfered with by my not meeting again the man I have in my. mind.
author: James Payn

quote: For my part, I travel not to go anywhere, but to go. I travel for travel's sake. The great affair is to move.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: For my part, whatever anguish of spirit it may cost, I am willing to know the whole truth to know the worst and provide for it.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: For myself I hold no preferences among flowers, so long as they are wild, free, spontaneous. Bricks to all greenhouses! Black thumb and cutworm to the potted plant!
author: Edward Abbey

quote: For myself, if I am to stake all I have and hope to be upon anything, I will venture it upon the abounding fullness of God - upon the assurance that, as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are His ways higher than our ways, and His thoughts than our thoughts.
author: Henry Norris Russell

quote: For one human being to love another that is perhaps the most difficult of all our tasks, the ultimate, the last test and proof, the work for which all other work is but preparation.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: For one swallow does not make a summer, nor does one day and so too one day, or a short time, does not make a man blessed and happy.
author: Aristotle

quote: For one who reads, there is no limit to the number of lives that may be lived, for fiction, biography, and history offer an inexhaustible number of lives in many parts of the world, in all periods of time.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: For our immediate family and relatives, Canada was a land of opportunity.
author: Sidney Altman

quote: For passion, be it observed, brings insight with it it can give a sort of intelligence to simpletons, fools, and idiots, especially during youth.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: For peace is not mere absence of war, but is a virtue that springs from, a state of mind, a disposition for benevolence, confidence, justice.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: For people to understand me when I travel, I speak with my hands.
author: Marcel Carne

quote: For poetry there exists neither large countries nor small. Its domain is in the heart of all men.
author: Giorgos Seferis

quote: For prayer is nothing else than being on terms of friendship with God.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: For science must breathe the oxygen of freedom.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: For small creatures such as we the vastness is bearable only through love.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: For so long as the Jew has even one ally, he will be convinced - in his smallness of mind - that his salvation came from that ally. It is only when he is alone - against all of his own efforts and frantic attempts - that he will, through no choice, be compelled to turn to G-d.

quote: For somehow this disease inheres in tyranny, never to trust one's friends.
author: Aeschylus

quote: For strange effects and extraordinary combinations we must go to life itself, which is always far more daring than any effort of the imagination.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: For success, attitude is equally as important as ability.
author: Walter Scott

quote: For that again, is what all manner of religion essentially is: childish dependency.
author: Albert Ellis

quote: For the execution of the voyage to the Indies, I did not make use of intelligence, mathematics or maps.
author: Christopher Columbus

quote: For the first time in our history, ideology and theology hold a monopoly of power in Washington.
author: Bill Moyers

quote: For the introduction of a new kind of music must be shunned as imperiling the whole state since styles of music are never disturbed without affecting the most important political institutions.
author: Plato

quote: For the last 3 years, we have celebrated National Nurses Week. Beginning on May 6, we will once again have the opportunity to truly commend the nursing community for their contributions to our national health delivery system.
author: Nathan Deal

quote: For the life of me, I don't understand what honest motive there is in putting this in front of this body to philosophically debate marriage on a constitutional amendment that is not going to happen, and which is enormously divisive in all of our communities.

quote: For the man sound of body and serene of mind there is no such thing as bad weather every day has its beauty, and storms which whip the blood do but make it pulse more vigorously.
author: George Gissing

quote: For the meaning of life differs from man to man, from day to day and from hour to hour. What matters, therefore, is not the meaning of life in general but rather the specific meaning of a person's life at a given moment.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: For the merchant, even honesty is a financial speculation.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: For the poison of hatred seated near the heart doubles the burden for the one who suffers the disease he is burdened with his own sorrow, and groans on seeing another's happiness.
author: Aeschylus

quote: For the progress of scientific knowledge will lead to a constant increase of expenditure.
author: Richard Cobden

quote: For the sake of goodness and love, man shall let death have no sovereignty over his thoughts.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: For the subtlest folly proceeds from the subtlest wisdom.
author: John Webster

quote: For the very first time the young are seeing history being made before it is censored by their elders.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: For the victor peace means the preservation of the position of power which he has secured. For the vanquished it means resigning himself to the position left to him.
author: Gustav Stresemann

quote: For the wretched one night is like a thousand for someone faring well death is just one more night.
author: Sophocles

quote: For there is no defense for a man who, in the excess of his wealth, has kicked the great altar of Justice out of sight.
author: Aeschylus

quote: For this reason, the expansion of relations with all countries is on the agenda of the Islamic Republic of Iran. I mean balanced relationships, based on mutual respect and observation of each other's rights.
author: Mahmoud Ahmadinejad

quote: For this reason, to study English literature without some general knowledge of the relation of the Bible to that literature would be to leave one's literary education very incomplete.
author: Lafcadio Hearn

quote: For those who live neither with religious consolations about death nor with a sense of death (or of anything else) as natural, death is the obscene mystery, the ultimate affront, the thing that cannot be controlled. It can only be denied.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: For those who seek to understand it, death is a highly creative force. The highest spiritual values of life can originate from the thought and study of death.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: For though we love both the truth and our friends, piety requires us to honor the truth first.
author: Aristotle

quote: For three days after death, hair and fingernails continue to grow but phone calls taper off.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: For time is the longest distance between two places.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: For tis not in mere death that men die most.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: For to be poised against fatality, to meet adverse conditions gracefully, is more than simple endurance it is an act of aggression, a positive triumph.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: For too long, we have focused on our differences - in our politics and backgrounds, in our race and beliefs - rather than cherishing the unity and pride that binds us together.
author: Bob Riley

quote: For true love is inexhaustible the more you give, the more you have. And if you go to draw at the true fountainhead, the more water you draw, the more abundant is its flow.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: For truly it is to be noted, that children's plays are not sports, and should be deemed as their most serious actions.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: For truth has such a face and such a mien, as to be loved needs only to be seen.
author: John Dryden

quote: For truth is always strange stranger than fiction.
author: Lord Byron

quote: For unflagging interest and enjoyment, a household of children, if things go reasonably well, certainly all other forms of success and achievement lose their importance by comparison.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: For us, sons of France, political sentiment is a passion while, for the Englishmen, politics are a question of business.
author: Wilfrid Laurier

quote: For what Harley Street specialist has time to understand the body, let alone the mind or both in combination, when he is a slave to thirteen thousand a year?
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: For what can war, but endless war, still breed?
author: John Milton

quote: For what is love itself, for the one we love best? An enfolding of immeasurable cares which yet are better than any joys outside our love.
author: George Eliot

quote: For what the horse does under compulsion, as Simon also observes, is done without understanding and there is no beauty in it either, any more than if one should whip and spur a dancer.
author: Xenophon

quote: For whatever be the knowledge which we are able to obtain of God, either by perception or reflection, we must of necessity believe that He is by many degrees far better than what we perceive Him to be.
author: Origen

quote: For women's tears are but the sweat of eyes.
author: Juvenal

quote: For, behind the scenes, halfway around the world in Mexico, were two decades of aggressive research on wheat that not only enabled Mexico to become self-sufficient with respect to wheat production but also paved the way to rapid increase in its production in other countries.
author: Norman Borlaug

quote: For, if a good speaker, never so eloquent, does not see into the fact, and is not speaking the truth of that - is there a more horrid kind of object in creation?
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: For, when with beauty we can virtue join, We paint the semblance of a form divine.
author: Matthew Prior

quote: Forbidden pleasures alone are loved immoderately when lawful, they do not excite desire.
author: Quintilian

quote: Force always attracts men of low morality.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Force and fraud are in war the two cardinal virtues.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Ford used to come to work in a big car with two Admiral's flags, on each side of the car. His assistant would be there with his accordion, playing, Hail to the Chief.

quote: Forget the damned motor car and build the cities for lovers and friends.

quote: Forget the past - the future will give you plenty to worry about.
author: George Allen, Sr.

quote: Forgive, O Lord, my little jokes on Thee, and I'll forgive Thy great big joke on me.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Forgive, son men are men they needs must err.

quote: Forgiveness is about empowering yourself, rather than empowering your past.

quote: Forgiveness is indifference. Forgiveness is impossible while love lasts.
author: Mary Chesnut

quote: Forgiveness is the economy of the heart... forgiveness saves the expense of anger, the cost of hatred, the waste of spirits.

quote: Forgiveness is the final form of love.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Forgiveness is the fragrance that the violet sheds on the heel that has crushed it.

quote: Forgiveness is the giving, and so the receiving, of life.
author: George MacDonald

quote: Forgiveness is the key to action and freedom.

quote: Forgiveness is the remission of sins. For it is by this that what has been lost, and was found, is saved from being lost again.

quote: Forgiveness says you are given another chance to make a new beginning.

quote: Forgiveness to the injured does belong but they ne'er pardon who have done wrong.
author: John Dryden

quote: Forgotten is forgiven.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Form follows beauty.
author: Oscar Niemeyer

quote: Form follows profit is the aesthetic principle of our times.
author: Richard Rogers

quote: Form your life humanly, and you have done enough: but you will never reach the height of art and the depth of science without something divine.

quote: Formerly, when religion was strong and science weak, men mistook magic for medicine now, when science is strong and religion weak, men mistake medicine for magic.

quote: Formula for success: rise early, work hard, strike oil.
author: J. Paul Getty

quote: Fort Smith, being the place of my longest stay, was the scene of my largest medical practice.
author: Ernest Thompson Seton

quote: Fortunately analysis is not the only way to resolve inner conflicts. Life itself still remains a very effective therapist.
author: Karen Horney

quote: Fortunately, somewhere between chance and mystery lies imagination, the only thing that protects our freedom, despite the fact that people keep trying to reduce it or kill it off altogether.
author: Luis Bunuel

quote: Fortune and love favor the brave.
author: Ovid

quote: Fortune knocks but once, but misfortune has much more patience.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Fortune raises up and fortune brings low both the man who fares well and the one who fares badly and there is no prophet of the future for mortal men.
author: Sophocles

quote: Fortune, which has a great deal of power in other matters but especially in war, can bring about great changes in a situation through very slight forces.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Forty is the old age of youth fifty the youth of old age.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Forward, as occasion offers. Never look round to see whether any shall note it... Be satisfied with success in even the smallest matter, and think that even such a result is no trifle.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Four legs good, two legs bad.
author: George Orwell

quote: Fourscore and seven years ago our fathers brought forth on this continent, a new nation, conceived in Liberty, and dedicated to the proposition that all men are created equal.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: France has a very important relationship with Germany. But that does not mean that we agree about everything or that two of our universities or companies are not going to compete.
author: Jean-Pierre Raffarin

quote: France is a place where the money falls apart in your hands but you can't tear the toilet paper.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: France is not poetic she even feels, in fact, a congenital horror of poetry. Among the writers who use verse, those whom she will always prefer are the most prosaic.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: France is the country where the money falls apart and you can't tear the toilet paper.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: Franklin Roosevelt was very concerned about environmental issues.
author: Gaylord Nelson

quote: Frankly, I don't mind not being President. I just mind that someone else is.
author: Edward Kennedy

quote: Frankly, I got into the movies because I like the movies a lot.
author: Jack Nicholson

quote: Free speech is not to be regulated like diseased cattle and impure butter. The audience that hissed yesterday may applaud today, even for the same performance.
author: William O. Douglas

quote: Freedom - to walk free and own no superior.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Freedom and justice cannot be parceled out in pieces to suit political convenience. I don't believe you can stand for freedom for one group of people and deny it to others.
author: Coretta Scott King

quote: Freedom and responsibility aren't interconnected things. They are the same thing.
author: Harry Browne

quote: Freedom can occur only through education.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Freedom comes only to those who no longer ask of life that it shall yield them any of those personal goods that are subject to the mutations of time.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Freedom from effort in the present merely means that there has been effort stored up in the past.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Freedom from the desire for an answer is essential to the understanding of a problem.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Freedom goes hand-in-hand with mutual respect.
author: Kay Rala Xanana Gusmao

quote: Freedom granted only when it is known beforehand that its effects will be beneficial is not freedom.
author: Friedrich August von Hayek

quote: Freedom has a price. Most people aren't willing to pay it.
author: Jack Kevorkian

quote: Freedom has cost too much blood and agony to be relinquished at the cheap price of rhetoric.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: Freedom in a commons brings ruin to all.
author: Garrett Hardin

quote: Freedom in art, freedom in society, this is the double goal towards which all consistent and logical minds must strive.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Freedom in general may be defined as the absence of obstacles to the realization of desires.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Freedom is a man's natural power of doing what he pleases, so far as he is not prevented by force or law.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Freedom is a muscle... you have to exercise it.
author: Roy Scheider

quote: Freedom is a possession of inestimable value.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Freedom is a system based on courage.
author: Charles Peguy

quote: Freedom is absolutely necessary for the progress in science and the liberal arts.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Freedom is always and exclusively freedom for the one who thinks differently.
author: Rosa Luxemburg

quote: Freedom is always the freedom of dissenters.
author: Rosa Luxemburg

quote: Freedom is an indivisible word. If we want to enjoy it, and fight for it, we must be prepared to extend it to everyone, whether they are rich or poor, whether they agree with us or not, no matter what their race or the color of their skin.
author: Wendell Willkie

quote: Freedom is an internal achievement rather than an external adjustment.
author: Powell Clayton

quote: Freedom is control in your own life.
author: Willie Nelson

quote: Freedom is from within.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Freedom is never dear at any price. It is the breath of life. What would a man not pay for living?
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Freedom is never voluntarily given by the oppressor it must be demanded by the oppressed.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Freedom is not procured by a full enjoyment of what is desired, but by controlling the desire.
author: Epictetus

quote: Freedom is not worth having if it does not connote freedom to err.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Freedom is the by-product of economic surplus.
author: Aneurin Bevan

quote: Freedom is the emancipation from the arbitrary rule of other men.
author: Mortimer Adler

quote: Freedom is the freedom to say that two plus two make four. If that is granted, all else follows.
author: George Orwell

quote: Freedom is the only law which genius knows.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Freedom is the open window through which pours the sunlight of the human spirit and human dignity.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Freedom is the oxygen of the soul.
author: Moshe Dayan

quote: Freedom is the recognition of necessity.
author: Friedrich Engels

quote: Freedom is the right to live as we wish.
author: Epictetus

quote: Freedom is the right to one's dignity as a man.
author: Archibald MacLeish

quote: Freedom is the right to tell people what they do not want to hear.
author: George Orwell

quote: Freedom is the sure possession of those alone who have the courage to defend it.
author: Pericles

quote: Freedom is what you do with what's been done to you.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Freedom lies in being bold.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Freedom makes a huge requirement of every human being. With freedom comes responsibility. For the person who is unwilling to grow up, the person who does not want to carry is own weight, this is a frightening prospect.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Freedom means the opportunity to be what we never thought we would be.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: Freedom of choice is more to be treasured than any possession earth can give.
author: David O. McKay

quote: Freedom of conscience entails more dangers than authority and despotism.
author: Michel Foucault

quote: Freedom of expression comes with responsibilities, especially when it comes with serious implications for peace.
author: Mohammed Morsi

quote: Freedom of expression is the matrix, the indispensable condition, of nearly every other form of freedom.
author: Benjamin Cardozo

quote: Freedom of opinion can only exist when the government thinks itself secure.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Freedom of speech is always under attack by Fascist mentality, which exists in all parts of the world, unfortunately.
author: Lawrence Ferlinghetti

quote: Freedom of the press is not an end in itself but a means to the end of achieving a free society.
author: Felix Frankfurter

quote: Freedom only for the members of the government, only for the members of the Party - though they are quite numerous - is no freedom at all.
author: Rosa Luxemburg

quote: Freedom would be not to choose between black and white but to abjure such prescribed choices.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: Freedom, morality, and the human dignity of the individual consists precisely in this that he does good not because he is forced to do so, but because he freely conceives it, wants it, and loves it.
author: Mikhail Bakunin

quote: Freedom. And Justice. If you have those two, it covers everything. You must stick to those principles and have the courage of your convictions.
author: Ian Smith

quote: French novels generally treat of the relations of women to the world and to lovers, after marriage consequently there is a great deal in French novels about adultery, about improper relations between the sexes, about many things which the English public would not allow.
author: Lafcadio Hearn

quote: Friends are as companions on a journey, who ought to aid each other to persevere in the road to a happier life.
author: Pythagoras

quote: Friends are born, not made.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Friends are the siblings God never gave us.
author: Mencius

quote: Friends are thieves of time.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Friends show their love in times of trouble, not in happiness.
author: Euripides

quote: Friends... they cherish one another's hopes. They are kind to one another's dreams.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Friendship at first sight, like love at first sight, is said to be the only truth.
author: Herman Melville

quote: Friendship can only exist between persons with similar interests and points of view. Man and woman by the conventions of society are born with different interests and different points of view.
author: August Strindberg

quote: Friendship has its illusions no less than love.
author: Stendhal

quote: Friendship improves happiness and abates misery, by the doubling of our joy and the dividing of our grief.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Friendship increases in visiting friends, but in visiting them seldom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Friendship is Love without his wings!
author: Lord Byron

quote: Friendship is a plant of slow growth and must undergo and withstand the shocks of adversity before it is entitled to the appellation.
author: George Washington

quote: Friendship is a pretty full-time occupation if you really are friendly with somebody. You can't have too many friends because then you're just not really friends.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Friendship is a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Friendship is a single soul dwelling in two bodies.
author: Aristotle

quote: Friendship is a very taxing and arduous form of leisure activity.
author: Mortimer Adler

quote: Friendship is an arrangement by which we undertake to exchange small favors for big ones.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: Friendship is but another name for an alliance with the follies and the misfortunes of others. Our own share of miseries is sufficient: why enter then as volunteers into those of another?
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Friendship is essentially a partnership.
author: Aristotle

quote: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character.
author: Charles Eastman

quote: Friendship is held to be the severest test of character. It is easy, we think, to be loyal to a family and clan, whose blood is in your own veins.
author: Charles Alexander Eastman

quote: Friendship is one mind in two bodies.
author: Mencius

quote: Friendship is the golden thread that ties the heart of all the world.
author: John Evelyn

quote: Friendship is the marriage of the soul, and this marriage is liable to divorce.
author: Voltaire

quote: Friendship is the shadow of the evening, which increases with the setting sun of life.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Friendship is the source of the greatest pleasures, and without friends even the most agreeable pursuits become tedious.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Friendship is two-sided. It isn't a friend just because someone's doing something nice for you. That's a nice person. There's friendship when you do for each other. It's like marriage - it's two-sided.
author: John Wooden

quote: Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art... It has no survival value rather it is one of those things that give value to survival.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Friendship may, and often does, grow into love, but love never subsides into friendship.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Friendship with ones self is all important, because without it one cannot be friends with anyone else in the world.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Friendship without self-interest is one of the rare and beautiful things of life.
author: James F. Byrnes

quote: Friendship, like love, is destroyed by long absence, though it may be increased by short intermissions.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Friendship, like the immortality of the soul, is too good to be believed.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Frisbeetarianism is the belief that when you die, your soul goes up on the roof and gets stuck.
author: George Carlin

quote: Frivolity is inborn, conceit acquired by education.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: From 1836, down to last year, there is no proof of the Government having any confidence in the duration of peace, or possessing increased security against war.
author: Richard Cobden

quote: From a commercial point of view, if Christmas did not exist it would be necessary to invent it.
author: Katharine Whitehorn

quote: From all this it follows what the general character of the problem of the development of a body of scientific knowledge is, in so far as it depends on elements internal to science itself.
author: Talcott Parsons

quote: From an early age I didn't buy into the value systems of working hard in a nine-to-five job. I thought creativity, friendship and loyalty and pushing the boundaries of what was acceptable was much more interesting.
author: Adam Clayton

quote: From as long as, literally as far back as I can remember I've liked puns, word jokes, I can literally recall looking at a comic at the age of six or seven and I remember what I enjoyed and what it was precisely and how the joke worked.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: From childhood I was passionately fond of music and wanted to be a musician. I have no recollection of any real desire ever to be anything else.
author: John Philip Sousa

quote: From lies to forgeries the step is not so long, and I have written technical essays on the logic of forgeries and on the influence of forgeries on history.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: From my rotting body, flowers shall grow and I am in them and that is eternity.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: From politics, it was an easy step to silence.
author: Jane Austen

quote: From principles is derived probability, but truth or certainty is obtained only from facts.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: From reading a previous answer, you know that I consider all those aspects to be part of American cultural myth and thus they figure into good American poetry, whether the poet is aware of what he is doing or not.
author: Diane Wakoski

quote: From secrecy and deception in high places, come home, America. From military spending so wasteful that it weakens our nation, come home, America.
author: George McGovern

quote: From sixteen to twenty, all women, kept in humor by their hopes and by their attractions, appear to be good-natured.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: From success you get a lot of things, but not that great inside thing that love brings you.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: From the age of fifteen, dogma has been the fundamental principle of my religion: I know no other religion I cannot enter into the idea of any other sort of religion religion, as a mere sentiment, is to me a dream and a mockery.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: From the depth of need and despair, people can work together, can organize themselves to solve their own problems and fill their own needs with dignity and strength.
author: Cesar Chavez

quote: From the described experiment it is clear that the mere act of eating, the food even not reaching the stomach, determines the stimulation of the gastric glands.
author: Ivan Pavlov

quote: From the equality of rights springs identity of our highest interests you cannot subvert your neighbor's rights without striking a dangerous blow at your own.
author: Carl Schurz

quote: From the errors of others, a wise man corrects his own.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: From the gut comes the strut, and where hunger reigns, strength abstains.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: From the lowest animals of which we can affirm intelligence up to man this type of intellect is found.
author: Edward Thorndike

quote: From the naturalistic point of view, all men are equal. There are only two exceptions to this rule of naturalistic equality: geniuses and idiots.
author: Mikhail Bakunin

quote: From the solemn gloom of the temple children run out to sit in the dust, God watches them play and forgets the priest.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: From the time I was a kid, I always knew something was going to happen to me. Didn't know exactly what.
author: Elvis Presley

quote: From their experience or from the recorded experience of others (history), men learn only what their passions and their metaphysical prejudices allow them to learn.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: From there to here, and here to there, funny things are everywhere.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: From those to whom much is given, much is expected. I have been given much - the love of my family, the faith and trust of the people of New York, and the chance to lead this state. I am deeply sorry that I did not live up to what was expected of me.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: From time immemorial artistic insights have been revealed to artists in their sleep and in dreams, so that at all times they ardently desired them.
author: Paracelsus

quote: From what the moderns want, we must learn what poetry should become from what the ancients did, what poetry must be.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: From you we have learned what we, at least, value, to separate Church and State and from you we gather inspiration at all times in our devotion to learning, to religious liberty, and to individual and National freedom.
author: Seth Low

quote: From your parents you learn love and laughter and how to put one foot before the other. But when books are opened you discover that you have wings.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: Frontiersmen good and bad, gunmen as well as inspired prophets of the future, have been my camp companions. Thus, I know the country of which I am about to write as few men now living have known it.
author: Buffalo Bill

quote: Fudging the data in any way whatsoever is quite literally a sin against the holy ghost of science. I'm not religious, but I put it that way because I feel so strongly. It's the one thing you do not ever do. You've got to have standards.
author: James Lovelock

quote: Full of wisdom are the ordinations of fate.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Fun I love, but too much fun is of all things the most loathsome. Mirth is better than fun, and happiness is better than mirth.
author: William Blake

quote: Fun is good.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Fundamental ideas are not a consequence of experience, but a result of the particular constitution and activity of the mind, which is independent of all experience in its origin, though constantly combined with experience in its exercise.
author: William Whewell

quote: Fundamentalists are panicked by the apparent disintegration of the family, the disappearance of certainty and the decay of morality. Fear leads them to ask, if we cannot trust the Bible, what can we trust?
author: Garrett Hardin

quote: Funny is an attitude.
author: Flip Wilson

quote: Funny is funny is funny.
author: Bob Newhart

quote: Funny is funny.
author: Don Rickles

quote: Funny is not a color. Being black is only good from the time you get from the curtain to the microphone.
author: Flip Wilson

quote: Funny things happen to you in movies for silly reasons.
author: Michael Caine

quote: Further, the dignity of the science itself seems to require that every possible means be explored for the solution of a problem so elegant and so celebrated.
author: Carl Friedrich Gauss

quote: G is Grace, the Flaming Star is the Torch of Reason. Those who possess this knowledge are indeed Illuminati.
author: Adam Weishaupt

quote: Gags die, humor doesn't.
author: Jack Benny

quote: Galileo was no idiot. Only an idiot could believe that science requires martyrdom - that may be necessary in religion, but in time a scientific result will establish itself.
author: David Hilbert

quote: Gambling with cards or dice or stocks is all one thing. It's getting money without giving an equivalent for it.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Gaming in general is a male thing. It isn't that gaming is designed to exclude women. Everybody who's tried to design a game to interest a large female audience has failed. And I think that has to do with the different thinking processes of men and women.
author: Gary Gygax

quote: Gandhi has asked that the British Government should walk out of India and leave the Indian people to settle differences among themselves, even if it means chaos and confusion.
author: Stafford Cripps

quote: Garden as though you will live forever.
author: William Kent

quote: Gardening is how I relax. It's another form of creating and playing with colors.
author: Oscar de la Renta

quote: Gardening is not a rational act.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Gardens are not made by singing 'Oh, how beautiful,' and sitting in the shade.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Gay people are the sweetest, kindest, most artistic, warmest and most thoughtful people in the world. And since the beginning of time all they've ever been is kicked.
author: Little Richard

quote: Gender consciousness has become involved in almost every intellectual field: history, literature, science, anthropology. There's been an extraordinary advance.
author: Clifford Geertz

quote: General Howard informed me, in a haughty spirit, that he would give my people 30 days to go back home, collect all their stock, and move onto the reservation.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: General Musharraf needs my participation to give credibility to the electoral process, as well as to respect the fundamental right of all those who wish to vote for me.
author: Benazir Bhutto

quote: General benevolence, but not general friendship, made a man what he ought to be.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Generally speaking, a howling wilderness does not howl: it is the imagination of the traveler that does the howling.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Generally speaking, the errors in religion are dangerous those in philosophy only ridiculous.
author: David Hume

quote: Genius ain't anything more than elegant common sense.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Genius always finds itself a century too early.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Genius always gives its best at first prudence, at last.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Genius at first is little more than a great capacity for receiving discipline.
author: George Eliot

quote: Genius is an African who dreams up snow.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: Genius is more often found in a cracked pot than in a whole one.
author: E. B. White

quote: Genius is present in every age, but the men carrying it within them remain benumbed unless extraordinary events occur to heat up and melt the mass so that it flows forth.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Genius is the ability to put into effect what is on your mind.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Genius is the ability to renew one's emotions in daily experience.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: Genius unrefined resembles a flash of lightning, but wisdom is like the sun.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: Genius without education is like silver in the mine.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Genius without religion is only a lamp on the outer gate of a palace it may serve to cast a gleam of light on those that are without, while the inhabitant sits in darkness.
author: Hannah More

quote: Genius worship is the inevitable sign of an uncreative age.
author: Clive Bell

quote: Genteel women suppose that those things do not really exist about which it is impossible to talk in polite company.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Gentlemen have talked a great deal of patriotism. A venerable word, when duly practiced.
author: Robert Walpole

quote: Gentlemen, I fervently trust that before long the principle of arbitration may win such confidence as to justify its extension to a wider field of international differences.
author: Henry Campbell-Bannerman

quote: Gentleness doesn't get work done unless you happen to be a hen laying eggs.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Gentleness, self-sacrifice and generosity are the exclusive possession of no one race or religion.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Genuine happiness can only be achieved when we transform our way of life from the unthinking pursuit of pleasure to one committed to enriching our inner lives, when we focus on 'being more' rather than simply having more.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Genuine poetry can communicate before it is understood.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Geological change usually takes thousands of years to happen but we are seeing the climate changing not just in our lifetimes but also year by year.
author: James Lovelock

quote: Germany has reduced savagery to a science, and this great war for the victorious peace of justice must go on until the German cancer is cut clean out of the world body.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Gestures, in love, are incomparably more attractive, effective and valuable than words.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: Get correct views of life, and learn to see the world in its true light. It will enable you to live pleasantly, to do good, and, when summoned away, to leave without regret.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: Get mad, then get over it.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Get up tomorrow early in the morning, and earlier than you did today, and do the best that you can. Always stay near me, for tomorrow I will have much to do and more than I ever had, and tomorrow blood will leave my body above the breast.
author: Joan of Arc

quote: Get well cards have become so humorous that if you don't get sick you're missing half the fun.
author: Flip Wilson

quote: Get your facts first, then you can distort them as you please.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Getting ahead in a difficult profession requires avid faith in yourself. That is why some people with mediocre talent, but with great inner drive, go so much further than people with vastly superior talent.
author: Sophia Loren

quote: Getting and spending, we lay waste our powers.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Getting divorced just because you don't love a man is almost as silly as getting married just because you do.
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quote: Getting money is not all a man's business: to cultivate kindness is a valuable part of the business of life.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Getting out of bed in the morning is an act of false confidence.
author: Jules Feiffer

quote: Getting rid of a delusion makes us wiser than getting hold of a truth.
author: Ludwig Borne

quote: Girls are the future mothers of our society, and it is important that we focus on their well-being.
author: Miriam Makeba

quote: Girls have an unfair advantage over men: if they can't get what they want by being smart, they can get it by being dumb.
author: Yul Brynner

quote: Girls shouldn't worry about being the equal of men in the business world.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Girls we love for what they are young men for what they promise to be.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Give a girl an education and introduce her properly into the world, and ten to one but she has the means of settling well, without further expense to anybody.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Give a little love to a child, and you get a great deal back.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Give a man health and a course to steer, and he'll never stop to trouble about whether he's happy or not.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Give me a couple of years, and I'll make that actress an overnight success.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: Give me a smart idiot over a stupid genius any day.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: Give me golf clubs, fresh air and a beautiful partner, and you can keep the clubs and the fresh air.
author: Jack Benny

quote: Give me liberty or give me death.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: Give me odorous at sunrise a garden of beautiful flowers where I can walk undisturbed.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Give me the luxuries of life and I will willingly do without the necessities.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Give us grace and strength to forbear and to persevere. Give us courage and gaiety and the quiet mind, spare to us our friends, soften to us our enemies.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Give your teachers the respect they deserve, because they are the ones who can help you get where you need to go.
author: Richard Howard

quote: Given my last position, that I was the first U.S attorney post 9/11 in New Jersey, I understand acutely the pain and sorrow and upset of the family members who lost loved ones that day at the hands of radical Muslim extremists. And their sensitivities and concerns have to be taken into account.
author: Chris Christie

quote: Giving every man a vote has no more made men wise and free than Christianity has made them good.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Glance into the world just as though time were gone: and everything crooked will become straight to you.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Glory is fleeting, but obscurity is forever.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Go as far as you can see when you get there, you'll be able to see farther.
author: J. P. Morgan

quote: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams. Live the life you have imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Go miser go, for money sell your soul. Trade wares for wares and trudge from pole to pole, So others may say when you are dead and gone. See what a vast estate he left his son.
author: John Dryden

quote: Go on failing. Go on. Only next time, try to fail better.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Go on thinking that you don't need to be read and you'll find that it may become quite true: no one will feel the need tom read it because it is written for yourself alone and the public won't feel any impulse to gate crash such a private party.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: Go right straight down the road, to do what is best, and to do it frankly and without evasion.
author: George C. Marshall

quote: Go to Heaven for the climate, Hell for the company.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Go to foreign countries and you will get to know the good things one possesses at home.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Go up close to your friend, but do not go over to him! We should also respect the enemy in our friend.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: God Almighty first planted a garden. And indeed, it is the purest of human pleasures.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: God Almighty never intended that the devil should triumph over the Church. He never intended that the saloons should walk rough-shod over Christianity.
author: Billy Sunday

quote: God almighty made women and the Rockefeller gang of thieves made the ladies.
author: Mary Harris Jones

quote: God always strives together with those who strive.
author: Aeschylus

quote: God always takes the simplest way.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: God and Nature first made us what we are, and then out of our own created genius we make ourselves what we want to be. Follow always that great law. Let the sky and God be our limit and Eternity our measurement.
author: Marcus Garvey

quote: God appoints our graces to be nurses to other men's weaknesses.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: God asks no man whether he will accept life. That is not the choice. You must take it. The only choice is how.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: God bears with the wicked, but not forever.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: God can be realized through all paths. All religions are true. The important thing is to reach the roof. You can reach it by stone stairs or by wooden stairs or by bamboo steps or by a rope. You can also climb up by a bamboo pole.
author: Ramakrishna

quote: God cannot give us a happiness and peace apart from Himself, because it is not there. There is no such thing.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: God could not be everywhere, and therefore he made mothers.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: God created man and, finding him not sufficiently alone, gave him a companion to make him feel his solitude more keenly.
author: Paul Valery

quote: God created man in His own image, says the Bible philosophers reverse the process: they create God in theirs.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: God created the family to provide the maximum love and support and morality and example that one can imagine.
author: Jerry Falwell

quote: God created the world the laws of nature were created by God. True science tries to find out what God put in the world. The trouble is where scientists speculate about theology and they don't know what they're talking about because they weren't there. They can't speculate about the origins of life because they weren't there.
author: Pat Robertson

quote: God creates out of nothing. Wonderful you say. Yes, to be sure, but he does what is still more wonderful: he makes saints out of sinners.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: God did not intend the human family to be wafted to heaven on flowery beds of ease.
author: Frank Knox

quote: God does not play dice.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: God employs several translators some pieces are translated by age, some by sickness, some by war, some by justice.
author: John Donne

quote: God enters by a private door into every individual.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: God expects but one thing of you, and that is that you should come out of yourself in so far as you are a created being made and let God be God in you.
author: Meister Eckhart

quote: God flourished my ministry and my career of creative thinking, communicating and writing back 50 years.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: God gave us faculties for our use each of them will receive its proper reward. Then do not let us try to charm them to sleep, but permit them to do their work until divinely called to something higher.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: God gave us memory so that we might have roses in December.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: God gave us the gift of life it is up to us to give ourselves the gift of living well.
author: Voltaire

quote: God gets you to the plate, but once your there your on your own.
author: Ted Williams

quote: God gives the nuts, but he does not crack them.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: God gives us intelligence to uncover the wonders of nature. Without the gift, nothing is possible.
author: James Clavell

quote: God gives us relatives thank God, we can choose our friends.
author: Addison Mizner

quote: God grant me the courage not to give up what I think is right even though I think it is hopeless.
author: Chester W. Nimitz

quote: God grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, the courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: God grant you the strength to fight off the temptations of surrender.
author: Walter Annenberg

quote: God had one son on earth without sin, but never one without suffering.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: God hangs the greatest weights upon the smallest wires.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: God has a most wicked sense of humor.
author: Maureen O'Hara

quote: God has been pleased to save us during the years of war that have already passed. We pray that He may be pleased to save us to the end. But we must do our part.
author: Eamon de Valera

quote: God has been very good to me, for I never dwell upon anything wrong which a person has done, so as to remember it afterwards. If I do remember it, I always see some other virtue in that person.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: God has cared for these trees, saved them from drought, disease, avalanches, and a thousand tempests and floods. But he cannot save them from fools.
author: John Muir

quote: God has entrusted me with myself.
author: Epictetus

quote: God has given us two hands, one to receive with and the other to give with.
author: Billy Graham

quote: God has given you one face, and you make yourself another.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: God has placed no limits to the exercise of the intellect he has given us, on this side of the grave.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: God has two dwellings one in heaven, and the other in a meek and thankful heart.
author: Izaak Walton

quote: God has ways of shaking the world when He is at work. He literally caused the ground to quake when Jesus died on the cross.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: God hates violence. He has ordained that all men fairly possess their property, not seize it.
author: Euripides

quote: God hath given you one face, and you make yourselves another.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: God helps those who fear Him.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: God helps those who help themselves.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: God invented concubinage, satan marriage.
author: Francis Picabia

quote: God is His own Design and End, and that there is no other Worthy of Him.
author: Mary Astell

quote: God is a comedian, playing to an audience too afraid to laugh.
author: Voltaire

quote: God is a metaphor for that which transcends all levels of intellectual thought. It's as simple as that.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: God is a thought who makes crooked all that is straight.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: God is absence. God is the solitude of man.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: God is another name for human intelligence raised above all error and imperfection, and extended to all possible truth.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: God is at home, it's we who have gone out for a walk.
author: Meister Eckhart

quote: God is day and night, winter and summer, war and peace, surfeit and hunger.
author: Heraclitus

quote: God is each truly and exalted thing, therefore the individual himself to the highest degree. But are not nature and the world individuals?
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: God is everywhere but He is most manifest in man. So serve man as God. That is as good as worshipping God.
author: Ramakrishna

quote: God is in all men, but all men are not in God that is why we suffer.
author: Ramakrishna

quote: God is more interested in your future and your relationships than you are.
author: Billy Graham

quote: God is not a dead equation!
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: God is not on the side of the big battalions, but on the side of those who shoot best.
author: Voltaire

quote: God is not present in idols. Your feelings are your god. The soul is your temple.
author: Chanakya

quote: God is not upset that Gandhi was not a Christian, because God is not a Christian! All of God's children and their different faiths help us to realize the immensity of God.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: God is not willing to do everything, and thus take away our free will and that share of glory which belongs to us.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: God is one, greatest of gods and men, not like mortals in body or thought.
author: Xenophanes

quote: God is only a great imaginative experience.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: God is really only another artist. He invented the giraffe, the elephant and the cat. He has no real style, He just goes on trying other things.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: God is the great mysterious motivator of what we call nature, and it has often been said by philosophers, that nature is the will of God. And I prefer to say that nature is the only body of God that we shall ever see.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: God is the perfect poet.
author: Robert Browning

quote: God is the tangential point between zero and infinity.
author: Alfred Jarry

quote: God is the universal substance in existing things. He comprises all things. He is the fountain of all being. In Him exists everything that is.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: God is to be worshipped as the one beloved, dearer than everything in this and next life.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: God is, even though the whole world deny him. Truth stands, even if there be no public support. It is self-sustained.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: God isn't compatible with machinery and scientific medicine and universal happiness. You must make your choice. Our civilization has chosen machinery and medicine and happiness.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: God judged it better to bring good out of evil than to suffer no evil to exist.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: God lends a helping hand to the man who tries hard.
author: Aeschylus

quote: God loves each of us as if there were only one of us.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: God loves to help him who strives to help himself.
author: Aeschylus

quote: God made everything out of nothing, but the nothingness shows through.
author: Paul Valery

quote: God made man to go by motives, and he will not go without them, any more than a boat without steam or a balloon without gas.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: God made me and broke the mold.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: God made the Idiot for practice, and then He made the School Board.
author: Mark Twain

quote: God may be in the details, but the goddess is in the questions. Once we begin to ask them, there's no turning back.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: God may be subtle, but he isn't plain mean.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: God may forgive your sins, but your nervous system won't.
author: Alfred Korzybski

quote: God moves in a mysterious way, His wonders to perform. He plants his footsteps in the sea, and rides upon the storm.
author: William Cowper

quote: God never ends anything on a negative God always ends on a positive.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: God pardons like a mother, who kisses the offense into everlasting forgiveness.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: God preordained, for his own glory and the display of His attributes of mercy and justice, a part of the human race, without any merit of their own, to eternal salvation, and another part, in just punishment of their sin, to eternal damnation.
author: John Calvin

quote: God proved His love on the Cross. When Christ hung, and bled, and died, it was God saying to the world, 'I love you.'
author: Billy Graham

quote: God reigns when we take a liberal view, when a liberal view is presented to us.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: God screens us evermore from premature ideas.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: God sometimes does try to the uttermost those whom he wishes to bless.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: God the Father, the supreme Architect, had already built this cosmic home we behold, the most sacred temple of His godhead, by the laws of His mysterious wisdom.
author: Giovanni Pico della Mirandola

quote: God tolerates even our stammering, and pardons our ignorance whenever something inadvertently escapes us - as, indeed, without this mercy there would be no freedom to pray.
author: John Calvin

quote: God used beautiful mathematics in creating the world.
author: Paul Dirac

quote: God who is eternally complete, who directs the stars, who is the master of fates, who elevates man from his lowliness to Himself, who speaks from the cosmos to every single human soul, is the most brilliant manifestation of the goal of perfection.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: God will forgive me that's his business.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: God will forgive me. It's his job.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: God will never direct us to be prideful, arrogant and unforgiving, immoral or slothful or full of fear. We step into these things because we are insensitive to the leadership of the Holy Spirit within us.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: God will never tell us to do something that gratifies the flesh.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: God will prepare everything for our perfect happiness in heaven, and if it takes my dog being there, I believe he'll be there.
author: Billy Graham

quote: God works wonders now and then Behold a lawyer, an honest man.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: God's angels often protect his servants from potential enemies.
author: Billy Graham

quote: God's children and their happiness are my reasons for being.
author: Red Skelton

quote: God's delays are not God's denials.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: God's dice always have a lucky roll.
author: Sophocles

quote: God's dream is that you and I and all of us will realize that we are family, that we are made for togetherness, for goodness, and for compassion.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: God's finger touched him, and he slept.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: God's first creature, which was light.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: God's gifts put man's best dreams to shame.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: God's love is too great to be confined to any one side of a conflict or to any one religion.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: God's mercy and grace give me hope - for myself, and for our world.
author: Billy Graham

quote: God's most lordly gift to man is decency of mind.
author: Aeschylus

quote: God's plan for enlarging His kingdom is so simple - one person telling another about the Savior. Yet we're busy and full of excuses. Just remember, someone's eternal destiny is at stake. The joy you'll have when you meet that person in heaven will far exceed any discomfort you felt in sharing the gospel.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: God's truth judges created things out of love, and Satan's truth judges them out of envy and hatred.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: God's voice is still and quiet and easily buried under an avalanche of clamour.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: God, I can push the grass apart and lay my finger on Thy heart.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: God, as Truth, has been for me a treasure beyond price. May He be so to every one of us.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: God, give us grace to accept with serenity the things that cannot be changed, courage to change the things which should be changed and the wisdom to distinguish the one from the other.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: God... a being whose only definition is that he is beyond man's power to conceive.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Goddam money. It always ends up making you blue as hell.
author: J. D. Salinger

quote: Godot is whatever it is in life that you are waiting for: 'I'm waiting to win the lottery. I'm waiting to fall in love'. For me, as a child, it was Christmas. At least that eventually came.
author: Ian Mckellen

quote: Going home must be like going to render an account.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Going to church doesn't make you any more a Christian than going to the garage makes you a car.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Going to war without France is like going hunting without an accordion.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: Going to work for a large company is like getting on a train. Are you going sixty miles an hour or is the train going sixty miles an hour and you're just sitting still?
author: J. Paul Getty

quote: Gold and silver, like other commodities, have an intrinsic value, which is not arbitrary, but is dependent on their scarcity, the quantity of labour bestowed in procuring them, and the value of the capital employed in the mines which produce them.
author: David Ricardo

quote: Golf is a day spent in a round of strenuous idleness.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Golf is a game in which one endeavors to control a ball with implements ill adapted for the purpose.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Golf is a game in which you yell 'fore,' shoot six, and write down five.
author: Paul Harvey

quote: Golf is a good walk spoiled.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Golf is so popular simply because it is the best game in the world at which to be bad.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Golf... is the infallible test. The man who can go into a patch of rough alone, with the knowledge that only God is watching him, and play his ball where it lies, is the man who will serve you faithfully and well.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: Good acting is all in the writing. If it isn't on the page, then it really won't make any difference. You cannot act on force of personality alone.
author: Larry Hagman

quote: Good actions give strength to ourselves and inspire good actions in others.
author: Plato

quote: Good artists copy, great artists steal.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Good books, like good friends, are few and chosen the more select, the more enjoyable.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Good breeding consists in concealing how much we think of ourselves and how little we think of the other person.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Good breeding differs, if at all, from high breeding only as it gracefully remembers the rights of others, rather than gracefully insists on its own rights.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Good breeding is the result of good sense, some good nature, and a little self-denial for the sake of others.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Good business leaders create a vision, articulate the vision, passionately own the vision, and relentlessly drive it to completion.
author: Jack Welch

quote: Good character is not formed in a week or a month. It is created little by little, day by day. Protracted and patient effort is needed to develop good character.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Good communication is just as stimulating as black coffee, and just as hard to sleep after.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Good design is good business.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: Good friends, good books and a sleepy conscience: this is the ideal life.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Good habits formed at youth make all the difference.
author: Aristotle

quote: Good health and good sense are two of life's greatest blessings.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: Good health is not something we can buy. However, it can be an extremely valuable savings account.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

quote: Good humor is one of the best articles of dress one can wear in society.
author: William Makepeace Thackeray

quote: Good humor is the health of the soul, sadness is its poison.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Good judgment comes from experience and experience comes from bad judgment.
author: Fred Brooks

quote: Good judgment comes from experience, and a lot of that comes from bad judgment.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Good leadership consists of showing average people how to do the work of superior people.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Good management consists in showing average people how to do the work of superior people.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Good manners is the art of making those people easy with whom we converse. Whoever makes the fewest people uneasy is the best bred in the room.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Good men must not obey the laws too well.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Good music is very close to primitive language.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Good nature is worth more than knowledge, more than money, more than honor, to the persons who possess it.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Good night, good night! Parting is such sweet sorrow, that I shall say good night till it be morrow.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the laws.
author: Plato

quote: Good teaching is one-fourth preparation and three-fourths pure theatre.
author: Gail Godwin

quote: Good things happen to those who hustle.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Good women always think it is their fault when someone else is being offensive. Bad women never take the blame for anything.
author: Anita Brookner

quote: Good words cool more than cold water.
author: John Ray

quote: Good writing is like a windowpane.
author: George Orwell

quote: Good, better, best. Never let it rest. 'Til your good is better and your better is best.
author: St. Jerome

quote: Good-humoured, unaffected girls, will not do for a man who has been used to sensible women. They are two distinct orders of being.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Goodness is beauty in the best estate.
author: Christopher Marlowe

quote: Goodness, armed with power, is corrupted and pure love without power is destroyed.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Gossip is the art of saying nothing in a way that leaves practically nothing unsaid.
author: Walter Winchell

quote: Government 'help' to business is just as disastrous as government persecution... the only way a government can be of service to national prosperity is by keeping its hands off.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Government has no other end, but the preservation of property.
author: John Locke

quote: Government is a trust, and the officers of the government are trustees. And both the trust and the trustees are created for the benefit of the people.
author: Henry Clay

quote: Government is an association of men who do violence to the rest of us.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: Government is an evil it is only the thoughtlessness and vices of men that make it a necessary evil. When all men are good and wise, government will of itself decay.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Government is essentially immoral.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Government is force, pure and simple. There's no way to sugar-coat that. And because government is force, it will attract the worst elements of society - people who want to use government to avoid having to earn their living and to avoid having to persuade others to accept their ideas voluntarily.
author: Harry Browne

quote: Government is not reason it is not eloquent it is force. Like fire, it is a dangerous servant and a fearful master.
author: George Washington

quote: Government of the people, by the people, for the people, shall not perish from the Earth.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Government will not fail to employ education, to strengthen its hands, and perpetuate its institutions.
author: William Godwin

quote: Government works less efficiently when it begins to grow out of control and takes on more and more of the responsibilities that belong to the citizens.
author: Jesse Ventura

quote: Government's role should be only to keep the playing field level, and to work hand in hand with business on issues such as employment. But beyond this, to as great an extent as possible, it should get the hell out of the way.
author: Jesse Ventura

quote: Government, even in its best state, is but a necessary evil in its worst state, an intolerable one.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Governments have never learned anything from history, or acted on principles deducted from it.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: Governments never learn. Only people learn.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: Grab the broom of anger and drive off the beast of fear.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: Grace in women has more effect than beauty.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Grace is the beauty of form under the influence of freedom.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Gradually I became aware of details: a company of French soldiers was marching through the streets of the town. They broke formation, and went in single file along the communication trench leading to the front line. Another group followed them.
author: Ernst Toller

quote: Gradually I came to realize that people will more readily swallow lies than truth, as if the taste of lies was homey, appetizing: a habit.
author: Martha Gellhorn

quote: Grammar is a piano I play by ear. All I know about grammar is its power.
author: Joan Didion

quote: Grand opera is the most powerful of stage appeals and that almost entirely through the beauty of music.
author: John Philip Sousa

quote: Grandchildren have taught me how important the future is. I try to look through their eyes and envision what's in their imagination. What's the world going to look like when they're my age? That really does take a huge imagination.
author: Richard Lugar

quote: Grandeur and beauty are so very opposite, that you often diminish the one as you increase the other. Variety is most akin to the latter, simplicity to the former.
author: William Shenstone

quote: Grant that the true organ with which the beautiful is apprehended is the imagination, and it follows that all arts are likely to affect the feelings indirectly.
author: Eduard Hanslick

quote: Gratitude bestows reverence, allowing us to encounter everyday epiphanies, those transcendent moments of awe that change forever how we experience life and the world.
author: John Milton

quote: Gratitude is the fairest blossom which springs from the soul.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Grave was the man in years, in looks, in word, his locks were grey, yet was his courage green.
author: Torquato Tasso

quote: Gravitation is not responsible for people falling in love.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Gray hair is God's graffiti.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Gray hairs are signs of wisdom if you hold your tongue, speak and they are but hairs, as in the young.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Great ambition is the passion of a great character. Those endowed with it may perform very good or very bad acts. All depends on the principles which direct them.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Great and good are seldom the same man.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Great art is as irrational as great music. It is mad with its own loveliness.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Great art is the contempt of a great man for small art.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Great art is the outward expression of an inner life in the artist, and this inner life will result in his personal vision of the world.
author: Edward Hopper

quote: Great art picks up where nature ends.
author: Marc Chagall

quote: Great artists are people who find the way to be themselves in their art. Any sort of pretension induces mediocrity in art and life alike.
author: Margot Fonteyn

quote: Great authors are admirable in this respect: in every generation they make for disagreement. Through them we become aware of our differences.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Great countries are those that produce great people.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Great dancers are not great because of their technique, they are great because of their passion.
author: Martha Graham

quote: Great effort is required to arrest decay and restore vigor. One must exercise proper deliberation, plan carefully before making a move, and be alert in guarding against relapse following a renaissance.
author: Horace

quote: Great emergencies and crises show us how much greater our vital resources are than we had supposed.
author: William James

quote: Great events make me quiet and calm it is only trifles that irritate my nerves.
author: Queen Victoria

quote: Great feelings will often take the aspect of error, and great faith the aspect of illusion.
author: Robert Burton

quote: Great geniuses have the shortest biographies.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Great grief does not of itself put an end to itself.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Great hearts steadily send forth the secret forces that incessantly draw great events.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Great hopes make great men.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Great ideas originate in the muscles.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Great indebtedness does not make men grateful, but vengeful and if a little charity is not forgotten, it turns into a gnawing worm.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Great is our admiration of the orator who speaks with fluency and discretion.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Great is the difference betwixt a man's being frightened at, and humbled for his sins.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Great is the guilt of an unnecessary war.
author: John Adams

quote: Great is the power of habit. It teaches us to bear fatigue and to despise wounds and pain.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Great is the victory, but the friendship of all is greater.
author: Emil Zatopek

quote: Great is truth, but still greater, from a practical point of view, is silence about truth. By simply not mentioning certain subjects... totalitarian propagandists have influenced opinion much more effectively than they could have by the most eloquent denunciations.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Great leaders are almost always great simplifiers, who can cut through argument, debate and doubt, to offer a solution everybody can understand.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Great love affairs start with Champagne and end with tisane.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Great loves too must be endured.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Great men are like eagles, and build their nest on some lofty solitude.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Great men are rarely isolated mountain peaks they are the summits of ranges.
author: Thomas W. Higginson

quote: Great men are seldom over-scrupulous in the arrangement of their attire.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Great men are they who see that spiritual is stronger than any material force - that thoughts rule the world.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Great men or men of great gifts you shall easily find, but symmetrical men never.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Great men, unknown to their generation, have their fame among the great who have preceded them, and all true worldly fame subsides from their high estimate beyond the stars.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Great minds are related to the brief span of time during which they live as great buildings are to a little square in which they stand: you cannot see them in all their magnitude because you are standing too close to them.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Great minds are to make others great. Their superiority is to be used, not to break the multitude to intellectual vassalage, not to establish over them a spiritual tyranny, but to rouse them from lethargy, and to aid them to judge for themselves.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Great minds discuss ideas average minds discuss events small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Great nations write their autobiographies in three manuscripts - the book of their deeds, the book of their words and the book of their art.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Great occasions do not make heroes or cowards they simply unveil them to the eyes of men. Silently and imperceptibly, as we wake or sleep, we grow strong or weak and at last some crisis shows what we have become.
author: Brooke Foss Westcott

quote: Great perils have this beauty, that they bring to light the fraternity of strangers.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Great research universities must insist on independence from government and on the exercise of academic freedom.
author: Alan Dershowitz

quote: Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Great talents are the most lovely and often the most dangerous fruits on the tree of humanity. They hang upon the most slender twigs that are easily snapped off.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Great things are done by a series of small things brought together.
