author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote: Great things are done when men and mountains meet.
author: William Blake

quote: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
author: George Eliot

quote: Great thoughts and a pure heart, that is what we should ask from God.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Great works are performed not by strength but by perseverance.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Great writing can be done in biography, history, art.
author: V. S. Naipaul

quote: Greater than the tread of mighty armies is an idea whose time has come.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Greatly begin. Though thou have time, but for a line, be that sublime. Not failure, but low aim is crime.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Greatness lies, not in being strong, but in the right using of strength and strength is not used rightly when it serves only to carry a man above his fellows for his own solitary glory. He is the greatest whose strength carries up the most hearts by the attraction of his own.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Greece's European neighbors were able step in and bolster the weak foundation on which Greece's free-spending budget was based. It would be difficult for any country, or intergovernmental organization, to rescue an economy the size of the U.S. if investors were ever to lose faith in our bonds because of our enormous debt.
author: Douglas Wilder

quote: Greek philosophy seems to have met with something with which a good tragedy is not supposed to meet, namely, a dull ending.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Green is the prime color of the world, and that from which its loveliness arises.
author: Pedro Calderon de la Barca

quote: Grief at the absence of a loved one is happiness compared to life with a person one hates.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Grief can't be shared. Everyone carries it alone. His own burden in his own way.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Grief has limits, whereas apprehension has none. For we grieve only for what we know has happened, but we fear all that possibly may happen.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: Ground not upon dreams you know they are ever contrary.
author: Thomas Middleton

quote: Grow old with me! The best is yet to be.
author: Robert Browning

quote: Growing old is no more than a bad habit which a busy person has no time to form.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Growing up, I didn't give my grandfather's photography a second thought. I wasn't involved in his work, except that I helped my dad print his negatives.
author: Kim Weston

quote: Growing up, I was taught that a man has to defend his family. When the wolf is trying to get in, you gotta stand in the doorway.
author: B. B. King

quote: Growth itself contains the germ of happiness.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Grudge no expense - yield to no opposition - forget fatigue - till, by the strength of prayer and sacrifice, the spirit of love shall have overcome .
author: Maria Weston Chapman

quote: Grumbling is the death of love.
author: Marlene Dietrich

quote: Guard against the impostures of pretended patriotism.
author: George Washington

quote: Guard with jealous attention the public liberty. Suspect everyone who approaches that jewel. Unfortunately, nothing will preserve it but downright force. Whenever you give up that force, you are inevitably ruined.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: Guilt is perhaps the most painful companion of death.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: HGH testing is happening in Olympics. The science is there. It is a valid test.
author: Roger Goodell

quote: Habit is a second nature that destroys the first. But what is nature? Why is habit not natural? I am very much afraid that nature itself is only a first habit, just as habit is a second nature.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Habit is a second nature which prevents us from knowing the first, of which it has neither the cruelties nor the enchantments.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Habits change into character.
author: Ovid

quote: Had the United States and the United Kingdom gone on alone to capture Baghdad, under the provisions of the Geneva and Hague conventions we would have been considered occupying powers and therefore would have been responsible for all the costs of maintaining or restoring government, education and other services for the people of Iraq.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: Had we lived I should have had a tale to tell of the hardihood, endurance and courage of my companions which would have stirred the heart of every Englishman. These rough notes and our dead bodies must tell the tale.
author: Robert Falcon Scott

quote: Half a truth is better than no politics.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Half a truth is often a great lie.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Half a world away nations that once lived under oppression and tyranny are now budding democracies due in large part to America 's leadership and the sacrifices of our military.
author: Bob Riley

quote: Half of the American people have never read a newspaper. Half never voted for President. One hopes it is the same half.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Half our life is spent trying to find something to do with the time we have rushed through life trying to save.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Half the lies they tell about me aren't true.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Half the pictures directed by men of reputation fail.
author: Carroll O'Connor

quote: Half the time I feel like I'm appealing to the downer freaks out there. We start to play one downer record after another until I begin to get down myself. Give me something from 1960 or something let me get up again. The music of today is for downer freaks, and I'm an upper.
author: Wolfman Jack

quote: Hamas, the opponents of Arafat, the opponents of peace, urged a boycott of the election, and yet there was an 85 percent turnout where Hamas is supposed to be strong. Isn't that really quite incredible?
author: Warren Christopher

quote: Happiness always looks small while you hold it in your hands, but let it go, and you learn at once how big and precious it is.
author: Maxim Gorky

quote: Happiness and moral duty are inseparably connected.
author: George Washington

quote: Happiness and peace will come to earth only as the light of love and human compassion enter the souls of men.
author: David O. McKay

quote: Happiness can exist only in acceptance.
author: George Orwell

quote: Happiness consumes itself like a flame. It cannot burn for ever, it must go out, and the presentiment of its end destroys it at its very peak.
author: August Strindberg

quote: Happiness depends more on how life strikes you than on what happens.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

quote: Happiness does not come from doing easy work but from the afterglow of satisfaction that comes after the achievement of a difficult task that demanded our best.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: Happiness does not consist in self-love.
author: Joseph Butler

quote: Happiness does not lie in happiness, but in the achievement of it.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: Happiness doesn't depend on any external conditions, it is governed by our mental attitude.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Happiness exists on earth, and it is won through prudent exercise of reason, knowledge of the harmony of the universe, and constant practice of generosity.
author: Jose Marti

quote: Happiness grows at our own firesides, and is not to be picked in strangers' gardens.
author: Douglas William Jerrold

quote: Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Happiness in marriage is entirely a matter of chance.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Happiness in this world, when it comes, comes incidentally. Make it the object of pursuit, and it leads us a wild-goose chase, and is never attained. Follow some other object, and very possibly we may find that we have caught happiness without dreaming of it.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Happiness includes chiefly the idea of satisfaction after full honest effort. No one can possibly be satisfied and no one can be happy who feels that in some paramount affairs he failed to take up the challenge of life.
author: Arnold Bennett

quote: Happiness is a ball after which we run wherever it rolls, and we push it with our feet when it stops.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Happiness is a butterfly, which when pursued, is always just beyond your grasp, but which, if you will sit down quietly, may alight upon you.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Happiness is a byproduct of function, purpose, and conflict those who seek happiness for itself seek victory without war.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Happiness is a choice that requires effort at times.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Happiness is a hard master, particularly other people's happiness.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Happiness is a how not a what. A talent, not an object.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Happiness is a matter of one's most ordinary and everyday mode of consciousness being busy and lively and unconcerned with self.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: Happiness is a monstrosity! Punished are those who seek it.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Happiness is a mystery, like religion, and should never be rationalised.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Happiness is a sunbeam which may pass through a thousand bosoms without losing a particle of its original ray nay, when it strikes on a kindred heart, like the converged light on a mirror, it reflects itself with redoubled brightness. It is not perfected till it is shared.
author: Jane Porter

quote: Happiness is a very small desk and a very big wastebasket.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Happiness is a virtue, not its reward.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Happiness is an imaginary condition, formerly attributed by the living to the dead, now usually attributed by adults to children, and by children to adults.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: Happiness is beneficial for the body, but it is grief that develops the powers of the mind.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Happiness is brief. It will not stay. God batters at its sails.
author: Euripides

quote: Happiness is good health and a bad memory.
author: Ingrid Bergman

quote: Happiness is having a large, loving, caring, close-knit family in another city.
author: George Burns

quote: Happiness is ideal, it is the work of the imagination.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: Happiness is itself a kind of gratitude.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: Happiness is like a cat, If you try to coax it or call it, it will avoid you it will never come. But if you pay not attention to it and go about your business, you'll find it rubbing against your legs and jumping into your lap.
author: William Bennett

quote: Happiness is like those palaces in fairy tales whose gates are guarded by dragons: we must fight in order to conquer it.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: Happiness is mostly a by-product of doing what makes us feel fulfilled.
author: Benjamin Spock

quote: Happiness is neither virtue nor pleasure nor this thing nor that but simply growth, We are happy when we are growing.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Happiness is neither without us nor within us. It is in God, both without us and within us.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Happiness is not a goal it is a by-product.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Happiness is not a possession to be prized, it is a quality of thought, a state of mind.
author: Daphne du Maurier

quote: Happiness is not a reward - it is a consequence. Suffering is not a punishment - it is a result.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Happiness is not an ideal of reason, but of imagination.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Happiness is not being pained in body or troubled in mind.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Happiness is nothing more than good health and a bad memory.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Happiness is obsolete: uneconomic.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: Happiness is perfume, you can't pour it on somebody else without getting a few drops on yourself.
author: James Van Der Zee

quote: Happiness is rarely absent it is we that know not of its presence.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Happiness is secured through virtue it is a good attained by man's own will.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Happiness is spiritual, born of truth and love. It is unselfish therefore it cannot exist alone, but requires all mankind to share it.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Happiness is that state of consciousness which proceeds from the achievement of one's values.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Happiness is the only good. The time to be happy is now. The place to be happy is here. The way to be happy is to make others so.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Happiness is the sublime moment when you get out of your corsets at night.
author: Joyce Grenfell

quote: Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Happiness is working with Jack Lemmon.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: Happiness is your dentist telling you it won't hurt and then having him catch his hand in the drill.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: Happiness isn't something you experience it's something you remember.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: Happiness lies first of all in health.
author: George William Curtis

quote: Happiness lies in the joy of achievement and the thrill of creative effort.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Happiness lies neither in vice nor in virtue but in the manner we appreciate the one and the other, and the choice we make pursuant to our individual organization.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Happiness never lays its finger on its pulse.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Happiness often sneaks in through a door you didn't know you left open.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Happiness or satisfaction consists only in the enjoyment of those objects which are by nature suited to our several particular appetites, passions, and affections.
author: Joseph Butler

quote: Happiness serves hardly any other purpose than to make unhappiness possible.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Happiness, or misery, is in the mind. It is the mind that lives.
author: William Cobbett

quote: Happiness: a good bank account, a good cook, and a good digestion.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Happiness? A good cigar, a good meal, a good cigar and a good woman - or a bad woman it depends on how much happiness you can handle.
author: George Burns

quote: Happy he who learns to bear what he cannot change.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Happy is he who still loves something he loved in the nursery: He has not been broken in two by time he is not two men, but one, and he has saved not only his soul but his life.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Happy is said to be the family which can eat onions together. They are, for the time being, separate, from the world, and have a harmony of aspiration.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: Happy is the man who finds a true friend, and far happier is he who finds that true friend in his wife.
author: Franz Schubert

quote: Happy is the man who has broken the chains which hurt the mind, and has given up worrying once and for all.
author: Ovid

quote: Happy is the son whose faith in his mother remains unchallenged.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Happy or unhappy, families are all mysterious. We have only to imagine how differently we would be described - and will be, after our deaths - by each of the family members who believe they know us.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Happy people are ignoramuses and glory is nothing else but success, and to achieve it one only has to be cunning.
author: Mikhail Lermontov

quote: Happy the man, and happy he alone, he who can call today his own he who, secure within, can say, tomorrow do thy worst, for I have lived today.
author: John Dryden

quote: Happy, happy Christmas, that can win us back to the delusions of our childhood days, recall to the old man the pleasures of his youth, and transport the traveler back to his own fireside and quiet home!
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Hard times arouse an instinctive desire for authenticity.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: Harmony makes small things grow, lack of it makes great things decay.
author: Sallust

quote: Harmony with land is like harmony with a friend you cannot cherish his right hand and chop off his left.
author: Aldo Leopold

quote: Has fortune dealt you some bad cards. Then let wisdom make you a good gamester.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: Has there ever been a society which has died of dissent? Several have died of conformity in our lifetime.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: Hate is too great a burden to bear. It injures the hater more than it injures the hated.
author: Coretta Scott King

quote: Hateful is the power, and pitiable is the life, of those who wish to be feared rather than loved.
author: Cornelius Nepos

quote: Hath the spirit of all beauty Kissed you in the path of duty?
author: Anna Katharine Green

quote: Hatred is an affair of the heart contempt that of the head.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Hatred is blind, as well as love.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Hatred is gained as much by good works as by evil.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Hatred is inveterate anger.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Hatred is settled anger.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Have a sense of humor about life - you will need it. And be courteous.
author: Peter Jennings

quote: Have an earnestness for death and you will have life.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: Have convictions. Be friendly. Stick to your beliefs as they stick to theirs. Work as hard as they do.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Have courage for the great sorrows of life and patience for the small ones and when you have laboriously accomplished your daily task, go to sleep in peace.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Have faith in God God has faith in you.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Have no fear of perfection - you'll never reach it.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Have regular hours for work and play make each day both useful and pleasant, and prove that you understand the worth of time by employing it well. Then youth will be delightful, old age will bring few regrets, and life will become a beautiful success.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Have the courage of your desire.
author: George Gissing

quote: Have the courage to be ignorant of a great number of things, in order to avoid the calamity of being ignorant of everything.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Have thy tools ready. God will find thee work.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: Have we not come to such an impasse in the modern world that we must love our enemies - or else? The chain reaction of evil - hate begetting hate, wars producing more wars - must be broken, or else we shall be plunged into the dark abyss of annihilation.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Have you ever heard of a good marriage growing in front of the cameras?
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: Have you ever thought that war is a madhouse and that everyone in the war is a patient?
author: Oriana Fallaci

quote: Have you heard about the Irishman who reversed into a car boot sale and sold the engine?
author: Frank Carson

quote: Have you learned the lessons only of those who admired you, and were tender with you, and stood aside for you? Have you not learned great lessons from those who braced themselves against you, and disputed passage with you?
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Having a child is surely the most beautifully irrational act that two people in love can commit.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Having a child, that's always been my biggest fear. I want a child and I fear a child.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Having come to live in this age is as though one were to have entered another country. Learn its language or risk being left out.
author: Theodore Bikel

quote: Having contemplated this admirable grove, I proceeded towards the shrubberies on the banks of the river, and though it was now late in December, the aromatic groves appeared in full bloom.
author: William Bartram

quote: Having imagination it takes you an hour to write a paragraph that if you were unimaginative would take you only a minute.
author: Franklin P. Adams

quote: Having knowledge but lacking the power to express it clearly is no better than never having any ideas at all.
author: Pericles

quote: Having leveled my palace, don't erect a hovel and complacently admire your own charity in giving me that for a home.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: Having money is rather like being a blond. It is more fun but not vital.
author: Mary Quant

quote: Having soon discovered to be great, I must appear so, and therefore studiously avoided mixing in society, and wrapped myself in mystery, devoting my time to fasting and prayer.
author: Nat Turner

quote: Having yet another vote on refinery legislation that uses high oil prices as an excuse to weaken environmental protections and to give more legislative gifts to the oil industry is misguided in the extreme.
author: Sherwood Boehlert

quote: He alone is free who lives with free consent under the entire guidance of reason.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: He alone loves the Creator perfectly who manifests a pure love for his neighbor.
author: Venerable Bede

quote: He belonged to that army known as invincible in peace, invisible in war.
author: William Tecumseh Sherman

quote: He doesn't know the meaning of the word fear, but then again he doesn't know the meaning of most words.
author: Bobby Bowden

quote: He enjoys much who is thankful for little.
author: Thomas Secker

quote: He had no failings which were not owing to a noble cause to an ardent, generous, perhaps an immoderate passion for fame a passion which is the instinct of all great souls.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: He had read much, if one considers his long life but his contemplation was much more than his reading. He was wont to say that if he had read as much as other men he should have known no more than other men.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: He has Van Gogh's ear for music.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: He has no enemies, but is intensely disliked by his friends.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: He has not learned the first lesson of life who does not every day surmount a fear.
author: John Dryden

quote: He has not lived badly whose birth and death has been unnoticed by the world.
author: Horace

quote: He has only half learned the art of reading who has not added to it the more refined art of skipping and skimming.
author: Arthur Balfour

quote: He has the obligation to society that any human being has. I don't think a satirist has any greater obligation to society than a bricklayer or anybody else.
author: Shel Silverstein

quote: He is a hard man who is only just, and a sad one who is only wise.
author: Voltaire

quote: He is a man of courage who does not run away, but remains at his post and fights against the enemy.
author: Socrates

quote: He is greatest whose strength carries up the most hearts by the attraction of his own.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: He is happiest, be he king or peasant, who finds peace in his home.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: He is neither a strategist nor is he schooled in the operational arts, nor is he a tactician, nor is he a general. Other than that he's a great military man.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: He is no lawyer who cannot take two sides.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: He is not a lover who does not love forever.
author: Euripides

quote: He is richest who is content with the least, for content is the wealth of nature.
author: Socrates

quote: He is the best man who, when making his plans, fears and reflects on everything that can happen to him, but in the moment of action is bold.
author: Herodotus

quote: He is the best physician who is the most ingenious inspirer of hope.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: He is the best sailor who can steer within fewest points of the wind, and exact a motive power out of the greatest obstacles.
author: Walter Scott

quote: He is the true enchanter, whose spell operates, not upon the senses, but upon the imagination and the heart.
author: Washington Irving

quote: He knows not his own strength that has not met adversity.
author: Ben Jonson

quote: He looked about as inconspicuous as a tarantula on a slice of angel food.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: He may be president, but he still comes home and swipes my socks.
author: Joseph P. Kennedy

quote: He most honors my style who learns under it to destroy the teacher.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: He must pull out his own eyes, and see no creature, before he can say, he sees no God He must be no man, and quench his reasonable soul, before he can say to himself, there is no God.
author: John Donne

quote: He only earns his freedom and his life Who takes them every day by storm.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: He passes from lyric to epic poetry in order to speak about the world and the torment in the world through man, rationally and emotionally. The poet then becomes a danger.
author: Salvatore Quasimodo

quote: He preacheth patience that never knew pain.
author: H. G. Bohn

quote: He read his mind. He's a strange sort of man, isn't he? It's not just the advice and the wisdom that he has.
author: Omar Sharif

quote: He surprised me by his familiarity with details of movements and battles which I did not suppose had come to his knowledge. As he kept me talking for over half an hour, I flattered myself that what I had to say interested him.
author: Henry Villard

quote: He taught me housekeeping when I divorce I keep the house.
author: Zsa Zsa Gabor

quote: He that can have patience can have what he will.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He that cannot forgive others breaks the bridge over which he must pass himself for every man has need to be forgiven.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: He that desireth to acquire any art or science seeketh first those means by which that art or science is obtained. If we ought to do so in things natural and earthly, how much more then in spiritual?
author: Robert Barclay

quote: He that does good to another does good also to himself.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: He that fails in his endeavors after wealth or power will not long retain either honesty or courage.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: He that gives good advice, builds with one hand he that gives good counsel and example, builds with both but he that gives good admonition and bad example, builds with one hand and pulls down with the other.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: He that has a great nose, thinks everybody is speaking of it.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: He that hath knowledge spareth his words.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: He that hath wife and children hath given hostages to fortune for they are impediments to great enterprises, either of virtue or mischief.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: He that hopes no good fears no ill.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: He that is good for making excuses is seldom good for anything else.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He that is jealous is not in love.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: He that is of the opinion money will do everything may well be suspected of doing everything for money.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He that knew all that learning ever writ, Knew only this - that he knew nothing yet.
author: Aphra Behn

quote: He that lives upon hope will die fasting.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He that raises a large family does, indeed, while he lives to observe them, stand a broader mark for sorrow but then he stands a broader mark for pleasure too.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He that rebels against reason is a real rebel, but he that in defence of reason rebels against tyranny has a better title to Defender of the Faith, than George the Third.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: He that takes truth for his guide, and duty for his end, may safely trust to God's providence to lead him aright.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: He that will not apply new remedies must expect new evils for time is the greatest innovator.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: He that would be angry and sin not, must not be angry with anything but sin.
author: John Ruskin

quote: He that would live in peace and at ease must not speak all he knows or all he sees.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He too serves a certain purpose who only stands and cheers.
author: Henry Adams

quote: He travels the fastest who travels alone.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: He wants only to rest and to have a little peace.
author: Luciano Pavarotti

quote: He wants you all to Himself to put His loving, divine arms around you.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: He was a bold man that first ate an oyster.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: He was a great patriot, a humanitarian, a loyal friend provided, of course, he really is dead.
author: Voltaire

quote: He was a manager, one of the singers, I guess talent coordinator for the local talent in Harlem. His name was Lover Patterson. He was living right across the street from where my dad had his restaurant. I guess he saw a lot of kids come in, a lot of my buddies.
author: Ben E. King

quote: He was a wise man who originated the idea of God.
author: Euripides

quote: He was an embittered atheist, the sort of atheist who does not so much disbelieve in God as personally dislike Him.
author: George Orwell

quote: He was as great as a man can be without morality.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: He was gifted with the sly, sharp instinct for self-preservation that passes for wisdom among the rich.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: He was just trying to tease me - I knew that later - but he said he'd have to leave because it wasn't fair to have anyone in the room who was going to make fun of what he had to say. He had a good sense of humor, really.
author: Fay Wray

quote: He was one of those men who possess almost every gift, except the gift of the power to use them.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: He was the editor of our paper. He created the publishing house in Hebrew. He was - I wouldn't say the 'guru' - but really he was our teacher and a most respected man. I wrote for the paper of the youth movement.
author: Shimon Peres

quote: He was thinking alone, and seriously racking his brain to find a direction for this single force four times multiplied, with which he did not doubt, as with the lever for which Archimedes sought, they should succeed in moving the world, when some one tapped gently at his door.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: He was very commanding, and you had to know what you were doing to work for Mr. Rogers. I learned how to ride very quickly with him as my riding teacher.
author: Glenn Ford

quote: He was what I often think is a dangerous thing for a statesman to be - a student of history and like most of those who study history, he learned from the mistakes of the past how to make new ones.
author: A. J. P. Taylor

quote: He who angers you conquers you.
author: Elizabeth Kenny

quote: He who asks of life nothing but the improvement of his own nature... is less liable than anyone else to miss and waste life.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: He who attends to his greater self becomes a great man, and he who attends to his smaller self becomes a small man.
author: Mencius

quote: He who avoids complaint invites happiness.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: He who begins by loving Christianity more than Truth, will proceed by loving his sect or church better than Christianity, and end in loving himself better than all.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: He who bestows his goods upon the poor shall have as much again, and ten times more.
author: John Bunyan

quote: He who binds to himself a joy Does the winged life destroy But he who kisses the joy as it flies Lives in eternity's sun rise.
author: William Blake

quote: He who builds a masjid in the way of Allah, God will build a house for him in the paradise.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: He who can be, and therefore is, another's, and he who participates in reason enough to apprehend, but not to have, is a slave by nature.
author: Aristotle

quote: He who can no longer pause to wonder and stand rapt in awe, is as good as dead his eyes are closed.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: He who controls the money supply of a nation controls the nation.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: He who despairs of the human condition is a coward, but he who has hope for it is a fool.
author: Albert Camus

quote: He who does not accept and respect those who want to reject life does not truly accept and respect life itself.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: He who does not become familiar with nature through love will never know her.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: He who does not bellow the truth when he knows the truth makes himself the accomplice of liars and forgers.
author: Charles Peguy

quote: He who does not love his own language is worse than an animal and smelly fish.
author: Jose Rizal

quote: He who doesn't fear death dies only once.
author: Giovanni Falcone

quote: He who draws noble delights from sentiments of poetry is a true poet, though he has never written a line in all his life.
author: George Sand

quote: He who exercises government by means of his virtue may be compared to the north polar star, which keeps its place and all the stars turn towards it.
author: Confucius

quote: He who falls in love with himself will have no rivals.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: He who fights with monsters might take care lest he thereby become a monster. Is not life a hundred times too short for us to bore ourselves?
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: He who follows his lessons tastes a profound peace, and looks upon everybody as a bunch of manure.
author: Moliere

quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: He who has done his best for his own time has lived for all times.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: He who has great power should use it lightly.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: He who has health, has hope and he who has hope, has everything.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: He who has not the spirit of this age, has all the misery of it.
author: Voltaire

quote: He who has religion will speak poetry. But philosophy is the tool with which to seek and discover religion.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: He who has so little knowledge of human nature as to seek happiness by changing anything but his own disposition will waste his life in fruitless efforts.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: He who hath many friends hath none.
author: Aristotle

quote: He who is cruel to animals becomes hard also in his dealings with men. We can judge the heart of a man by his treatment of animals.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: He who is fixed to a star does not change his mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: He who is incapable of feeling strong passions, of being shaken by anger, of living in every sense of the word, will never be a good actor.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

quote: He who is not a good servant will not be a good master.
author: Plato

quote: He who is not everyday conquering some fear has not learned the secret of life.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: He who is not impressed by sound advice, lacks faith.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: He who is not just is severe, he who is not wise is sad.
author: Voltaire

quote: He who is obsessed by death is made guilty by it.
author: Elias Canetti

quote: He who is of calm and happy nature will hardly feel the pressure of age, but to him who is of an opposite disposition youth and age are equally a burden.
author: Plato

quote: He who is overly attached to his family members experiences fear and sorrow, for the root of all grief is attachment. Thus one should discard attachment to be happy.
author: Chanakya

quote: He who is prudent and lies in wait for an enemy who is not, will be victorious.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: He who is taught to live upon little owes more to his father's wisdom than he who has a great deal left him does to his father's care.
author: William Penn

quote: He who is the author of a war lets loose the whole contagion of hell and opens a vein that bleeds a nation to death.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: He who is to be a good ruler must have first been ruled.
author: Aristotle

quote: He who is too busy doing good finds no time to be good.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: He who is unable to live in society, or who has no need because he is sufficient for himself, must be either a beast or a god.
author: Aristotle

quote: He who joyfully marches to music in rank and file has already earned my contempt. He has been given a large brain by mistake, since for him the spinal cord would suffice.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: He who knows best knows how little he knows.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: He who knows how to flatter also knows how to slander.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: He who knows nothing is closer to the truth than he whose mind is filled with falsehoods and errors.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: He who laughs best today, will also laughs last.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: He who laughs most, learns best.
author: John Cleese

quote: He who learns but does not think, is lost! He who thinks but does not learn is in great danger.
author: Confucius

quote: He who learns must suffer. And even in our sleep pain that cannot forget falls drop by drop upon the heart, and in our own despair, against our will, comes wisdom to us by the awful grace of God.
author: Aeschylus

quote: He who loses wealth loses much he who loses a friend loses more but he that loses his courage loses all.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: He who loves, flies, runs, and rejoices he is free and nothing holds him back.
author: Henri Matisse

quote: He who negates present society, and seeks social conditions based on the sharing of property, is a revolutionary whether he calls himself an anarchist or a communist.
author: Johann Most

quote: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: He who possesses art and science has religion he who does not possess them, needs religion.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: He who receives money in trust to administer for the benefit of its owner, and uses it either for his own interest or against the wishes of its rightful owner, is a thief.
author: Jose Marti

quote: He who rides the sea of the Nile must have sails woven of patience.
author: William Golding

quote: He who risks and fails can be forgiven. He who never risks and never fails is a failure in his whole being.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: He who seeks rest finds boredom. He who seeks work finds rest.
author: Dylan Thomas

quote: He who speaks without modesty will find it difficult to make his words good.
author: Confucius

quote: He who stands aloof runs the risk of believing himself better than others and misusing his critique of society as an ideology for his private interest.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: He who steals a little steals with the same wish as he who steals much, but with less power.
author: Plato

quote: He who waits to do a great deal of good at once will never do anything.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: He who wants to persuade should put his trust not in the right argument, but in the right word. The power of sound has always been greater than the power of sense.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: He who would do good to another must do it in Minute Particulars: general Good is the plea of the scoundrel, hypocrite, and flatterer, for Art and Science cannot exist but in minutely organized Particulars.
author: William Blake

quote: He who would learn to fly one day must first learn to stand and walk and run and climb and dance one cannot fly into flying.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: He whom many fear, has himself many to fear.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: He will therefore have to use what knowledge he can achieve, not to shape the results as the craftsman shapes his handiwork, but rather to cultivate a growth by providing the appropriate environment, in the manner in which the gardener does this for his plants.
author: Friedrich August von Hayek

quote: He's a man of great common sense and good taste - meaning thereby a man without originality or moral courage.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: He's a novice, but he's had these - he's experienced in leadership in tight circumstances. He started - he dropped the first bomb, led the first air strike into North Vietnam.
author: James Stockdale

quote: He's dreaming with his eyes open, and those that dream with their eyes open are dangerous, for they do not know when their dreams come to an end.
author: Hugo Pratt

quote: He's the kind of man a woman would have to marry to get rid of.
author: Mae West

quote: He, however, who begins with Metaphysics, will not only become confused in matters of religion, but will fall into complete infidelity.
author: Maimonides

quote: He, who every morning plans the transactions of the day, and follows that plan, carries a thread that will guide him through a labyrinth of the most busy life.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity.
author: Hippocrates

quote: Healing yourself is connected with healing others.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Health care reform, the marquee legislative accomplishment of the Obama administration's first term, was passed before we entered the world of divided government.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: Health consists of having the same diseases as one's neighbors.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: Health consists with temperance alone.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Health food may be good for the conscience but Oreos taste a hell of a lot better.
author: Robert Redford

quote: Health is not a condition of matter, but of Mind.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Health is not valued till sickness comes.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Health is the core of human development.
author: Gro Harlem Brundtland

quote: Health is the soul that animates all the enjoyments of life, which fade and are tasteless without it.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Health is the state about which medicine has nothing to say.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Health is the thing that makes you feel that now is the best time of the year.
author: Franklin P. Adams

quote: Health nuts are going to feel stupid someday, lying in hospitals dying of nothing.
author: Redd Foxx

quote: Healthy citizens are the greatest asset any country can have.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Healthy people live with their world.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

quote: Hear me, my chiefs! I am tired. My heart is sick and sad. From where the sun now stands, I will fight no more forever.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: Heat cannot be separated from fire, or beauty from The Eternal.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Heaven and hell suppose two distinct species of men, the good and the bad. But the greatest part of mankind float betwixt vice and virtue.
author: David Hume

quote: Heaven grant us patience with a man in love.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Heaven has no rage like love to hatred turned, nor hell a fury like a woman scorned.
author: William Congreve

quote: Heaven is under our feet as well as over our heads.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Heaven knows that I have done all that a mortal could do, to save the people, and the failure was not my fault, but the fault of others.
author: Davy Crockett

quote: Heaven means to be one with God.
author: Confucius

quote: Hegel was right when he said that we learn from history that man can never learn anything from history.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Heights by great men reached and kept were not obtained by sudden flight but, while their companions slept, they were toiling upward in the night.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Hell hath no fury like a bureaucrat scorned.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: Hell is full of musical amateurs.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Hell isn't merely paved with good intentions it's walled and roofed with them. Yes, and furnished too.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Hell, I never vote for anybody, I always vote against.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Hell, madam, is to love no longer.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Hell, there are no rules here - we're trying to accomplish something.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Help us to be ever faithful gardeners of the spirit, who know that without darkness nothing comes to birth, and without light nothing flowers.
author: May Sarton

quote: Helping someone come to a saving knowledge of Christ is the greatest achievement possible.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: Helplessness induces hopelessness, and history attests that loss of hope and not loss of lives is what decides the issue of war.
author: B. H. Liddell Hart

quote: Hemingway seems to be in a funny position. People nowadays can't identify with him closely as a member of their own generation, and he isn't yet historical.
author: Leslie Fiedler

quote: Hence poetry is something more philosophic and of graver import than history, since its statements are rather of the nature of universals, whereas those of history are singulars.
author: Aristotle

quote: Hence, within the space of two generations there has been a complete revolution in the attitude of the trades-unions toward the women working in their trades.
author: Florence Kelley

quote: Henceforth I ask not good fortune. I myself am good fortune.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Henceforth the leaves of the tree of knowledge were for women, and for the healing of the nations.
author: Lucy Stone

quote: Her angel's face, As the great eye of heaven shined bright, And made a sunshine in the shady place.
author: Edmund Spenser

quote: Here I am paying big money to you writers and what for? All you do is change the words.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: Here bring your wounded hearts, here tell your anguish Earth has no sorrow that Heaven cannot heal.
author: Thomas More

quote: Here is everything which can lay hold of the eye, ear and imagination - everything which can charm and bewitch the simple and ignorant. I wonder how Luther ever broke the spell.
author: John Adams

quote: Here is my first principle of foreign policy: good government at home.
author: William E. Gladstone

quote: Here is the amazing thing about Easter the Resurrection Sunday for Christians is this, that Christ in the dying moments on the cross gives us the greatest illustration of forgiveness possible.
author: T. D. Jakes

quote: Here is the rule to remember in the future, When anything tempts you to be bitter: not, 'This is a misfortune' but 'To bear this worthily is good fortune.'
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Here men from the planet Earth first set foot upon the Moon. July 1969 AD. We came in peace for all mankind.
author: Neil Armstrong

quote: Here or henceforward it is all the same to me, I accept Time absolutely.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Here take back the stuff that I am, nature, knead it back into the dough of being, make of me a bush, a cloud, whatever you will, even a man, only no longer make me me.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Here's my Golden Rule for a tarnished age: Be fair with others, but keep after them until they're fair with you.
author: Alan Alda

quote: Here's what I see all across this great city - people working together to make Boston a better place to live and to raise children, to grow and pursue dreams.
author: Thomas Menino

quote: Here's what I tell anybody and this is what I believe. The greatest gift we have is the gift of life. We understand that. That comes from our Creator. We're given a body. Now you may not like it, but you can maximize that body the best it can be maximized.
author: Mike Ditka

quote: Heredity is what sets the parents of a teenager wondering about each other.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Heresies are experiments in man's unsatisfied search for truth.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Heresy is another word for freedom of thought.
author: Graham Greene

quote: Hero-worship is strongest where there is least regard for human freedom.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Heroism on command, senseless violence, and all the loathsome nonsense that goes by the name of patriotism - how passionately I hate them!
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Hesitation increases in relation to risk in equal proportion to age.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Hezbollah's contempt for human suffering is total, as it showed once again this morning when its rockets murdered two Israeli Arab children in Nazareth.
author: Tom Lantos

quote: Hide nothing, for time, which sees all and hears all, exposes all.
author: Sophocles

quote: High achievers spot rich opportunities swiftly, make big decisions quickly and move into action immediately. Follow these principles and you can make your dreams come true.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: High and low culture come together in all Post Modern art, and American poetry is not excluded from this.
author: Diane Wakoski

quote: High expectations are the key to everything.
author: Sam Walton

quote: Higher taxes is the road to ruin. We must and we will shrink our government, and that means making some tough choices, tightening our belts.
author: Chris Christie

quote: His death was the first time that Ed Wynn ever made anyone sad.
author: Red Skelton

quote: His ignorance was as remarkable as his knowledge.
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: His knowledge of books had in some degree diminished his knowledge of the world.
author: William Shenstone

quote: His lack of education is more than compensated for by his keenly developed moral bankruptcy.
author: Woody Allen

quote: His lordship may compel us to be equal upstairs, but there will never be equality in the servants hall.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: His lordship may compel us to be equal upstairs, but there will never be equality in the servants' hall.
author: J. M. Barrie

quote: His smile is like the silver plate on a coffin.
author: John Philpot Curran

quote: His talent was as natural as the pattern that was made by the dust on a butterfly's wings. At one time he understood it no more than the butterfly did and he did not know when it was brushed or marred.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: His was a great sin who first invented consciousness. Let us lose it for a few hours.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Historian: an unsuccessful novelist.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Historically the director has been the key creative element in a film and we must maintain that. We must protect that, in spite of the fact that there is new technology that's continually trying to erode that.
author: John Frankenheimer

quote: History books that contain no lies are extremely dull.
author: Anatole France

quote: History could pass for a scarlet text, its jot and title graven red in human blood.
author: Eldridge Cleaver

quote: History develops, art stands still.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: History does not merely touch on language, but takes place in it.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: History does nothing it does not possess immense riches, it does not fight battles. It is men, real, living, who do all this.
author: Karl Marx

quote: History has remembered the kings and warriors, because they destroyed art has remembered the people, because they created.
author: William Morris

quote: History is Philosophy teaching by example.
author: Thucydides

quote: History is a cyclic poem written by time upon the memories of man.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: History is a gallery of pictures in which there are few originals and many copies.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: History is a guide to navigation in perilous times. History is who we are and why we are the way we are.
author: David McCullough

quote: History is a people's memory, and without a memory, man is demoted to the lower animals.
author: Malcom X

quote: History is a race between education and catastrophe.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: History is a set of lies agreed upon.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: History is a vision of God's creation on the move.
author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quote: History is filled with tragic examples of wars that result from diplomatic impasse. Whether in our local communities or in international relations, the skillful use of our communicative capacities to negotiate and resolve differences is the first evidence of human wisdom.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: History is indeed little more than the register of the crimes, follies, and misfortunes of mankind.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: History is littered with wars which everybody knew would never happen.
author: Enoch Powell

quote: History is little more than the register of the crimes, follies, and misfortunes of mankind.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: History is more or less bunk.
author: Henry Ford

quote: History is mostly guessing the rest is prejudice.
author: Will Durant

quote: History is not a burden on the memory but an illumination of the soul.
author: Lord Acton

quote: History is only the register of crimes and misfortunes.
author: Voltaire

quote: History is the only true teacher, the revolution the best school for the proletariat.
author: Rosa Luxemburg

quote: History is the science of things which are not repeated.
author: Paul Valery

quote: History is the version of past events that people have decided to agree upon.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: History is written by the victors.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: History is, strictly speaking, the study of questions the study of answers belongs to anthropology and sociology.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: History keeps her secrets longer than most of us. But she has one secret that I will reveal to you tonight in the greatest confidence. Sometimes there are no winners at all. And sometimes nobody needs to lose.
author: John le Carre

quote: History offers no evidence for the proposition that the assignment of women to military combat jobs is the way to win wars, improve combat readiness, or promote national security.
author: Phyllis Schlafly

quote: History passes the final judgment.
author: Sidney Poitier

quote: History repeats itself, but the special call of an art which has passed away is never reproduced. It is as utterly gone out of the world as the song of a destroyed wild bird.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: History repeats itself, first as tragedy, second as farce.
author: Karl Marx

quote: History should be written as philosophy.
author: Voltaire

quote: History shows that our way of life is the stronger way. From it has come more wealth, more industry, more happiness, more human enlightenment than from any other way.
author: Wendell Willkie

quote: History shows that the majority of people that have done anything great have passed their youth in seclusion.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: History shows that there are no invincible armies.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: History shows that where ethics and economics come in conflict, victory is always with economics. Vested interests have never been known to have willingly divested themselves unless there was sufficient force to compel them.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: History suggests that capitalism is a necessary condition for political freedom. Clearly it is not a sufficient condition.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: History takes time. History makes memory.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: History teaches us that men and nations behave wisely once they have exhausted all other alternatives.
author: Abba Eban

quote: History will be kind to me for I intend to write it.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: History will have to record that the greatest tragedy of this period of social transition was not the strident clamor of the bad people, but the appalling silence of the good people.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: History will see advertising as one of the real evil things of our time. It is stimulating people constantly to want things, want this, want that.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: History, a distillation of rumour.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: History, despite its wrenching pain, cannot be unlived, but if faced with courage, need not be lived again.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: History, in general, only informs us of what bad government is.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: History, sociology, economics, psychology et al. confirmed Joyce's view of Everyman as victim.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: Hitherto I have courted Truth with a kind of Romantick Passion, in spite of all Difficulties and Discouragements: for knowledge is thought so unnecessary an Accomplishment for a Woman, that few will give themselves the Trouble to assist us in the Attainment of it.
author: Mary Astell

quote: Hitler and Mussolini were only the primary spokesmen for the attitude of domination and craving for power that are in the heart of almost everyone. Until the source is cleared, there will always be confusion and hate, wars and class antagonisms.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Hitler never abandoned the cloak of legality he recognized the enormous psychological value of having the law on his side. Instead, he turned the law inside out and made illegality legal.
author: Robert Byrd

quote: Hitting is timing. Pitching is upsetting timing.
author: Warren Spahn

quote: Hold fast to dreams For when dreams go Life is a barren field Frozen with snow.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: Hold fast to the Bible. To the influence of this Book we are indebted for all the progress made in true civilization and to this we must look as our guide in the future.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: Hold firmly that our faith is identical with that of the ancients. Deny this, and you dissolve the unity of the Church.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Hold yourself responsible for a higher standard than anybody expects of you. Never excuse yourself.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Hollywood has always been a cage... a cage to catch our dreams.
author: John Huston

quote: Hollywood is a cross between a health farm, a recreation center and an insane asylum. It's a company town, and I happen to like the company!
author: Michael Caine

quote: Home is a name, a word, it is a strong one stronger than magician ever spoke, or spirit ever answered to, in the strongest conjuration.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Home is the place we love best and grumble the most.
author: Billy Sunday

quote: Home is the place where, when you have to go there, they have to take you in.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Home is where one starts from.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Home is where the heart is.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: Home is, I suppose just a child's idea. A house at night, and a lamp in the house. A place to feel safe.
author: V. S. Naipaul

quote: Home life ceases to be free and beautiful as soon as it is founded on borrowing and debt.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Home life is no more natural to us than a cage is natural to a cockatoo.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Homer has taught all other poets the art of telling lies skillfully.
author: Aristotle

quote: Homer is new this morning, and perhaps nothing is as old as today's newspaper.
author: Charles Peguy

quote: Homesickness is nothing. Fifty percent of the people in the world are homesick all the time.
author: John Cheever

quote: Honest conviction is my courage the Constitution is my guide.
author: Andrew Johnson

quote: Honest disagreement is often a good sign of progress.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Honest good humor is the oil and wine of a merry meeting, and there is no jovial companionship equal to that where the jokes are rather small and laughter abundant.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Honest pioneer work in the field of science has always been, and will continue to be, life's pilot. On all sides, life is surrounded by hostility. This puts us under an obligation.
author: Wilhelm Reich

quote: Honesty is the best policy - when there is money in it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Honesty is the best policy.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Honesty is the cornerstone of all success, without which confidence and ability to perform shall cease to exist.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: Honesty is the first chapter in the book of wisdom.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Honesty is the most single most important factor having a direct bearing on the final success of an individual, corporation, or product.
author: Ed McMahon

quote: Honesty is the rarest wealth anyone can possess, and yet all the honesty in the world ain't lawful tender for a loaf of bread.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Honor is not the exclusive property of any political party.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Honor is simply the morality of superior men.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Hope founded upon a human being, a man-made philosophy or any institution is always misplaced... because these things are unreliable and fleeting.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: Hope in reality is the worst of all evils because it prolongs the torments of man.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Hope is a feeling that life and work have meaning. You either have it or you don't, regardless of the state of the world that surrounds you.
author: Vaclav Havel

quote: Hope is a flatterer, but the most upright of all parasites for she frequents the poor man's hut, as well as the palace of his superior.
author: William Shenstone

quote: Hope is a good breakfast, but it is a bad supper.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Hope is a risk that must be run.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Hope is a state of mind, not of the world. Hope, in this deep and powerful sense, is not the same as joy that things are going well, or willingness to invest in enterprises that are obviously heading for success, but rather an ability to work for something because it is good.
author: Vaclav Havel

quote: Hope is a very thin diet.
author: Thomas Shadwell

quote: Hope is a very unruly emotion.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Hope is a waking dream.
author: Aristotle

quote: Hope is being able to see that there is light despite all of the darkness.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: Hope is definitely not the same thing as optimism. It is not the conviction that something will turn out well, but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
author: Vaclav Havel

quote: Hope is like a harebell trembling from its birth.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: Hope is like a road in the country there was never a road, but when many people walk on it, the road comes into existence.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: Hope is like the sun, which, as we journey toward it, casts the shadow of our burden behind us.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Hope is not the conviction that something will turn out well but the certainty that something makes sense, regardless of how it turns out.
author: Vaclav Havel

quote: Hope is patience with the lamp lit.
author: Tertullian

quote: Hope is the best possession. None are completely wretched but those who are without hope. Few are reduced so low as that.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Hope is the cordial that keeps life from stagnating.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Hope is the dream of a waking man.
author: Aristotle

quote: Hope is the only bee that makes honey without flowers.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Hope is the only universal liar who never loses his reputation for veracity.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Hope is the pillar that holds up the world. Hope is the dream of a waking man.
author: Pliny the Elder

quote: Hope is the struggle of the soul, breaking loose from what is perishable, and attesting her eternity.
author: Herman Melville

quote: Hope is the thing with feathers that perches in the soul - and sings the tunes without the words - and never stops at all.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Hope is the word which God has written on the brow of every man.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Hope lies in dreams, in imagination, and in the courage of those who dare to make dreams into reality.
author: Jonas Salk

quote: Hope springs eternal in the human breast: Man never is, but always To be Blest.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Hope travels through, nor quits us when we die.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Hope will never be silent.
author: Harvey Milk

quote: Hope, like faith, is nothing if it is not courageous it is nothing if it is not ridiculous.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Hope, the best comfort of our imperfect condition.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: Hope... is the companion of power, and the mother of success for who so hopes has within him the gift of miracles.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Hopes are but the dreams of those that wake.
author: Matthew Prior

quote: Horror is the natural reaction to the last 5,000 years of history.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: Households, cities, countries, and nations have enjoyed great happiness when a single individual has taken heed of the Good and Beautiful. Such people not only liberate themselves they fill those they meet with a free mind.
author: Philo

quote: How I Love Lucy was born? We decided that instead of divorce lawyers profiting from our mistakes, we'd profit from them.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: How absurd men are! They never use the liberties they have, they demand those they do not have. They have freedom of thought, they demand freedom of speech.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: How blessed are some people, whose lives have no fears, no dreads to whom sleep is a blessing that comes nightly, and brings nothing but sweet dreams.
author: Bram Stoker

quote: How can a Man respect his Wife when he has a contemptible Opinion of her and her Sex?
author: Mary Astell

quote: How can a doctor judge a woman's sanity by merely bidding her good morning and refusing to hear her pleas for release? Even the sick ones know it is useless to say anything, for the answer will be that it is their imagination.
author: Nellie Bly

quote: How can a woman be expected to be happy with a man who insists on treating her as if she were a perfectly normal human being.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: How can people trust the harvest, unless they see it sown?
author: Mary Renault

quote: How can sincerity be a condition of friendship? A taste for truth at any cost is a passion which spares nothing.
author: Albert Camus

quote: How can we live in harmony? First we need to know we are all madly in love with the same God.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: How can you sing of amazing grace and all God's wonders without using your hands?
author: Mahalia Jackson

quote: How can you think and hit at the same time?
author: Yogi Berra

quote: How did it get so late so soon? Its night before its afternoon. December is here before its June. My goodness how the time has flewn. How did it get so late so soon?
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: How disappointment tracks the steps of hope.
author: Letitia Elizabeth Landon

quote: How do I stay so healthy and boyishly handsome? It's simple. I drink the blood of young runaways.
author: William Shatner

quote: How does it become a man to behave towards the American government today? I answer, that he cannot without disgrace be associated with it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: How does one kill fear, I wonder? How do you shoot a specter through the heart, slash off its spectral head, take it by its spectral throat?
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: How does the Meadow flower its bloom unfold? Because the lovely little flower is free down to its root, and in that freedom bold.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: How dreadful knowledge of the truth can be when there's no help in the truth.
author: Sophocles

quote: How easy to be amiable in the midst of happiness and success.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: How far that little candle throws its beams! So shines a good deed in a naughty world.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: How far you go in life depends on your being tender with the young, compassionate with the aged, sympathetic with the striving and tolerant of the weak and strong. Because someday in your life you will have been all of these.
author: George Washington Carver

quote: How few there are who have courage enough to own their faults, or resolution enough to mend them.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: How glorious a greeting the sun gives the mountains!
author: John Muir

quote: How incessant and great are the ills with which a prolonged old age is replete.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: How is it possible that a being with such sensitive jewels as the eyes, such enchanted musical instruments as the ears, and such fabulous arabesque of nerves as the brain can experience itself anything less than a god.
author: Alan Watts

quote: How is it that little children are so intelligent and men so stupid? It must be education that does it.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: How is it they live in such harmony the billions of stars - when most men can barely go a minute without declaring war in their minds about someone they know.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: How large and varied is the educational bill of fare set before every young gentleman in Great Britain and to judge by the mental stamina it affords him in most cases, what a waste of good food it is!
author: James Payn

quote: How like herrings and onions our vices are in the morning after we have committed them.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: How long most people would look at the best book before they would give the price of a large turbot for it?
author: John Ruskin

quote: How long was I in the army? Five foot eleven.
author: Spike Milligan

quote: How mankind defers from day to day the best it can do, and the most beautiful things it can enjoy, without thinking that every day may be the last one, and that lost time is lost eternity!
author: Max Muller

quote: How many famous and high-spirited heroes have lived a day too long?
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: How many things we held yesterday as articles of faith which today we tell as fables.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: How many women have the courage to start properly with a cold, cold bath early in the morning? I jump in, throw the water, cold as ice, and after the first plunge I am happy.
author: Anna Held

quote: How marriage ruins a man! It is as demoralizing as cigarettes, and far more expensive.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: How much a dunce that has been sent to roam, excels a dunce that has been kept at home.
author: William Cowper

quote: How much more grievous are the consequences of anger than the causes of it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: How much time he saves who does not look to see what his neighbor says or does or thinks.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: How often have I said to you that when you have eliminated the impossible, whatever remains, however improbable, must be the truth?
author: Arthur Conan Doyle

quote: How old would you be if you didn't know how old you are?
author: Satchel Paige

quote: How paramount the future is to the present when one is surrounded by children.
author: Charles Darwin

quote: How pathetically scanty my self-knowledge is compared with, say, my knowledge of my room. There is no such thing as observation of the inner world, as there is of the outer world.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: How pleasant it is for a father to sit at his child's board. It is like an aged man reclining under the shadow of an oak which he has planted.
author: Voltaire

quote: How poor are they that have not patience! What wound did ever heal but by degrees?
author: William Shakespeare

quote: How sad it is that we give up on people who are just like us.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: How shall I be able to rule over others, that have not full power and command of myself?
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: How strange that nature does not knock, and yet does not intrude!
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: How strange this fear of death is! We are never frightened at a sunset.
author: George MacDonald

quote: How sweet it is!
author: Jackie Gleason

quote: How thoroughly it is ingrained in mathematical science that every real advance goes hand in hand with the invention of sharper tools and simpler methods which, at the same time, assist in understanding earlier theories and in casting aside some more complicated developments.
author: David Hilbert

quote: How to gain, how to keep, how to recover happiness is in fact for most men at all times the secret motive of all they do, and of all they are willing to endure.
author: William James

quote: How true Daddy's words were when he said: all children must look after their own upbringing. Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
author: Anne Frank

quote: How unhappy is he who cannot forgive himself.
author: Publilius Syrus

quote: How wonderful that we have met with a paradox. Now we have some hope of making progress.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: However far modern science and techniques have fallen short of their inherent possibilities, they have taught mankind at least one lesson nothing is impossible.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: However great an evil immorality may be, we must not forget that it is not without its beneficial consequences. It is only through extremes that men can arrive at the middle path of wisdom and virtue.
author: Wilhelm von Humboldt

quote: However many blessings we expect from God, His infinite liberality will always exceed all our wishes and our thoughts.
author: John Calvin

quote: However much we may sympathize with a small nation confronted by a big and powerful neighbours, we cannot in all circumstances undertake to involve the whole British Empire in a war simply on her account.
author: Neville Chamberlain

quote: However painful the process of leaving home, for parents and for children, the really frightening thing for both would be the prospect of the child never leaving home.
author: Robert Neelly Bellah

quote: However things may seem, no evil thing is success and no good thing is failure.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: However, I must not indulge in homespun wisdom here before so distinguished an assembly, especially as I am to be followed by a representative of science.
author: Knut Hamsun

quote: However, anyone to whom this happens should not leave his room upon awakening, should speak to no-one, but remain alone and sober until everything comes back to him, and he recalls the dream.
author: Paracelsus

quote: However, even during the preparations for action, we laid our plans in such a manner that should there be progress through diplomatic negotiation, we would be well prepared to cancel operations at the latest moment that communication technology would have permitted.
author: Hideki Tojo

quote: Hubert Humphrey talks so fast that listening to him is like trying to read Playboy magazine with your wife turning the pages.
author: Barry Goldwater

quote: Human Nature is the only science of man and yet has been hitherto the most neglected.
author: David Hume

quote: Human behavior flows from three main sources: desire, emotion, and knowledge.
author: Plato

quote: Human beings are accustomed to think of intellect as the power of having and controlling ideas and of ability to learn as synonymous with ability to have ideas. But learning by having ideas is really one of the rare and isolated events in nature.
author: Edward Thorndike

quote: Human beings are the only creatures on earth that allow their children to come back home.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Human beings do not eat nutrients, they eat food.
author: Mary Catherine Bateson

quote: Human beings do not live in the objective world alone, nor alone in the world of social activity as ordinarily understood, but are very much at the mercy of the particular language which has become the medium of expression for their society.
author: Edward Sapir

quote: Human beings exercise responsibilities within a social setting and a framework of obligations which transcend the principle of intelligence.
author: Michael Polanyi

quote: Human beings must be known to be loved but Divine beings must be loved to be known.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Human dignity is better served by embracing knowledge.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: Human education is concerned with certain changes in the intellects, characters and behavior of men, its problems being roughly included under these four topics: Aims, materials, means and methods.
author: Edward Thorndike

quote: Human felicity is produced not as much by great pieces of good fortune that seldom happen as by little advantages that occur every day.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Human folk are as a matter of fact eager to find intelligence in animals.
author: Edward Thorndike

quote: Human history becomes more and more a race between education and catastrophe.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Human history in essence is the history of ideas.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Human intelligence is a reflection of the intelligence that produces everything. In knowing, we are simply extending the intelligence that comes to and constitutes us. We mimic the mind of God, so to speak. Or better, we continue and extend it.
author: Huston Smith

quote: Human judges can show mercy. But against the laws of nature, there is no appeal.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: Human love has little regard for the truth. It makes the truth relative, since nothing, not even the truth, must come between it and the beloved person.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: Human memory is a marvelous but fallacious instrument. The memories which lie within us are not carved in stone not only do they tend to become erased as the years go by, but often they change, or even increase by incorporating extraneous features.
author: Primo Levi

quote: Human misery is too great for men to do without faith.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Human nature doesn't include all human beings. There are human beings who are indifferent to politics, religion, virtually anything.
author: Conor Cruise O'Brien

quote: Human nature is above all things lazy.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: Human nature is evil, and goodness is caused by intentional activity.
author: Xun Zi

quote: Human nature is not black and white but black and grey.
author: Graham Greene

quote: Human nature is not of itself vicious.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Human nature is potentially aggressive and destructive and potentially orderly and constructive.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Human nature is so well disposed towards those who are in interesting situations, that a young person, who either marries or dies, is sure of being kindly spoken of.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Human nature is such that people are born with a love of profit If they follow these inclinations, they will struggle and snatch from each other, and inclinations to defer or yield will die.
author: Xun Zi

quote: Human nature is what Heaven supplies.
author: Xun Zi
