author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Keep close to Nature's heart... and break clear away, once in awhile, and climb a mountain or spend a week in the woods. Wash your spirit clean.
author: John Muir

quote: Keep cool anger is not an argument.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: Keep love in your heart. A life without it is like a sunless garden when the flowers are dead.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Keep true to the dreams of your youth.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Keep your eyes open to your mercies. The man who forgets to be thankful has fallen asleep in life.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Keep your eyes wide open before marriage, half shut afterwards.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Keep your face to the sunshine and you cannot see a shadow.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Keep your faith in God, but keep your powder dry.
author: Oliver Cromwell

quote: Keep your fears to yourself, but share your courage with others.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Kids coming back from Iraq and Afghanistan deserve to come back to 21st century medical care.
author: Anthony Principi

quote: Kindness has converted more sinners than zeal, eloquence, or learning.
author: Frederick William Faber

quote: Kindness in women, not their beauteous looks, shall win my love.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Kindness is in our power, even when fondness is not.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Kindness is more important than wisdom, and the recognition of this is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Theodore Isaac Rubin

quote: Kindness, I've discovered, is everything in life.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: King Louis Philippe once said to me that he attributed the great success of the British nation in political life to their talking politics after dinner.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: King consciously steered away from legal claims and instead relied on civil disobedience.
author: Constance Baker Motley

quote: Kisses are a better fate than wisdom.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: Kittens can happen to anyone.
author: Paul Gallico

quote: Know one knows whether death, which people fear to be the greatest evil, may not be the greatest good.
author: Plato

quote: Know the true value of time snatch, seize, and enjoy every moment of it. No idleness, no laziness, no procrastination: never put off till tomorrow what you can do today.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Know then this truth, enough for man to know virtue alone is happiness below.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Know then thyself, presume not God to scan The proper study of mankind is man.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Knowing how to die is knowing how to live. What is death anyway? It's the outcome of life.
author: Jeanne Moreau

quote: Knowing that we can be loved exactly as we are gives us all the best opportunity for growing into the healthiest of people.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: Knowing your own darkness is the best method for dealing with the darknesses of other people.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Knowledge about life is one thing effective occupation of a place in life, with its dynamic currents passing through your being, is another.
author: William James

quote: Knowledge and human power are synonymous.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Knowledge becomes evil if the aim be not virtuous.
author: Plato

quote: Knowledge can be communicated, but not wisdom. One can find it, live it, be fortified by it, do wonders through it, but one cannot communicate and teach it.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Knowledge comes, but wisdom lingers. It may not be difficult to store up in the mind a vast quantity of facts within a comparatively short time, but the ability to form judgments requires the severe discipline of hard work and the tempering heat of experience and maturity.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Knowledge conquered by labor becomes a possession - a property entirely our own.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Knowledge is a polite word for dead but not buried imagination.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: Knowledge is an unending adventure at the edge of uncertainty.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: Knowledge is ancient error reflecting on its youth.
author: Francis Picabia

quote: Knowledge is in the end based on acknowledgement.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Knowledge is invariably a matter of degree: you cannot put your finger upon even the simplest datum and say this we know.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Knowledge is knowing that we cannot know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Knowledge is like money: the more he gets, the more he craves.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Knowledge is like money: to be of value it must circulate, and in circulating it can increase in quantity and, hopefully, in value.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: Knowledge is love and light and vision.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Knowledge is never too dear.
author: Francis Walsingham

quote: Knowledge is not a passion from without the mind, but an active exertion of the inward strength, vigor and power of the mind, displaying itself from within.
author: Ralph Cudworth

quote: Knowledge is not simply another commodity. On the contrary. Knowledge is never used up. It increases by diffusion and grows by dispersion.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: Knowledge is of no value unless you put it into practice.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Knowledge is of two kinds. We know a subject ourselves, or we know where we can find information upon it.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Knowledge is power.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Knowledge is proud that it knows so much wisdom is humble that it knows no more.
author: William Cowper

quote: Knowledge is soon changed, then lost in the mist, an echo half-heard.
author: Gene Wolfe

quote: Knowledge is the consequence of time, and multitude of days are fittest to teach wisdom.
author: Jeremy Collier

quote: Knowledge is the eye of desire and can become the pilot of the soul.
author: Will Durant

quote: Knowledge is the life of the mind.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: Knowledge is the prime need of the hour.
author: Mary McLeod Bethune

quote: Knowledge is the treasure of a wise man.
author: William Penn

quote: Knowledge is true opinion.
author: Plato

quote: Knowledge may give weight, but accomplishments give luster, and many more people see than weigh.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Knowledge may give weight, but accomplishments give lustre, and many more people see than weigh.
author: Herodotus

quote: Knowledge of God's Word is a bulwark against deception, temptation, accusation, even persecution.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Knowledge of human nature is the beginning and end of political education.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Knowledge of the sciences is so much smoke apart from the heavenly science of Christ.
author: John Calvin

quote: Knowledge of the world in only to be acquired in the world, and not in a closet.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Knowledge of what is does not open the door directly to what should be.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Knowledge once gained casts a light beyond its own immediate boundaries.
author: John Tyndall

quote: Knowledge rests not upon truth alone, but upon error also.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Knowledge shrinks as wisdom grows.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Knowledge slowly builds up what Ignorance in an hour pulls down.
author: George Eliot

quote: Knowledge which is acquired under compulsion obtains no hold on the mind.
author: Plato

quote: Knowledge which is divorced from justice, may be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Knowledge will forever govern ignorance and a people who mean to be their own governors must arm themselves with the power which knowledge gives.
author: James Madison

quote: Knowledge without education is but armed injustice.
author: Horace

quote: Knowledge without justice ought to be called cunning rather than wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: Knowledge, the object of knowledge and the knower are the three factors which motivate action the senses, the work and the doer comprise the threefold basis of action.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Kubrick's vision seemed to be that humans are doomed, whereas Clarke's is that humans are moving on to a better stage of evolution.
author: Marvin Minsky

quote: LOVE: A word properly applied to our delight in particular kinds of food sometimes metaphorically spoken of the favorite objects of all our appetites.
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Labels don't mean anything to me. I'm trying to play as passionately as I'm able to. If they want to call that cool, that's fine. Just spell the name right, is the formula.
author: Lee Konitz

quote: Labor disgraces no man unfortunately, you occasionally find men who disgrace labor.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: Labor wants pride and joy in doing good work, a sense of making or doing something beautiful or useful - to be treated with dignity and respect as brother and sister.
author: Thorstein Veblen

quote: Labor was the first price, the original purchase - money that was paid for all things.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Labour was the first price, the original purchase - money that was paid for all things. It was not by gold or by silver, but by labour, that all wealth of the world was originally purchased.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Lack of knowledge... that is the problem.
author: W. Edwards Deming

quote: Lack of money is the root of all evil.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Ladies and gentlemen: There can be no greater investment in Alabama's future than an investment in education.
author: Bob Riley

quote: Land and sea, weakness and decline are great separators, but death is the great divorcer for ever.
author: John Keats

quote: Land really is the best art.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: Landlords, like all other men, love to reap where they never sowed.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Language is the armory of the human mind, and at once contains the trophies of its past and the weapons of its future conquests.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Language is the house of the truth of Being.
author: Martin Heidegger

quote: Language... has created the word 'loneliness' to express the pain of being alone. And it has created the word 'solitude' to express the glory of being alone.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Lapped in poetry, wrapped in the picturesque, armed with logical sentences and inalienable words.
author: Anatole Broyard

quote: Later on they send me to Hollywood. To make movies. It was all new to me. I was only 21 years old.
author: Elvis Presley

quote: Later, in the early teens, I used to ride my bike every Saturday morning to the nearest airport, ten miles away, push airplanes in and out of the hangars, and clean up the hangars.
author: Alan Shepard

quote: Latinos care about education, yes, so we need reform, not just money.
author: Susana Martinez

quote: Laugh and the world laughs with you, snore and you sleep alone.
author: Anthony Burgess

quote: Laughter is day, and sobriety is night a smile is the twilight that hovers gently between both, more bewitching than either.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Laughter is not a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is the best ending for one.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Laughter is not at all a bad beginning for a friendship, and it is far the best ending for one.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Laughter is the closest thing to the grace of God.
author: Karl Barth

quote: Laughter is the sensation of feeling good all over and showing it principally in one place.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Laughter kills fear, and without fear there can be no faith. For without fear of the devil there is no need for God.
author: Sean Connery

quote: Law is stable the societies we are speaking of are progressive. The greater or less happiness of a people depends on the degree of promptitude with which the gulf is narrowed.
author: Henry James Sumner Maine

quote: Law represents the effort of man to organize society governments, the efforts of selfishness to overthrow liberty.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Law without education is a dead letter. With education the needed law follows without effort and, of course, with power to execute itself indeed, it seems to execute itself.
author: Rutherford B. Hayes

quote: Laws are generally found to be nets of such a texture, as the little creep through, the great break through, and the middle-sized are alone entangled in it.
author: William Shenstone

quote: Laws are like sausages, it is better not to see them being made.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Laws are silent in time of war.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Laws are spider webs through which the big flies pass and the little ones get caught.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Laws control the lesser man... Right conduct controls the greater one.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Laws too gentle are seldom obeyed too severe, seldom executed.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Lawyers are men who hire out their words and anger.
author: Horace

quote: Lawyers are the only persons in whom ignorance of the law is not punished.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Lawyers spend a great deal of their time shoveling smoke.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: Lawyers, I suppose, were children once.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Lay this unto your breast: Old friends, like old swords, still are trusted best.
author: John Webster

quote: Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Lazy people tend not to take chances, but express themselves by tearing down other's work.
author: Ann Rule

quote: Leaders aren't born they are made. And they are made just like anything else, through hard work. And that's the price we'll have to pay to achieve that goal, or any goal.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: Leaders must invoke an alchemy of great vision.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

quote: Leadership - mobilization toward a common goal.
author: Gary Wills

quote: Leadership appears to be the art of getting others to want to do something you are convinced should be done.
author: Vance Packard

quote: Leadership consists not in degrees of technique but in traits of character it requires moral rather than athletic or intellectual effort, and it imposes on both leader and follower alike the burdens of self-restraint.
author: Lewis H. Lapham

quote: Leadership involves finding a parade and getting in front of it.
author: John Naisbitt

quote: Leadership is a matter of having people look at you and gain confidence, seeing how you react. If you're in control, they're in control.
author: Tom Landry

quote: Leadership is a potent combination of strategy and character. But if you must be without one, be without the strategy.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: Leadership is getting someone to do what they don't want to do, to achieve what they want to achieve.
author: Tom Landry

quote: Leadership is intangible, and therefore no weapon ever designed can replace it.
author: Omar N. Bradley

quote: Leadership is particularly necessary to ensure ready acceptance of the unfamiliar and that which is contrary to tradition.
author: Cyril Falls

quote: Leadership is solving problems. The day soldiers stop bringing you their problems is the day you have stopped leading them. They have either lost confidence that you can help or concluded you do not care. Either case is a failure of leadership.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Leadership should be born out of the understanding of the needs of those who would be affected by it.
author: Marian Anderson

quote: Leadership that exploits and sacrifices young people on the altar of its goals is nothing more than raw, demonic power. Genuine leadership is found in ceaseless efforts to foster young people, to pave the way forward for them.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Lean your body forward slightly to support the guitar against your chest, for the poetry of the music should resound in your heart.
author: Andres Segovia

quote: Learn from me, if not by my precepts, then by my example, how dangerous is the pursuit of knowledge and how much happier is that man who believes his native town to be the world than he who aspires to be greater than his nature will allow.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: Learn from yesterday, live for today, hope for tomorrow. The important thing is not to stop questioning.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Learn from your dreams what you lack.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Learn to get in touch with the silence within yourself, and know that everything in life has purpose. There are no mistakes, no coincidences, all events are blessings given to us to learn from.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: Learn to think continentally.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: Learn to... be what you are, and learn to resign with a good grace all that you are not.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Learned Institutions ought to be favorite objects with every free people. They throw that light over the public mind which is the best security against crafty and dangerous encroachments on the public liberty.
author: James Madison

quote: Learning can take place in the backyard if there is a human being there who cares about the child. Before learning computers, children should learn to read first. They should sit around the dinner table and hear what their parents have to say and think.
author: Dixie Carter

quote: Learning carries within itself certain dangers because out of necessity one has to learn from one's enemies.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: Learning disabilities cannot be cured, but they can be treated successfully and children with LD can go on to live happy, successful lives.
author: Anne Ford

quote: Learning gives us a fuller conviction of the imperfections of our nature which one would think, might dispose us to modesty.
author: Jeremy Collier

quote: Learning has always been made much of, but forgetting has always been deprecated therefore pedantry has pretty well established itself throughout the modern world at the expense of culture.
author: Albert J. Nock

quote: Learning hath gained most by those books by which the printers have lost.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Learning how to be still, to really be still and let life happen - that stillness becomes a radiance.
author: Morgan Freeman

quote: Learning how to operate a soul figures to take time.
author: Timothy Leary

quote: Learning is acquired by reading books, but the much more necessary learning, the knowledge of the world, is only to be acquired by reading men, and studying all the various facets of them.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Learning is its own exceeding great reward.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Learning is not attained by chance, it must be sought for with ardor and diligence.
author: Abigail Adams

quote: Learning is not compulsory... neither is survival.
author: W. Edwards Deming

quote: Learning is the ally, not the adversary of genius... he who reads in a proper spirit, can scarcely read too much.
author: William Godwin

quote: Learning lines is on my mind until I do know them. I'll read the paper or paint the house to keep from starting to memorize. I've never found an easy way.
author: Paul Lynde

quote: Learning music by reading about it is like making love by mail.
author: Luciano Pavarotti

quote: Learning never exhausts the mind.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Learning sleeps and snores in libraries, but wisdom is everywhere, wide awake, on tiptoe.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Learning starts with failure the first failure is the beginning of education.
author: John Hersey

quote: Learning teacheth more in one year than experience in twenty.
author: Roger Ascham

quote: Learning to read music in Braille and play by ear helped me develop a damn good memory.
author: Ray Charles

quote: Learning to trust is one of life's most difficult tasks.
author: Isaac Watts

quote: Learning without thought is labor lost thought without learning is perilous.
author: Confucius

quote: Learning, while at school, that the charge for the education of girls was the same as that for boys, and that, when they became teachers, women received only half as much as men for their services, the injustice of this distinction was so apparent.
author: Lucretia Mott

quote: Leave all the afternoon for exercise and recreation, which are as necessary as reading. I will rather say more necessary because health is worth more than learning.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Leave it as it is. The ages have been at work on it and man can only mar it.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Leave the President's family business to him. You will have plenty to do without trying to manage the First Family. They are likely to do fine without your help.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Leave the atom alone.
author: E. Y. Harburg

quote: Leave the matter of religion to the family altar, the church, and the private school, supported entirely by private contributions. Keep the church and state forever separate.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: Leaving home in a sense involves a kind of second birth in which we give birth to ourselves.
author: Robert Neelly Bellah

quote: Left-wing politicians take away your liberty in the name of children and of fighting poverty, while right-wing politicians do it in the name of family values and fighting drugs. Either way, government gets bigger and you become less free.
author: Harry Browne

quote: Legend remains victorious in spite of history.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

quote: Legend: A lie that has attained the dignity of age.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Legends die hard. They survive as truth rarely does.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: Leibniz dedicated his life to efforts to educate people to understand that true happiness is found by locating their identity in benefitting mankind and their posterity.
author: Robert Trout

quote: Leisure and curiosity might soon make great advances in useful knowledge, were they not diverted by minute emulation and laborious trifles.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Leisure is the time for doing something useful. This leisure the diligent person will obtain the lazy one never.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Leon Theremin's original designs are elegant, ingenious and effective. As electronics goes, the theremin is very simple. But there are so many subtleties hidden in the details of the design. It's like a great sonnet, or a painting, or a speech, that is perfectly done on more than one level.
author: Robert Moog

quote: Lesbian existence comprises both the breaking of a taboo and the rejection of a compulsory way of life. It is also a direct or indirect attack on the male right of access to women.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Less is more.
author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quote: Less is only more where more is no good.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Lesser artists borrow, great artists steal.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: Lessons of wisdom have the most power over us when they capture the heart through the groundwork of a story, which engages the passions.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Let a man do what he will by a single woman, the world is encouragingly apt to think Marriage a sufficient amends.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Let a man get up and say, Behold, this is the truth, and instantly I perceive a sandy cat filching a piece of fish in the background. Look, you have forgotten the cat, I say.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Let advertisers spend the same amount of money improving their product that they do on advertising and they wouldn't have to advertise it.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Let age, not envy, draw wrinkles on thy cheeks.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: Let children read whatever they want and then talk about it with them. If parents and kids can talk together, we won't have as much censorship because we won't have as much fear.
author: Judy Blume

quote: Let each man exercise the art he knows.
author: Aristophanes

quote: Let every eye negotiate for itself and trust no agent.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Let every man be respected as an individual and no man idolized.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Let everyone try and find that as a result of daily prayer he adds something new to his life, something with which nothing can be compared.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Let food be thy medicine and medicine be thy food.
author: Hippocrates

quote: Let him who expects one class of society to prosper in the highest degree, while the other is in distress, try whether one side of the face can smile while the other is pinched.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Let ignorance talk as it will, learning has its value.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Let it be your constant method to look into the design of people's actions, and see what they would be at, as often as it is practicable and to make this custom the more significant, practice it first upon yourself.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Let judges secretly despair of justice: their verdicts will be more acute. Let generals secretly despair of triumph killing will be defamed. Let priests secretly despair of faith: their compassion will be true.
author: Leonard Cohen

quote: Let me alone, and go in search of someone else.
author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quote: Let me alone: I have yet my legs and one arm. Tell the surgeon to make haste and his instruments. I know I must lose my right arm, so the sooner it's off the better.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: Let me be a free man - free to travel, free to stop, free to work.
author: Chief Joseph

quote: Let me be clear. I support the definition of marriage as a union between a man and a woman.
author: Ben Nelson

quote: Let me be the first to tell you, drinking alcohol is the worst thing to do in cold weather. Hot soup is the best because the process of digesting food helps to warm you up.
author: Morgan Freeman

quote: Let me embrace thee, sour adversity, for wise men say it is the wisest course.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Let me give you a definition of ethics: It is good to maintain and further life it is bad to damage and destroy life.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Let me recommend the best medicine in the world: a long journey, at a mild season, through a pleasant country, in easy stages.
author: James Madison

quote: Let me remind you that credit is the lifeblood of business, the lifeblood of prices and jobs.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Let me say again that the relationship is asymmetrical: there's no democracy without a market economy, but you can have a market economy without democracy.
author: Peter L. Berger

quote: Let me smile with the wise, and feed with the rich.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Let me start by emphasizing that I am open to efforts to expedite environmental procedures for true emergencies or in other clear cases where current laws are needlessly burdensome.
author: Sherwood Boehlert

quote: Let me start with Yahoo. As we meet today, a Chinese citizen who had the courage to speak his mind on the Internet is in prison because Yahoo chose to share his name and address with the Chinese Government.
author: Tom Lantos

quote: Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: Let me tell you, never before in the history of this planet has anybody made the progress that African-Americans have made in a 30-year period, in spite of many black folks and white folks lying to one another.
author: Dick Gregory

quote: Let me tell you, sisters, seeing dried egg on a plate in the morning is a lot dirtier than anything I've had to deal with in politics.
author: Ann Richards

quote: Let men see, let them know, a real man, who lives as he was meant to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Let my name stand among those who are willing to bear ridicule and reproach for the truth's sake, and so earn some right to rejoice when the victory is won.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: Let no man fear to die, we love to sleep all, and death is but the sounder sleep.
author: Francis Beaumont

quote: Let no one who loves be unhappy, even love unreturned has its rainbow.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: Let not him who is houseless pull down the house of another, but let him work diligently and build one for himself, thus by example assuring that his own shall be safe from violence when built.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Let parents bequeath to their children not riches, but the spirit of reverence.
author: Plato

quote: Let peace, descending from her native heaven, bid her olives spring amidst the joyful nations and plenty, in league with commerce, scatter blessings from her copious hand!
author: Daniel Boone

quote: Let the beauty of what you love be what you do.
author: Rumi

quote: Let the fear of a danger be a spur to prevent it he that fears not, gives advantage to the danger.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Let the fear of danger be a spur to prevent it he that fears not, gives advantage to the danger.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: Let the future tell the truth, and evaluate each one according to his work and accomplishments. The present is theirs the future, for which I have really worked, is mine.
author: Nikola Tesla

quote: Let the gentle bush dig its root deep and spread upward to split the boulder.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Let the great world spin for ever down the ringing grooves of change.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Let the master praise him, and say, 'Here ye do well.' For, I assure you, there is no such whetstone to sharpen a good wit, and encourage a will to learning, as is praise.
author: Roger Ascham

quote: Let the people think they govern and they will be governed.
author: William Penn

quote: Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: Let them be reassured, it has never been one of our intentions to ban religion in society, but solely to protect the national education system from any conspicuous display of religious affiliation.
author: Jean-Pierre Raffarin

quote: Let them eat cake.
author: Marie Antoinette

quote: Let them hate me, provided they respect my conduct.
author: Tiberius

quote: Let them hate so long as they fear.
author: Lucius Accius

quote: Let them look to the past, but let them also look to the future let them look to the land of their ancestors, but let them look also to the land of their children.
author: Wilfrid Laurier

quote: Let us all be brave enough to die the death of a martyr, but let no one lust for martyrdom.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Let us always meet each other with smile, for the smile is the beginning of love.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Let us banish fear.
author: Carter G. Woodson

quote: Let us be grateful to people who make us happy, they are the charming gardeners who make our souls blossom.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Let us be true: this is the highest maxim of art and of life, the secret of eloquence and of virtue, and of all moral authority.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Let us beware of saying that death is the opposite of life. The living being is only a species of the dead, and a very rare species.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Let us build a 21st-century rural economy of cutting-edge companies and technologies that lead us to energy and food security. Such an investment will revitalize rural America, re-establish our moral leadership on climate security and eliminate our addiction to foreign oil.
author: Tom Vilsack

quote: Let us change our traditional attitude to the construction of programs. Instead of imagining that our main task is to instruct a computer what to do, let us concentrate rather on explaining to human beings what we want a computer to do.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Let us develop the resources of our land, call forth its powers, build up its institutions, promote all its great interests, and see whether we also, in our day and generation, may not perform something worthy to be remembered.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Let us have peace.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: Let us learn to appreciate there will be times when the trees will be bare, and look forward to the time when we may pick the fruit.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Let us leave pretty women to men devoid of imagination.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Let us live for the beauty of our own reality.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: Let us more and more insist on raising funds of love, of kindness, of understanding, of peace. Money will come if we seek first the Kingdom of God - the rest will be given.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Let us never forget that government is ourselves and not an alien power over us. The ultimate rulers of our democracy are not a President and senators and congressmen and government officials, but the voters of this country.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Let us not be deceived we are today in the midst of a cold war.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Let us not be satisfied with just giving money. Money is not enough, money can be got, but they need your hearts to love them. So, spread your love everywhere you go.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Let us not deceive ourselves we must elect world peace or world destruction.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Let us not listen to those who think we ought to be angry with our enemies, and who believe this to be great and manly. Nothing is so praiseworthy, nothing so clearly shows a great and noble soul, as clemency and readiness to forgive.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Let us not look back in anger, nor forward in fear, but around in awareness.
author: James Thurber

quote: Let us not, in the eagerness of our haste to educate, forget all the ends of education.
author: William Godwin

quote: Let us now set forth one of the fundamental truths about marriage: the wife is in charge.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Let us permit nature to have her way. She understands her business better than we do.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Let us put our minds together and see what life we can make for our children.
author: Sitting Bull

quote: Let us put theology out of religion. Theology has always sent the worst to heaven, the best to hell.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Let us raise a standard to which the wise and honest can repair the rest is in the hands of God.
author: George Washington

quote: Let us realize that: the privilege to work is a gift, the power to work is a blessing, the love of work is success!
author: David O. McKay

quote: Let us speak, though we show all our faults and weaknesses, - for it is a sign of strength to be weak, to know it, and out with it - not in a set way and ostentatiously, though, but incidentally and without premeditation.
author: Herman Melville

quote: Let us take things as we find them: let us not attempt to distort them into what they are not... We cannot make facts. All our wishing cannot change them. We must use them.
author: John Henry Newman

quote: Let us tenderly and kindly cherish, therefore, the means of knowledge. Let us dare to read, think, speak, and write.
author: John Adams

quote: Let us touch the dying, the poor, the lonely and the unwanted according to the graces we have received and let us not be ashamed or slow to do the humble work.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Let us with caution indulge the supposition that morality can be maintained without religion. Reason and experience both forbid us to expect that national morality can prevail in exclusion of religious principle.
author: George Washington

quote: Let us work without theorizing, tis the only way to make life endurable.
author: Voltaire

quote: Let woman out of the home, let man into it, should be the aim of education. The home needs man, and the world outside needs woman.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Let your Discourse with Men of Business be Short and Comprehensive.
author: George Washington

quote: Let your family, staff, and friends know that you're still the same person, despite all the publicity and notoriety that accompanies your position.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Let your hopes, not your hurts, shape your future.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Let your life lightly dance on the edges of Time like dew on the tip of a leaf.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Let your mind alone, and see what happens.
author: Virgil Thomson

quote: Let your religion be less of a theory and more of a love affair.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Let your soul stand cool and composed before a million universes.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Let's create a legal system that can work.
author: Sam Brownback

quote: Let's drink to the spirit of gallantry and courage that made a strange Heaven out of unbelievable Hell, and let's drink to the hope that one day this country of ours, which we love so much, will find dignity and greatness and peace again.
author: Noel Coward

quote: Let's hope you feel better now.
author: Jack Kevorkian

quote: Let's stop pretending we can arrest our way to safety and security. Despite all the fine work that policemen and women do, we have got to find other solutions to deter crime.
author: Carrie P. Meek

quote: Let's talk of a system that transforms all the social organisms into a work of art, in which the entire process of work is included... something in which the principle of production and consumption takes on a form of quality. It's a Gigantic project.
author: Joseph Beuys

quote: Lets have faith that right makes might and in that faith let us, to the end, dare to do our duty as we understand it.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Liberal: a power worshipper without power.
author: George Orwell

quote: Liberalism is Rationalism in politics.
author: Francis Parker Yockey

quote: Liberalism is trust of the people tempered by prudence. Conservatism is distrust of the people tempered by fear.
author: William E. Gladstone

quote: Liberalism is, I think, resurgent. One reason is that more and more people are so painfully aware of the alternative.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Liberals, it has been said, are generous with other peoples' money, except when it comes to questions of national survival when they prefer to be generous with other people's freedom and security.
author: William F. Buckley, Jr.

quote: Liberate the minds of men and ultimately you will liberate the bodies of men.
author: Marcus Garvey

quote: Libertarians know that a free country has nothing to fear from anyone coming in or going out - while a welfare state is scared to death of poor people coming in and rich people getting out.
author: Harry Browne

quote: Liberty cannot be established without morality, nor morality without faith.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: Liberty cannot be preserved without general knowledge among the people.
author: John Adams

quote: Liberty consists in the power of doing that which is permitted by the law.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Liberty doesn't work as well in practice as it does in speeches.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Liberty for wolves is death to the lambs.
author: Isaiah Berlin

quote: Liberty has never come from Government. Liberty has always come from the subjects of it. The history of liberty is a history of limitations of governmental power, not the increase of it.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Liberty is not the power of doing what we like, but the right to do what we ought.
author: Lord Acton

quote: Liberty may be endangered by the abuse of liberty, but also by the abuse of power.
author: James Madison

quote: Liberty means responsibility. That is why most men dread it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Liberty, according to my metaphysics is a self-determining power in an intellectual agent. It implies thought and choice and power.
author: John Adams

quote: Life affords no higher pleasure than that of surmounting difficulties, passing from one step of success to another, forming new wishes and seeing them gratified.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Life always rides in strength to victory, not through internationalism... but only through the direct responsibility of the individual.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Life and death have been lacking in my life.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: Life and death. They are somehow sweetly and beautifully mixed, but I don't know how.
author: Gloria Swanson

quote: Life and human society are the chief concern of Confucianism and, through it, the chief concern of the Chinese people.
author: Hu Shih

quote: Life beats down and crushes the soul and art reminds you that you have one.
author: Stella Adler

quote: Life becomes harder for us when we live for others, but it also becomes richer and happier.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Life began with waking up and loving my mother's face.
author: George Eliot

quote: Life being what it is, one dreams of revenge.
author: Paul Gauguin

quote: Life belongs to the living, and he who lives must be prepared for changes.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Life can be pulled by goals just as surely as it can be pushed by drives.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: Life can only be understood backwards but it must be lived forwards.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Life can't defeat a writer who is in love with writing, for life itself is a writer's lover until death.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: Life cannot subsist in society but by reciprocal concessions.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Life consists in what a man is thinking of all day.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Life consists not in holding good cards but in playing those you hold well.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Life contains but two tragedies. One is not to get your heart's desire the other is to get it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Life could be wonderful if people would leave you alone.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: Life deprived of beauty is not worthy of being called human.
author: Luis Barragan

quote: Life does not agree with philosophy: There is no happiness that is not idleness, and only what is useless is pleasurable.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Life does not cease to be funny when people die any more than it ceases to be serious when people laugh.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Life doesn't imitate art, it imitates bad television.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Life every man holds dear but the dear man holds honor far more precious dear than life.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Life finds its purpose and fulfillment in the expansion of happiness.
author: Maharishi Mahesh Yogi

quote: Life grants nothing to us mortals without hard work.
author: Horace

quote: Life has a certain flavor for those who have fought and risked all that the sheltered and protected can never experience.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Life has a higher end, than to be amused.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Life has got a habit of not standing hitched. You got to ride it like you find it. You got to change with it. If a day goes by that don't change some of your old notions for new ones, that is just about like trying to milk a dead cow.
author: Woody Guthrie

quote: Life has its own hidden forces which you can only discover by living.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Life has loveliness to sell, all beautiful and splendid things, blue waves whitened on a cliff, soaring fire that sways and sings, and children's faces looking up, holding wonder like a cup.
author: Sara Teasdale

quote: Life has meaning only if one barters it day by day for something other than itself.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Life has no blessing like a prudent friend.
author: Euripides

quote: Life has obliged him to remember so much useful knowledge that he has lost not only his history, but his whole original cargo of useless knowledge history, languages, literatures, the higher mathematics, or what you will - are all gone.
author: Albert J. Nock

quote: Life imitates art far more than art imitates Life.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Life in common among people who love each other is the ideal of happiness.
author: George Sand

quote: Life in general has never been even close to fair, so the pretense that the government can make it fair is a valuable and inexhaustible asset to politicians who want to expand government.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: Life in the twentieth century is like a parachute jump: you have to get it right the first time.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Life is 10 percent what you make it, and 90 percent how you take it.
author: Irving Berlin

quote: Life is God's novel. Let him write it.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: Life is a banquet, and most poor suckers are starving to death.
author: Rosalind Russell

quote: Life is a battle between faith and reason in which each feeds upon the other, drawing sustenance from it and destroying it.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Life is a corrupting process from the time a child learns to play his mother off against his father in the politics of when to go to bed he who fears corruption fears life.
author: Saul Alinsky

quote: Life is a culmination of the past, an awareness of the present, an indication of a future beyond knowledge, the quality that gives a touch of divinity to matter.
author: Charles Lindbergh

quote: Life is a game. Money is how we keep score.
author: Ted Turner

quote: Life is a gift, given in trust - like a child.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Life is a great big canvas throw all the paint you can at it.
author: Danny Kaye

quote: Life is a great sunrise. I do not see why death should not be an even greater one.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: Life is a long lesson in humility.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: Life is a lot like jazz... it's best when you improvise.
author: George Gershwin

quote: Life is a moderately good play with a badly written third act.
author: Truman Capote

quote: Life is a process of becoming, a combination of states we have to go through. Where people fail is that they wish to elect a state and remain in it. This is a kind of death.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Life is a series of collisions with the future it is not the sum of what we have been, but what we yearn to be.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Life is a series of experiences, each one of which makes us bigger, even though sometimes it is hard to realize this. For the world was built to develop character, and we must learn that the setbacks and grieves which we endure help us in our marching onward.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Life is a succession of lessons which must be lived to be understood.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Life is a tragedy when seen in close-up, but a comedy in long-shot.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: Life is a travelling to the edge of knowledge, then a leap taken.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Life is all memory, except for the one present moment that goes by you so quickly you hardly catch it going.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Life is an exciting business, and most exciting when it is lived for others.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Life is an operation which is done in a forward direction. One lives toward the future, because to live consists inexorably in doing, in each individual life making itself.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Life is an unfoldment, and the further we travel the more truth we can comprehend. To understand the things that are at our door is the best preparation for understanding those that lie beyond.
author: Hypatia

quote: Life is as tedious as twice-told tale, vexing the dull ear of a drowsy man.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Life is but a moment, death also is but another.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Life is but thought.
author: Sara Teasdale

quote: Life is divided into three terms - that which was, which is, and which will be. Let us learn from the past to profit by the present, and from the present, to live better in the future.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Life is either a great adventure or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Life is essentially a cheat and its conditions are those of defeat the redeeming things are not happiness and pleasure but the deeper satisfactions that come out of struggle.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Life is far too important a thing ever to talk seriously about.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Life is given to you like a flat piece of land and everything has to be done. I hope that when I am finished, my piece of land will be a beautiful garden, so there is a lot of work.
author: Jeanne Moreau

quote: Life is half spent before we know what it is.
author: George Herbert

quote: Life is hard it's harder if you're stupid.
author: John Wayne

quote: Life is hard. After all, it kills you.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Life is largely a matter of expectation.
author: Horace

quote: Life is like a trumpet - if you don't put anything into it, you don't get anything out of it.
author: William Christopher Handy

quote: Life is like a very short visit to a toyshop between birth and death.
author: Desmond Morris

quote: Life is like an ice-cream cone, you have to lick it one day at a time.
author: Charles M. Schulz

quote: Life is like an onion. You peel it off one layer at a time, and sometimes you weep.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Life is like music, it must be composed by ear, feeling and instinct, not by rule. Nevertheless one had better know the rules, for they sometimes guide in doubtful cases, though not often.
author: Paracelsus

quote: Life is made up of small pleasures. Happiness is made up of those tiny successes. The big ones come too infrequently. And if you don't collect all these tiny successes, the big ones don't really mean anything.
author: Norman Lear

quote: Life is made up of sobs, sniffles, and smiles, with sniffles predominating.
author: O. Henry

quote: Life is made up, not of great sacrifices or duties, but of little things, in which smiles and kindness, and small obligations given habitually, are what preserve the heart and secure comfort.
author: Humphry Davy

quote: Life is neither good or evil, but only a place for good and evil.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Life is never fair, and perhaps it is a good thing for most of us that it is not.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Life is not a matter of holding good cards, but of playing a poor hand well.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Life is not a matter of place, things or comfort rather, it concerns the basic human rights of family, country, justice and human dignity.
author: Imelda Marcos

quote: Life is not a problem to be solved, but a reality to be experienced.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Life is not an easy matter... You cannot live through it without falling into frustration and cynicism unless you have before you a great idea which raises you above personal misery, above weakness, above all kinds of perfidy and baseness.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: Life is not easy for any of us. But what of that? We must have perseverance and above all confidence in ourselves. We must believe that we are gifted for something and that this thing must be attained.
author: Marie Curie

quote: Life is only a long and bitter suicide, and faith alone can transform this suicide into a sacrifice.
author: Franz Liszt

quote: Life is pleasant. Death is peaceful. It's the transition that's troublesome.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Life is pretty simple: You do some stuff. Most fails. Some works. You do more of what works. If it works big, others quickly copy it. Then you do something else. The trick is the doing something else.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

quote: Life is short and we have never too much time for gladdening the hearts of those who are travelling the dark journey with us. Oh be swift to love, make haste to be kind.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Life is short, the art long.
author: Hippocrates

quote: Life is so fresh, life is every day so new if we are fighting, only for the best. Sometimes I think the only real satisfaction in life is failure, failure in your endeavor to do your best.
author: Maude Adams

quote: Life is the art of being well deceived and in order that the deception may succeed it must be habitual and uninterrupted.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Life is the flower for which love is the honey.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Life is the only art that we are required to practice without preparation, and without being allowed the preliminary trials, the failures and botches, that are essential for training.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Life is the only real counselor wisdom unfiltered through personal experience does not become a part of the moral tissue.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: Life is thickly sown with thorns, and I know no other remedy than to pass quickly through them. The longer we dwell on our misfortunes, the greater is their power to harm us.
author: Voltaire

quote: Life is to be entered upon with courage.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: Life is to be fortified by many friendships. To love and to be loved is the greatest happiness of existence.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Life is to be lived. If you have to support yourself, you had bloody well better find some way that is going to be interesting. And you don't do that by sitting around.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Life is too short to work so hard.
author: Vivien Leigh

quote: Life is tough, but it's tougher when you're stupid.
author: John Wayne

quote: Life is truly known only to those who suffer, lose, endure adversity and stumble from defeat to defeat.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Life is what we make it, always has been, always will be.
author: Grandma Moses

quote: Life is without meaning. You bring the meaning to it. The meaning of life is whatever you ascribe it to be. Being alive is the meaning.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Life isn't a matter of milestones, but of moments.
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Life itself is but the shadow of death, and souls departed but the shadows of the living.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: Life itself is the proper binge.
author: Julia Child

quote: Life itself still remains a very effective therapist.
author: Karen Horney

quote: Life levels all men. Death reveals the eminent.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Life lived for tomorrow will always be just a day away from being realized.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Life loves the liver of it.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Life loves to be taken by the lapel and told: 'I'm with you kid. Let's go.'
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Life magazine ran a page featuring me and three other girls that was clearly the precursor of Sports Illustrated swimsuit issues.
author: Esther Williams

quote: Life must be a constant education one must learn everything, from speaking to dying.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Life must be lived and curiosity kept alive. One must never, for whatever reason, turn his back on life.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Life must be lived as play.
author: Plato

quote: Life should be great rather than long.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: Life shrinks or expands in proportion to one's courage.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Life stands before me like an eternal spring with new and brilliant clothes.
author: Carl Friedrich Gauss

quote: Life was a funny thing that happened to me on the way to the grave.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: Life was a lot simpler when what we honored was father and mother rather than all major credit cards.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Life well spent is long.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Life will always be to a large extent what we ourselves make it.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Life without idealism is empty indeed. We just hope or starve to death.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Life would be infinitely happier if we could only be born at the age of eighty and gradually approach eighteen.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Life would be tolerable but for its amusements.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Life's Tragedy is that we get old to soon and wise too late.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Life's an awfully lonesome affair. You come into the world alone and you go out of the world alone yet it seems to me you are more alone while living than even going and coming.
author: Emily Carr

quote: Life's but a walking shadow, a poor player, that struts and frets his hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more it is a tale told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Life's greatest happiness is to be convinced we are loved.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Life's like a movie, write your own ending. Keep believing, keep pretending.
author: Jim Henson

quote: Life's most persistent and urgent question is, 'What are you doing for others?'
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Life, an age to the miserable, and a moment to the happy.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Life... is not simply a series of exciting new ventures. The future is not always a whole new ball game. There tends to be unfinished business. One trails all sorts of things around with one, things that simply won't be got rid of.
author: Anita Brookner

quote: Light is meaningful only in relation to darkness, and truth presupposes error. It is these mingled opposites which people our life, which make it pungent, intoxicating. We only exist in terms of this conflict, in the zone where black and white clash.
author: Louis Aragon

quote: Light is the symbol of truth.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Light, God's eldest daughter, is a principal beauty in a building.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Like Christ said, love thee one another. I learned to do that, and I learned to respect and be appreciative and thankful for what I had.
author: James Brown

quote: Like a welcome summer rain, humor may suddenly cleanse and cool the earth, the air and you.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: Like all dreamers, I mistook disenchantment for truth.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Like all great travellers, I have seen more than I remember, and remember more than I have seen.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Like all pure creatures, cats are practical.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Like all sciences and all valuations, the psychology of women has hitherto been considered only from the point of view of men.
author: Karen Horney

quote: Like all young reporters - brilliant or hopelessly incompetent - I dreamed of the glamorous life of the foreign correspondent: prowling Vienna in a Burberry trench coat, speaking a dozen languages to dangerous women, narrowly escaping Sardinian bandits - the usual stuff that newspaper dreams are made of.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Like any other people, like fathers, mothers, sons and daughters in every land, when the issue of peace or war has been put squarely to the American people, they have registered for peace.
author: Paul Robeson

quote: Like charity, I believe glamour should begin at home.
author: Loretta Young

quote: Like dogs in a wheel, birds in a cage, or squirrels in a chain, ambitious men still climb and climb, with great labor, and incessant anxiety, but never reach the top.
author: Robert Browning

quote: Like every man of sense and good feeling, I abominate work.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Like every other good thing in this world, leisure and culture have to be paid for. Fortunately, however, it is not the leisured and the cultured who have to pay.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Like everybody, I have invested in things that have gone bad, because there's never any guarantee of success or profit when it comes to money.
author: Murray Walker

quote: Like everyone else who makes the mistake of getting older, I begin each day with coffee and obituaries.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Like everything which is not the involuntary result of fleeting emotion but the creation of time and will, any marriage, happy or unhappy, is infinitely more interesting than any romance, however passionate.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Like fragile ice anger passes away in time.
author: Ovid

quote: Like hatred, jealousy is forbidden by the laws of life because it is essentially destructive.
author: Alexis Carrel

quote: Like many intellectuals, he was incapable of saying a simple thing in a simple way.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Like many people, most Libertarians feel empathy and sympathy for less fortunate people. But they know you can't have perfection in a world of limited resources.
author: Harry Browne

quote: Like the British Constitution, she owes her success in practice to her inconsistencies in principle.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Like the old soldier of the ballad, I now close my military career and just fade away, an old soldier who tried to do his duty as God gave him the light to see that duty. Goodbye.
author: Douglas MacArthur

quote: Likewise, education can direct people toward good or evil ends. When education is based on a fundamentally distorted worldview, the results are horrific.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Liking money like I like it, is nothing less than mysticism. Money is a glory.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Limit to courage? There is no limit to courage.
author: Gabriele D'Annunzio

quote: Lincoln's stature and strength, his intelligence and ambition - in short, all the elements which gave him popularity among men in New Salem, rendered him equally attractive to the fair sex of that village.
author: John George Nicolay

quote: Liquid architecture. It's like jazz - you improvise, you work together, you play off each other, you make something, they make something. And I think it's a way of - for me, it's a way of trying to understand the city, and what might happen in the city.
author: Frank Gehry

quote: Listen once in a while. It's amazing what you can hear.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Listen there's a hell of a good universe next door: let's go.
author: e. e. cummings

quote: Listen to any musical phrase or rhythm, and grasp it as a whole, and you thereupon have present in you the image, so to speak, of the divine knowledge of the temporal order.
author: Josiah Royce

quote: Listening is a positive act: you have to put yourself out to do it.
author: David Hockney

quote: Literature adds to reality, it does not simply describe it. It enriches the necessary competencies that daily life requires and provides and in this respect, it irrigates the deserts that our lives have already become.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Literature flourishes best when it is half a trade and half an art.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Literature is the art of discovering something extraordinary about ordinary people, and saying with ordinary words something extraordinary.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: Literature is the expression of a feeling of deprivation, a recourse against a sense of something missing. But the contrary is also true: language is what makes us human. It is a recourse against the meaningless noise and silence of nature and history.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Literature isn't a moral beauty contest. Its power arises from the authority and audacity with which the impersonation is pulled off the belief it inspires is what counts.
author: Philip Roth

quote: Literature overtakes history, for literature gives you more than one life. It expands experience and opens new opportunities to readers.
author: Carlos Fuentes

quote: Literature transmits incontrovertible condensed experience... from generation to generation. In this way literature becomes the living memory of a nation.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: Litigation takes the place of sex at middle age.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: Little League baseball is a very good thing because it keeps the parents off the streets.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: Little children are still the symbol of the eternal marriage between love and duty.
author: George Eliot

quote: Little else is requisite to carry a state to the highest degree of opulence from the lowest barbarism but peace, easy taxes, and a tolerable administration of justice: all the rest being brought about by the natural course of things.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune but great minds rise above them.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Little minds have little worries, big minds have no time for worries.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Little progress can be made by merely attempting to repress what is evil. Our great hope lies in developing what is good.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Little things seem nothing, but they give peace, like those meadow flowers which individually seem odorless but all together perfume the air.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Live as brave men and if fortune is adverse, front its blows with brave hearts.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Live as if you were living a second time, and as though you had acted wrongly the first time.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: Live as if you were to die tomorrow. Learn as if you were to live forever.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Live by this credo: have a little laugh at life and look around you for happiness instead of sadness. Laughter has always brought me out of unhappy situations.
author: Red Skelton

quote: Live daringly, boldly, fearlessly. Taste the relish to be found in competition - in having put forth the best within you.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

quote: Live fast, die young, and leave a good looking corpse.
author: John Derek

quote: Live the life you've dreamed.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Live theater to me is much more free than the movies or television.
author: Eartha Kitt

quote: Live with integrity, respect the rights of other people, and follow your own bliss.
author: Nathaniel Branden

quote: Live your life, do your work, then take your hat.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Live, so you do not have to look back and say: 'God, how I have wasted my life.'
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: Lives of great men all remind us, we can make our lives sublime, and, departing, leave behind us, footprints on the sands of time.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Living here on Earth, we breathe the rhythms of a universe that extends infinitely above us. When resonant harmonies arise between this vast outer cosmos and the inner human cosmos, poetry is born.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Living in an age of advertisement, we are perpetually disillusioned. The perfect life is spread before us every day, but it changes and withers at a touch.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: Living in dreams of yesterday, we find ourselves still dreaming of impossible future conquests.
author: Charles Lindbergh

quote: Living the past is a dull and lonely business looking back strains the neck muscles, causing you to bump into people not going your way.
author: Edna Ferber

quote: Living well is the best revenge.
author: George Herbert

quote: Lo! The poor Indian, whose untutored mind sees God in clouds, or hears him in the wind.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Loads of chemicals and hazardous wastes have been introduced into the atmosphere that didn't even exist in 1948. The environmental condition of the planet is far worse than it was 42 years ago.
author: Gaylord Nelson

quote: Local and regional food systems are about opportunity.
author: Tom Vilsack

quote: Logic is neither an art nor a science but a dodge.
author: Stendhal

quote: Logic is one thing, the human animal another. You can quite easily propose a logical solution to something and at the same time hope in your heart of hearts it won't work out.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: Logic is the beginning of wisdom, not the end.
author: Leonard Nimoy

quote: Logic is the technique by which we add conviction to truth.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Logic will get you from A to B. Imagination will take you everywhere.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Logic will never change emotion or perception.
author: Edward de Bono

quote: Loneliness expresses the pain of being alone and solitude expresses the glory of being alone.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Long as I was riding in a big Cadillac and dressed nice and had plenty of food, that's all I cared about.
author: Etta James

quote: Long before history began we men have got together apart from the women and done things. We had time.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Long before we understand ourselves through the process of self-examination, we understand ourselves in a self-evident way in the family, society and state in which we live.
author: Hans-Georg Gadamer

quote: Look at Islam in a rational manner and without demagoguery or emotion. It is the leading religion of the world with 1.5 billion followers.
author: Zbigniew Brzezinski

quote: Look at all the buses now that want exact change, exact change. I figure if I give them exact change, they should take me exactly where I want to go.
author: George C. Wallace

quote: Look at an infantryman's eyes and you can tell how much war he has seen.
author: William Alexander Henry

quote: Look at the average American diet: ice cream, butter, cheese, whole milk, all this fat. People don't realize how much of this stuff you get by the end of the day. High blood pressure is from all this high-fat eating.
author: Jack LaLanne

quote: Look back over the past, with its changing empires that rose and fell, and you can foresee the future, too.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Look back, and smile on perils past.
author: Walter Scott

quote: Look deep into nature, and then you will understand everything better.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Look not mournfully into the past, it comes not back again. Wisely improve the present, it is thine. Go forth to meet the shadowy future without fear and with a manly heart.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Look to the future, because that is where you'll spend the rest of your life.
author: George Burns

quote: Look up, laugh loud, talk big, keep the color in your cheek and the fire in your eye, adorn your person, maintain your health, your beauty and your animal spirits.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Look within. Within is the fountain of good, and it will ever bubble up, if thou wilt ever dig.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Look your best - who said love is blind?
author: Mae West

quote: Look, I don't want to wax philosophic, but I will say that if you're alive you've got to flap your arms and legs, you've got to jump around a lot, for life is the very opposite of death, and therefore you must at very least think noisy and colorfully, or you're not alive.
author: Mel Brooks

quote: Look, I worked with American Republican presidents and Democratic presidents, all of them, and each of them has shown a deep and profound friendship to Israel, you know? I can't remember anybody who was in that sense negative as far as Israel is concerned.
author: Shimon Peres

quote: Look, architecture has a lot of places to hide behind, a lot of excuses. 'The client made me do this.' 'The city made me do this.' 'Oh, the budget.' I don't believe that anymore.
author: Frank Gehry

quote: Look, people have an image of Italians. When I go somewhere in the world, I don't care where it is, when they look at me it's not about my intelligence. It's who can I beat up.
author: Danny Aiello

quote: Look, there's no metaphysics on earth like chocolates.
author: Fernando Pessoa

quote: Looking after my health today gives me a better hope for tomorrow.
author: Anne Wilson Schaef

quote: Lord save us all from a hope tree that has lost the faculty of putting out blossoms.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Lord, Lord, how subject we old men are to this vice of lying!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Lord, give us the wisdom to utter words that are gentle and tender, for tomorrow we may have to eat them.
author: Mo Udall

quote: Lord, grant that I might not so much seek to be loved as to love.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: Lord, make me an instrument of thy peace. Where there is hatred, let me sow love.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: Los Angeles gives one the feeling of the future more strongly than any city I know of. A bad future, too, like something out of Fritz Lang's feeble imagination.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Los Angeles was an impression of failure, of disappointment, of despair, and of oddly makeshift lives. This is California? I thought.
author: Joseph Barbera

quote: Lose not yourself in a far off time, seize the moment that is thine.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Losing an illusion makes you wiser than finding a truth.
author: Ludwig Borne

quote: Loss and possession, death and life are one, There falls no shadow where there shines no sun.
author: Hilaire Belloc

quote: Loss is nothing else but change, and change is Nature's delight.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Loss means losing what was We want to change but we don't want to lose. Without time for loss, we don't have time for soul.
author: James Hillman

quote: Loss of hope rather than loss of life is what decides the issues of war. But helplessness induces hopelessness.
author: B. H. Liddell Hart

quote: Lost time is never found again.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Lost wealth may be replaced by industry, lost knowledge by study, lost health by temperance or medicine, but lost time is gone forever.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Loud peace propaganda makes war seem imminent.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Love all, trust a few, do wrong to none.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Love alone could waken love.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Love alone is capable of uniting living beings in such a way as to complete and fulfill them, for it alone takes them and joins them by what is deepest in themselves.
author: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quote: Love always creates, it never destroys. In this lie's man's only promise.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Love and business and family and religion and art and patriotism are nothing but shadows of words when a man's starving!
author: O. Henry

quote: Love and desire are the spirit's wings to great deeds.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Love and friendship exclude each other.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Love and war are the same thing, and stratagems and policy are as allowable in the one as in the other.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Love and work are the cornerstones of our humanness.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Love and work... work and love, that's all there is.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Love before marriage is absolutely necessary.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Love begins at home, and it is not how much we do... but how much love we put in that action.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Love begins by taking care of the closest ones - the ones at home.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Love between man and man is impossible because there must not be sexual intercourse and friendship between man and woman is impossible because there must be sexual intercourse.
author: James Joyce

quote: Love built on beauty, soon as beauty, dies.
author: John Donne

quote: Love can do much, but duty more.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Love cannot endure indifference. It needs to be wanted. Like a lamp, it needs to be fed out of the oil of another's heart, or its flame burns low.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Love cannot express the idea of music, while music may give an idea of love.
author: Hector Berlioz

quote: Love casts out fear, but we have to get over the fear in order to get close enough to love them.
author: Dorothy Day

quote: Love ceases to be a pleasure when it ceases to be a secret.
author: Aphra Behn

quote: Love comes when manipulation stops when you think more about the other person than about his or her reactions to you. When you dare to reveal yourself fully. When you dare to be vulnerable.
author: Joyce Brothers

quote: Love conquers all things except poverty and toothache.
author: Mae West

quote: Love conquers all.
author: Virgil

quote: Love consists in giving without getting in return in giving what is not owed, what is not due the other. That's why true love is never based, as associations for utility or pleasure are, on a fair exchange.
author: Mortimer Adler

quote: Love consists in this, that two solitudes protect and touch and greet each other.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: Love demands infinitely less than friendship.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Love does not alter the beloved, it alters itself.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Love does not claim possession, but gives freedom.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Love does not consist in gazing at each other, but in looking outward together in the same direction.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: Love does not dominate it cultivates.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Love doesn't grow on trees like apples in Eden - it's something you have to make. And you must use your imagination too.
author: Joyce Cary

quote: Love grows more tremendously full, swift, poignant, as the years multiply.
author: Zane Grey

quote: Love has always been the most important business in my life, I should say the only one.
author: Stendhal

quote: Love has features which pierce all hearts, he wears a bandage which conceals the faults of those beloved. He has wings, he comes quickly and flies away the same.
author: Voltaire

quote: Love has its place, as does hate. Peace has its place, as does war. Mercy has its place, as do cruelty and revenge.
author: Meir Kahane

quote: Love has nothing to do with what you are expecting to get - only with what you are expecting to give - which is everything.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Love implies anger. The man who is angered by nothing cares about nothing.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Love is a better teacher than duty.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Love is a canvas furnished by nature and embroidered by imagination.
author: Voltaire

quote: Love is a friendship set to music.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Love is a fruit in season at all times, and within reach of every hand.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Love is a game that two can play and both win.
author: Eva Gabor

quote: Love is a gross exaggeration of the difference between one person and everybody else.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Love is a hole in the heart.
author: Ben Hecht

quote: Love is a portion of the soul itself, and it is of the same nature as the celestial breathing of the atmosphere of paradise.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Love is a serious mental disease.
author: Plato

quote: Love is a smoke made with the fume of sighs.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Love is a springtime plant that perfumes everything with its hope, even the ruins to which it clings.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Love is a symbol of eternity. It wipes out all sense of time, destroying all memory of a beginning and all fear of an end.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: Love is all we have, the only way that each can help the other.
author: Euripides

quote: Love is always being given where it is not required.
author: E. M. Forster
