quote: Love is always bestowed as a gift - freely, willingly and without expectation. We don't love to be loved we love to love.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Love is always open arms. If you close your arms about love you will find that you are left holding only yourself.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Love is an act of endless forgiveness, a tender look which becomes a habit.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Love is an attempt at penetrating another being, but it can only succeed if the surrender is mutual.
author: Octavio Paz

quote: Love is an emotion experienced by the many and enjoyed by the few.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Love is an emotion that is based on an opinion of women that is impossible for those who have had any experience with them.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Love is an endless mystery, for it has nothing else to explain it.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Love is an energy which exists of itself. It is its own value.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Love is anterior to life, posterior to death, initial of creation, and the exponent of breath.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Love is being stupid together.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Love is blind friendship closes its eyes.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Love is blind.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: Love is by far bigger than the government can ever be.
author: Jesse Ventura

quote: Love is composed of a single soul inhabiting two bodies.
author: Aristotle

quote: Love is easy, and I love writing. You can't resist love. You get an idea, someone says something, and you're in love.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Love is flower like Friendship is like a sheltering tree.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Love is life. And if you miss love, you miss life.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Love is like a beautiful flower which I may not touch, but whose fragrance makes the garden a place of delight just the same.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Love is like a faucet, it turns off and on.
author: Billie Holiday

quote: Love is like a virus. It can happen to anybody at any time.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Love is like the wild rose-briar Friendship like the holly-tree. The holly is dark when the rose-briar blooms, but which will bloom most constantly?
author: Emily Bronte

quote: Love is like war: easy to begin but very hard to stop.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Love is love's reward.
author: John Dryden

quote: Love is moral even without legal marriage, but marriage is immoral without love.
author: Ellen Key

quote: Love is my religion - I could die for it.
author: John Keats

quote: Love is never lost. If not reciprocated, it will flow back and soften and purify the heart.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Love is not a feeling of happiness. Love is a willingness to sacrifice.
author: Michael Novak

quote: Love is not a mere impulse, it must contain truth, which is law.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Love is not consolation. It is light.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Love is not love that alters when it alteration finds.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Love is not weakness. It is strong. Only the sacrament of marriage can contain it.
author: Boris Pasternak

quote: Love is often nothing but a favorable exchange between two people who get the most of what they can expect, considering their value on the personality market.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Love is often the fruit of marriage.
author: Moliere

quote: Love is only a dirty trick played on us to achieve continuation of the species.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Love is rarer than genius itself. And friendship is rarer than love.
author: Charles Peguy

quote: Love is something far more than desire for sexual intercourse it is the principal means of escape from the loneliness which afflicts most men and women throughout the greater part of their lives.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Love is space and time measured by the heart.
author: Marcel Proust

quote: Love is staying up all night with a sick child - or a healthy adult.
author: David Frost

quote: Love is supreme and unconditional like is nice but limited.
author: Duke Ellington

quote: Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own... Jealousy is a disease, love is a healthy condition. The immature mind often mistakes one for the other, or assumes that the greater the love, the greater the jealousy.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Love is that splendid triggering of human vitality the supreme activity which nature affords anyone for going out of himself toward someone else.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Love is the answer to everything. It's the only reason to do anything. If you don't write stories you love, you'll never make it. If you don't write stories that other people love, you'll never make it.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Love is the attempt to form a friendship inspired by beauty.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Love is the beauty of the soul.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Love is the delightful interval between meeting a beautiful girl and discovering that she looks like a haddock.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Love is the delusion that one woman differs from another.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Love is the expression of one's values, the greatest reward you can earn for the moral qualities you have achieved in your character and person, the emotional price paid by one man for the joy he receives from the virtues of another.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Love is the great miracle cure. Loving ourselves works miracles in our lives.
author: Louise L. Hay

quote: Love is the greatest refreshment in life.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Love is the joy of the good, the wonder of the wise, the amazement of the Gods.
author: Plato

quote: Love is the magician that pulls man out of his own hat.
author: Ben Hecht

quote: Love is the most difficult and dangerous form of courage. Courage is the most desperate, admirable and noble kind of love.
author: Delmore Schwartz

quote: Love is the most important thing in the world. Hate, we should remove from the dictionary.
author: John Wooden

quote: Love is the only force capable of transforming an enemy into friend.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Love is the only gold.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Love is the only reality and it is not a mere sentiment. It is the ultimate truth that lies at the heart of creation.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Love is the only sane and satisfactory answer to the problem of human existence.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Love is the poetry of the senses.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Love is the power to see similarity in the dissimilar.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: Love is the river of life in the world.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Love is the triumph of imagination over intelligence.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Love is the whole history of a woman's life, it is but an episode in a man's.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: Love is the wisdom of the fool and the folly of the wise.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Love is too young to know what conscience is.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Love is union with somebody, or something, outside oneself, under the condition of retaining the separateness and integrity of one's own self.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Love is what you've been through with somebody.
author: James Thurber

quote: Love is when he gives you a piece of your soul, that you never knew was missing.
author: Torquato Tasso

quote: Love is when the desire to be desired takes you so badly that you feel you could die of it.
author: Henri de Toulouse-Lautrec

quote: Love is when you meet someone who tells you something new about yourself.
author: Andre Breton

quote: Love isn't an emotion or an instinct - it's an art.
author: Mae West

quote: Love isn't something you find. Love is something that finds you.
author: Loretta Young

quote: Love knows not distance it hath no continent its eyes are for the stars.
author: Gilbert Parker

quote: Love looks through a telescope envy, through a microscope.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Love makes a subtle man out of a crude one, it gives eloquence to the mute, it gives courage the cowardly and makes the idle quick and sharp.
author: Juan Ruiz

quote: Love makes your soul crawl out from its hiding place.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: Love many things, for therein lies the true strength, and whosoever loves much performs much, and can accomplish much, and what is done in love is done well.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote: Love matches, so called, have illusion for their father and need for their mother.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Love may be or it may not, but where it is, it ought to reveal itself in its immensity.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Love means not ever having to say you're sorry.
author: Erich Segal

quote: Love means to love that which is unlovable or it is no virtue at all.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish it's source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings.
author: Anais Nin

quote: Love never dies of starvation, but often of indigestion.
author: Ninon de L'Enclos

quote: Love of beauty is taste. The creation of beauty is art.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Love of man for woman - love of woman for man. That's the nature, the meaning, the best of life itself.
author: Zane Grey

quote: Love of our neighbour, then, has just the same respect to, is no more distant from, self-love, than hatred of our neighbour, or than love or hatred of anything else.
author: Joseph Butler

quote: Love recognizes no barriers. It jumps hurdles, leaps fences, penetrates walls to arrive at its destination full of hope.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Love seeketh not itself to please, nor for itself hath any care, but for another gives its ease, and builds a Heaven in Hell's despair.
author: William Blake

quote: Love shall be our token love be yours and love be mine.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: Love sought is good, but given unsought, is better.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Love takes up where knowledge leaves off.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Love the giver more than the gift.
author: Brigham Young

quote: Love thy neighbor - and if he happens to be tall, debonair and devastating, it will be that much easier.
author: Mae West

quote: Love to faults is always blind, always is to joy inclined. Lawless, winged, and unconfined, and breaks all chains from every mind.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Love turns, with a little indulgence, to indifference or disgust hatred alone is immortal.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Love will find a way through paths where wolves fear to prey.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Love you will find only where you may show yourself weak without provoking strength.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Love, friendship and respect do not unite people as much as a common hatred for something.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Love, hope, fear, faith - these make humanity These are its sign and note and character.
author: Robert Browning

quote: Love, it has been said, flows downward. The love of parents for their children has always been far more powerful than that of children for their parents and who among the sons of men ever loved God with a thousandth part of the love which God has manifested to us?
author: Augustus Hare

quote: Love, with very young people, is a heartless business. We drink at that age from thirst, or to get drunk it is only later in life that we occupy ourselves with the individuality of our wine.
author: Isak Dinesen

quote: Love, work, and knowledge are the wellsprings of our lives, they should also govern it.
author: Wilhelm Reich

quote: Love. Fall in love and stay in love. Write only what you love, and love what you write. The key word is love. You have to get up in the morning and write something you love, something to live for.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Lovers have a right to betray you... friends don't.
author: Judy Holliday

quote: Lovers may be - and indeed generally are - enemies, but they never can be friends, because there must always be a spice of jealousy and a something of Self in all their speculations.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Lovers may be and indeed generally are enemies, but they never can be friends, because there must always be a spice of jealousy and a something of Self in all their speculations.
author: George Byron

quote: Lovers who love truly do not write down their happiness.
author: Anatole France

quote: Loving a child doesn't mean giving in to all his whims to love him is to bring out the best in him, to teach him to love what is difficult.
author: Nadia Boulanger

quote: Loyalty and devotion lead to bravery. Bravery leads to the spirit of self-sacrifice. The spirit of self-sacrifice creates trust in the power of love.
author: Morihei Ueshiba

quote: Loyalty to the country always. Loyalty to the government when it deserves it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Luck is a dividend of sweat. The more you sweat, the luckier you get.
author: Ray Kroc

quote: Luck is everything... My good luck in life was to be a really frightened person. I'm fortunate to be a coward, to have a low threshold of fear, because a hero couldn't make a good suspense film.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: Luck is not chance, it's toil fortune's expensive smile is earned.
author: Emily Dickinson

quote: Luck is not something you can mention in the presence of self-made men.
author: E. B. White

quote: Luck is the residue of design.
author: Branch Rickey

quote: Luck? I don't know anything about luck. I've never banked on it and I'm afraid of people who do. Luck to me is something else: Hard work - and realizing what is opportunity and what isn't.
author: Lucille Ball

quote: Lucky individuals in each generation find technology appropriate to their needs.
author: Freeman Dyson

quote: Lucky that man whose children make his happiness in life and not his grief, the anguished disappointment of his hopes.
author: Euripedes

quote: Lust is to the other passions what the nervous fluid is to life it supports them all, lends strength to them all ambition, cruelty, avarice, revenge, are all founded on lust.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: Luxury is the wolf at the door and its fangs are the vanities and conceits germinated by success. When an artist learns this, he knows where the danger is.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Lying in bed would be an altogether perfect and supreme experience if only one had a colored pencil long enough to draw on the ceiling.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Machiavelli's teaching would hardly have stood the test of Parliamentary government, for public discussion demands at least the profession of good faith.
author: Lord Acton

quote: Machines are worshipped because they are beautiful and valued because they confer power they are hated because they are hideous and loathed because they impose slavery.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Madam, I have been looking for a person who disliked gravy all my life let us swear eternal friendship.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Madame, all stories, if continued far enough, end in death, and he is no true-story teller who would keep that from you.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Magic and new technology have always walked hand in hand - even back in the days of Robert Houdin.
author: David Copperfield

quote: Magicians lose the opportunity to experience a sense of wonder.
author: David Copperfield

quote: Magnanimity in politics is not seldom the truest wisdom and a great empire and little minds go ill together.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Mail your packages early so the post office can lose them in time for Christmas.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: Mainly what I learned from Buddy... was an attitude. He loved music, and he taught me that it shouldn't have any barriers to it.
author: Waylon Jennings

quote: Mainly, I thought of Barney as a kid. You can always look into the faces of kids and see what they're thinking, if they're happy or sad. That's what I tried to do with Barney.
author: Don Knotts

quote: Major success feels a bit like a coronation. Like I'd become a king. I was one of the most famous people in the world, loved and hated in equal measure. I couldn't see anything bad with it. It made me a happy person.
author: Larry Hagman

quote: Make big plans aim high in hope and work, remembering that a noble, logical diagram once recorded will not die.
author: Daniel Burnham

quote: Make crime pay. Become a lawyer.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Make it a habit to tell people thank you. To express your appreciation, sincerely and without the expectation of anything in return. Truly appreciate those around you, and you'll soon find many others around you. Truly appreciate life, and you'll find that you have more of it.
author: Ralph Marston

quote: Make no little plans they have no magic to stir men's blood.
author: Daniel Burnham

quote: Make sure you never, never argue at night. You just lose a good night's sleep, and you can't settle anything until morning anyway.
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
author: Epictetus

quote: Make the most of your regrets never smother your sorrow, but tend and cherish it till it comes to have a separate and integral interest. To regret deeply is to live afresh.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Make women rational creatures, and free citizens, and they will quickly become good wives - that is, if men do not neglect the duties of husbands and fathers.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: Making duplicate copies and computer printouts of things no one wanted even one of in the first place is giving America a new sense of purpose.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: Making money is art and working is art and good business is the best art.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: Making movies is just like betting on horses at the racetrack.
author: Maureen O'Hara

quote: Malcolm X made me very strong at a time I needed to understand what I was angry about. He had peace in his heart. He exerted a big influence on me.
author: Lena Horne

quote: Mama and Daddy King represent the best in manhood and womanhood, the best in a marriage, the kind of people we are trying to become.
author: Coretta Scott King

quote: Man - a creature made at the end of the week's work when God was tired.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Man alone is born crying, lives complaining, and dies disappointed.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Man always dies before he is fully born.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: Man approaches the unattainable truth through a succession of errors.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Man as an individual is a genius. But men in the mass form the headless monster, a great, brutish idiot that goes where prodded.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: Man becomes great exactly in the degree in which he works for the welfare of his fellow-men.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Man becomes man only by his intelligence, but he is man only by his heart.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Man becomes weak or ill by accident as a consequence of the lack of resources. Even the most severally ill patients must be treated with the aim of restoring their health.
author: Michael Servetus

quote: Man can certainly flee from God... but he cannot escape him. He can certainly hate God and be hateful to God, but he cannot change into its opposite the eternal love of God which triumphs even in his hate.
author: Karl Barth

quote: Man can embody truth but he cannot know it.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Man can never be a woman's equal in the spirit of selfless service with which nature has endowed her.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Man cannot be free if he does not know that he is subject to necessity, because his freedom is always won in his never wholly successful attempts to liberate himself from necessity.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Man cannot discover new oceans unless he has the courage to lose sight of the shore.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Man cannot live by bread alone he must have peanut butter.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Man cannot live by incompetence alone.
author: Charlotte Whitton

quote: Man does not control his own fate. The women in his life do that for him.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Man does not live by soap alone and hygiene, or even health, is not much good unless you can take a healthy view of it or, better still, feel a healthy indifference to it.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Man falls from the pursuit of the ideal of plan living and high thinking the moment he wants to multiply his daily wants. Man's happiness really lies in contentment.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Man finds it hard to get what he wants, because he does not want the best God finds it hard to give, because He would give the best, and man will not take it.
author: George MacDonald

quote: Man has but three events in his life: to be born, to live, and to die. He is not conscious of his birth, he suffers at his death and he forgets to live.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Man has demonstrated that he is master of everything except his own nature.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Man has gone long enough, or even too long, without being man enough to face the simple truth that the trouble with man is man.
author: James Thurber

quote: Man has lost the capacity to foresee and to forestall. He will end by destroying the earth.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Man has made use of his intelligence, he invented stupidity.
author: Remy de Gourmont

quote: Man has no Body distinct from his Soul for that called Body is a portion of Soul discerned by the five Senses, the chief inlets of Soul in this age.
author: William Blake

quote: Man has no right to kill his brother. It is no excuse that he does so in uniform: he only adds the infamy of servitude to the crime of murder.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Man has to awaken to wonder - and so perhaps do peoples. Science is a way of sending him to sleep again.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Man has two great spiritual needs. One is for forgiveness. The other is for goodness.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Man has, as it were, become a kind of prosthetic God. When he puts on all his auxiliary organs, he is truly magnificent but those organs have not grown on him and they still give him much trouble at times.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Man hath still either toys or care: But hath no root, nor to one place is tied, but ever restless and irregular, about this earth doth run and ride. He knows he hath a home, but scarce knows where He says it is so far, that he has quite forgot how to go there.
author: Henry Vaughan

quote: Man is a creative retrospection of nature upon itself.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Man is a creature who lives not upon bread alone, but primarily by catchwords.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Man is a credulous animal, and must believe something in the absence of good grounds for belief, he will be satisfied with bad ones.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Man is a genius when he is dreaming.
author: Akira Kurosawa

quote: Man is an artifact designed for space travel. He is not designed to remain in his present biologic state any more than a tadpole is designed to remain a tadpole.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Man is an exception, whatever else he is. If he is not the image of God, then he is a disease of the dust. If it is not true that a divine being fell, then we can only say that one of the animals went entirely off its head.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Man is an idea, and a precious small idea once he turns his back on love.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Man is an intelligence in servitude to his organs.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Man is born in a day, and he dies in a day, and the thing is easily over but to have a sick heart for three-fourths of one's lifetime is simply to have death renewed every morning and life at that price is not worth living.
author: Gilbert Parker

quote: Man is born passionate of body, but with an innate though secret tendency to the love of Good in his main-spring of Mind. But God help us all! It is at present a sad jar of atoms.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Man is but a reed, the most feeble thing in nature, but he is a thinking reed.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Man is by nature a political animal.
author: Aristotle

quote: Man is by nature competitive, combative, ambitious, jealous, envious, and vengeful.
author: Arthur Keith

quote: Man is fond of counting his troubles, but he does not count his joys. If he counted them up as he ought to, he would see that every lot has enough happiness provided for it.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: Man is fully responsible for his nature and his choices.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Man is least himself when he talks in his own person. Give him a mask, and he will tell you the truth.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Man is not the creature of circumstances, circumstances are the creatures of men. We are free agents, and man is more powerful than matter.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Man is only great when he acts from passion.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Man is subject to innumerable pains and sorrows by the very condition of humanity, and yet, as if nature had not sown evils enough in life, we are continually adding grief to grief and aggravating the common calamity by our cruel treatment of one another.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Man is the most intelligent of the animals - and the most silly.
author: Diogenes

quote: Man is the religious animal. He is the only one that's got true religion, several of them.
author: Hal Holbrook

quote: Man is the unnatural animal, the rebel child of nature, and more and more does he turn himself against the harsh and fitful hand that reared him.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Man is unique not because he does science, and his is unique not because he does art, but because science and art equally are expressions of his marvelous plasticity of mind.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: Man is, properly speaking, based upon hope, he has no other possession but hope this world of his is emphatically the place of hope.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Man lives for science as well as bread.
author: William James

quote: Man masters nature not by force but by understanding. This is why science has succeeded where magic failed: because it has looked for no spell to cast over nature.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: Man must cease attributing his problems to his environment, and learn again to exercise his will - his personal responsibility in the realm of faith and morals.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Man must evolve for all human conflict a method which rejects revenge, aggression and retaliation. The foundation of such a method is love.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Man must feel the earth to know himself and recognize his values... God made life simple. It is man who complicates it.
author: Charles Lindbergh

quote: Man must search for what is right, and let happiness come on its own.
author: Johann Pestalozzi

quote: Man needs difficulties they are necessary for health.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Man needs, for his happiness, not only the enjoyment of this or that, but hope and enterprise and change.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Man seems to be capable of great virtues but not of small virtues capable of defying his torturer but not of keeping his temper.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Man seems to insist on ignoring the lessons available from history.
author: Norman Borlaug

quote: Man should forget his anger before he lies down to sleep.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Man should not try to avoid stress any more than he would shun food, love or exercise.
author: Hans Selye

quote: Man spends his life in reasoning on the past, in complaining of the present, in fearing future.
author: Antoine Rivarol

quote: Man tells his aspiration in his God but in his demon he shows his depth of experience.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: Man wants to live, but it is useless to hope that this desire will dictate all his actions.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Man was made at the end of the week's work when God was tired.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Man was nature's mistake she neglected to finish him and she has never ceased paying for her mistake.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Man will never be free until the last king is strangled with the entrails of the last priest.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Man will occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of the time he will pick himself up and continue on.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Man's greatness lies in his power of thought.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Man's loneliness is but his fear of life.
author: Eugene O'Neill

quote: Man's mind is like a store of idolatry and superstition so much so that if a man believes his own mind it is certain that he will forsake God and forge some idol in his own brain.
author: John Calvin

quote: Man's mind is so formed that it is far more susceptible to falsehood than to truth.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: Man's naked form belongs to no particular moment in history it is eternal, and can be looked upon with joy by the people of all ages.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: Man's nature is not essentially evil. Brute nature has been know to yield to the influence of love. You must never despair of human nature.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Man's only true happiness is to live in hope of something to be won by him. Reverence something to be worshipped by him, and love something to be cherished by him, forever.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Man's real life is happy, chiefly because he is ever expecting that it soon will be so.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Man's survival, from the time of Adam and Eve until the invention of agriculture, must have been precarious because of his inability to ensure his food supply.
author: Norman Borlaug

quote: Man's true nature being lost, everything becomes his nature as, his true good being lost, everything becomes his good.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Man's ultimate concern must be expressed symbolically, because symbolic language alone is able to express the ultimate.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Man, being reasonable, must get drunk the best of life is but intoxication.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Man, if I made one million dollars I would come in at six in the morning, sweep the stands, wash the uniforms, clean out the office, manage the team and play the games.
author: Duke Snider

quote: Man, unlike anything organic or inorganic in the universe, grows beyond his work, walks up the stairs of his concepts, emerges ahead of his accomplishments.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Managing is getting paid for home runs that someone else hits.
author: Casey Stengel

quote: Manifesting that order of poetry where we can at last grow up to that which we stored up as we grew.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: Mankind has probably done more damage to the Earth in the 20th century than in all of previous human history.
author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

quote: Mankind is considered (by the radical environmentalists) the lowest and the meanest of all species and is blamed for everything.
author: Dixie Lee Ray

quote: Mankind is made great or little by its own will.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Mankind is not likely to salvage civilization unless he can evolve a system of good and evil which is independent of heaven and hell.
author: George Orwell

quote: Mankind will never win lasting peace so long as men use their full resources only in tasks of war. While we are yet at peace, let us mobilize the potentialities, particularly the moral and spiritual potentialities, which we usually reserve for war.
author: John Foster Dulles

quote: Mankind, when left to themselves, are unfit for their own government.
author: George Washington

quote: Manners are a sensitive awareness of the feelings of others. If you have that awareness, you have good manners, no matter what fork you use.
author: Emily Post

quote: Manners are like the shadows of virtues, they are the momentary display of those qualities which our fellow creatures love and respect.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Manners are love in a cool climate.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: Manners require time, and nothing is more vulgar than haste.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Many a genius has been slow of growth. Oaks that flourish for a thousand years do not spring up into beauty like a reed.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: Many a good hanging prevents a bad marriage.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Many a happiness in life, as many a disaster, can be due to chance, but the peace within us can never be governed by chance.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Many a man curses the rain that falls upon his head, and knows not that it brings abundance to drive away the hunger.
author: Saint Basil

quote: Many a man fails as an original thinker simply because his memory it too good.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Many a man will have the courage to die gallantly, but will not have the courage to say, or even to think, that the cause for which he is asked to die is an unworthy one.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Many a man's strength is in opposition, and when he faileth, he grows out of use.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Many a person has held close, throughout their entire lives, two friends that always remained strange to one another, because one of them attracted by virtue of similarity, the other by difference.
author: Emil Ludwig

quote: Many a trip continues long after movement in time and space have ceased.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Many are needed to plant and water what has been planted now that the faith has spread so far and there are so many people... No matter who plants or waters, God gives no harvest unless what is planted is the faith of Peter and unless he agrees to his teachings.
author: Thomas Becket

quote: Many attempts have been made by writers on art and poetry to define beauty in the abstract, to express it in the most general terms, to find some universal formula for it.
author: Walter Pater

quote: Many baseball fans look upon an umpire as a sort of necessary evil to the luxury of baseball, like the odor that follows an automobile.
author: Christy Mathewson

quote: Many difficulties which nature throws in our way, may be smoothed away by the exercise of intelligence.
author: Titus Livius

quote: Many foxes grow gray but few grow good.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Many great actions are committed in small struggles.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Many have left their families to defend our freedom. We salute their bravery we express our appreciation and support to their families. And we pray for their safe return.
author: Bob Taft

quote: Many have said of Alchemy, that it is for the making of gold and silver. For me such is not the aim, but to consider only what virtue and power may lie in medicines.
author: Paracelsus

quote: Many highly intelligent people are poor thinkers. Many people of average intelligence are skilled thinkers. The power of a car is separate from the way the car is driven.
author: Edward de Bono

quote: Many individuals are doing what they can. But real success can only come if there is a change in our societies and in our economics and in our politics.
author: David Attenborough

quote: Many intelligence reports in war are contradictory even more are false, and most are uncertain.
author: Karl Von Clausewitz

quote: Many men are deeply moved by the mere semblance of suffering in a woman they take the look of pain for a sign of constancy or of love.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Many men go fishing all of their lives without knowing that it is not fish they are after.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Many men have been capable of doing a wise thing, more a cunning thing, but very few a generous thing.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Many of the artists who have represented Negro life have seen only the comic, ludicrous side of it, and have lacked sympathy with and appreciation for the warm big heart that dwells within such a rough exterior.
author: Henry Ossawa Tanner

quote: Many of the insights of the saint stem from their experience as sinners.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Many of us believe that we need health care reform. That being said - Americans felt like they weren't being listened to. There were a lot of people across the political spectrum who said we don't want a one-size-fits-all healthcare plan.
author: Timothy Griffin

quote: Many people around the President have sizeable egos before entering government, some with good reason. Their new positions will do little to moderate their egos.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Many people believe that they are attracted by God, or by Nature, when they are only repelled by man.
author: William Ralph Inge

quote: Many people don't understand how disciplined you have to be to play jazz... And that is really the idea of democracy - freedom within the Constitution or discipline. You don't just get out there and do anything you want.
author: Dave Brubeck

quote: Many people know so little about what is beyond their short range of experience. They look within themselves - and find nothing! Therefore they conclude that there is nothing outside themselves either.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Many people mistake our work for our vocation. Our vocation is the love of Jesus.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Many people submit to excessive appetites without realizing that they do not need to eat so much food.
author: Kate Smith

quote: Many people take no care of their money till they come nearly to the end of it, and others do just the same with their time.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Many people think they want things, but they don't really have the strength, the discipline. They are weak. I believe that you get what you want if you want it badly enough.
author: Sophia Loren

quote: Many people want the government to protect the consumer. A much more urgent problem is to protect the consumer from the government.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: Many persons have a wrong idea of what constitutes true happiness. It is not attained through self-gratification but through fidelity to a worthy purpose.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Many politicians are in the habit of laying it down as a self-evident proposition that no people ought to be free till they are fit to use their freedom. The maxim is worthy of the fool in the old story who resolved not to go into the water till he had learned to swim.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

quote: Many societies have educated their male children on the simple device of teaching them not to be women.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Many soldiers returning from Iraq and Afghanistan suffer from serious, long-term, physical and mental health problems, due to their service. It is unconscionable to cut the already limited health care benefits available to these brave men and women.
author: Mark Dayton

quote: Many things difficult to design prove easy to performance.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Many who have had an opportunity of knowing any more about mathematics confuse it with arithmetic, and consider it an arid science. In reality, however, it is a science which requires a great amount of imagination.
author: Sofia Kovalevskaya

quote: Many who have spent a lifetime in it can tell us less of love than the child that lost a dog yesterday.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Many women long for what eludes them, and like not what is offered them.
author: Ovid

quote: Marriage and the creation of families has been an integral part of our society since its creation it should not be defined without the kind of involvement by the people which a constitutional process would require.
author: Robert Foster Bennett

quote: Marriage brings one into fatal connection with custom and tradition, and traditions and customs are like the wind and weather, altogether incalculable.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Marriage destroyed my relationship with two wonderful men.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Marriage is a bribe to make the housekeeper think she's a householder.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Marriage is a coming together for better or for worse, hopefully enduring, and intimate to the degree of being sacred.
author: William O. Douglas

quote: Marriage is a gamble, let's be honest.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Marriage is a great institution, but I'm not ready for an institution.
author: Mae West

quote: Marriage is a great institution.
author: Elizabeth Taylor

quote: Marriage is a reflection of your life in general: how you treat people, how you argue, how secure you are in your own thoughts. How vehemently do you argue your point of view? With what disdain do you view the other's point of view?
author: William Shatner

quote: Marriage is a series of desperate arguments people feel passionately about.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Marriage is a very good thing, but I think it's a mistake to make a habit out of it.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Marriage is a wonderful institution, but who wants to live in an institution?
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Marriage is a wonderful institution, but who would want to live in an institution?
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Marriage is about the most expensive way for the average man to get laundry done.
author: Burt Reynolds

quote: Marriage is an adventure, like going to war.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Marriage is an alliance entered into by a man who can't sleep with the window shut, and a woman who can't sleep with the window open.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Marriage is an attempt to solve problems together which you didn't even have when you were on your own.
author: Eddie Cantor

quote: Marriage is for women the commonest mode of livelihood, and the total amount of undesired sex endured by women is probably greater in marriage than in prostitution.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Marriage is good enough for the lower classes: they have facilities for desertion that are denied to us.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Marriage is good for those who are afraid to sleep alone at night.
author: St. Jerome

quote: Marriage is like a cage one sees the birds outside desperate to get in, and those inside equally desperate to get out.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Marriage is like a formality for me.
author: David Copperfield

quote: Marriage is like life - it is a field of battle, not a bed of roses.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Marriage is like paying an endless visit in your worst clothes.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: Marriage is like putting your hand into a bag of snakes in the hope of pulling out an eel.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Marriage is like wine. It is not be properly judged until the second glass.
author: Douglas William Jerrold

quote: Marriage is miserable unless you find the right person that is your soulmate and that takes a lot of looking.
author: Marvin Gaye

quote: Marriage is nature's way of keeping us from fighting with strangers.
author: Alan King

quote: Marriage is neither heaven nor hell, it is simply purgatory.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Marriage is not just spiritual communion, it is also remembering to take out the trash.
author: Joyce Brothers

quote: Marriage is one long conversation, chequered by disputes.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Marriage is popular because it combines the maximum of temptation with the maximum of opportunity.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Marriage is the death of hope.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Marriage is the grave or tomb of wit.
author: Margaret Cavendish

quote: Marriage is the highest state of friendship. If happy, it lessens our cares by dividing them, at the same time that it doubles our pleasures by mutual participation.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Marriage is the most natural state of man, and... the state in which you will find solid happiness.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Marriage is the torment of one, the felicity of two, the strife and enmity of three.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Marriage is this grand madness, and I think if people knew that, they would perhaps take it more seriously.
author: Bono

quote: Marriage is too interesting an experiment to be tried only once.
author: Eva Gabor

quote: Marriage may be the closest thing to Heaven or Hell any of us will know on this earth.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Marriage must be a relation either of sympathy or of conquest.
author: George Eliot

quote: Marriage must incessantly contend with a monster that devours everything: familiarity.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Marriage resembles a pair of shears, so joined that they cannot be separated often moving in opposite directions, yet always punishing anyone who comes between them.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Marriage to Fernando offered shelter and security, but the shackle was the price I'd pay.
author: Esther Williams

quote: Marriage! Nothing else demands so much of a man.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Marriage, a market which has nothing free but the entrance.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: Marriage, even the best marriages are tough.
author: Jayne Meadows

quote: Marriage, it seems, confines every man to his proper rank.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: Marriage, like death, is a debt we owe to nature.
author: Julia Ward Howe

quote: Marriage, like money, is still with us and, like money, progressively devalued.
author: Robert Graves

quote: Marriage: A friendship recognized by the police.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Marriage: A word which should be pronounced 'mirage'.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Marriage: a ceremony in which rings are put on the finger of the lady and through the nose of the gentleman.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Marriages are made in heaven and consummated on Earth.
author: John Lyly

quote: Married and divorced, three beautiful daughters, two in college. The other one is 16, lives with her mom. I'm 46, I've worked for the Post Office for 18 years, seven facilities in three states.
author: Arthur Godfrey

quote: Married love between man and woman is bigger than oaths guarded by right of nature.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Married men live longer than single men. But married men are a lot more willing to die.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: Married people should not be quick to hear what is said by either when in ill humor.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Marrying for love may be a bit risky, but it is so honest that God can't help but smile on it.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Martin Luther King Jr. is remembered as our prince of peace, of civil rights. We owe him something major that will keep his memory alive.
author: Morgan Freeman

quote: Martin Luther King, Jr. didn't carry just a piece of cloth to symbolize his belief in racial equality he carried the American flag.
author: Adrian Cronauer

quote: Martyrdom is the only way a man can become famous without ability.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Martyrdom: The only way a man can become famous without ability.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Marvelous is the power which can be exercised, almost unconsciously, over a company, or an individual, or even upon a crowd by one person gifted with good temper, good digestion, good intellects, and good looks.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: Masterpieces are not single and solitary births they are the outcome of many years of thinking in common, of thinking by the body of the people, so that the experience of the mass is behind the single voice.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Material possessions, winning scores, and great reputations are meaningless in the eyes of the Lord, because He knows what we really are and that is all that matters.
author: John Wooden

quote: Materialism coarsens and petrifies everything, making everything vulgar, and every truth false.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Math is sometimes called the science of patterns.
author: Ronald Graham

quote: Mathematical science is in my opinion an indivisible whole, an organism whose vitality is conditioned upon the connection of its parts.
author: David Hilbert

quote: Mathematics is, as it were, a sensuous logic, and relates to philosophy as do the arts, music, and plastic art to poetry.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Mattresses! Beautiful! Let's go buy a couple of mattresses. Give 'em to people for their birthday.
author: Lawrence Tierney

quote: Maturity is only a short break in adolescence.
author: Jules Feiffer

quote: May He who is the Brahman of the Hindus, the Ahura-Mazda of the Zoroastrians, the Buddha of the Buddhists, the Jehovah of the Jews, the Father in Heaven of the Christians give strength to you to carry out your noble idea.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: May it not be that, just as we have to have faith in Him, God has to have faith in us and, considering the history of the human race so far, may it not be that 'faith' is even more difficult for Him than it is for us?
author: W. H. Auden

quote: May joy and good fellowship reign, and in this manner, may the Olympic Torch pursue its way through ages, increasing friendly understanding among nations, for the good of a humanity always more enthusiastic, more courageous and more pure.
author: Pierre de Coubertin

quote: May the same Almighty Goodness banish the accursed monster, war, from all lands, with her hated associates, rapine and insatiable ambition!
author: Daniel Boone

quote: May there always be peace, love and happiness in every house.
author: Islom Karimov

quote: May we be saved from evil thoughts and deed of enemies of world peace who find pleasure in creating havoc and perpetrating all forms of carnage.
author: Yahya Jammeh

quote: May we so love as never to have occasion to repent of our love!
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: May you live all the days of your life.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: May you live as long as you wish and love as long as you live.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: May your trails be crooked, winding, lonesome, dangerous, leading to the most amazing view. May your mountains rise into and above the clouds.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: Maybe Christmas, the Grinch thought, doesn't come from a store.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Maybe all one can do is hope to end up with the right regrets.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: Maybe if everybody in leadership was a woman, you might not get into the conflicts in the first place. But if you watch the women who have made it to the top, they haven't exactly been non-aggressive - including me.
author: Madeleine Albright

quote: Maybe nature is fundamentally ugly, chaotic and complicated. But if it's like that, then I want out.
author: Steven Weinberg

quote: Maybe there's a chance to get back to grown-up films. Anything that uses humor and dramatic values to deal with human emotions and gets down to what people are to people.
author: Robert Altman

quote: Maybe we can show government how to operate better as a result of better architecture. Eventually, I think Chicago will be the most beautiful great city left in the world.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Maybe you are the 'cool' generation If coolness means a capacity to stay calm and use your head in the service of ends passionately believed in, then it has my admiration.
author: Kingman Brewster, Jr.

quote: Measures must always in a progressive society be held superior to men, who are after all imperfect instruments, working for their fulfilment.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Mechanization best serves mediocrity.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Medicine is my lawful wife and literature my mistress when I get tired of one, I spend the night with the other.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: Medicine is not only a science it is also an art. It does not consist of compounding pills and plasters it deals with the very processes of life, which must be understood before they may be guided.
author: Paracelsus

quote: Medicine sometimes snatches away health, sometimes gives it.
author: Ovid

quote: Medicine to produce health must examine disease and music, to create harmony must investigate discord.
author: Plutarch

quote: Mediocre men often have the most acquired knowledge.
author: Claude Bernard

quote: Mediocre men work at their best men seeking excellence strive to do better.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Meditation here may think down hours to moments. Here the heart may give a useful lesson to the head and learning wiser grow without his books.
author: William Cowper

quote: Meetings are indispensable when you don't want to do anything.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Memories are like mulligatawny soup in a cheap restaurant. It is best not to stir them.
author: P. G. Wodehouse

quote: Memory is a great artist. For every man and for every woman it makes the recollection of his or her life a work of art and an unfaithful record.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Memory is the mother of all wisdom.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Men acquire a particular quality by constantly acting in a particular way.
author: Aristotle

quote: Men admire the man who can organize their wishes and thoughts in stone and wood and steel and brass.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Men always fall for frigid women because they put on the best show.
author: Fanny Brice

quote: Men always talk about the most important things to perfect strangers. In the perfect stranger we perceive man himself the image of a God is not disguised by resemblances to an uncle or doubts of wisdom of a mustache.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Men always want to be a woman's first love - women like to be a man's last romance.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Men and women are not born inconstant: they are made so by their early amorous experiences.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Men and women belong to different species and communications between them is still in its infancy.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Men and women have strengths that complement each other.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Men and women must be educated, in a great degree, by the opinions and manners of the society they live in.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: Men and women should stay apart, till their hearts grow gentle towards one another again.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Men and women were declared equal one morning and everybody could divorce each other by postcard.
author: Kate Millett

quote: Men and women who know the brutal reality of war, who know that war strips people of their very humanity, must unite in a new global partnership for peace.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Men are April when they woo, December when they wed. Maids are May when they are maids, but the sky changes when they are wives.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Men are apt to mistake the strength of their feeling for the strength of their argument. The heated mind resents the chill touch and relentless scrutiny of logic.
author: William E. Gladstone

quote: Men are beginning to realize that they are not individuals but persons in society, that man alone is weak and adrift, that he must seek strength in common action.
author: Dorothy Day

quote: Men are born ignorant, not stupid. They are made stupid by education.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Men are born to succeed, not to fail.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Men are but children of a larger growth, Our appetites as apt to change as theirs, And full as craving too, and full as vain.
author: Diane Arbus

quote: Men are by nature merely indifferent to one another but women are by nature enemies.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Men are convinced of your arguments, your sincerity, and the seriousness of your efforts only by your death.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Men are disturbed not by things, but by the view which they take of them.
author: Epictetus

quote: Men are freest when they are most unconscious of freedom. The shout is a rattling of chains, always was.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Men are governed by lines of intellect - women: by curves of emotion.
author: James Joyce

quote: Men are happy to be laughed at for their humor, but not for their folly.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Men are like the stars some generate their own light while others reflect the brilliance they receive.
author: Jose Marti

quote: Men are limited by the knowledge of their minds, the worth of their characters and the principles upon which they are building their lives.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Men are more easily governed through their vices than through their virtues.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Men are more moral than they think and far more immoral than they can imagine.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Men are moved by two levers only: fear and self interest.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Men are never really willing to die except for the sake of freedom: therefore they do not believe in dying completely.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Men are not prisoners of fate, but only prisoners of their own minds.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Men are only as good as their technical development allows them to be.
author: George Orwell

quote: Men are self-confident because they grow up identifying with super-heroes. Women have bad self-images because they grow up identifying with Barbie.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Men are so necessarily mad, that not to be mad would amount to another form of madness.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Men are so simple and so much inclined to obey immediate needs that a deceiver will never lack victims for his deceptions.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Men are so simple and yield so readily to the desires of the moment that he who will trick will always find another who will suffer to be tricked.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Men are so willing to respect anything that bores them.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Men are strong so long as they represent a strong idea they become powerless when they oppose it.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Men are swayed more by fear than by reverence.
author: Aristotle

quote: Men are the dreams of a shadow.
author: Pindar

quote: Men are what their mothers made them.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Men are wise in proportion, not to their experience, but to their capacity for experience.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Men at most differ as Heaven and Earth, but women, worst and best, as Heaven and Hell.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Men become accustomed to poison by degrees.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Men become much more attractive when they start looking older. But it doesn't do much for women, though we do have an advantage: make-up.
author: Bette Davis

quote: Men blaspheme what they do not know.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Men can only be happy when they do not assume that the object of life is happiness.
author: George Orwell

quote: Men cannot count, they do not know that two and two make four if women do not tell them so.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Men cannot not live by exchanging articles, but producing them. They live by work not trade.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Men create gods after their own image, not only with regard to their form but with regard to their mode of life.
author: Aristotle

quote: Men despise religion. They hate it and are afraid it may be true.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Men die in despair, while spirits die in ecstasy.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Men do change, and change comes like a little wind that ruffles the curtains at dawn, and it comes like the stealthy perfume of wildflowers hidden in the grass.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Men do less than they ought, unless they do all that they can.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Men do not accept their prophets and slay them, but they love their martyrs and worship those whom they have tortured to death.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: Men do not fail they give up trying.
author: Elihu Root

quote: Men do not learn much from the lessons of history and that is the most important of all the lessons of history.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Men do not understand books until they have a certain amount of life, or at any rate no man understands a deep book, until he has seen and lived at least part of its contents.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Men don't and can't live by exchanging articles, but by producing them. They don't live by trade, but by work. Give up that foolish and vain title of Trades Unions and take that of laborers Unions.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Men exist for the sake of one another.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Men fear death as children fear to go in the dark and as that natural fear in children is increased by tales, so is the other.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Men feel that cruelty to the poor is a kind of cruelty to animals. They never feel that it is an injustice to equals nay it is treachery to comrades.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Men for the sake of getting a living forget to live.
author: Margaret Fuller

quote: Men get laid, but women get screwed.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: Men get to be a mixture of the charming mannerisms of the women they have known.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: Men go abroad to wonder at the heights of mountains, at the huge waves of the sea, at the long courses of the rivers, at the vast compass of the ocean, at the circular motions of the stars, and they pass by themselves without wondering.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Men hate the individual whom they call avaricious only because nothing can be gained from him.
author: Voltaire

quote: Men have a much better time of it than women. For one thing, they marry later for another thing, they die earlier.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Men have a respect for scholarship and learning greatly out of proportion to the use they commonly serve.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Men have an extraordinarily erroneous opinion of their position in nature and the error is ineradicable.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: Men have become the tools of their tools.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Men have had every advantage of us in telling their own story. Education has been theirs in so much higher a degree the pen has been in their hands. I will not allow books to prove anything.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Men have looked upon the desert as barren land, the free holding of whoever chose but in fact each hill and valley in it had a man who was its acknowledged owner and would quickly assert the right of his family or clan to it, against aggression.
author: T. E. Lawrence

quote: Men have to do some awfully mean things to keep up their respectability.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Men in general are quick to believe that which they wish to be true.
author: Julius Caesar

quote: Men kick friendship around like a football, but it doesn't seem to crack. Women treat it like glass and it goes to pieces.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: Men like me are impossible until the day when they become necessary.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Men like me, who merely wish to establish political freedom, will in such circumstances lose all their influence, and others will get influence who may become dangerous to all established interests whatsoever.
author: Lajos Kossuth

quote: Men live by intervals of reason under the sovereignty of humor and passion.
author: Thomas Browne

quote: Men love to wonder, and that is the seed of science.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Men marry because they are tired women, because they are curious both are disappointed.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Men may change their climate, but they cannot change their nature. A man that goes out a fool cannot ride or sail himself into common sense.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Men may yearn for peace, cry for peace, and work for peace, but there will be no peace until they follow the path pointed out by the Living Christ. He is the true light of men's lives.
author: David O. McKay

quote: Men mourn for what they have lost women for what they ain't got.
author: Josh Billings

quote: Men must be governed by God or they will be ruled by tyrants.
author: William Penn

quote: Men must know their limitations.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: Men must live and create. Live to the point of tears.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Men must turn square corners when they deal with the Government.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: Men naturally despise those who court them, but respect those who do not give way to them.
author: Thucydides

quote: Men never cling to their dreams with such tenacity as at the moment when they are losing faith in them, and know it, but do not dare yet to confess it to themselves.
author: William Graham Sumner

quote: Men never do evil so completely and cheerfully as when they do it from religious conviction.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Men now monopolize the upper levels... depriving women of their rightful share of opportunities for incompetence.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Men occasionally stumble over the truth, but most of them pick themselves up and hurry off as if nothing had happened.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Men of age object too much, consult too long, adventure too little, repent too soon, and seldom drive business home to the full period, but content themselves with a mediocrity of success.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Men of genius are often dull and inert in society as the blazing meteor, when it descends to earth, is only a stone.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Men of genius sometimes accomplish most when they work the least, for they are thinking out inventions and forming in their minds the perfect idea that they subsequently express with their hands.
author: Giorgio Vasari

quote: Men of ill judgment ignore the good that lies within their hands, till they have lost it.
author: Sophocles

quote: Men of lofty genius when they are doing the least work are most active.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: Men of my age live in a state of continual desperation.
author: Vita Sackville-West

quote: Men often act knowingly against their interest.
author: David Hume

quote: Men often oppose a thing merely because they have had no agency in planning it, or because it may have been planned by those whom they dislike.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: Men often take their imagination for their heart and they believe they are converted as soon as they think of being converted.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Men ought either to be indulged or utterly destroyed, for if you merely offend them they take vengeance, but if you injure them greatly they are unable to retaliate, so that the injury done to a man ought to be such that vengeance cannot be feared.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Men reach their sexual peak at eighteen. Women reach theirs at thirty-five. Do you get the feeling that God is playing a practical joke?
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Men rise from one ambition to another: first, they seek to secure themselves against attack, and then they attack others.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Men seldom, or rather never for a length of time and deliberately, rebel against anything that does not deserve rebelling against.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Men should be bewailed at their birth, and not at their death.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: Men should be either treated generously or destroyed, because they take revenge for slight injuries - for heavy ones they cannot.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Men should pledge themselves to nothing for reflection makes a liar of their resolution.
author: Sophocles

quote: Men should think twice before making widow hood woman's only path to power.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Men show their character in nothing more clearly than what they think laughable.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Men shrink less from offending one who inspires love than one who inspires fear.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Men shut their doors against a setting sun.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Men speak of natural rights, but I challenge any one to show where in nature any rights existed or were recognized until there was established for their declaration and protection a duly promulgated body of corresponding laws.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Men take only their needs into consideration - never their abilities.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Men talk of killing time, while time quietly kills them.
author: Dion Boucicault

quote: Men tend to feel threatened women tend to feel guilty.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Men think about women. Women think about what men think about them.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: Men think highly of those who rise rapidly in the world whereas nothing rises quicker than dust, straw, and feathers.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Men tire themselves in pursuit of rest.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Men trust their ears less than their eyes.
author: Herodotus

quote: Men use thought only as authority for their injustice, and employ speech only to conceal their thoughts.
author: Voltaire

quote: Men was formed for society, and is neither capable of living alone, nor has the courage to do it.
author: William Blackstone

quote: Men were not intended to work with the accuracy of tools, to be precise and perfect in all their actions.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Men who are in earnest are not afraid of consequences.
author: Marcus Garvey

quote: Men who are unhappy, like men who sleep badly, are always proud of the fact.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Men who care passionately for women attach themselves at least as much to the temple and to the accessories of the cult as to their goddess herself.
author: Marguerite Yourcenar

quote: Men who consistently leave the toilet seat up secretly want women to get up to go the bathroom in the middle of the night and fall in.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Men who do things without being told draw the most wages.
author: Rodney Dangerfield

quote: Men who have a pierced ear are better prepared for marriage - they've experienced pain and bought jewelry.
author: Rita Rudner

quote: Men who live valiantly and die nobly have a strength and a courage from the eternal Father.
author: Josephus Daniels

quote: Men who think that a woman's past love affairs lessen her love for them are usually stupid and weak.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Men will bear many things from a kept mistress, which they would not bear from a wife.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Men would live exceedingly quiet if these two words, mine and thine, were taken away.
author: Anaxagoras

quote: Men! The only animal in the world to fear.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Men's actions are too strong for them. Show me a man who has acted, and who has not been the victim and slave of his action.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Men's ideas are the most direct emanations of their material state.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Men's indignation, it seems, is more excited by legal wrong than by violent wrong the first looks like being cheated by an equal, the second like being compelled by a superior.
author: Thucydides

quote: Men's need to dominate women may be based in their own sense of marginality or emptiness we do not know its root, and men are making no effort to discover it.
author: Marilyn French

quote: Men's vows are women's traitors!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Men, as well as women, are much oftener led by their hearts than by their understandings.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Men, even when alone, lighten their labors by song, however rude it may be.
author: Quintilian

quote: Men, their rights, and nothing more women, their rights, and nothing less.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Men, who are rogues individually, are in the mass very honorable people.
author: Charles de Secondat

quote: Mencius said that human nature is good. I disagree with that.
author: Xun Zi

quote: Mendacity is a system that we live in. Liquor is one way out an death's the other.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: Mental fight means thinking against the current, not with it. It is our business to puncture gas bags and discover the seeds of truth.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Mere goodness can achieve little against the power of nature.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: Mere longevity is a good thing for those who watch Life from the side lines. For those who play the game, an hour may be a year, a single day's work an achievement for eternity.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: Mere parsimony is not economy. Expense, and great expense, may be an essential part in true economy.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Method is more important than strength, when you wish to control your enemies. By dropping golden beads near a snake, a crow once managed To have a passer-by kill the snake for the beads.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Miami Beach is where neon goes to die.
author: Lenny Bruce

quote: Michael Palin decided to give up on his considerable comedy talents to make those dreadfully tedious travel shows. Have you ever tried to watch one?
author: John Cleese

quote: Michael has a connection with children, just like Mickey Mouse does, and he brings happiness to them, and joy.
author: Jermaine Jackson

quote: Mickey Mouse popped out of my mind onto a drawing pad 20 years ago on a train ride from Manhattan to Hollywood at a time when business fortunes of my brother Roy and myself were at lowest ebb and disaster seemed right around the corner.
author: Walt Disney

quote: Microsoft is engaging in unlawful predatory practices that go well beyond the scope of fair competition.
author: Orrin Hatch

quote: Middle age is when your age starts to show around your middle.
author: Bob Hope

quote: Middle age is youth without levity, and age without decay.
author: Doris Day

quote: Middle age occurs when you are too young to take up golf and too old to rush up to the net.
author: Franklin P. Adams

quote: Middle-aged women have greater stability, they are more loyal, and their capacity for steady work is greater than that of younger women.
author: Kate Smith

quote: Mighty proud I am that I am able to have a spare bed for my friends.
author: Samuel Pepys

quote: Military hardliners called me a 'security threat' for promoting peace in South Asia and for supporting a broad-based government in Afghanistan.
author: Benazir Bhutto

quote: Military intelligence is a contradiction in terms.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Military justice is to justice what military music is to music.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Military strength in reserve is better than military strength being reigned upon the other side including all of its innocent civilians.
author: Theodore C. Sorensen

quote: Miller didn't write Death of a Salesman. He released it. It was there inside him, waiting to be turned loose. That's the measure of its merit.
author: Elia Kazan

quote: Millions of men have lived to fight, build palaces and boundaries, shape destinies and societies but the compelling force of all times has been the force of originality and creation profoundly affecting the roots of human spirit.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: Millions saw the apple fall, but Newton was the one who asked why.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: Minds that are ill at ease are agitated by both hope and fear.
author: Ovid

quote: Ministry is the least important thing. You cannot not minister if you are in communion with God and live in community.
author: Henri Nouwen

quote: Miracles are not contrary to nature, but only contrary to what we know about nature.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Miracles do not, in fact, break the laws of nature.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Miracles, in the sense of phenomena we cannot explain, surround us on every hand: life itself is the miracle of miracles.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Mirth is the sweet wine of human life. It should be offered sparkling with zestful life unto God.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Mischief springs from the power which the moneyed interest derives from a paper currency which they are able to control, from the multitude of corporations with exclusive privileges... which are employed altogether for their benefit.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: Misery is the company of lawsuits.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: Mistakes are almost always of a sacred nature. Never try to correct them. On the contrary: rationalize them, understand them thoroughly. After that, it will be possible for you to sublimate them.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Mistakes are, after all, the foundations of truth, and if a man does not know what a thing is, it is at least an increase in knowledge if he knows what it is not.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Mixing one's wines may be a mistake, but old and new wisdom mix admirably.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Moderation has been called a virtue to limit the ambition of great men, and to console undistinguished people for their want of fortune and their lack of merit.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Moderation is a virtue only in those who are thought to have an alternative.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

quote: Modern Orthodoxy has a highly positive attitude toward the State of Israel. Our Ultra-Orthodox brethren recognize only the Holy Land, but not the state.
author: Norman Lamm

quote: Modern education has devoted itself to the teaching of impudence, and then we complain that we can no longer control our mobs.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Modern morality and manners suppress all natural instincts, keep people ignorant of the facts of nature and make them fighting drunk on bogey tales.
author: Aleister Crowley

quote: Modern poets talk against business, poor things, but all of us write for money. Beginners are subjected to trial by market.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Modern society, based as it is on the division of labor, can be preserved only under conditions of lasting peace.
author: Ludwig von Mises

quote: Modernity is the transient, the fleeting, the contingent it is one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immovable.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Modernity is the transitory, the fugitive, the contingent, which make up one half of art, the other being the eternal and the immutable. This transitory fugitive element, which is constantly changing, must not be despised or neglected.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Modernity signifies the transitory, the fugitive, the contingent, the half of art of which the other half is the eternal and the immutable.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Modernity, the child of the Enlightenment, failed when it became apparent that the good society cannot be achieved by unaided reason.
author: Robert Bork

quote: Mom and Pop were just a couple of kids when they got married. He was eighteen, she was sixteen and I was three.
author: Billie Holiday
