quote: Nearly all men can stand adversity, but if you want to test a man's character, give him power.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Nearly all the best things that came to me in life have been unexpected, unplanned by me.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Nearly all the powerful people of this age are unbelievers, the best of them in doubt and misery, the most in plodding hesitation, doing as well as they can, what practical work lies at hand.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Nearly everyone I met, worked with, or read about was my teacher, one way or another.
author: Loretta Young

quote: Neatness begets order but from order to taste there is the same difference as from taste to genius, or from love to friendship.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: Necessity does the work of courage.
author: Nicholas M. Butler

quote: Necessity is blind until it becomes conscious. Freedom is the consciousness of necessity.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Necessity never made a good bargain.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Necessity of action takes away the fear of the act, and makes bold resolution the favorite of fortune.
author: Francis Quarles

quote: Negro banks, as a rule, have failed because the people, taught that their own pioneers in business cannot function in this sphere, withdrew their deposits.
author: Carter G. Woodson

quote: Negroes - Sweet and docile, Meek, humble, and kind: Beware the day - They change their mind.
author: Langston Hughes

quote: Neither a lofty degree of intelligence nor imagination nor both together go to the making of genius. Love, love, love, that is the soul of genius.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

quote: Neither a man nor a crowd nor a nation can be trusted to act humanely or to think sanely under the influence of a great fear.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Neither comprehension nor learning can take place in an atmosphere of anxiety.
author: Rose Kennedy

quote: Neither current events nor history show that the majority rule, or ever did rule.
author: Jefferson Davis

quote: Neither money nor position can atone to me for low birth.
author: Anthony Trollope

quote: Neither should a ship rely on one small anchor, nor should life rest on a single hope.
author: Epictetus

quote: Neither soldiers nor money can defend a king but only friends won by good deeds, merit, and honesty.
author: Sallust

quote: Neither the life of an individual nor the history of a society can be understood without understanding both.
author: C. Wright Mills

quote: Neutrality is a negative word. It does not express what America ought to feel. We are not trying to keep out of trouble we are trying to preserve the foundations on which peace may be rebuilt.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Never Have Your Dog Stuffed is really advice to myself, a reminder to myself not to avoid change or uncertainty, but to go with it, to surf into change.
author: Alan Alda

quote: Never a lip is curved with pain that can't be kissed into smiles again.
author: Bret Harte

quote: Never a tear bedims the eye that time and patience will not dry.
author: Bret Harte

quote: Never again! I can see no reason for marriage - ever at all. I've had it. Three times is enough.
author: Ingrid Bergman

quote: Never allow a person to tell you no who doesn't have the power to say yes.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Never apologize for showing feeling. When you do so, you apologize for the truth.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Never argue at the dinner table, for the one who is not hungry always gets the best of the argument.
author: Voltaire

quote: Never be discouraged. If I were sunk in the lowest pits of Nova Scotia, with the Rocky Mountains piled on me, I would hang on, exercise faith, and keep up good courage, and I would come out on top.
author: Joseph Smith, Jr.

quote: Never bear more than one kind of trouble at a time. Some people bear three kinds of trouble - the ones they've had, the ones they have, and the ones they expect to have.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: Never believe anything in politics until it has been officially denied.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Never believe that a few caring people can't change the world. For, indeed, that's all who ever have.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Never call an accountant a credit to his profession a good accountant is a debit to his profession.
author: Charles Lyell

quote: Never complain and never explain.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Never continue in a job you don't enjoy. If you're happy in what you're doing, you'll like yourself, you'll have inner peace. And if you have that, along with physical health, you will have had more success than you could possibly have imagined.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: Never contract friendship with a man that is not better than thyself.
author: Confucius

quote: Never cut a tree down in the wintertime. Never make a negative decision in the low time. Never make your most important decisions when you are in your worst moods. Wait. Be patient. The storm will pass. The spring will come.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Never despair, but if you do, work on in despair.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Never does nature say one thing and wisdom another.
author: Juvenal

quote: Never doubt that a small group of thoughtful, committed citizens can change the world indeed, it's the only thing that ever has.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Never doubt that you can change history. You already have.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: Never dress down for the poor. They won't respect you for it. They want their First Lady to look like a million dollars.
author: Imelda Marcos

quote: Never esteem men on account of their riches or their station. Respect goodness, find it where you may.
author: William Cobbett

quote: Never fear: Thank Home, and Poetry, and the Force behind both.
author: Wilfred Owen

quote: Never floss with a stranger.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: Never forget that everything Hitler did in Germany was legal.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Never fret for an only son, the idea of failure will never occur to him.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Never get married in the morning - you never know who you might meet that night.
author: Paul Hornung

quote: Never give up, for that is just the place and time that the tide will turn.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: Never go on trips with anyone you do not love.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Never go to bed angry, stay up and fight.
author: William Congreve

quote: Never hurry. Take plenty of exercise. Always be cheerful. Take all the sleep you need. You may expect to be well.
author: James Freeman Clarke

quote: Never in the field of human conflict was so much owed by so many to so few.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Never in the history of fashion has so little material been raised so high to reveal so much that needs to be covered so badly.
author: Cecil Beaton

quote: Never let the fear of striking out get in your way.
author: Babe Ruth

quote: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Never lose an opportunity of seeing anything beautiful, for beauty is God's handwriting.
author: Charles Kingsley

quote: Never lose sight of the fact that all human felicity lies in man's imagination, and that he cannot think to attain it unless he heeds all his caprices. The most fortunate of persons is he who has the most means to satisfy his vagaries.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: Never make friends with people who are above or below you in status. Such friendships will never give you any happiness.
author: Chanakya

quote: Never make predictions, especially about the future.
author: Casey Stengel

quote: Never permit a dichotomy to rule your life, a dichotomy in which you hate what you do so you can have pleasure in your spare time. Look for a situation in which your work will give you as much happiness as your spare time.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Never raise your hand to your children - it leaves your midsection unprotected.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Never respect men merely for their riches, but rather for their philanthropy we do not value the sun for its height, but for its use.
author: Gamaliel Bailey

quote: Never say a humorous thing to a man who does not possess humor. He will always use it in evidence against you.
author: Herbert Beerbohm Tree

quote: Never seem more learned than the people you are with. Wear your learning like a pocket watch and keep it hidden. Do not pull it out to count the hours, but give the time when you are asked.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Never seem wiser, nor more learned, than the people you are with. Wear your learning, like your watch, in a private pocket: and do not merely pull it out and strike it merely to show that you have one.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Never spend your money before you have earned it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Never stand begging for that which you have the power to earn.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Never tell people how to do things. Tell them what to do and they will surprise you with their ingenuity.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Never think that war, no matter how necessary, nor how justified, is not a crime.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Never throughout history has a man who lived a life of ease left a name worth remembering.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Never to lie is to have no lock on your door, you are never wholly alone.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Never trust anyone completely but God. Love people, but put your full trust only in God.
author: Lawrence Welk

quote: Never trust anyone who wants what you've got. Friend or no, envy is an overwhelming emotion.
author: Eubie Blake

quote: Never trust the artist. Trust the tale. The proper function of the critic is to save the tale from the artist who created it.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Never try to impress a woman, because if you do she'll expect you to keep up the standard for the rest of your life.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Never underestimate the power of human stupidity.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Never undertake anything for which you wouldn't have the courage to ask the blessings of heaven.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Never was anything great achieved without danger.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Never was it given to mortal man - To lie so boldly as we women can.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Never wear your best trousers when you go out to fight for freedom and truth.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Never work just for money or for power. They won't save your soul or help you sleep at night.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: Nevertheless most of the evergreen forests of the north must always remain the home of wild animals and trappers, a backward region in which it is easy for a great fur company to maintain a practical monopoly.
author: Ellsworth Huntington

quote: Nevertheless the passions, whether violent or not, should never be so expressed as to reach the point of causing disgust and music, even in situations of the greatest horror, should never be painful to the ear but should flatter and charm it, and thereby always remain music.
author: Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart

quote: Nevertheless, as is a frequent occurrence in science, a general hypothesis was constructed from a few specific instances of a phenomenon.
author: Sidney Altman

quote: Nevertheless, the number of farmers, small as well as large, who are adopting the new seeds and new technology is increasing very rapidly, and the increase in numbers during the past three years has been phenomenal.
author: Norman Borlaug

quote: Nevertheless, whether in occurrences lasting days, hours or mere minutes at a time, I have experienced happiness often, and have had brief encounters with it in my later years, even in old age.
author: Herman Hesse

quote: New England is the home of all that is good and noble with all her sternness and uncompromising opinions.
author: Ellen Henrietta Swallow Richards

quote: New Year's Day is every man's birthday.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: New Year's Resolution: To tolerate fools more gladly, provided this does not encourage them to take up more of my time.
author: James Agate

quote: New York City is a great monument to the power of money and greed... a race for rent.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: New discoveries in science will continue to create a thousand new frontiers for those who still would adventure.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: New needs need new techniques. And the modern artists have found new ways and new means of making their statements... the modern painter cannot express this age, the airplane, the atom bomb, the radio, in the old forms of the Renaissance or of any other past culture.
author: Jackson Pollock

quote: News reports don't change the world. Only facts change it, and those have already happened when we get the news.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: Newspaper people, once celebrated as founts of ribald humor and uncouth fun, have of late lost all their gaiety, and small wonder.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Newspapers are the second hand of history. This hand, however, is usually not only of inferior metal to the other hands, it also seldom works properly.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Next in importance to freedom and justice is popular education, without which neither freedom nor justice can be permanently maintained.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Next time I see you, remind me not to talk to you.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Next to God we are nothing. To God we are Everything.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Next to enjoying ourselves, the next greatest pleasure consists in preventing others from enjoying themselves, or, more generally, in the acquisition of power.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Next to power without honor, the most dangerous thing in the world is power without humor.
author: Eric Sevareid

quote: Next to religion, let your care be to promote justice.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Next to the love of God, the love of country is the best preventive of crime.
author: George Borrow

quote: Nice to be here? At my age it's nice to be anywhere.
author: George Burns

quote: Nigeria has had a complicated colonial history. My work has examined that part of our story extensively.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: Nine men in ten are would be suicides.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Nine tenths of education is encouragement.
author: Anatole France

quote: Nine times out of ten, in the arts as in life, there is actually no truth to be discovered there is only error to be exposed.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Nine-tenths of wisdom is being wise in time.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Ninety eight percent of the adults in this country are decent, hardworking, honest Americans. It's the other lousy two percent that get all the publicity. But then, we elected them.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: Ninety percent of leadership is the ability to communicate something people want.
author: Dianne Feinstein

quote: Ninety percent of the politicians give the other ten percent a bad reputation.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

quote: Ninety-nine per cent of the people in the world are fools and the rest of us are in great danger of contagion.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Nip the shoots of arbitrary power in the bud, is the only maxim which can ever preserve the liberties of any people.
author: John Quincy Adams

quote: Nixon was the most dishonest individual I have ever met in my life. He lied to his wife, his family, his friends, his colleagues in the Congress, lifetime members of his own political party, the American people and the world.
author: Barry Goldwater

quote: No Government can be long secure without a formidable Opposition.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: No Government has the moral authority to dismantle the universally understood meaning of marriage.
author: Keith O'Brien

quote: No account of the Renaissance can be complete without some notice of the attempt made by certain Italian scholars of the fifteenth century to reconcile Christianity with the religion of ancient Greece.
author: Walter Pater

quote: No advance in wealth, no softening of manners, no reform or revolution has ever brought human equality a millimeter nearer.
author: George Orwell

quote: No amount of experimentation can ever prove me right a single experiment can prove me wrong.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: No amount of law enforcement can solve a problem that goes back to the family.
author: J. Edgar Hoover

quote: No amount of skillful invention can replace the essential element of imagination.
author: Edward Hopper

quote: No architect troubled to design houses that suited people who were to live in them, because that would have meant building a whole range of different houses. It was far cheaper and, above all, timesaving to make them identical.
author: Michael Ende

quote: No architecture is so haughty as that which is simple.
author: John Ruskin

quote: No art can be noble which is incapable of expressing thought, and no art is capable of expressing thought which does not change.
author: John Ruskin

quote: No bastard ever won a war by dying for his country. He won it by making the other poor dumb bastard die for his country.
author: George S. Patton

quote: No cause is left but the most ancient of all, the one, in fact, that from the beginning of our history has determined the very existence of politics, the cause of freedom versus tyranny.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: No change of circumstances can repair a defect of character.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: No complaint... is more common than that of a scarcity of money.
author: Adam Smith

quote: No country can act wisely simultaneously in every part of the globe at every moment of time.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

quote: No country in history ever sent mothers of toddlers off to fight enemy soldiers until the United States did this in the Iraq war.
author: Phyllis Schlafly

quote: No country in the history of the world has ever contributed more to humankind and accomplished more for its people in so brief a period of time as Israel has done since its relatively recent rebirth in 1948.
author: Alan Dershowitz

quote: No crime is so great as daring to excel.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: No disease that can be treated by diet should be treated with any other means.
author: Maimonides

quote: No distance of place or lapse of time can lessen the friendship of those who are thoroughly persuaded of each other's worth.
author: Robert Southey

quote: No doubt exists that all women are crazy it's only a question of degree.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: No emancipation without that of society.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: No emperor has the power to dictate to the heart.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: No enterprise can exist for itself alone. It ministers to some great need, it performs some great service, not for itself, but for others or failing therein, it ceases to be profitable and ceases to exist.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: No enterprise is more likely to succeed than one concealed from the enemy until it is ripe for execution.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: No evil can happen to a good man, either in life or after death.
author: Plato

quote: No experience is a cause of success or failure. We do not suffer from the shock of our experiences, so-called trauma - but we make out of them just what suits our purposes.
author: Alfred Adler

quote: No face which we can give to a matter will stead us so well at last as the truth. This alone wears well.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: No fathers or mothers think their own children ugly.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: No foreign policy - no matter how ingenious - has any chance of success if it is born in the minds of a few and carried in the hearts of none.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

quote: No further evidence is needed to show that 'mental illness' is not the name of a biological condition whose nature awaits to be elucidated, but is the name of a concept whose purpose is to obscure the obvious.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: No gentleman ever discusses any relationship with a lady.
author: Keith Miller

quote: No good deed goes unpunished.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: No good is ever done to society by the pictorial representation of its diseases.
author: John Ruskin

quote: No good opera plot can be sensible, for people do not sing when they are feeling sensible.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: No government can help the destinies of people who insist in putting sectional and class consciousness ahead of general weal.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: No government fights fascism to destroy it. When the bourgeoisie sees that power is slipping out of its hands, it brings up fascism to hold onto their privileges.
author: Buenaventura Durruti

quote: No government ought to be without censors and where the press is free no one ever will.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: No government ought to be without censors and where the press is free, no one ever will. Chance is the pseudonym of God when he did not want to sign.
author: Anatole France

quote: No great art has ever been made without the artist having known danger.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: No great artist ever sees things as they really are. If he did, he would cease to be an artist.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: No great deed is done by falterers who ask for certainty.
author: George Eliot

quote: No great idea in its beginning can ever be within the law. How can it be within the law? The law is stationary. The law is fixed. The law is a chariot wheel which binds us all regardless of conditions or place or time.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: No great intellectual thing was ever done by great effort.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: No great man ever complains of want of opportunity.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: No great man lives in vain. The history of the world is but the biography of great men.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: No great thing is created suddenly.
author: Epictetus

quote: No greater nor more affectionate honor can be conferred on an American than to have a public school named after him.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: No greater thing is created suddenly, any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig. If you tell me that you desire a fig, I answer you that there must be time. Let it first blossom, then bear fruit, then ripen.
author: Epictetus

quote: No group and no government can properly prescribe precisely what should constitute the body of knowledge with which true education is concerned.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: No harm comes to man from outside alone: dumbness is the objective spirit.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: No heirloom of humankind captures the past as do art and language.
author: Theodore Bikel

quote: No human being can really understand another, and no one can arrange another's happiness.
author: Graham Greene

quote: No human being will ever know the Truth, for even if they happen to say it by chance, they would not even known they had done so.
author: Xenophanes

quote: No human being, however great, or powerful, was ever so free as a fish.
author: John Ruskin

quote: No idea is so outlandish that it should not be considered with a searching but at the same time a steady eye.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: No illusion is more crucial than the illusion that great success and huge money buy you immunity from the common ills of mankind, such as cars that won't start.
author: Larry McMurtry

quote: No lie ever reaches old age.
author: Sophocles

quote: No longer shall I paint interiors with men reading and women knitting. I will paint living people who breathe and feel and suffer and love.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: No lover, if he be of good faith, and sincere, will deny he would prefer to see his mistress dead than unfaithful.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: No lying knight or lying priest ever prospered in any age, but especially not in the dark ones. Men prospered then only in following an openly declared purpose, and preaching candidly beloved and trusted creeds.
author: John Ruskin

quote: No man but a blockhead ever wrote except for money.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: No man can be a failure if he thinks he's a success If he thinks he is a winner, then he is.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: No man can call himself liberal, or radical, or even a conservative advocate of fair play, if his work depends in any way on the unpaid or underpaid labor of women at home, or in the office.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: No man can think clearly when his fists are clenched.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: No man chooses evil because it is evil he only mistakes it for happiness, the good he seeks.
author: Mary Wollstonecraft

quote: No man ever believes that the Bible means what it says: He is always convinced that it says what he means.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: No man ever got very high by pulling other people down. The intelligent merchant does not knock his competitors. The sensible worker does not work those who work with him. Don't knock your friends. Don't knock your enemies. Don't knock yourself.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: No man ever prayed heartily without learning something.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: No man goes before his time - unless the boss leaves early.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: No man has a good enough memory to be a successful liar.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: No man has any natural authority over his fellow men.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: No man has received from nature the right to command his fellow human beings.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: No man has the right to dictate what other men should perceive, create or produce, but all should be encouraged to reveal themselves, their perceptions and emotions, and to build confidence in the creative spirit.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: No man is excluded from calling upon God, the gate of salvation is set open unto all men: neither is there any other thing which keepeth us back from entering in, save only our own unbelief.
author: John Calvin

quote: No man is good enough to govern another man without the other's consent.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: No man is good enough to govern any woman without her consent.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: No man is great enough or wise enough for any of us to surrender our destiny to. The only way in which anyone can lead us is to restore to us the belief in our own guidance.
author: Henry Miller

quote: No man is regular in his attendance at the House of Commons until he is married.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: No man is so foolish but he may sometimes give another good counsel, and no man so wise that he may not easily err if he takes no other counsel than his own. He that is taught only by himself has a fool for a master.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: No man is truly great who is great only in his lifetime. The test of greatness is the page of history.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: No man is worth his salt who is not ready at all times to risk his well-being, to risk his body, to risk his life, in a great cause.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: No man knows till he has suffered from the night how sweet and dear to his heart and eye the morning can be.
author: Bram Stoker

quote: No man likes to have his intelligence or good faith questioned, especially if he has doubts about it himself.
author: Henry Adams

quote: No man really knows about other human beings. The best he can do is to suppose that they are like himself.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: No man should bring children into the world who is unwilling to persevere to the end in their nature and education.
author: Plato

quote: No man should marry until he has studied anatomy and dissected at least one woman.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: No man was ever great by imitation.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: No man was ever so completely skilled in the conduct of life, as not to receive new information from age and experience.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: No man was ever wise by chance.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: No man who worships education has got the best out of education... Without a gentle contempt for education no man's education is complete.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: No man will be a sailor who has contrivance enough to get himself into a jail for being in a ship is being in a jail, with the chance of being drowned... a man in a jail has more room, better food, and commonly better company.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: No man will make a great leader who wants to do it all himself or get all the credit for doing it.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: No man's knowledge here can go beyond his experience.
author: John Locke

quote: No marriage can stand up under the strain of incessant association.
author: Johnny Weissmuller

quote: No matter how busy you are, you must take time to make the other person feel important.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: No matter how calmly you try to referee, parenting will eventually produce bizarre behavior, and I'm not talking about the kids. Their behavior is always normal.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: No matter how corrupt and unjust a convict may be, he loves fairness more than anything else. If the people placed over him are unfair, from year to year he lapses into an embittered state characterized by an extreme lack of faith.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: No matter how dull, or how mean, or how wise a man is, he feels that happiness is his indisputable right.
author: Helen Keller

quote: No matter how fast I could do it with the digital camera I don't think I would get the same thing out of it. The passion I have for formulating an idea stands alone. It is the important essence of what I do.
author: Kim Weston

quote: No matter how full a reservoir of maxims one may possess, and no matter how good one's sentiments may be, if one has not taken advantage of every concrete opportunity to act, one's character may remain entirely unaffected for the better.
author: William James

quote: No matter how much cats fight, there always seem to be plenty of kittens.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: No matter how old we become, we can still call them 'Holy Mother' and 'Father' and put a child-like trust in them.
author: Desmond Morris

quote: No matter how prepared you think you are for the death of a loved one, it still comes as a shock, and it still hurts very deeply.
author: Billy Graham

quote: No matter how vast, how total, the failure of man here on earth, the work of man will be resumed elsewhere. War leaders talk of resuming operations on this front and that, but man's front embraces the whole universe.
author: Henry Miller

quote: No matter what looms ahead, if you can eat today, enjoy today, mix good cheer with friends today enjoy it and bless God for it.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: No matter what message you are about to deliver somewhere, whether it is holding out a hand of friendship, or making clear that you disapprove of something, is the fact that the person sitting across the table is a human being, so the goal is to always establish common ground.
author: Madeleine Albright

quote: No memory is ever alone it's at the end of a trail of memories, a dozen trails that each have their own associations.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: No mind is thoroughly well organized that is deficient in a sense of humor.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: No money is better spent than what is laid out for domestic satisfaction.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: No more distressing moment can ever face a British government than that which requires it to come to a hard, fast and specific decision.
author: Barbara Tuchman

quote: No nation can rise to the height of glory unless your women are side by side with you.
author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

quote: No nation could preserve its freedom in the midst of continual warfare.
author: James Madison

quote: No nation ever had an army large enough to guarantee it against attack in time of peace, or ensure it of victory in time of war.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: No nice men are good at getting taxis.
author: Katharine Whitehorn

quote: No one can be happy who has been thrust outside the pale of truth. And there are two ways that one can be removed from this realm: by lying, or by being lied to.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: No one can confidently say that he will still be living tomorrow.
author: Euripides

quote: No one can get an education, for of necessity education is a continuing process.
author: Louis L'Amour

quote: No one can live entirely on their own, nor can any country or society exist in isolation.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: No one can look back on his schooldays and say with truth that they were altogether unhappy.
author: George Orwell

quote: No one can possibly achieve any real and lasting success or 'get rich' in business by being a conformist.
author: J. Paul Getty

quote: No one can really honestly be the very best, no one.
author: John Wooden

quote: No one ever told me that grief felt so like fear.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: No one has a right to consume happiness without producing it.
author: Helen Keller

quote: No one has yet realized the wealth of sympathy, the kindness and generosity hidden in the soul of a child. The effort of every true education should be to unlock that treasure.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: No one in this world has ever lost money by underestimating the intelligence of the great masses of the plain people. Nor has anyone ever lost public office thereby.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: No one is a friend to his friend who does not love in return.
author: Plato

quote: No one is above the game or the rules that govern it. Respect for the game and the people who participate in it will not be compromised.
author: Roger Goodell

quote: No one is more arrogant toward women, more aggressive or scornful, than the man who is anxious about his virility.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: No one is so completely disenchanted with the world, or knows it so thoroughly, or is so utterly disgusted with it, that when it begins to smile upon him he does not become partially reconciled to it.
author: Giacomo Leopardi

quote: No one person can possibly combine all the elements supposed to make up what everyone means by friendship.
author: Francis Marion Crawford

quote: No one person invented Mulberry. The knowledge that we had to have this floating harbor slowly grew.
author: Lord Mountbatten

quote: No one realizes how beautiful it is to travel until he comes home and rests his head on his old, familiar pillow.
author: Lin Yutang

quote: No one should be able to enter a wilderness by mechanical means.
author: Garrett Hardin

quote: No one should be left to suffer alone.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: No one should ever say that it was my ignorance if I did or showed forth anything however small according to God's good pleasure but let this be your conclusion and let it so be thought, that - as is the perfect truth - it was the gift of God.
author: Saint Patrick

quote: No one should fear to undertake any task in the name of our Saviour, if it is just and if the intention is purely for His holy service.
author: Christopher Columbus

quote: No one wants to see curvy women.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: No one was ever great without some portion of divine inspiration.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: No one who achieves success does so without acknowledging the help of others. The wise and confident acknowledge this help with gratitude.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: No one who has lived even for a fleeting moment for something other than life in its conventional sense and has experienced the exaltation that this feeling produces can then renounce his new freedom so easily.
author: Andre Breton

quote: No one would talk much in society if they knew how often they misunderstood others.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: No one's going to be able to operate without a grounding in the basic sciences. Language would be helpful, although English is becoming increasingly international. And travel. You have to have a global attitude.
author: Rupert Murdoch

quote: No oppression is so heavy or lasting as that which is inflicted by the perversion and exorbitance of legal authority.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: No part of the education of a politician is more indispensable than the fighting of elections.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: No part of the world can be truly understood without a knowledge of its garment of vegetation, for this determines not only the nature of the animal inhabitants but also the occupations of the majority of human beings.
author: Ellsworth Huntington

quote: No partner in a love relationship... should feel that he has to give up an essential part of himself to make it viable.
author: May Sarton

quote: No passion in the world is equal to the passion to alter someone else's draft.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: No passion so effectually robs the mind of all its powers of acting and reasoning as fear.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: No people in history have ever survived who thought they could protect their freedom by making themselves inoffensive to their enemies.
author: Dean Acheson

quote: No period of history has ever been great or ever can be that does not act on some sort of high, idealistic motives, and idealism in our time has been shoved aside, and we are paying the penalty for it.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: No period of my life has been one of such unmixed happiness as the four years which have been spent within college walls.
author: Horatio Alger

quote: No person connected with me by blood or marriage will be appointed to office.
author: Rutherford B. Hayes

quote: No person has the right to rain on your dreams.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: No person who is enthusiastic about his work has anything to fear from life.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: No person who is not a great sculptor or painter can be an architect. If he is not a sculptor or painter, he can only be a builder.
author: John Ruskin

quote: No person will make a great business who wants to do it all himself or get all the credit.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: No philosophy, no religion, has ever brought so glad a message to the world as this good news of Atheism.
author: Annie Besant

quote: No pleasure has any savor for me without communication.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: No poems can please for long or live that are written by water drinkers.
author: Horace

quote: No power in society, no hardship in your condition can depress you, keep you down, in knowledge, power, virtue, influence, but by your own consent.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: No power of government ought to be employed in the endeavor to establish any system or article of belief on the subject of religion.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: No power on earth has a right to take our property from us without our consent.
author: John Jay

quote: No protracted war can fail to endanger the freedom of a democratic country.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: No punishment has ever possessed enough power of deterrence to prevent the commission of crimes. On the contrary, whatever the punishment, once a specific crime has appeared for the first time, its reappearance is more likely than its initial emergence could ever have been.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: No rational argument will have a rational effect on a man who does not want to adopt a rational attitude.
author: Karl Popper

quote: No real English gentleman, in his secret soul, was ever sorry for the death of a political economist.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: No real social change has ever been brought about without a revolution... revolution is but thought carried into action.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: No sadder proof can be given by a man of his own littleness than disbelief in great men.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: No sane local official who has hung up an empty stocking over the municipal fireplace, is going to shoot Santa Claus just before a hard Christmas.
author: Alfred E. Smith

quote: No science is immune to the infection of politics and the corruption of power.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: No single man can be taken as a model for a perfect figure, for no man lives on earth who is endowed with the whole of beauty.
author: Albrecht Durer

quote: No society can surely be flourishing and happy, of which the far greater part of the members are poor and miserable.
author: Adam Smith

quote: No sooner does man discover intelligence than he tries to involve it in his own stupidity.
author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

quote: No speech can stain what is noble by nature.
author: Sophocles

quote: No spring nor summer beauty hath such grace as I have seen in one autumnal face.
author: John Donne

quote: No story is the same to us after a lapse of time or rather we who read it are no longer the same interpreters.
author: George Eliot

quote: No struggle can ever succeed without women participating side by side with men.
author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

quote: No student of Chinese history can say that the Chinese are incapable of religious experience, even when judged by the standards of medieval Europe or pious India.
author: Hu Shih

quote: No tendency is quite so strong in human nature as the desire to lay down rules of conduct for other people.
author: William Howard Taft

quote: No theory is good unless it permits, not rest, but the greatest work. No theory is good except on condition that one use it to go on beyond.
author: Andre Gide

quote: No trait is more justified than revenge in the right time and place.
author: Meir Kahane

quote: No true and permanent fame can be founded except in labors which promote the happiness of mankind.
author: Charles Sumner

quote: No true believer could be intolerant or a persecutor. If I were a magistrate and the law carried the death penalty against atheists, I would begin by sending to the stake whoever denounced another.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: No valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
author: Alan Watts

quote: No wedding bells for me anymore. I've been happily married to my profession for years.
author: Shirley Bassey

quote: No woman ever hates a man for being in love with her, but many a woman hate a man for being a friend to her.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: No woman should ever be quite accurate about her age. It looks so calculating.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: No work or love will flourish out of guilt, fear, or hollowness of heart, just as no valid plans for the future can be made by those who have no capacity for living now.
author: Alan Watts

quote: No, I chose the name Jane Seymour because I was doing my first film, 'Ode to Lovely War,' and one of the top agents in England spotted me dancing in the chorus. I was a singer and dancer in that movie with Maggie Smith, um, and he told me he couldn't sell me as Joyce Penelope Willomena Frankenburger.
author: Jane Seymour

quote: No, I don't regret anything at this point. That may change on the next phone call, but at the moment I don't regret anything.
author: William Shatner

quote: No, I regret nothing, all I regret is having been born, dying is such a long tiresome business I always found.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: No, I think marriage is a great thing.
author: David Copperfield

quote: No, I will be the pattern of all patience I will say nothing.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: No, I'm no enemy to learning it hurts not me.
author: William Congreve

quote: No, men and women of the Irish race, we shall not fight for England. We shall fight for the destruction of the British Empire and the construction of an Irish republic.
author: James Larkin

quote: No, not rich. I am a poor man with money, which is not the same thing.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: No, the religion of Jesus is a social religion.
author: George Whitefield

quote: No, what I should really like to do right now, in the full blaze of lights, before this illustrious assembly, is to shower every one of you with gifts, with flowers, with offerings of poetry - to be young once more, to ride on the crest of the wave.
author: Knut Hamsun

quote: Nobility is a graceful ornament to the civil order. It is the Corinthian capital of polished society.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Noble deeds that are concealed are most esteemed.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Noble life demands a noble architecture for noble uses of noble men. Lack of culture means what it has always meant: ignoble civilization and therefore imminent downfall.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Nobody can bring you peace but yourself.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Nobody can give you freedom. Nobody can give you equality or justice or anything. If you're a man, you take it.
author: Malcolm X

quote: Nobody can give you wiser advice than yourself.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Nobody climbs mountains for scientific reasons. Science is used to raise money for the expeditions, but you really climb for the hell of it.
author: Edmund Hillary

quote: Nobody could tell us or really had a very good idea, if there were a massive release of radiation, what kind of medical treatment people were going to need and this or that, or, indeed, whether there would be medical personnel around.
author: William Scranton

quote: Nobody ever chooses the already unfortunate as objects of his loyal friendship.
author: Lucan

quote: Nobody ever went broke underestimating the taste of the American public.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Nobody expects to trust his body overmuch after the age of fifty.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: Nobody gets justice. People only get good luck or bad luck.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Nobody has ever before asked the nuclear family to live all by itself in a box the way we do. With no relatives, no support, we've put it in an impossible situation.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Nobody has ever measured, not even poets, how much the heart can hold.
author: Zelda Fitzgerald

quote: Nobody loves a woman because she is handsome or ugly, stupid or intelligent. We love because we love.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Nobody minded what you did in bed or what you said about God, a very civilized attitude in 1948.
author: Simon Raven

quote: Nobody roots for Goliath.
author: Wilt Chamberlain

quote: Nobody sees a flower really it is so small. We haven't time, and to see takes time - like to have a friend takes time.
author: Georgia O'Keeffe

quote: Nobody should trust their virtue with necessity, the force of which is never known till it is felt, and it is therefore one of the first duties to avoid the temptation of it.
author: Mary Wortley Montagu

quote: Nobody understands another's sorrow, and nobody another's joy.
author: Franz Schubert

quote: Nobody who ever gave his best regretted it.
author: George Halas

quote: Nobody, I think, ought to read poetry, or look at pictures or statues, who cannot find a great deal more in them than the poet or artist has actually expressed. Their highest merit is suggestiveness.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Non-cooperation with evil is as much a duty as is cooperation with good.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Non-violence and truth are inseparable and presuppose one another.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Non-violence is the article of faith.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Non-violence requires a double faith, faith in God and also faith in man.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: None are more hopelessly enslaved than those who falsely believe they are free.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: None are so old as those who have outlived enthusiasm.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: None but a coward dares to boast that he has never known fear.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: None but a poet can write a tragedy. For tragedy is nothing less than pain transmuted into exaltation by the alchemy of poetry.
author: Edith Hamilton

quote: None can love freedom heartily, but good men the rest love not freedom, but licence.
author: John Milton

quote: None of the abstract concepts comes closer to fulfilled utopia than that of eternal peace.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: None of us feels the true love of God till we realize how wicked we are. But you can't teach people that - they have to learn by experience.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: None of us is responsible for the complexion of his skin. This fact of nature offers no clue to the character or quality of the person underneath.
author: Marian Anderson

quote: None of us will ever accomplish anything excellent or commanding except when he listens to this whisper which is heard by him alone.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: None speak of the bravery, the might, or the intellect of Jesus but the devil is always imagined as a being of acute intellect, political cunning, and the fiercest courage. These universal and instinctive tendencies of the human mind reveal much.
author: Lydia M. Child

quote: None who have always been free can understand the terrible fascinating power of the hope of freedom to those who are not free.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Nonetheless, do I have respect for people who believe in the hereafter? Of course I do. I might add, perhaps even a touch of envy too, because of the solace.
author: Studs Terkel

quote: Nonsense and beauty have close connections.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: Nonviolence is the first article of my faith. It is also the last article of my creed.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Nor dread nor hope attend a dying animal a man awaits his end dreading and hoping all.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: Normality is death.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: Not a few other very eminent and scholarly men made the same request, urging that I should no longer through fear refuse to give out my work for the common benefit of students of Mathematics.
author: Nicolaus Copernicus

quote: Not all intelligence can be artificial now, so if we make a mistake, the consequences are no longer simply located within an institution or a national culture.
author: William Irwin Thompson

quote: Not all is doom and gloom. We are beginning to understand the natural world and are gaining a reverence for life - all life.
author: Roger Tory Peterson

quote: Not brute force but only persuasion and faith are the kings of this world.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Not by appointment do we meet delight Or joy they heed not our expectancy But round some corner of the streets of life they of a sudden greet us with a smile.
author: Gerald Massey

quote: Not cohabitation but consensus constitutes marriage.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Not even old age knows how to love death.
author: Sophocles

quote: Not every difficult and dangerous thing is suitable for training, but only that which is conducive to success in achieving the object of our effort.
author: Epictetus

quote: Not every religion has to have St. Augustine's attitude to sex. Why even in our culture marriages are celebrated in a church, everyone present knows what is going to happen that night, but that doesn't prevent it being a religious ceremony.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Not every truth is the better for showing its face undisguised and often silence is the wisest thing for a man to heed.
author: Pindar

quote: Not everybody trusts paintings but people believe photographs.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: Not everyone can see the truth, but he can be it.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Not failure, but low aim, is crime.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Not for nothing is their motto TGIF - 'Thank God It's Friday.' They live for the weekends, when they can go do what they really want to do.
author: Richard Nelson Bolles

quote: Not ignorance, but ignorance of ignorance, is the death of knowledge.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Not just Christians and Jews, but also Muslims, Buddhists, Hindus and the followers of many other religions believe in values like peace, respect, tolerance and dignity. These are values that bring people together and enable us to build responsible and solid communities.
author: Alcee Hastings

quote: Not just in commerce but in the world of ideas too our age is putting on a veritable clearance sale. Everything can be had so dirt cheap that one begins to wonder whether in the end anyone will want to make a bid.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Not life, but good life, is to be chiefly valued.
author: Socrates

quote: Not longer loved or fostered by religion, beauty is lifted from its face as a mask, and its absence exposes features on that face which threaten to become incomprehensible to man.
author: Hans Urs von Balthasar

quote: Not necessity, not desire - no, the love of power is the demon of men. Let them have everything - health, food, a place to live, entertainment - they are and remain unhappy and low-spirited: for the demon waits and waits and will be satisfied.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Not one has shown an iota of fear of death. They want to end this agony.
author: Jack Kevorkian

quote: Not one man in a thousand has the strength of mind or the goodness of heart to be an atheist.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Not only do I have to live, right, I have to get some cash for my troubles - it's a scary thing, and people need to start to think about the messages that they send in the movies.
author: Morgan Freeman

quote: Not only is the self entwined in society it owes society its existence in the most literal sense.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: Not only is there no God, but try finding a plumber on Sunday.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Not only must we be good, but we must also be good for something.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Not only our future economic soundness but the very soundness of our democratic institutions depends on the determination of our government to give employment to idle men.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Not only the priceless heritage of our fathers, of our seamen, of our Empire builders is being thrown away in a war that serves no British interests - but our alliance leader Stalin dreams of nothing but the destruction of that heritage of our fathers?
author: John Amery

quote: Not the fruit of experience, but experience itself, is the end.
author: Walter Pater

quote: Not the power to remember, but its very opposite, the power to forget, is a necessary condition for our existence.
author: Saint Basil

quote: Not to be born is, past all prizing, best.
author: Sophocles

quote: Not to discriminate every moment some passionate attitude in those about us, and in the very brilliancy of their gifts some tragic dividing on their ways, is, on this short day of frost and sun, to sleep before evening.
author: Walter Pater

quote: Not to expose your true feelings to an adult seems to be instinctive from the age of seven or eight onwards.
author: George Orwell

quote: Not to mention the fact that of course terrorists hate freedom. I think they do hate. But believe me, I don't think they sit there abstractly hating freedom.
author: Zbigniew Brzezinski

quote: Not truth, but faith, it is that keeps the world alive.
author: Edna St. Vincent Millay

quote: Not when truth is dirty, but when it is shallow, does the enlightened man dislike to wade into its waters.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Not without hope we suffer and we mourn.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Nothing astonishes men so much as common sense and plain dealing.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Nothing can atone for the lack of modesty without which beauty is ungraceful and wit detestable.
author: Richard Steele

quote: Nothing can be more absurd than the practice that prevails in our country of men and women not following the same pursuits with all their strengths and with one mind, for thus, the state instead of being whole is reduced to half.
author: Plato

quote: Nothing can be more contrary to religion and the clergy than reason and common sense.
author: Voltaire

quote: Nothing can bring a real sense of security into the home except true love.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Nothing can contribute more to peace of soul than the lack of any opinion whatever.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Nothing can happen more beautiful than death.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Nothing can stop the man with the right mental attitude from achieving his goal nothing on earth can help the man with the wrong mental attitude.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Nothing does reason more right, than the coolness of those that offer it: For Truth often suffers more by the heat of its defenders, than from the arguments of its opposers.
author: William Penn

quote: Nothing doth more hurt in a state than that cunning men pass for wise.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Nothing else in the world... not all the armies... is so powerful as an idea whose time has come.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Nothing endears so much a friend as sorrow for his death. The pleasure of his company has not so powerful an influence.
author: David Hume

quote: Nothing endures but change.
author: Heraclitus

quote: Nothing ever becomes real till it is experienced.
author: John Keats

quote: Nothing ever comes to one, that is worth having, except as a result of hard work.
author: Booker T. Washington

quote: Nothing except the mint can make money without advertising.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

quote: Nothing exists from whose nature some effect does not follow.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Nothing external to you has any power over you.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Nothing flatters a man as much as the happiness of his wife he is always proud of himself as the source of it.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Nothing gives a fearful man more courage than another's fear.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: Nothing gives one person so much advantage over another as to remain always cool and unruffled under all circumstances.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Nothing gives rest but the sincere search for truth.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Nothing goes by luck in composition. It allows of no tricks. The best you can write will be the best you are.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Nothing great in the world has ever been accomplished without passion.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: Nothing great is created suddenly, any more than a bunch of grapes or a fig. If you tell me that you desire a fig. I answer you that there must be time. Let it first blossom, then bear fruit, then ripen.
author: Epictetus

quote: Nothing great was ever achieved without enthusiasm.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Nothing happens to any man that he is not formed by nature to bear.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Nothing has been purchased more dearly than the little bit of reason and sense of freedom which now constitutes our pride.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Nothing has more strength than dire necessity.
author: Euripides

quote: Nothing has such power to broaden the mind as the ability to investigate systematically and truly all that comes under thy observation in life.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Nothing in education is so astonishing as the amount of ignorance it accumulates in the form of inert facts.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Nothing in human nature is so God-like as the disposition to do good to our fellow-creatures.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Nothing in life is as good as the marriage of true minds between man and woman. As good? It is life itself.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Nothing in life is so exhilarating as to be shot at without result.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Nothing in life is to be feared, it is only to be understood. Now is the time to understand more, so that we may fear less.
author: Marie Curie

quote: Nothing in the affairs of men is worthy of great anxiety.
author: Plato

quote: Nothing in the universe is contingent, but all things are conditioned to exist and operate in a particular manner by the necessity of the divine nature.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Nothing in this world can take the place of persistence. Talent will not nothing is more common than unsuccessful people with talent. Genius will not unrewarded genius is almost a proverb. Education will not the world is full of educated failures. Persistence and determination alone are omnipotent.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Nothing induces me to read a novel except when I have to make money by writing about it. I detest them.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Nothing is a waste of time if you use the experience wisely.
author: Auguste Rodin

quote: Nothing is as dangerous in architecture as dealing with separated problems. If we split life into separated problems we split the possibilities to make good building art.
author: Alvar Aalto

quote: Nothing is as peevish and pedantic as men's judgments of one another.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: Nothing is beautiful, only man: on this piece of naivete rests all aesthetics, it is the first truth of aesthetics. Let us immediately add its second: nothing is ugly but degenerate man - the domain of aesthetic judgment is therewith defined.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Nothing is capable of being well set to music that is not nonsense.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Nothing is ever done in this world until men are prepared to kill one another if it is not done.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Nothing is impossible, the word itself says 'I'm possible'!
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Nothing is less important than which fork you use. Etiquette is the science of living. It embraces everything. It is ethics. It is honor.
author: Emily Post

quote: Nothing is more beautiful than the loveliness of the woods before sunrise.
author: George Washington Carver

quote: Nothing is more capable of troubling our reason, and consuming our health, than secret notions of jealousy in solitude.
author: Aphra Behn

quote: Nothing is more conducive to peace of mind than not having any opinion at all.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Nothing is more despicable than respect based on fear.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Nothing is more destructive of respect for the government and the law of the land than passing laws which cannot be enforced.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Nothing is more fearful than imagination without taste.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Nothing is more generally known than our duties which belong to Christianity and yet, how amazing is it, nothing is less practiced?
author: George Whitefield

quote: Nothing is more gratifying to the mind of man than power or dominion.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Nothing is more important in the preservation of peace than to secure among the great mass of the people living under constitutional government a just conception of the rights which their nation has against others and of the duties their nation owes to others.
author: Elihu Root

quote: Nothing is more noble, nothing more venerable than fidelity. Faithfulness and truth are the most sacred excellences and endowments of the human mind.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Nothing is really work unless you would rather be doing something else.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: Nothing is so admirable in politics as a short memory.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Nothing is so beautiful as spring - when weeds, in wheels, shoot long and lovely and lush Thrush's eggs look little low heavens, and thrush through the echoing timber does so rinse and wring the ear, it strikes like lightning to hear him sing.
author: Gerard Manley Hopkins

quote: Nothing is so fatal to religion as indifference.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Nothing is so galling to a people not broken in from the birth as a paternal, or in other words a meddling government, a government which tells them what to read and say and eat and drink and wear.
author: Thomas W. Higginson

quote: Nothing is so galling to a people not broken in from the birth as a paternal, or, in other words, a meddling government, a government which tells them what to read, and say, and eat, and drink and wear.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

quote: Nothing is so intolerable to man as being fully at rest, without a passion, without business, without entertainment, without care.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Nothing is so perfectly amusing as a total change of ideas.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Nothing is so permanent as a temporary government program.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: Nothing is so strongly fortified that it cannot be taken by money.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Nothing is too wonderful to be true if it be consistent with the laws of nature.
author: Michael Faraday

quote: Nothing is void of God, his work is everywhere his full of himself.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Nothing is work unless you'd rather be doing something else.
author: George Halas

quote: Nothing leads so straight to futility as literary ambitions without systematic knowledge.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: Nothing matters but the facts. Without them, the science of criminal investigation is nothing more than a guessing game.
author: Blake Edwards

quote: Nothing prevents happiness like the memory of happiness.
author: Andre Gide

quote: Nothing recedes like success.
author: Walter Winchell

quote: Nothing retains less of desire in art, in science, than this will to industry, booty, possession.
author: Andre Breton

quote: Nothing seems at first sight less important than the outward form of human actions, yet there is nothing upon which men set more store: they grow used to everything except to living in a society which has not their own manners.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: Nothing separates the generations more than music. By the time a child is eight or nine, he has developed a passion for his own music that is even stronger than his passions for procrastination and weird clothes.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Nothing so conclusively proves a man's ability to lead others as what he does from day to day to lead himself.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: Nothing so fortifies a friendship as a belief on the part of one friend that he is superior to the other.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Nothing succeeds like success.
author: Alexandre Dumas

quote: Nothing that is God's is obtainable by money.
author: Tertullian

quote: Nothing that is really good and God-like dies.
author: Ernst Moritz Arndt

quote: Nothing that is worth doing can be achieved in a lifetime therefore we must be saved by hope.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Nothing that was worthy in the past departs no truth or goodness realized by man ever dies, or can die.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Nothing truly convincing - which would possess thoroughness, vigor, and skill - has been written against the ancients as yet especially not against their poetry.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Nothing turns out to be so oppressive and unjust as a feeble government.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Nothing we do, however virtuous, can be accomplished alone therefore we are saved by love.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Nothing which has entered into our experience is ever lost.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: Nothing which is true or beautiful or good makes complete sense in any immediate context of history therefore we must be saved by faith.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: Nothing will work unless you do.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Nothing would be more tiresome than eating and drinking if God had not made them a pleasure as well as a necessity.
author: Voltaire

quote: Nothing you write, if you hope to be good, will ever come out as you first hoped.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: Notice the difference between what happens when a man says to himself, I have failed three times, and what happens when he says, I am a failure.
author: S. I. Hayakawa

quote: Novel technologies and ideas that impinge on human biology and their perceived impact on human values have renewed strains in the relationship between science and society.
author: Paul Berg

quote: Novelists are not equipped to make a movie, in my opinion. They make their own movie when they write: they're casting, they're dressing the scene, they're working out where the energy of the scene is coming from and they're also relying tremendously on the creative imagination of the reader.
author: John le Carre

quote: Novels are the Socratic dialogues of our time. Practical wisdom fled from school wisdom into this liberal form.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Now I can do no more. We must trust to the Great Disposer of all events and the justice of our cause. I thank God for this opportunity of doing my duty.
author: Horatio Nelson

quote: Now I need to take a piece of wood and make it sound like the railroad track, but I also had to make it beautiful and lovable so that a person playing it would think of it in terms of his mistress, a bartender, his wife, a good psychiatrist - whatever.
author: Les Paul

quote: Now I see the secret of making the best person: it is to grow in the open air and to eat and sleep with the earth.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Now I'm an old Christmas tree, the roots of which have died. They just come along and while the little needles fall off me replace them with medallions.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Now a soft kiss - Aye, by that kiss, I vow an endless bliss.
author: John Keats

quote: Now all the knowledge and wisdom that is in creatures, whether angels or men, is nothing else but a participation of that one eternal, immutable and increased wisdom of God.
author: Ralph Cudworth

quote: Now for my own case, I bless the Lord that, for all that hath been said of me, my conscience doth not condemn me. I do not say I am free of sin, but I am at peace with God through a slain Mediator and I believe that there is no salvation but only in Christ.
author: Donald Cargill

quote: Now is the age of anxiety.
author: W. H. Auden

quote: Now it is established in the sciences that no knowledge is acquired save through the study of its causes and beginnings, if it has had causes and beginnings nor completed except by knowledge of its accidents and accompanying essentials.
author: Avicenna

quote: Now it is human nature to want to eat to ones fill when hungry, to want to warm up when cold, to want to rest when tired. These all are a part of people's emotional nature.
author: Xun Zi

quote: Now our founding fathers had the wisdom to know that social acceptance and popularity were fleeing, and that this country's principles needed to be rooted in strengths greater than the passions and the emotions of the times.
author: Chris Christie

quote: Now our job, our duty, our responsibility to ensure the safety and security of our citizens cannot be complete unless we guarantee health care security for our citizens.
author: Thomas Vilsack

quote: Now people all across America are starting to believe in America again. We are coming back, back to the heights of greatness, back to America's proud role as a temple of justice and a champion of peace.
author: Theodore C. Sorensen

quote: Now science has presented us with a hope called stem cell research, which may provide our scientists with many answers that have for so long been beyond our grasp.
author: Nancy Reagan

quote: Now that I look back on it, having retired from being a reporter, it was kind of romantic. It was a wonderful way to live one's life, just as I imagined it would be when I was 6 or 7.
author: Charles Kuralt

quote: Now that the House of Commons is trying to become useful, it does a great deal of harm.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Now the reason the enlightened prince and the wise general conquer the enemy whenever they move and their achievements surpass those of ordinary men is foreknowledge.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Now this relaxation of the mind from work consists on playful words or deeds. Therefore it becomes a wise and virtuous man to have recourse to such things at times.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Now, God be praised, that to believing souls gives light in darkness, comfort in despair.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: Now, I learned soon enough, that among the three, two don't trust the third one - the third one is the government. Both industry and unions feel the government is a talking organization and a spending organization.
author: Shimon Peres

quote: Now, do I think there has to be shared sacrifice among other nations in the world who want a stable and secure world? Absolutely, there has to be. But I don't think that America can ever abdicate its leadership role in the world because of who we are and where we've come from. We are the symbol for the world for freedom and liberty.
author: Chris Christie

quote: Now, everybody, I suppose, is aware that in recent years the silly business of divination by dreams has ceased to be a joke and has become a very serious science.
author: Arthur Machen

quote: Now, for this book I had to learn the world of the Senate, which is really for all that's written about the Senate, an unknowing world and its mores, and the way things work with subcommittees and all. I loved learning about that.
author: Robert Caro

quote: Now, in New Jersey, we have more government workers per square mile than any state in America. But since I've been governor we now have fewer people on the state payroll at any time since Christie Whitman left office in January 2001. That's the right direction, Mr. President, not the wrong direction.
author: Chris Christie

quote: Now, we believe that the majority of teachers in America know our system must be reformed, to put students first so that America can compete, that teachers don't teach to become rich or famous. They teach because they love children.
author: Chris Christie

quote: Now, we occupy a lowly position, both in space and rank in comparison with the heavenly sphere, and the Almighty is Most High not in space, but with respect to absolute existence, greatness and power.
author: Maimonides

quote: Nowadays it is the fashion to emphasize the horrors of the last war. I didn't find it so horrible. There are just as horrible things happening all round us today, if only we had eyes to see them.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Nowadays nothing but money counts: a fortune brings honors, friendships the poor man everywhere lies low.
author: Ovid

quote: Nowadays the rage for possession has got to such a pitch that there is nothing in the realm of nature, whether sacred or profane, out of which profit cannot be squeezed.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: Nullification means insurrection and war and the other states have a right to put it down.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: Number one, cash is king... number two, communicate... number three, buy or bury the competition.
author: Jack Welch

quote: Numerous politicians have seized absolute power and muzzled the press. Never in history has the press seized absolute power and muzzled the politicians.
author: David Brinkley

quote: Nurses are an integral component of the health care system, and it is important that we recognize the over 2.7 million registered nurses for the significant work that they do.
author: Nathan Deal

quote: Nurture your minds with great thoughts. To believe in the heroic makes heroes.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: O God, O God, how weary, stale, flat, and unprofitable seem to me all the uses of this world!
author: William Shakespeare

quote: O Lord, help me to be pure, but not yet.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: O love, if I regret the age when one savors you, it is not for the hour of pleasure, but for the one that follows it.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: O man you are busy working for the world, and the world is busy trying to turn you out.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: O my brethren, my heart is enlarge towards you. I trust I feel something of that hidden, but powerful presence of Christ, whilst I am preaching to you.
author: George Whitefield

quote: O reason, reason, abstract phantom of the waking state, I had already expelled you from my dreams, now I have reached a point where those dreams are about to become fused with apparent realities: now there is only room here for myself.
author: Louis Aragon

quote: O that unbelievers would learn of faithful Abraham, and believe whatever is revealed from God, though they cannot fully comprehend it! Abraham knew God commanded him to offer up his son, and therefore believed, notwithstanding carnal reasoning might suggest may objections.
author: George Whitefield

quote: O! many a shaft, at random sent, Finds mark the archer little meant! And many a word, at random spoken, May soothe or wound a heart that's broken!
author: Walter Scott

quote: O! what a Godlike Power is that of doing Good! I envy the Rich and the Great for nothing else!
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: O, thou art fairer than the evening air clad in the beauty of a thousand stars.
author: Christopher Marlowe

quote: Obedience is an act of faith disobedience is the result of unbelief.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Obedience is the fruit of faith.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: Obedience is the mother of success and is wedded to safety.
author: Aeschylus

quote: Obedience to lawful authority is the foundation of manly character.
author: Robert E. Lee

quote: Objects we ardently pursue bring little happiness when gained most of our pleasures come from unexpected sources.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Obscenity, which is ever blasphemy against the divine beauty in life, is a monster for which the corruption of society forever brings forth new food, which it devours in secret.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Observation is a passive science, experimentation an active science.
author: Claude Bernard

quote: Observation more than books and experience more than persons, are the prime educators.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quote: Observe all men, thyself most.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Observe constantly that all things take place by change, and accustom thyself to consider that the nature of the Universe loves nothing so much as to change the things which are, and to make new things like them.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: Observe good faith and justice toward all nations. Cultivate peace and harmony with all.
author: George Washington

quote: Obsessed by a fairy tale, we spend our lives searching for a magic door and a lost kingdom of peace.
author: Eugene O'Neill

quote: Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off your goal.
author: Henry Ford

quote: Obviously one must hold oneself responsible for the evil impulses of one's dreams. In what other way can one deal with them? Unless the content of the dream rightly understood is inspired by alien spirits, it is part of my own being.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Obviously the facts are never just coming at you but are incorporated by an imagination that is formed by your previous experience. Memories of the past are not memories of facts but memories of your imaginings of the facts.
author: Philip Roth

quote: Occurrences in this domain are beyond the reach of exact prediction because of the variety of factors in operation, not because of any lack of order in nature.
