quote: Outside the kingdom of the Lord there is no nation which is greater than any other. God and history will remember your judgment.
author: Haile Selassie

quote: Outstanding leaders go out of their way to boost the self-esteem of their personnel. If people believe in themselves, it's amazing what they can accomplish.
author: Sam Walton

quote: Over grown military establishments are under any form of government inauspicious to liberty, and are to be regarded as particularly hostile to republican liberty.
author: George Washington

quote: Over the last half century the television interview has given us some of TV's most heart-stopping and memorable moments. On the surface it is a simple format - two people sitting across from one another having a conversation. But underneath it is often a power struggle - a battle for the psychological advantage.
author: David Frost

quote: Over the next two years UNICEF will focus on improving access to and the quality of education to provide children who have dropped out of school or who work during school hours the opportunity to gain a formal education!
author: Roger Moore

quote: Overall, the anarchy was the most creative of all periods of Japanese culture for in it there appeared the greatest landscape painting, the culmination of the skill of landscape gardening and the arts of flower arrangement, and the No drama.
author: J. M. Roberts

quote: Overcoming my dad telling me that I could never amount to anything is what has made me the megalomaniac that you see today.
author: Bono

quote: Overnight stardom can be harmful to your mental health. Yeah. It has ruined a lot of people.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: Own only what you can always carry with you: know languages, know countries, know people. Let your memory be your travel bag.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: PC stuff just lowers the general acceptance of good work and replaces it with bogus poetry that celebrates values that in themselves are probably quite worthy.
author: Diane Wakoski

quote: Pain is the doorway to wisdom and to truth.
author: Keith Miller

quote: Painful as it may be, a significant emotional event can be the catalyst for choosing a direction that serves us - and those around us - more effectively. Look for the learning.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: Pains of love be sweeter far than all other pleasures are.
author: John Dryden

quote: Painting from nature is not copying the object it is realizing one's sensations.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: Painting is a faith, and it imposes the duty to disregard public opinion.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote: Painting is an infinitely minute part of my personality.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Painting is easy when you don't know how, but very difficult when you do.
author: Edgar Degas

quote: Painting is just another way of keeping a diary.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Painting is silent poetry, and poetry is painting that speaks.
author: Plutarch

quote: Painting will have to deal more fully and less obliquely with life and nature's phenomena before it can again become great.
author: Edward Hopper

quote: Painting, sculpture and architecture are finished, but the art habit continues.
author: Robert Smithson

quote: Pakistan not only means freedom and independence but the Muslim Ideology which has to be preserved, which has come to us as a precious gift and treasure and which, we hope other will share with us.
author: Muhammad Ali Jinnah

quote: Pale Death beats equally at the poor man's gate and at the palaces of kings.
author: Horace

quote: Pale death, with impartial step, knocks at the hut of the poor and the towers of kings.
author: Horace

quote: Papa always makes it clear that he would like to know me as much more rational and lucid than the girls and women he gets to know during his analytic hours.
author: Anna Freud

quote: Papa, potatoes, poultry, prunes and prism, are all very good words for the lips.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Parentage is a very important profession, but no test of fitness for it is ever imposed in the interest of the children.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Parents are like shuttles on a loom. They join the threads of the past with threads of the future and leave their own bright patterns as they go.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: Parents are not interested in justice, they're interested in peace and quiet.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Parents can only give good advice or put them on the right paths, but the final forming of a person's character lies in their own hands.
author: Anne Frank

quote: Parents have become so convinced that educators know what is best for their children that they forget that they themselves are really the experts.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: Paris is always a good idea.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Part of it went on gambling, and part of it went on women. The rest I spent foolishly.
author: George Raft

quote: Part of my strength as an actor comes from what I've learned all these years: when you play a villain, you try to get the light touches when you play a hero, you try to get in some of the warts.
author: John Forsythe

quote: Part of show business is magic. You don't know how it happens.
author: Sammy Davis, Jr.

quote: Part of the inhumanity of the computer is that, once it is competently programmed and working smoothly, it is completely honest.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Part of the reason for the ugliness of adults, in a child's eyes, is that the child is usually looking upwards, and few faces are at their best when seen from below.
author: George Orwell

quote: Part of the secret of a success in life is to eat what you like and let the food fight it out inside.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Participate joyfully in the sorrows of the world. We cannot cure the world of sorrows, but we can choose to live in joy.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Party domination and State leadership are concepts incompatible with one another.
author: Franz von Papen

quote: Party-spirit at best is but the madness of many for the gain of a few.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Passion for fame: A passion which is the instinct of all great souls.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Passion is momentary love is enduring.
author: John Wooden

quote: Passion is universal humanity. Without it religion, history, romance and art would be useless.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Patience and Diligence, like faith, remove mountains.
author: William Penn

quote: Patience and perseverance have a magical effect before which difficulties disappear and obstacles vanish.
author: John Quincy Adams

quote: Patience and time do more than strength or passion.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Patience is necessary, and one cannot reap immediately where one has sown.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Patience is the best medicine.
author: John Florio

quote: Patience is the companion of wisdom.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Patience is the most necessary quality for business, many a man would rather you heard his story than grant his request.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Patience means restraining one's inclinations.
author: Tokugawa Ieyasu

quote: Patience was not my strong point.
author: Lauren Bacall

quote: Patience, that blending of moral courage with physical timidity.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Patience, the beggar's virtue, shall find no harbor here.
author: Philip Massinger

quote: Patriot: the person who can holler the loudest without knowing what he is hollering about.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Patriotism is an ephemeral motive that scarcely ever outlasts the particular threat to society that aroused it.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Patriotism is easy to understand in America. It means looking out for yourself by looking out for your country.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Patriotism is often an arbitrary veneration of real estate above principles.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Patriotism is supporting your country all the time, and your government when it deserves it.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Patriotism is the last refuge of the scoundrel.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Patriotism is the virtue of the vicious.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Patriotism is the willingness to kill and be killed for trivial reasons.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Patriotism is usually stronger than class hatred, and always stronger than internationalism.
author: George Orwell

quote: Patriotism is voluntary. It is a feeling of loyalty and allegiance that is the result of knowledge and belief. A patriot shows their their patriotism through their actions, by their choice.
author: Jesse Ventura

quote: Patriotism is your conviction that this country is superior to all others because you were born in it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Patriotism must be founded on great principals and supported by great virtue.
author: Henry Bolingbroke

quote: Patriotism was a living fire of unquestioned belief and purpose.
author: Frank Knox

quote: Patriotism, when it wants to make itself felt in the domain of learning, is a dirty fellow who should be thrown out of doors.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Patriots always talk of dying for their country and never of killing for their country.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Pay mind to your own life, your own health, and wholeness. A bleeding heart is of no help to anyone if it bleeds to death.
author: Frederick Buechner

quote: Peace and abstinence from European interferences are our objects, and so will continue while the present order of things in America remain uninterrupted.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Peace and friendship with all mankind is our wisest policy, and I wish we may be permitted to pursue it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Peace and not war is the father of all things.
author: Ludwig von Mises

quote: Peace begins with a smile.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: Peace cannot be achieved through violence, it can only be attained through understanding.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Peace cannot be kept by force it can only be achieved by understanding.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Peace comes when you talk to the guy you most hate. And that's where the courage of a leader comes, because when you sit down with your enemy, you as a leader must already have very considerable confidence from your own constituency.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: Peace does not include a vendetta there will be neither winners nor losers.
author: Ahmed Ben Bella

quote: Peace for us means the destruction of Israel. We are preparing for an all-out war, a war which will last for generations.
author: Yasser Arafat

quote: Peace goes into the making of a poem as flour goes into the making of bread.
author: Pablo Neruda

quote: Peace has to be created, in order to be maintained. It will never be achieved by passivity and quietism.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: Peace is a natural effect of trade.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: Peace is its own reward.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Peace is liberty in tranquillity.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Peace is much more precious than a piece of land... let there be no more wars.
author: Anwar Sadat

quote: Peace is not an absence of war, it is a virtue, a state of mind, a disposition for benevolence, confidence, justice.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Peace is not made at the council table or by treaties, but in the hearts of men.
author: Herbert Hoover

quote: Peace is not merely a distant goal that we seek, but a means by which we arrive at that goal.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Peace is not only better than war, but infinitely more arduous.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Peace is not the absence of conflict but the presence of creative alternatives for responding to conflict - alternatives to passive or aggressive responses, alternatives to violence.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: Peace is not the absence of war, but a virtue based on strength of character.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: Peace is not the product of a victory or a command. It has no finishing line, no final deadline, no fixed definition of achievement. Peace is a never-ending process, the work of many decisions.
author: Oscar Hammerstein II

quote: Peace is rarely denied to the peaceful.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Peace is that state in which fear of any kind is unknown.
author: John Buchan

quote: Peace is the first thing the angels sang.
author: John Keble

quote: Peace is the umpire for doing the will of God.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Peace is the virtue of civilization. War is its crime.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Peace on earth would mean the end of civilization as we know it.
author: Joseph Heller

quote: Peace to the shacks! War on the palaces!
author: Georg Buchner

quote: Peace was declared, but not all of us were drunk with joy or stricken blind.
author: George Grosz

quote: Peace with the Palestinians will open ports of peace all around the Mediterranean. The duty of leaders is to pursue freedom ceaselessly, even in the face of hostility, in the face of doubt and disappointment. Just imagine what could be.
author: Shimon Peres

quote: Peace without justice is tyranny.
author: William Allen White

quote: Peace, above all things, is to be desired, but blood must sometimes be spilled to obtain it on equable and lasting terms.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: Peace, commerce and honest friendship with all nations entangling alliances with none.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Peace, plenty, and contentment reign throughout our borders, and our beloved country presents a sublime moral spectacle to the world.
author: James K. Polk

quote: People always make war when they say they love peace.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: People are beginning to see that the first requisite to success in life is to be a good animal.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: People are craving this great progress in electronics, going after computers, the Internet, etc. It's a giant progress technologically. But they must have a balance of soul, a balance for human beauty. That means art has an important role.
author: Mstislav Rostropovich

quote: People are generally amazed that I would take an interest in any form that would require me to stop talking for three hours.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

quote: People are getting smarter nowadays they are letting lawyers, instead of their conscience, be their guide.
author: Will Rogers

quote: People are like stained - glass windows. They sparkle and shine when the sun is out, but when the darkness sets in, their true beauty is revealed only if there is a light from within.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: People are ready to say, 'Yes, we are ready for single-payer health insurance.' We are the only industrialized country in the world that does not have national health insurance. We are the richest in wealth and the poorest in health of all the industrial nations.
author: Studs Terkel

quote: People are smarter than you might think.
author: John Astin

quote: People are unjust to anger - it can be enlivening and a lot of fun.
author: Philip Roth

quote: People are what you make them. A scornful look turns into a complete fool a man of average intelligence. A contemptuous indifference turns into an enemy a woman who, well treated, might have been an angel.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: People ask how can a Jewish kid from the Bronx do preppy clothes? Does it have to do with class and money? It has to do with dreams.
author: Ralph Lauren

quote: People ask me how I keep my figure, and I tell them it's because I paint. When you're covered in paint, it's quite hard to put food in your mouth!
author: Jane Seymour

quote: People ask the difference between a leader and a boss. The leader leads, and the boss drives.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: People can be more forgiving than you can imagine. But you have to forgive yourself. Let go of what's bitter and move on.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: People can die of mere imagination.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

quote: People change and forget to tell each other.
author: Lillian Hellman

quote: People commonly travel the world over to see rivers and mountains, new stars, garish birds, freak fish, grotesque breeds of human they fall into an animal stupor that gapes at existence and they think they have seen something.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: People could rationally decide that prolonged relationships take up too much time and effort and that they'd much rather do other kinds of things. But most people are afraid of rejection.
author: Albert Ellis

quote: People criticized me for my photography. They said it's not art.
author: David Hockney

quote: People crushed by laws, have no hope but to evade power. If the laws are their enemies, they will be enemies to the law and those who have most to hope and nothing to lose will always be dangerous.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: People deal too much with the negative, with what is wrong. Why not try and see positive things, to just touch those things and make them bloom?
author: Nhat Hanh

quote: People demand freedom of speech as a compensation for the freedom of thought which they seldom use.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: People demand freedom only when they have no power.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: People didn't have the political guts to stand up against an American war.
author: George McGovern

quote: People discuss my art and pretend to understand as if it were necessary to understand, when it's simply necessary to love.
author: Claude Monet

quote: People disparage knowing and the intellectual life, and urge doing. I am content with knowing, if only I could know.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: People do not lack strength they lack will.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: People do not understand what a great revenue economy is.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: People don't follow titles, they follow courage.
author: William Wells Brown

quote: People don't have fortunes left them in that style nowadays men have to work and women to marry for money. It's a dreadfully unjust world.
author: Louisa May Alcott

quote: People don't notice whether it's winter or summer when they're happy.
author: Anton Chekhov

quote: People fall forward to success.
author: Mary Kay Ash

quote: People feel uncomfortable talking about racial issues out of fear that if they express things, they will be characterized in a way that's not fair. I think that there is still a need for a dialogue about things racial that we've not engaged in.
author: Eric Holder

quote: People from a planet without flowers would think we must be mad with joy the whole time to have such things about us.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: People got insights into what was bothering them, but they hardly did a damn thing to change.
author: Albert Ellis

quote: People grow through experience if they meet life honestly and courageously. This is how character is built.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: People hate me because I am a multifaceted, talented, wealthy, internationally famous genius.
author: Jerry Lewis

quote: People have an image of Italians. When I go somewhere in the world, I don't care where it is, when they look at me it's not about my intelligence. It's who can I beat up.
author: Danny Aiello

quote: People have their own deaths as well as their own lives, and even if there is nothing beyond death, we shall differ in our nothingness.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: People have to talk about something just to keep their voice boxes in working order so they'll have good voice boxes in case there's ever anything really meaningful to say.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

quote: People here argue about religion interminably, but it appears that they are competing at the same time to see who can be the least devout.
author: Charles de Secondat

quote: People in cities may forget the soil for as long as a hundred years, but Mother Nature's memory is long and she will not let them forget indefinitely.
author: Henry Cantwell Wallace

quote: People intoxicate themselves with work so they won't see how they really are.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: People living deeply have no fear of death.
author: Anais Nin

quote: People love chopping wood. In this activity one immediately sees results.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: People love westerns worldwide. There's something fantasy-like about an individual fighting the elements. Or even bad guys and the elements. It's a simpler time. There's no organized laws and stuff.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: People make music to get a reaction. Music is communication.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: People might not get all they work for in this world, but they must certainly work for all they get.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: People must feel that the natural world is important and valuable and beautiful and wonderful and an amazement and a pleasure.
author: David Attenborough

quote: People must help one another it is nature's law.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: People need to be made more aware of the need to work at learning how to live because life is so quick and sometimes it goes away too quickly.
author: Andy Warhol

quote: People need to start to think about the messages that they send in the movies.
author: Morgan Freeman

quote: People never lie so much as after a hunt, during a war or before an election.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: People of genius do not excel in any profession because they work in it, they work in it because they excel.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: People of humor are always in some degree people of genius.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: People of mediocre ability sometimes achieve outstanding success because they don't know when to quit. Most men succeed because they are determined to.
author: George Allen, Sr.

quote: People often complain that music is too ambiguous, that what they should think when they hear it is so unclear, whereas everyone understands words. With me, it is exactly the opposite, and not only with regard to an entire speech but also with individual words.
author: Felix Mendelssohn

quote: People praise virtue, but they hate it, they run away from it. It freezes you to death, and in this world you've got to keep your feet warm.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: People respect nonfiction but they read novels.
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: People say I'm extravagant because I want to be surrounded by beauty. But tell me, who wants to be surrounded by garbage?
author: Imelda Marcos

quote: People say that if you find water rising up to your ankle, that's the time to do something about it, not when it's around your neck.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: People say that money is not the key to happiness, but I always figured if you have enough money, you can have a key made.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: People say women shouldn't have long hair over a certain age, but I've never done what everyone says.
author: Jane Seymour

quote: People say you favor assassination, what do you think war is? Except that it's assassination on a much larger scale, a much more horrific scale.
author: John Bolton

quote: People see God every day, they just don't recognize him.
author: Pearl Bailey

quote: People should have freedom in their pilgrimages and tours. They should come and visit historical monuments and sites - let's say the sites around Iran - where they can easily engage in wide- scale contacts with others.
author: Mahmoud Ahmadinejad

quote: People sleep peaceably in their beds at night only because rough men stand ready to do violence on their behalf.
author: George Orwell

quote: People talk about doom-laden scenarios happening in the future: they are happening in Africa now. You can see it perfectly clearly. Periodic famines are due to too many people living on land that can't sustain them.
author: David Attenborough

quote: People talk about the courage of condemned men walking to the place of execution: sometimes it needs as much courage to walk with any kind of bearing towards another person's habitual misery.
author: Graham Greene

quote: People tell me they idolise me, want to be like me, but I tell them, 'trust me, you don't want my life.' I've been a very tortured soul.
author: Phil Spector

quote: People think I'm crazy because I travel too much, but I haven't been doing any of that lately because I got a little sick this year and I've tried to take care of it.
author: Lee Hazlewood

quote: People think computers will keep them from making mistakes. They're wrong. With computers you make mistakes faster.
author: Adam Osborne

quote: People think that computer science is the art of geniuses but the actual reality is the opposite, just many people doing things that build on eachother, like a wall of mini stones.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: People think that if you look fairly reasonable, you can't possibly act, and as I only care about acting, I think beauty can be a great handicap.
author: Vivien Leigh

quote: People try much less hard to make a marriage work than they used to fifty years ago. Divorce is easier.
author: Mary Wesley

quote: People usually think according to their inclinations, speak according to their learning and ingrained opinions, but generally act according to custom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: People who are always taking care of their health are like misers, who are hoarding a treasure which they have never spirit enough to enjoy.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: People who are more than casually interested in computers should have at least some idea of what the underlying hardware is like. Otherwise the programs they write will be pretty weird.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: People who believe they have the power to exercise some measure of control over their lives are healthier, more effective and more successful than those who lack faith in their ability to effect changes in their lives.
author: Albert Bandura

quote: People who cannot find time for recreation are obliged sooner or later to find time for illness.
author: John Wanamaker

quote: People who don't know how to keep themselves healthy ought to have the decency to get themselves buried, and not waste time about it.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: People who don't read seem to me mysterious. I don't know how they think or learn about other people. Novels are a very important part of our education.
author: Nina Bawden

quote: People who enjoy meetings should not be in charge of anything.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: People who have no hold over their process of thinking are likely to be ruined by liberty of thought. If thought is immature, liberty of thought becomes a method of converting men into animals.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: People who have time on their hands will inevitably waste the time of people who have work to do.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: People who have tried it, tell me that a clear conscience makes you very happy and contented but a full stomach does the business quite as well, and is cheaper, and more easily obtained.
author: Jerome K. Jerome

quote: People who identify themselves as conservatives donate money to charity more often than people who identify themselves as liberals. They donate more money and a higher percentage of their incomes.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: People who insist on telling their dreams are among the terrors of the breakfast table.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: People who keep dogs are cowards who haven't got the guts to bite people themselves.
author: August Strindberg

quote: People who keep stiff upper lips find that it's damn hard to smile.
author: Judith Guest

quote: People who know little are usually great talkers, while men who know much say little.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: People who lean on logic and philosophy and rational exposition end by starving the best part of the mind.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: People who make history know nothing about history. You can see that in the sort of history they make.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: People who make music together cannot be enemies, at least while the music lasts.
author: Paul Hindemith

quote: People who overly take care of their health are like misers. They hoard up a treasure which they never enjoy.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: People who refuse to rest honorably on their laurels when they reach retirement age seem very admirable to me.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: People who talk about revolution and class struggle without referring explicitly to everyday life, without understanding what is subversive about love and what is positive in the refusal of constraints, such people have a corpse in their mouth.
author: Raoul Vaneigem

quote: People who think they know everything are a great annoyance to those of us who do.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: People who throw kisses are hopelessly lazy.
author: Bob Hope

quote: People who work together will win, whether it be against complex football defenses, or the problems of modern society.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: People will buy anything that is 'one to a customer.'
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote: People will generally accept facts as truth only if the facts agree with what they already believe.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: People wish to be poets more than they wish to write poetry, and that's a mistake. One should wish to celebrate more than one wishes to be celebrated.
author: Lucille Clifton

quote: People with courage and character always seem sinister to the rest.
author: Hermann Hesse

quote: People with great gifts are easy to find, but symmetrical and balanced ones never.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: People with high blood pressure, diabetes - those are conditions brought about by life style. If you change the life style, those conditions will leave.
author: Dick Gregory

quote: People, and especially theologians, should try to familiarize themselves with scientific ideas. Of course, science is technical in many respects, but there are some very good books that try to set out some of the conceptual structure of science.
author: John Polkinghorne

quote: Perfect as the wing of a bird may be, it will never enable the bird to fly if unsupported by the air. Facts are the air of science. Without them a man of science can never rise.
author: Ivan Pavlov

quote: Perfect freedom is as necessary to the health and vigor of commerce as it is to the health and vigor of citizenship.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: Perfect friendship is the friendship of men who are good, and alike in excellence for these wish well alike to each other qua good, and they are good in themselves.
author: Aristotle

quote: Perfect numbers like perfect men are very rare.
author: Rene Descartes

quote: Perfecting oneself is as much unlearning as it is learning.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: Perfection is attained by slow degrees it requires the hand of time.
author: Voltaire

quote: Perfection of means and confusion of ends seem to characterize our age.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Perhaps I am doomed to retrace my steps under the illusion that I am exploring, doomed to try and learn what I should simply recognize, learning a mere fraction of what I have forgotten.
author: Andre Breton

quote: Perhaps I know best why it is man alone who laughs he alone suffers so deeply that he had to invent laughter.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Perhaps in time the so-called Dark Ages will be thought of as including our own.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Perhaps it is a universal truth that the loss of liberty at home is to be charged to provisions against danger, real or pretended, from abroad.
author: James Madison

quote: Perhaps it is because cats do not live by human patterns, do not fit themselves into prescribed behavior, that they are so united to creative people.
author: Andre Norton

quote: Perhaps it sounds ridiculous, but the best thing that young filmmakers should do is to get hold of a camera and some film and make a movie of any kind at all.
author: Stanley Kubrick

quote: Perhaps it would be better for science, that all criticism should be avowed.
author: Charles Babbage

quote: Perhaps it's good for one to suffer. Can an artist do anything if he's happy? Would he ever want to do anything? What is art, after all, but a protest against the horrible inclemency of life?
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Perhaps life is just that... a dream and a fear.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: Perhaps my problem in marriage-and it is the problem of many women-was to want both intimacy and independence. It is a difficult line to walk, yet both needs are important to a marriage.
author: Hedy Lamarr

quote: Perhaps nature is our best assurance of immortality.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Perhaps no person can be a poet, or even enjoy poetry, without a certain unsoundness of mind.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

quote: Perhaps one of the most important accomplishments of my administration has been minding my own business.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: Perhaps one of the only positive pieces of advice that I was ever given was that supplied by an old courtier who observed: Only two rules really count. Never miss an opportunity to relieve yourself never miss a chance to sit down and rest your feet.
author: King Edward VIII

quote: Perhaps people, and kids especially, are spoiled today, because all the kids today have cars, it seems. When I was young you were lucky to have a bike.
author: James Cagney

quote: Perhaps the fact that we have seen millions voting themselves into complete dependence on a tyrant has made our generation understand that to choose one's government is not necessarily to secure freedom.
author: Friedrich August von Hayek

quote: Perhaps the greatest social service that can be rendered by anybody to the country and to mankind is to bring up a family.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Perhaps the mission of those who love mankind is to make people laugh at the truth, to make truth laugh, because the only truth lies in learning to free ourselves from insane passion for the truth.
author: Umberto Eco

quote: Perhaps the prevalence of pedantry may be largely accounted for by the common error of thinking that, because useful knowledge should be remembered, any kind of knowledge that is at all worth learning should be remembered too.
author: Albert J. Nock

quote: Perhaps there is an idea among Japanese students that one general difference between Japanese and Western poetry is that the former cultivates short forms and the latter longer ones, gut this is only in part true.
author: Lafcadio Hearn

quote: Perhaps travel cannot prevent bigotry, but by demonstrating that all peoples cry, laugh, eat, worry, and die, it can introduce the idea that if we try and understand each other, we may even become friends.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Permanent success cannot be achieved except by incessant intellectual labour, always inspired by the ideal.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

quote: Perpetual devotion to what a man calls his business is only to be sustained by perpetual neglect of many other things.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Perpetual optimism is a force multiplier.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Persecution is not an original feature in any religion but it is always the strongly marked feature of all religions established by law.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Perseverance is a great element of success. If you only knock long enough and loud enough at the gate, you are sure to wake up somebody.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Perseverance is failing 19 times and succeeding the 20th.
author: Julie Andrews

quote: Personal beauty is a greater recommendation than any letter of reference.
author: Aristotle

quote: Personality is everything in art and poetry.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Personality is only ripe when a man has made the truth his own.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Personality is the most important thing to an actress's success.
author: Mae West

quote: Personally, I don't like a girlfriend to have a husband. If she'll fool her husband, I figure she'll fool me.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Personally, I like two types of men - domestic and foreign.
author: Mae West

quote: Personally, I would be delighted if there were a life after death, especially if it permitted me to continue to learn about this world and others, if it gave me a chance to discover how history turns out.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Pessimism is only the name that men of weak nerves give to wisdom.
author: Bernard De Voto

quote: Pessimism leads to weakness, optimism to power.
author: William James

quote: Pessimism only describes an attitude, and not facts, and hence is entirely subjective.
author: Francis Parker Yockey

quote: Philanthropic colonization is a failure. National colonization will succeed.
author: Theodor Herzl

quote: Philanthropy is involved with basic innovations that transform society, not simply maintaining the status quo or filling basic social needs that were formerly the province of the public sector.
author: David Rockefeller

quote: Philosophy and Art both render the invisible visible by imagination.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: Philosophy begins in wonder. And, at the end, when philosophic thought has done its best, the wonder remains.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Philosophy is a battle against the bewitchment of our intelligence by means of language.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: Philosophy is an attempt by man to find cause and effect. Religion has the same goal.
author: Al Goldstein

quote: Philosophy is the highest music.
author: Plato

quote: Philosophy would render us entirely Pyrrhonian, were not nature too strong for it.
author: David Hume

quote: Photography is more than a medium for factual communication of ideas. It is a creative art.
author: Ansel Adams

quote: Photography is truth. The cinema is truth twenty-four times per second.
author: Jean-Luc Godard

quote: Photography suits the temper of this age - of active bodies and minds. It is a perfect medium for one whose mind is teeming with ideas, imagery, for a prolific worker who would be slowed down by painting or sculpting, for one who sees quickly and acts decisively, accurately.
author: Edward Weston

quote: Photography takes an instant out of time, altering life by holding it still.
author: Dorothea Lange

quote: Physical bravery is an animal instinct moral bravery is much higher and truer courage.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Physical courage is a great test.
author: Oriana Fallaci

quote: Physical strength can never permanently withstand the impact of spiritual force.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Physical strength in a woman - that's what I am.
author: Tina Turner

quote: Physics is experience, arranged in economical order.
author: Ernst Mach

quote: Pick the day. Enjoy it - to the hilt. The day as it comes. People as they come... The past, I think, has helped me appreciate the present - and I don't want to spoil any of it by fretting about the future.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: Pictures deface walls more often than they decorate them.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Pictures must not be too picturesque.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Piecemeal social engineering resembles physical engineering in regarding the ends as beyond the province of technology.
author: Karl Popper

quote: Piety is not a goal but a means to attain through the purest peace of mind the highest culture.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Piety requires us to honor truth above our friends.
author: Aristotle

quote: Pithy sentences are like sharp nails which force truth upon our memory.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Pity may represent little more than the impersonal concern which prompts the mailing of a check, but true sympathy is the personal concern which demands the giving of one's soul.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Pity the selfishness of lovers: it is brief, a forlorn hope it is impossible.
author: Elizabeth Bowen

quote: Plain women know more about men than beautiful women do.
author: Katharine Hepburn

quote: Planning ahead is a measure of class. The rich and even the middle class plan for future generations, but the poor can plan ahead only a few weeks or days.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Plant and your spouse plants with you weed and you weed alone.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Plant thy foot firmly in the prints which His foot has made before thee.
author: Joseph Barber Lightfoot

quote: Plants that wake when others sleep. Timid jasmine buds that keep their fragrance to themselves all day, but when the sunlight dies away let the delicious secret out to every breeze that roams about.
author: Thomas Moore

quote: Plato is dear to me, but dearer still is truth.
author: Aristotle

quote: Plato's philosophy is a dignified preface to future religion.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Play is often talked about as if it were a relief from serious learning. But for children play is serious learning. Play is really the work of childhood.
author: Fred Rogers

quote: Please know that I am aware of the hazards. I want to do it because I want to do it. Women must try to do things as men have tried. When they fail, their failure must be a challenge to others.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: Please write music like Wagner, only louder.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: Pleasure and freedom from pain, are the only things desirable as ends.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Aristotle

quote: Pleasure only starts once the worm has got into the fruit, to become delightful happiness must be tainted with poison.
author: Georges Bataille

quote: Plot, rules, nor even poetry, are not half so great beauties in tragedy or comedy as a just imitation of nature, of character, of the passions and their operations in diversified situations.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: Poetry a criticism of life under the conditions fixed for such a criticism by the laws of poetic truth and poetic beauty.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: Poetry and consumption are the most flattering of diseases.
author: William Shenstone

quote: Poetry and progress are like two ambitious men who hate one another with an instinctive hatred, and when they meet upon the same road, one of them has to give place.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: Poetry consists in a rhyming dictionary and things seen.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Poetry fettered, fetters the human race. Nations are destroyed or flourish in proportion as their poetry, painting, and music are destroyed or flourish.
author: William Blake

quote: Poetry for me is as much a spiritual practice as sexual ecstasy is.
author: James Broughton

quote: Poetry had far better imply things than preach them directly... in the open pulpit her voice grows hoarse and fails.
author: F. L. Lucas

quote: Poetry has been to me its own exceeding great reward it has given me the habit of wishing to discover the good and beautiful in all that meets and surrounds me.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Poetry has done enough when it charms, but prose must also convince.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Poetry involves the mysteries of the irrational perceived through rational words.
author: Vladimir Nabokov

quote: Poetry is a beautiful way of spoiling prose, and the laborious art of exchanging plain sense for harmony.
author: Horace Walpole

quote: Poetry is a matter of life, not just a matter of language.
author: Lucille Clifton

quote: Poetry is a mirror which makes beautiful that which is distorted.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Poetry is a mixture of common sense, which not all have, with an uncommon sense, which very few have.
author: John Masefield

quote: Poetry is a phantom script telling how rainbows are made and why they go away.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Poetry is a special use of language that opens onto the real. The business of the poet is truth telling, which is why in the Celtic tradition no one could be a teacher unless he or she was a poet.
author: Huston Smith

quote: Poetry is a succession of questions which the poet constantly poses.
author: Vicente Aleixandre

quote: Poetry is a sword of lightning, ever unsheathed, which consumes the scabbard that would contain it.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Poetry is a way of taking life by the throat.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Poetry is about the grief. Politics is about the grievance.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Poetry is above all a concentration of the power of language, which is the power of our ultimate relationship to everything in the universe.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: Poetry is adolescence fermented, and thus preserved.
author: Jose Ortega y Gasset

quote: Poetry is all that is worth remembering in life.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Poetry is also the physical self of the poet, and it is impossible to separate the poet from his poetry.
author: Salvatore Quasimodo

quote: Poetry is always slightly mysterious, and you wonder what is your relationship to it.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: Poetry is an echo, asking a shadow to dance.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Poetry is an orphan of silence. The words never quite equal the experience behind them.
author: Charles Simic

quote: Poetry is as precise a thing as geometry.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: Poetry is emotion put into measure. The emotion must come by nature, but the measure can be acquired by art.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: Poetry is fascinating. As soon as it begins the poetry has changed the thing into something extra, and somehow prose can go over into poetry.
author: Michael Tippett

quote: Poetry is finer and more philosophical than history for poetry expresses the universal, and history only the particular.
author: Aristotle

quote: Poetry is just the evidence of life. If your life is burning well, poetry is just the ash.
author: Leonard Cohen

quote: Poetry is life distilled.
author: Gwendolyn Brooks

quote: Poetry is like making a joke. If you get one word wrong at the end of a joke, you've lost the whole thing.
author: W. S. Merwin

quote: Poetry is nearer to vital truth than history.
author: Plato

quote: Poetry is not a turning loose of emotion, but an escape from emotion it is not the expression of personality, but an escape from personality. But, of course, only those who have personality and emotions know what it means to want to escape from these things.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Poetry is not an expression of the party line. It's that time of night, lying in bed, thinking what you really think, making the private world public, that's what the poet does.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: Poetry is not only dream and vision it is the skeleton architecture of our lives. It lays the foundations for a future of change, a bridge across our fears of what has never been before.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: Poetry is simply the most beautiful, impressive, and widely effective mode of saying things.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: Poetry is so vital to us until school spoils it.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Poetry is something to make us wiser and better, by continually revealing those types of beauty and truth, which God has set in all men's souls.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: Poetry is the art of substantiating shadows, and of lending existence to nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Poetry is the art of uniting pleasure with truth.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Poetry is the deification of reality.
author: Edith Sitwell

quote: Poetry is the mother-tongue of the human race.
author: Johann Georg Hamann

quote: Poetry is the one place where people can speak their original human mind. It is the outlet for people to say in public what is known in private.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: Poetry is the opening and closing of a door, leaving those who look through to guess about what is seen during the moment.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Poetry is the record of the best and happiest moments of the happiest and best minds.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Poetry is the revelation of a feeling that the poet believes to be interior and personal which the reader recognizes as his own.
author: Salvatore Quasimodo

quote: Poetry is the rhythmical creation of beauty in words.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Poetry is the spontaneous overflow of powerful feelings: it takes its origin from emotion recollected in tranquility.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: Poetry is the synthesis of hyacinths and biscuits.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Poetry is the universal language which the heart holds with nature and itself. He who has a contempt for poetry, cannot have much respect for himself, or for anything else.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Poetry is thoughts that breathe, and words that burn.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: Poetry is what gets lost in translation.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Poetry is when an emotion has found its thought and the thought has found words.
author: Robert Frost

quote: Poetry isn't a profession, it's a way of life. It's an empty basket you put your life into it and make something out of that.
author: Mary Oliver

quote: Poetry lifts the veil from the hidden beauty of the world, and makes familiar objects be as if they were not familiar.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Poetry may make us from time to time a little more aware of the deeper, unnamed feelings which form the substratum of our being, to which we rarely penetrate for our lives are mostly a constant evasion of ourselves.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Poetry must have something in it that is barbaric, vast and wild.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Poetry operates by hints and dark suggestions. It is full of secrets and hidden formulae, like a witch's brew.
author: Anthony Hecht

quote: Poetry proceeds from the totality of man, sense, imagination, intellect, love, desire, instinct, blood and spirit together.
author: Jacques Maritain

quote: Poetry remembers that it was an oral art before it was a written art.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: Poetry should be great and unobtrusive, a thing which enters into one's soul, and does not startle it or amaze it with itself, but with its subject.
author: John Keats

quote: Poetry should help, not only to refine the language of the time, but to prevent it from changing too rapidly.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: Poetry should surprise by a fine excess and not by singularity, it should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
author: John Keats

quote: Poetry should... should strike the reader as a wording of his own highest thoughts, and appear almost a remembrance.
author: John Keats

quote: Poetry surrounds us everywhere, but putting it on paper is, alas, not so easy as looking at it.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote: Poetry, even when apparently most fantastic, is always a revolt against artifice, a revolt, in a sense, against actuality.
author: James Joyce

quote: Poetry, it is often said and loudly so, is life's true mirror. But a monkey looking into a work of literature looks in vain for Socrates.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: Poetry: the best words in the best order.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: Poets are the only people to whom love is not only a crucial, but an indispensable experience, which entitles them to mistake it for a universal one.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Poets are the sense, philosophers the intelligence of humanity.
author: Samuel Beckett

quote: Poets are the unacknowledged legislators of the world.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Poets have said that the reason to have children is to give yourself immortality. Immortality? Now that I have five children, my only hope is that they are all out of the house before I die.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Poets say science takes away from the beauty of the stars - mere globs of gas atoms. I, too, can see the stars on a desert night, and feel them. But do I see less or more?
author: Richard P. Feynman

quote: Poets should ignore most criticism and get on with making poetry.
author: Anne Stevenson

quote: Poets utter great and wise things which they do not themselves understand.
author: Plato

quote: Politeness is to human nature what warmth is to wax.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Political Freedom without economic equality is a pretense, a fraud, a lie and the workers want no lying.
author: Mikhail Bakunin

quote: Political correctness? In my humor, I never talk about politics. I was never much into all that.
author: Don Rickles

quote: Political ideology can corrupt the mind, and science.
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: Political liberty, the peace of a nation, and science itself are gifts for which Fate demands a heavy tax in blood!
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Political promises are much like marriage vows. They are made at the beginning of the relationship between candidate and voter, but are quickly forgotten.
author: Dick Gregory

quote: Political tyranny is nothing compared to the social tyranny and a reformer who defies society is a more courageous man than a politician who defies Government.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: Politicians also have no leisure, because they are always aiming at something beyond political life itself, power and glory, or happiness.
author: Aristotle

quote: Politicians should read science fiction, not westerns and detective stories.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: Politicians, like generals, have a tendency to fight the last war.
author: John Bolton

quote: Politicians... talk in generalities and lies, and I think they've caused all our grief. They're so awful, they're really funny. I hate thinking this because my dad loved politics.
author: Paul Lynde

quote: Politics I conceive to be nothing more than the science of the ordered progress of society along the lines of greatest usefulness and convenience to itself.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: Politics and the pulpit are terms that have little agreement.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Politics are a very unsatisfactory game.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Politics are beautiful. They enable a community to live collectively with one another. It's not about stabbing each other in the back it's about enabling people to reach their dreams and pursue happiness.
author: Ben Nicholson

quote: Politics are not the task of a Christian.
author: Dietrich Bonhoeffer

quote: Politics are very much like war. We may even have to use poison gas at times.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Politics disgusts me.
author: Brigitte Bardot

quote: Politics doesn't make strange bedfellows - marriage does.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Politics has become so expensive that it takes a lot of money even to be defeated.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Politics have no relation to morals.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Politics in America is the binding secular religion.
author: Theodore White

quote: Politics in a literary work, is like a gun shot in the middle of a concert, something vulgar, and however, something which is impossible to ignore.
author: Stendhal

quote: Politics is a blood sport.
author: Aneurin Bevan

quote: Politics is a science. You can demonstrate that you are right and that others are wrong.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Politics is almost as exciting as war, and quite as dangerous. In war you can only be killed once, but in politics many times.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Politics is an act of faith you have to show some kind of confidence in the intellectual and moral capacity of the public.
author: George McGovern

quote: Politics is applesauce.
author: Will Rogers

quote: Politics is for the present, but an equation is for eternity.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Politics is human beings it's addition rather than subtraction.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Politics is not a game. It is an earnest business.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Politics is not an exact science.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Politics is not bean bags. It's serious, tough stuff.
author: Colin Powell

quote: Politics is not my life. I have a career in radio and another career in film.
author: Jesse Ventura

quote: Politics is not the art of the possible. It consists in choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Politics is perhaps the only profession for which no preparation is thought necessary.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: Politics is repetition. It is not change. Change is something beyond what we call politics. Change is the essence politics is supposed to be the means to bring into being.
author: Kate Millett

quote: Politics is such a torment that I advise everyone I love not to mix with it.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Politics is the ability to foretell what is going to happen tomorrow, next week, next month and next year. And to have the ability afterwards to explain why it didn't happen.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Politics is the art of choosing between the disastrous and the unpalatable.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Politics is the art of controlling your environment.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: Politics is the art of looking for trouble, finding it everywhere, diagnosing it incorrectly and applying the wrong remedies.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: Politics is the art of preventing people from busying themselves with what is their own business.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Politics is the art of the next best.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Politics is the art of the possible.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Politics is the diversion of trivial men who, when they succeed at it, become important in the eyes of more trivial men.
author: George Jean Nathan

quote: Politics is the reflex of the business and industrial world.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: Politics is the womb in which war develops.
author: Karl Von Clausewitz

quote: Politics is too partisan, and sometimes patriotism is cast aside. Patriotism is honor and love of your country and your brothers and sisters. With politics I get the impression that it's all about what's good for the party and not necessarily what's good for the country.
author: Ricardo Montalban

quote: Politics is very interesting and always leads to conflict.
author: Ridley Scott

quote: Politics makes me sick.
author: William Howard Taft

quote: Politics makes strange bedfellows.
author: Charles Dudley Warner

quote: Politics ruins the character.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: Politics, as a practice, whatever its professions, has always been the systematic organization of hatreds.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Politics, as a practise, whatever its professions, has always been the systematic organization of hatreds.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Politics, as the word is commonly understood, are nothing but corruptions.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Politics, like theater, is one of those things where you've got to be wise enough to know when to leave.
author: Richard Lamm

quote: Politics... have always been the systematic organization of hatreds.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Polygraph tests are 20th-century witchcraft.
author: Sam Ervin

quote: Poor David Hume is dying fast, but with more real cheerfulness and good humor and with more real resignation to the necessary course of things, than any whining Christian ever dyed with pretended resignation to the will of God.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Poor, darling fellow - he died of food. He was killed by the dinner table.
author: Diana Vreeland

quote: Pop changes week to week, month to month. But great music is like literature.
author: Ravi Shankar

quote: Pop songs are not as graceful as they used to be. Performers today haven't gone through the regimen of learning how to write. And of course, everyone wants to own copyrights.
author: Hal David

quote: Popular art is the dream of society it does not examine itself.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Popular opinions, on subjects not palpable to sense, are often true, but seldom or never the whole truth.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: Population, when unchecked, goes on doubling itself every 25 years or increases in a geometrical ratio.
author: Thomas Malthus

quote: Positioning the brand and regaining trust are all smart things for us to do and those are the litmus tests for any decisions we make.
author: John McKinley

quote: Positive feelings come from being honest about yourself and accepting your personality, and physical characteristics, warts and all and, from belonging to a family that accepts you without question.
author: Willard Scott

quote: Posterity: you will never know how much it has cost my generation to preserve your freedom. I hope you will make good use of it.
author: John Quincy Adams

quote: Potentially, a government is the most dangerous threat to man's rights: it holds a legal monopoly on the use of physical force against legally disarmed victims.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Poverty is multidimensional. It extends beyond money incomes to education, health care, political participation and advancement of one's own culture and social organisation.
author: Atal Bihari Vajpayee

quote: Poverty is uncomfortable but nine times out of ten the best thing that can happen to a young man is to be tossed overboard and compelled to sink or swim.
author: James A. Garfield

quote: Poverty makes you sad as well as wise.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Power acquired by violence is only a usurpation, and lasts only as long as the force of him who commands prevails over that of those who obey.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: Power always thinks it has a great soul and vast views beyond the comprehension of the weak.
author: John Adams

quote: Power always thinks... that it is doing God's service when it is violating all his laws.
author: John Adams

quote: Power and speed be hands and feet.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Power and violence are opposites where the one rules absolutely, the other is absent. Violence appears where power is in jeopardy, but left to its own course it ends in power's disappearance.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Power can be taken, but not given. The process of the taking is empowerment in itself.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: Power concedes nothing without a demand. It never did and it never will.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: Power corrupts, and absolute power corrupts absolutely.
author: Lord Acton

quote: Power does not corrupt men fools, however, if they get into a position of power, corrupt power.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Power does not corrupt. Fear corrupts... perhaps the fear of a loss of power.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Power has only one duty - to secure the social welfare of the People.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Power in America today is control of the means of communication.
author: Theodore White

quote: Power in defense of freedom is greater than power in behalf of tyranny and oppression.
author: Malcolm X

quote: Power is action the electoral principle is discussion. No political action is possible when discussion is permanently established.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Power is always dangerous. Power attracts the worst and corrupts the best.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: Power is given only to those who dare to lower themselves and pick it up. Only one thing matters, one thing to be able to dare!
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: Power is my mistress. I have worked too hard at her conquest to allow anyone to take her away from me.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Power is no blessing in itself, except when it is used to protect the innocent.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: Power is not a means, it is an end. One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution one makes the revolution in order to establish the dictatorship.
author: George Orwell

quote: Power is not alluring to pure minds.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Power is not an institution, and not a structure neither is it a certain strength we are endowed with it is the name that one attributes to a complex strategical situation in a particular society.
author: Michel Foucault

quote: Power is not revealed by striking hard or often, but by striking true.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Power is not something that can be assumed or discarded at will like underwear.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: Power is not sufficient evidence of truth.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Power is of two kinds. One is obtained by the fear of punishment and the other by acts of love. Power based on love is a thousand times more effective and permanent then the one derived from fear of punishment.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Power is paradoxical.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: Power is the great aphrodisiac.
author: Henry A. Kissinger

quote: Power is the most persuasive rhetoric.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Power must be used, but it must be tempered by soul-searching and the recognition of our human capacity for error. That is the maxim that should inform our approach to every challenge, from reforming state government to engaging in foreign affairs.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: Power never takes a back step only in the face of more power.
author: Malcolm X

quote: Power ought to serve as a check to power.
author: Charles de Secondat

quote: Power over a man's subsistence is power over his will.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: Power should not be concentrated in the hands of so few, and powerlessness in the hands of so many.
author: Maggie Kuhn

quote: Power tends to corrupt and absolute power corrupts absolutely.
author: Lord Acton

quote: Power without a nation's confidence is nothing.
author: Catherine the Great

quote: Power without abuse loses its charm.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Power, after love, is the first source of happiness.
author: Stendhal

quote: Practical politics consists in ignoring facts.
author: Henry Adams

quote: Practical wisdom is only to be learned in the school of experience. Precepts and instruction are useful so far as they go, but, without the discipline of real life, they remain of the nature of theory only.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Practically every environmental problem we have can be traced to our addiction to fossil fuels, primarily oil.
author: Dennis Weaver

quote: Practically speaking, your religion is the story you tell about your life.
author: Andrew Greeley

quote: Practice means to perform, over and over again in the face of all obstacles, some act of vision, of faith, of desire. Practice is a means of inviting the perfection desired.
author: Martha Graham

quote: Practice puts brains in your muscles.
author: Sam Snead

quote: Praise or blame has but a momentary effect on the man whose love of beauty in the abstract makes him a severe critic on his own works.
author: John Keats

quote: Pray as though everything depended on God. Work as though everything depended on you.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Pray for intestinal fortitude, work hard, and keep the faith. Oh, and pray for good luck, you're gonna need it.
author: Jerry Reed

quote: Pray thee, spare, thyself at times: for it becomes a wise man sometimes to relax the high pressure of his attention to work.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: Prayer does not change God, but it changes him who prays.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: Prayer does not use up artificial energy, doesn't burn up any fossil fuel, doesn't pollute. Neither does song, neither does love, neither does the dance.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Prayer is more than meditation. In meditation the source of strength is one's self. When one prays he goes to a source of strength greater than his own.
author: Chiang Kai-shek

quote: Prayer is more than meditation. In meditation, the source of strength is one's self. When one prays, he goes to a source of strength greater than his own.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: Prayer is simply a two-way conversation between you and God.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Prayer is the key of the morning and the bolt of the evening.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Preach the Gospel at all times and when necessary use words.
author: Francis of Assisi

quote: Preachers in pulpits talked about what a great message is in the book. No matter what you do, somebody always imputes meaning into your books.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: Precepts or maxims are of great weight and a few useful ones on hand do more to produce a happy life than the volumes we can't find.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Prediction is very difficult, especially if it's about the future.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: Pregnancy is a kind of miracle. Especially so in that it proves that a man and woman can conspire to force God to create a new soul.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: Prejudice is a burden that confuses the past, threatens the future and renders the present inaccessible.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: Prejudice is a great time saver. You can form opinions without having to get the facts.
author: E. B. White

quote: Prejudices are so to speak the mechanical instincts of men: through their prejudices they do without any effort many things they would find too difficult to think through to the point of resolving to do them.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: Prepare for death, if here at night you roam, and sign your will before you sup from home.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Prepare for the unknown by studying how others in the past have coped with the unforeseeable and the unpredictable.
author: George S. Patton

quote: Preparing our city to achieve its destiny will require strong leadership.
author: Thomas Menino

quote: President Johnson did not want the Vietnam War to broaden. He wanted the North Vietnamese to leave their brothers in the South alone.
author: William Westmoreland

quote: President Obama is doing the right thing by offering young immigrants, most often in this country through no action of their own, a chance to live and work openly, free from the fear of deportation.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: President Obama's fight for rural America is personal. He was raised by a single mom and grandparents from Kansas. He hails from a farming state, Illinois.
author: Tom Vilsack

quote: Presidential leadership needn't always cost money. Look for low- and no-cost options. They can be surprisingly effective.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Pressure is a word that is misused in our vocabulary. When you start thinking of pressure, it's because you've started to think of failure.
author: Tommy Lasorda

quote: Prestige is the shadow of money and power.
author: C. Wright Mills

quote: Pretend to be dumb, that's the only way to reach old age.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: Prices are important not because money is considered paramount but because prices are a fast and effective conveyor of information through a vast society in which fragmented knowledge must be coordinated.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: Pride is still aiming at the best houses: Men would be angels, angels would be gods. Aspiring to be gods, if angels fell aspiring to be angels men rebel.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Pride slays thanksgiving, but a humble mind is the soil out of which thanks naturally grow. A proud man is seldom a grateful man, for he never thinks he gets as much as he deserves.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Pride, avarice, and envy are in every home.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Pride, envy, avarice - these are the sparks have set on fire the hearts of all men.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: Prince Charles is an absolute Mountbatten. The real intelligence in the royal family comes through my parents to Prince Philip and the children.
author: Lord Mountbatten

quote: Princes and governments are far more dangerous than other elements within society.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: Principles have no real force except when one is well-fed.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Prison continues, on those who are entrusted to it, a work begun elsewhere, which the whole of society pursues on each individual through innumerable mechanisms of discipline.
author: Michel Foucault

quote: Prisons are built with stones of Law. Brothels with the bricks of religion.
author: William Blake

quote: Pro football gave me a good sense of perspective to enter politics: I'd already been booed, cheered, cut, sold, traded and hung in effigy.
author: Jack Kemp

quote: Probability is expectation founded upon partial knowledge. A perfect acquaintance with all the circumstances affecting the occurrence of an event would change expectation into certainty, and leave nether room nor demand for a theory of probabilities.
author: George Boole

quote: Probably millions of Americans got up this morning with a cup of coffee, a cigarette and a donut. No wonder they are sick and fouled up.
author: Jack LaLanne

quote: Probably the happiest period in life most frequently is in middle age, when the eager passions of youth are cooled, and the infirmities of age not yet begun as we see that the shadows, which are at morning and evening so large, almost entirely disappear at midday.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Problems are not stop signs, they are guidelines.
author: Robert H. Schuller

quote: Problems are only opportunities in work clothes.
author: Henry J. Kaiser

quote: Produce great men, the rest follows.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: Productive achievement is a consequence and an expression of health and self-esteem, not its cause.
author: Nathaniel Branden

quote: Productive power is the foundation of a country's economic strength.
author: Stafford Cripps

quote: Profit in business comes from repeat customers, customers that boast about your project or service, and that bring friends with them.
author: W. Edwards Deming

quote: Profit is sweet, even if it comes from deception.
author: Sophocles

quote: Progress however, of the best kind, is comparatively slow. Great results cannot be achieved at once and we must be satisfied to advance in life as we walk, step by step.
author: Samuel Smiles

quote: Progress is a nice word. But change is its motivator. And change has its enemies.
author: Robert Kennedy

quote: Progress is impossible without change, and those who cannot change their minds cannot change anything.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Progress is measured by richness and intensity of experience - by a wider and deeper apprehension of the significance and scope of human existence.
author: Herbert Read

quote: Progress is measured by the degree of differentiation within a society.
author: Herbert Read

quote: Progress was all right. Only it went on too long.
author: James Thurber

quote: Progress would not have been the rarity it is if the early food had not been the late poison.
author: Walter Bagehot

quote: Progressive art can assist people to learn not only about the objective forces at work in the society in which they live, but also about the intensely social character of their interior lives. Ultimately, it can propel people toward social emancipation.
author: Salvador Dali

quote: Prohibit the taking of omens, and do away with superstitious doubts. Then, until death itself comes, no calamity need be feared.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Projecting a persuasive image of a desirable and practical future is extremely important to high morale, to dynamism, to consensus, and in general to help the wheels of society turn smoothly.
author: Herman Kahn

quote: Promise me you'll always remember: You're braver than you believe, and stronger than you seem, and smarter than you think.
author: A. A. Milne

quote: Promises are the uniquely human way of ordering the future, making it predictable and reliable to the extent that this is humanly possible.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Propaganda must appeal to mankind's better judgment and to the necessary belief in a better future. For this belief, the valley of the shadow of death is but a war station on the road to the blessed summit.
author: Christian Lous Lange

quote: Proper school nutrition must be complemented by activities outside of the cafeteria. The decisions parents make to keep their kids healthy are critical in fighting this battle on the home front.
author: Tom Vilsack

quote: Property is intended to serve life, and no matter how much we surround it with rights and respect, it has no personal being. It is part of the earth man walks on. It is not man.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Property is not the sacred right. When a rich man becomes poor it is a misfortune, it is not a moral evil. When a poor man becomes destitute, it is a moral evil, teeming with consequences and injurious to society and morality.
author: Lord Acton

quote: Prophesy is a good line of business, but it is full of risks.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Prose is architecture, not interior decoration, and the Baroque is over.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: Prose talks and poetry sings.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: Prosperity is a great teacher adversity a greater.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Prosperity is not without many fears and distastes adversity not without many comforts and hopes.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Prosperity is the best protector of principle.
author: Mark Twain

quote: Prosperous farmers mean more employment, more prosperity for the workers and the business men of every industrial area in the whole country.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Proud people breed sad sorrows for themselves.
author: Emily Bronte

quote: Proverbs are always platitudes until you have personally experienced the truth of them.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Proverbs are short sentences drawn from long experience.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: Providence has nothing good or high in store for one who does not resolutely aim at something high or good. A purpose is the eternal condition of success.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Prudence is but experience, which equal time, equally bestows on all men, in those things they equally apply themselves unto.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Psychology is the science of the act of experiencing, and deals with the whole system of such acts as they make up mental life.
author: Samuel Alexander

quote: Psychology is the science of the intellects, characters and behavior of animals including man.
author: Edward Thorndike

quote: Psychotherapy theory turns it all on you: you are the one who is wrong. If a kid is having trouble or is discouraged, the problem is not just inside the kid it's also in the system, the society.
author: James Hillman

quote: Public opinion is no more than this: what people think that other people think.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: Pugnacity is a form of courage, but a very bad form.
author: Sinclair Lewis

quote: Punishment is now unfashionable... because it creates moral distinctions among men, which, to the democratic mind, are odious. We prefer a meaningless collective guilt to a meaningful individual responsibility.
author: Thomas Szasz

quote: Punishment may make us obey the orders we are given, but at best it will only teach an obedience to authority, not a self-control which enhances our self-respect.
author: Bruno Bettelheim

quote: Pure drawing is an abstraction. Drawing and colour are not distinct, everything in nature is coloured.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: Pure mathematics is, in its way, the poetry of logical ideas.
author: Albert Einstein
