quote: Pure phenomenology claims to be the science of pure phenomena. This concept of the phenomenon, which was developed under various names as early as the eighteenth century without being clarified, is what we shall have to deal with first of all.
author: Edmund Husserl

quote: Pure truth cannot be assimilated by the crowd it must be communicated by contagion.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: Puritanism. The haunting fear that someone, somewhere, may be happy.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: Purity is not imposed upon us as though it were a kind of punishment, it is one of those mysterious but obvious conditions of that supernatural knowledge of ourselves in the Divine, which we speak of as faith. Impurity does not destroy this knowledge, it slays our need for it.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: Purity of personal life is the one indispensable condition for building up a sound education.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Pursue some path, however narrow and crooked, in which you can walk with love and reverence.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Pushing production out of America to nations without our environmental standards increases global environmental risks.
author: Frank Murkowski

quote: Put more trust in nobility of character than in an oath.
author: Solon

quote: Put off your imagination, as you put off your overcoat, when you enter the laboratory. Put it on again, as you put on your overcoat, when you leave.
author: Claude Bernard

quote: Put two or three men in positions of conflicting authority. This will force them to work at loggerheads, allowing you to be the ultimate arbiter.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Put your faith in God and confidence in yourself.
author: Alberta Hunter

quote: Put your mind on the gospel. And remember - there's one God for all.
author: Mahalia Jackson

quote: Put your trust in God but be sure to keep your powder dry.
author: Oliver Cromwell

quote: Put your trust in the Lord and go ahead. Worry gets you no place.
author: Roy Acuff

quote: Putting a little time aside for clean fun and good humor is very necessary to relieve the tensions of our time.
author: Hattie McDaniel

quote: Putting is like wisdom - partly a natural gift and partly the accumulation of experience.
author: Arnold Palmer

quote: Putting women in military combat is the cutting edge of the feminist goal to force us into an androgynous society.
author: Phyllis Schlafly

quote: Quakers almost as good as colored. They call themselves friends and you can trust them every time.
author: Harriet Tubman

quote: Quality in a classical Greek sense is how to live with grace and intelligence, with bravery and mercy.
author: Theodore White

quote: Quality is not an act, it is a habit.
author: Aristotle

quote: Quantity in food is more to be regarded than quality. A full meal is a great enemy both to study and industry.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Quarreling over food and drink, having neither scruples nor shame, not knowing right from wrong, not trying to avoid death or injury, not fearful of greater strength or of greater numbers, greedily aware only of food and drink - such is the bravery of the dog and boar.
author: Xun Zi

quote: Quentin and I were constantly finding something new that we had in common and comic books were one of them. I think we were talking about comic books much earlier in our relationship, before I had the part.
author: David Carradine

quote: Quentin is very organic there was no way that he was going to put someone else's hand in there and anyway, my hands are kind of famous. It seemed right.
author: David Carradine

quote: Question everything. Learn something. Answer nothing.
author: Euripides

quote: Question with boldness even the existence of a God because, if there be one, he must more approve of the homage of reason, than that of blind-folded fear.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: Quit worrying about your health. It will go away.
author: Robert Orben

quote: Race hate isn't human nature race hate is the abandonment of human nature.
author: Orson Welles

quote: Racism is a refuge for the ignorant. It seeks to divide and to destroy. It is the enemy of freedom, and deserves to be met head-on and stamped out.
author: Pierre Berton

quote: Racism is still with us. But it is up to us to prepare our children for what they have to meet, and, hopefully, we shall overcome.
author: Rosa Parks

quote: Racism is taught in our society, it is not automatic. It is learned behavior toward persons with dissimilar physical characteristics.
author: Alex Haley

quote: Raising children is a creative endeavor, an art rather than a science.
author: Bruno Bettelheim

quote: Raising children is an incredibly hard and risky business in which no cumulative wisdom is gained: each generation repeats the mistakes the previous one made.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Rare as is true love, true friendship is rarer.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Rare is the union of beauty and purity.
author: Juvenal

quote: Rarely do great beauty and great virtue dwell together.
author: Petrarch

quote: Rarely do we find men who willingly engage in hard, solid thinking. There is an almost universal quest for easy answers and half-baked solutions. Nothing pains some people more than having to think.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Rarely promise, but, if lawful, constantly perform.
author: William Penn

quote: Rashness belongs to youth prudence to old age.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Rather than love, than money, than fame, give me truth.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Rather than turning away from the staggering scale and depth of misery caused by war, we must strive to develop our capacity to empathize and feel the sufferings of others.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Rationalism and Newtonian science has lured us into dark woods, but a new metaphysics can rescue us.
author: Huston Smith

quote: Reactionary: a man walking backwards with his face to the future.
author: Aneurin Bevan

quote: Read as you taste fruit or savor wine, or enjoy friendship, love or life.
author: George Herbert

quote: Read no history: nothing but biography, for that is life without theory.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Read the Bible. Work hard and honestly. And don't complain.
author: Billy Graham

quote: Read the best books first, or you may not have a chance to read them at all.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Reading - the best state yet to keep absolute loneliness at bay.
author: William Styron

quote: Reading about nature is fine, but if a person walks in the woods and listens carefully, he can learn more than what is in books, for they speak with the voice of God.
author: George Washington Carver

quote: Reading computer manuals without the hardware is as frustrating as reading manuals without the software.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: Reading furnishes the mind only with materials of knowledge it is thinking that makes what we read ours.
author: John Locke

quote: Reading is an art form, and every man can be an artist.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Reading is not a duty, and has consequently no business to be made disagreeable.
author: Aneurin Bevan

quote: Reading isn't good for a ballplayer. Not good for his eyes. If my eyes went bad even a little bit I couldn't hit home runs. So I gave up reading.
author: Babe Ruth

quote: Reading, after a certain age, diverts the mind too much from its creative pursuits. Any man who reads too much and uses his own brain too little falls into lazy habits of thinking.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Reading, solitude, idleness, a soft and sedentary life, intercourse with women and young people, these are perilous paths for a young man, and these lead him constantly into danger.
author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

quote: Real courage is when you know you're licked before you begin, but you begin anyway and see it through no matter what.
author: Harper Lee

quote: Real education must ultimately be limited to men who insist on knowing, the rest is mere sheep-herding.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Real education should consist of drawing the goodness and the best out of our own students. What better books can there be than the book of humanity?
author: Cesar Chavez

quote: Real education should educate us out of self into something far finer into a selflessness which links us with all humanity.
author: Nancy Astor

quote: Real firmness is good for anything strut is good for nothing.
author: Alexander Hamilton

quote: Real freedom lies in wildness, not in civilization.
author: Charles Lindbergh

quote: Real generosity toward the future lies in giving all to the present.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Real knowledge is to know the extent of one's ignorance.
author: Confucius

quote: Real knowledge, like everything else of value, is not to be obtained easily. It must be worked for, studied for, thought for, and, more that all, must be prayed for.
author: Thomas Arnold

quote: Real men are sadly lacking in this world, for when they are put to the test they prove worthless.
author: Franz Liszt

quote: Real nobility is based on scorn, courage, and profound indifference.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Real politics are the possession and distribution of power.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Real popular culture is folk art - coalminers' songs and so forth.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: Real success is not on the stage, but off the stage as a human being, and how you get along with your fellow man.
author: Sammy Davis, Jr.

quote: Real-life people are often the hardest to play, people that you recreate who have actually lived, because you have to live up to people's knowledge of those characters.
author: Derek Jacobi

quote: Realists do not fear the results of their study.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: Reality is merely an illusion, albeit a very persistent one.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Reality must take precedence over public relations, for nature cannot be fooled.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quote: Reality only reveals itself when it is illuminated by a ray of poetry.
author: Georges Braque

quote: Reality seems valueless by comparison with the dreams of fevered imaginations reality is therefore abandoned.
author: Emile Durkheim

quote: Really I don't like human nature unless all candied over with art.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Really big people are, above everything else, courteous, considerate and generous - not just to some people in some circumstances - but to everyone all the time.
author: Thomas J. Watson

quote: Really, I have to laugh because there was a whole set of stories that made me sound like the Dragon Lady, you know, 'tough this and tough that.' Then there is this business about 'gooey.' The bottom line is I am a pragmatic idealist.
author: Madeleine Albright

quote: Really, the potential for, first of all, any college graduate today is enormously good. These are good times for anyone with a college degree today, particularly African Americans. With a college degree today, you really breach the unemployment rate.
author: Alexis Herman

quote: Reason and judgment are the qualities of a leader.
author: Tacitus

quote: Reason is God's crowning gift to man.
author: Sophocles

quote: Reason is a crutch for age, but youth is strong enough to walk alone.
author: John Dryden

quote: Reason is a supple nymph, and slippery as a fish by nature. She had as leave give her kiss to an absurdity any day, as to syllogistic truth. The absurdity may turn out truer.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Reason is not automatic. Those who deny it cannot be conquered by it. Do not count on them. Leave them alone.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Reason is our soul's left hand, faith her right.
author: John Donne

quote: Reason is the natural order of truth but imagination is the organ of meaning.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: Reason respects the differences, and imagination the similitudes of things.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Reason, observation, and experience the holy trinity of science.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Reasonable men adapt to the world around them unreasonable men make the world adapt to them. The world is changed by unreasonable men.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Reasoned arguments and suggestions which make allowance for the full difficulties of the state of war that exists may help, and will always be listened to with respect and sympathy.
author: Stafford Cripps

quote: Rebellion against tyrants is obedience to God.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Recently I heard a 'wise guy' story that I had a party at my home for twenty-five men. It's an interesting story, but I don't know twenty-five men I'd want to invite ta a party.
author: Joan Crawford

quote: Recognition of belligerency as an expression of sympathy is all very well.
author: Henry Cabot Lodge

quote: Recommend to your children virtue that alone can make them happy, not gold.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: Recommend virtue to your children it alone, not money, can make them happy. I speak from experience.
author: Ludwig van Beethoven

quote: Redefining marriage will have huge implications for what is taught in our schools, and for wider society. It will redefine society since the institution of marriage is one of the fundamental building blocks of society. The repercussions of enacting same-sex marriage into law will be immense.
author: Keith O'Brien

quote: Reflect upon your present blessings of which every man has many - not on your past misfortunes, of which all men have some.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: Reform is not pleasant, but grievous no person can reform themselves without suffering and hard work, how much less a nation.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Reformation, like education, is a journey, not a destination.
author: Mary Harris Jones

quote: Refusal to believe until proof is given is a rational position denial of all outside of our own limited experience is absurd.
author: Annie Besant

quote: Regard it as just as desirable to build a chicken house as to build a cathedral.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Regard your soldiers as your children, and they will follow you into the deepest valleys look on them as your own beloved sons, and they will stand by you even unto death.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Regarding life, the wisest men of all ages have judged alike: it is worthless.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Regardless of what one's attitude towards prohibition may be, temperance is something against which, at a time of war, no reasonable protest can be made.
author: William Lyon Mackenzie King

quote: Regularity in the hours of rising and retiring, perseverance in exercise, adaptation of dress to the variations of climate, simple and nutritious aliment, and temperance in all things are necessary branches of the regimen of health.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Rejoicing in our joy, not suffering over our suffering, makes someone a friend.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Relax? How can anybody relax and play golf? You have to grip the club, don't you?
author: Ben Hogan

quote: Religion always remains higher than everyday life. In order to make the elevation towards religion easier for people, religion must be able to alter its forms in relation to the consciousness of modern man.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: Religion and art spring from the same root and are close kin. Economics and art are strangers.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: Religion and political expediency go beautifully hand in hand.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: Religion brings to man an inner strength, spiritual light, and ineffable peace.
author: Alexis Carrel

quote: Religion can be the enemy of God. It's often what happens when God, like Elvis, has left the building.
author: Bono

quote: Religion can emerge in all forms of feeling: here wild anger, there the sweetest pain here consuming hatred, there the childlike smile of serene humility.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Religion can never reform mankind because religion is slavery.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: Religion flourishes in greater purity, without than with the aid of Government.
author: James Madison

quote: Religion has done love a great service by making it a sin.
author: Anatole France

quote: Religion is a candle inside a multicolored lantern. Everyone looks through a particular color, but the candle is always there.
author: Mohammed Naguib

quote: Religion is a matter of the heart. No physical inconvenience can warrant abandonment of one's own religion.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Religion is a mixed blessing.
author: John Shelby Spong

quote: Religion is a strange, wonderful thing. More crimes have been committed in the name of righteousness than any other notion.
author: Tom T. Hall

quote: Religion is absolutely unfathomable. Always and everywhere one can dig more deeply into infinities.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Religion is all bunk.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Religion is an illusion and it derives its strength from the fact that it falls in with our instinctual desires.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: Religion is doing a man does not merely think his religion or feel it, he 'lives' his religion as much as he is able, otherwise it is not religion but fantasy or philosophy.
author: G. I. Gurdjieff

quote: Religion is doing a man does not merely think his religion or feel it, he lives his religion as much as he is able, otherwise it is not religion but fantasy or philosophy.
author: George Gurdjieff

quote: Religion is essentially the art and the theory of the remaking of man. Man is not a finished creation.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: Religion is excellent stuff for keeping common people quiet.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Religion is just mind control.
author: George Carlin

quote: Religion is more than life. Remember that his own religion is the truest to every man even if it stands low in the scales of philosophical comparison.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Religion is not a department of life it is something that enters into the whole of it.
author: Alan Watts

quote: Religion is not only a part of education, an element of humanity, but the center of everything else, always the first and the ultimate, the absolutely original.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Religion is of general and public concern, and on its support depend, in great measure, the peace and good order of government, the safety and happiness of the people.
author: Samuel Chase

quote: Religion is organized to satisfy and guide the soul - politics does the same thing for the body.
author: Joyce Cary

quote: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by the rulers as useful.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Religion is something left over from the infancy of our intelligence, it will fade away as we adopt reason and science as our guidelines.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Religion is the call to confront reality to master the self.
author: Huston Smith

quote: Religion is the frozen thought of man out of which they build temples.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Religion is the impotence of the human mind to deal with occurrences it cannot understand.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Religion is the last refuge of human savagery.
author: Alfred North Whitehead

quote: Religion is the masterpiece of the art of animal training, for it trains people as to how they shall think.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Religion is the opium of the masses.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Religion is the possibility of the removal of every ground of confidence except confidence in God alone.
author: Karl Barth

quote: Religion is the recognition of all our duties as divine commands.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Religion is the sigh of the oppressed creature, the heart of a heartless world, and the soul of soulless conditions. It is the opium of the people.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Religion is the state of being grasped by an ultimate concern, a concern which qualifies all other concerns as preliminary and which itself contains the answer to the question of a meaning of our life.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: Religion is to mysticism what popularization is to science.
author: Henri Bergson

quote: Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Religion must completely encircle the spirit of ethical man like his element, and this luminous chaos of divine thoughts and feelings is called enthusiasm.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Religion must mainly be a matter of principles only. It cannot be a matter of rules. The moment it degenerates into rules, it ceases to be a religion, as it kills responsibility which is an essence of the true religious act.
author: B. R. Ambedkar

quote: Religion needs a baptism of horse sense.
author: Billy Sunday

quote: Religion obviously played a role in this book and the previous book, too.
author: Studs Terkel

quote: Religion often is misused for purely power-political goals, including war.
author: Hans Kung

quote: Religion points to that area of human experience where in one way or another man comes upon mystery as a summons to pilgrimage.
author: Frederick Buechner

quote: Religion promotes the divine discontent within oneself, so that one tries to make oneself a better person and draw oneself closer to God.
author: Cyril Cusack

quote: Religion which lays so many restraints upon us, is a troublesome companion to those who will lay no restraints upon themselves.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Religion without humanity is very poor human stuff.
author: Sojourner Truth

quote: Religion's in the heart, not in the knees.
author: Douglas William Jerrold

quote: Religion, oh, just another of those numerous failures resulting from an attempt to popularize art.
author: Ezra Pound

quote: Religions do a useful thing: they narrow God to the limits of man. Philosophy replies by doing a necessary thing: it elevates man to the plane of God.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Religions, which condemn the pleasures of sense, drive men to seek the pleasures of power. Throughout history power has been the vice of the ascetic.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Religious beliefs evolved by group-selection, tribe competing against tribe, and the illogic of religions is not a weakness but their essential strength.
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: Religious poetry, civic poetry, lyric or dramatic poetry are all categories of man's expression which are valid only if the endorsement of formal content is valid.
author: Salvatore Quasimodo

quote: Religious tolerance is something we should all practice however, there have been more persecution and atrocities committed in the name of religion and religious freedom than anything else.
author: Walter Koenig

quote: Religious wars are not caused by the fact that there is more than one religion, but by the spirit of intolerance... the spread of which can only be regarded as the total eclipse of human reason.
author: Charles de Secondat

quote: Remember always that the composer's pen is still mightier than the bow of the violinist in you lie all the possibilities of the creation of beauty.
author: John Philip Sousa

quote: Remember and help America remember that the fellowship of human beings is more important than the fellowship of race and class and gender in a democratic society.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: Remember even though the outside world might be raining, if you keep on smiling the sun will soon show its face and smile back at you.
author: Anna Lee

quote: Remember happiness doesn't depend upon who you are or what you have it depends solely on what you think.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Remember in 1973 the same science chatter said that the coming Ice Age is going to occur, we're going to lose millions of people. And the politicians knew how to solve it, they just didn't have the courage to solve it they were going to put coal dust on the Arctic.
author: Don Young

quote: Remember me with smiles and laughter, for that is how I will remember you all. If you can only remember me with tears, then don't remember me at all.
author: Laura Ingalls Wilder

quote: Remember that God under the Law ordained a Lamb to be offered up to Him every Morning and Evening.
author: Thomas Ken

quote: Remember that credit is money.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Remember that government doesn't earn one single dollar it spends. In order for you to get money from the government, that money must first be taken from somebody else.
author: Jesse Ventura

quote: Remember that happiness is as contagious as gloom. It should be the first duty of those who are happy to let others know of their gladness.
author: Maurice Maeterlinck

quote: Remember the rights of the savage, as we call him. Remember that the happiness of his humble home, remember that the sanctity of life in the hill villages of Afghanistan, among the winter snows, is as inviolable in the eye of Almighty God, as can be your own.
author: William E. Gladstone

quote: Remember the sufferings of Christ, the storms that were weathered... the crown that came from those sufferings which gave new radiance to the faith... All saints give testimony to the truth that without real effort, no one ever wins the crown.
author: Thomas Becket

quote: Remember we're all in this alone.
author: Lily Tomlin

quote: Remember when life's path is steep to keep your mind even.
author: Horace

quote: Remember, I come from such an excessively overdone, red-carpet place called Hollywood. So I'm used to people blowing up their success in ways that are far above and beyond the truth.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: Remember, I'm a doctor's daughter. So obviously I'm interested in all medical things.
author: Nancy Reagan

quote: Remember, as long as you live, that nothing but strict truth can carry you through the world, with either your conscience or your honor unwounded.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: Remember, each one of us has the power to change the world. Just start thinking peace, and the message will spread quicker than you think.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Remember, half the doctors in this country graduated in the bottom half of their class.
author: Al McGuire

quote: Remember, the storm is a good opportunity for the pine and the cypress to show their strength and their stability.
author: Ho Chi Minh

quote: Reminds me of my safari in Africa. Somebody forgot the corkscrew and for several days we had to live on nothing but food and water.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Removing the faults in a stage-coach may produce a perfect stage-coach, but it is unlikely to produce the first motor car.
author: Edward de Bono

quote: Reporters thrive on the world's misfortune. For this reason they often take an indecent pleasure in events that dismay the rest of humanity.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Representation of the world, like the world itself, is the work of men they describe it from their own point of view, which they confuse with the absolute truth.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: Republicans many times can't get the words 'equality of opportunity' out of their mouths. Their lips do not form that way.
author: Jack Kemp

quote: Republics are created by the virtue, public spirit, and intelligence of the citizens. They fall, when the wise are banished from the public councils, because they dare to be honest, and the profligate are rewarded, because they flatter the people, in order to betray them.
author: Joseph Story

quote: Reputation is favorable notoriety as distinguished from fame, which is permanent approval of great deeds and noble thoughts by the best intelligence of mankind.
author: George William Curtis

quote: Reputation is what men and women think of us character is what God and angels know of us.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: Rereading A.J. Liebling carries me happily back to an age when all good journalists knew they had plenty to be modest about, and were.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Research is creating new knowledge.
author: Neil Armstrong

quote: Research is of considerable importance in certain fields, such as science and history.
author: Fred Saberhagen

quote: Resentment seems to have been given us by nature for a defense, and for a defense only! It is the safeguard of justice and the security of innocence.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Resignation is the courage of Christian sorrow.
author: Alexandre Vinet

quote: Resist your fear fear will never lead to you a positive end. Go for your faith and what you believe.
author: T. D. Jakes

quote: Resistance is feasible even for those who are not heroes by nature, and it is an obligation, I believe, for those who fear the consequences and detest the reality of the attempt to impose American hegemony.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: Resolve and thou art free.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Resolve not to be poor: whatever you have, spend less. Poverty is a great enemy to human happiness it certainly destroys liberty, and it makes some virtues impracticable, and others extremely difficult.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Resolved, that the women of this nation in 1876, have greater cause for discontent, rebellion and revolution than the men of 1776.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: Respect commands itself and can neither be given nor withheld when it is due.
author: Eldridge Cleaver

quote: Respect for ourselves guides our morals, respect for others guides our manners.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Respect for right conduct is felt by every body.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Respect for self is the beginning of cultivating virtue in men and women.
author: Gordon B. Hinckley

quote: Respect is one of life's greatest treasures. I mean, what does it all add up to if you don't have that?
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Respect the burden.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Respect the masterpiece. It is true reverence to man. There is no quality so great, none so much needed now.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Respect your efforts, respect yourself. Self-respect leads to self-discipline. When you have both firmly under your belt, that's real power.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: Respectable means rich, and decent means poor. I should die if I heard my family called decent.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: Responsibility educates.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Rest when you're weary. Refresh and renew yourself, your body, your mind, your spirit. Then get back to work.
author: Ralph Marston

quote: Restlessness is discontent and discontent is the first necessity of progress. Show me a thoroughly satisfied man and I will show you a failure.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Restore human legs as a means of travel. Pedestrians rely on food for fuel and need no special parking facilities.
author: Lewis Mumford

quote: Restoring responsibility and accountability is essential to the economic and fiscal health of our nation.
author: Carl Levin

quote: Results! Why, man, I have gotten a lot of results. I know several thousand things that won't work.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Retaliation is related to nature and instinct, not to law. Law, by definition, cannot obey the same rules as nature.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Retirement at sixty-five is ridiculous. When I was sixty-five I still had pimples.
author: George Burns

quote: Revenge is a kind of wild justice, which the more a man's nature runs to, the more ought law to weed it out.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Revenge is barren of itself: it is the dreadful food it feeds on its delight is murder, and its end is despair.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: Revenge is the naked idol of the worship of a semi-barbarous age.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: Reverse every natural instinct and do the opposite of what you are inclined to do, and you will probably come very close to having a perfect golf swing.
author: Ben Hogan

quote: Revived in this country the long forgotten beauties of Gothic architecture.
author: James Wyatt

quote: Revolutionaries do not make revolutions. The revolutionaries are those who know when power is lying in the street and then they can pick it up.
author: Hannah Arendt

quote: Revolutions are the locomotives of history.
author: Karl Marx

quote: Revolutions are the periods of history when individuals count most.
author: Norman Mailer

quote: Revolutions demand enormous sacrifices and, at the same time, create a new need to change the world again.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: Rhetoric and dialectics can't change what I have learned from observation and experience.
author: Paul Getty

quote: Rhetoric is a poor substitute for action, and we have trusted only to rhetoric. If we are really to be a great nation, we must not merely talk we must act big.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: Rhetoric is the art of ruling the minds of men.
author: Plato

quote: Rhyme, that enslaved queen, that supreme charm of our poetry, that creator of our meter.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Rich men's houses are seldom beautiful, rarely comfortable, and never original. It is a constant source of surprise to people of moderate means to observe how little a big fortune contributes to Beauty.
author: Margot Asquith

quote: Rich people without wisdom and learning are but sheep with golden fleeces.
author: Solon

quote: Riding a motorcycle on today's highways, you have to ride in a very defensive manner. You have to be a good rider and you have to have both hands and both feet on the controls at all times.
author: Evel Knievel

quote: Right now it's only a notion, but I think I can get the money to make it into a concept, and later turn it into an idea.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Rightly defined philosophy is simply the love of wisdom.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Rigid, the skeleton of habit alone upholds the human frame.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: Risk is a part of God's game, alike for men and nations.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: Risk! Risk anything! Care no more for the opinions of others, for those voices. Do the hardest thing on earth for you. Act for yourself. Face the truth.
author: Katherine Mansfield

quote: Rock 'n' roll is ridiculous. It's absurd. In the past, U2 was trying to duck that. Now we're wrapping our arms around it and giving it a great big kiss.
author: Bono

quote: Rock Hudson wasn't my type. He's a great guy and had a great sense of humor.
author: Tab Hunter

quote: Rock and roll music, if you like it, if you feel it, you can't help but move to it. That's what happens to me. I can't help it.'
author: Elvis Presley

quote: Rock music is niche.
author: Bono

quote: Rocket scientists agree that we have about reached the limit of our ability to travel in space using chemical rockets. To achieve anything near the speed of light we will need a new energy source and a new propellant. Nuclear fission is not an option.
author: Wilson Greatbatch

quote: Rogue internet pharmacies continue to pose a serious threat to the health and safety of Americans. Simply put, a few unethical physicians and pharmacists have become drug suppliers to a nation.
author: Dianne Feinstein

quote: Romance is everything.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: Romance is mush, stifling those who strive.
author: Billy Strayhorn

quote: Romance like a ghost escapes touching it is always where you are not, not where you are. The interview or conversation was prose at the time, but it is poetry in the memory.
author: George William Curtis

quote: Romance should never begin with sentiment. It should begin with science and end with a settlement.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Romantic love is an illusion. Most of us discover this truth at the end of a love affair or else when the sweet emotions of love lead us into marriage and then turn down their flames.
author: Thomas Moore

quote: Rome - the city of visible history, where the past of a whole hemisphere seems moving in funeral procession with strange ancestral images and trophies gathered from afar.
author: George Eliot

quote: Roosevelt was the one who had the vision to change our policy from isolationism to world leadership. That was a terrific revolution. Our country's never been the same since.
author: W. Averell Harriman

quote: Roosevelt's declaration that Americans had 'nothing to fear but fear itself' was a glorious piece of inspirational rhetoric and just as gloriously wrong.
author: Russell Baker

quote: Roosevelt's humor was broad, his manner friendly. Of wit there was little of philosophy, none. What did he possess? Intuition, inspiration, love of adventure.
author: Emanuel Celler

quote: Roses are red, violets are blue, I'm schizophrenic, and so am I.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: Rounding to the nearest cent is sufficiently accurate for practical purposes.
author: Alexander John Ellis

quote: Rude contact with facts chased my visions and dreams quickly away, and in their stead I beheld the horrors, the corruption, the evils and hypocrisy of society, and as I stood among them, a young wife, a great wail of agony went out from my soul.
author: Victoria Woodhull

quote: Rudeness is a weak imitation of strength.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: Ruin is the destination toward which all men rush, each pursuing his own best interest in a society that believes in the freedom of the commons.
author: Garrett Hardin

quote: Rule No.1: Never lose money. Rule No.2: Never forget rule No.1.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: Rules and models destroy genius and art.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Run for your life from any man who tells you that money is evil. That sentence is the leper's bell of an approaching looter.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: Russia will occupy most of the good food lands of central Europe while we have the industrial portions. We must find some way of persuading Russia to play ball.
author: Henry L. Stimson

quote: Russians can give you arms but only the United States can give you a solution.
author: Anwar Sadat

quote: Sad Patience, too near neighbour to despair.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: Sad people dislike the happy, and the happy the sad the quick thinking the sedate, and the careless the busy and industrious.
author: Horace

quote: Saddle your dreams before you ride em.
author: Mary Webb

quote: Sadness flies away on the wings of time.
author: Jean de La Fontaine

quote: Same-sex marriage would eliminate entirely in law the basic idea of a mother and a father for every child. It would create a society which deliberately chooses to deprive a child of either a mother or a father.
author: Keith O'Brien

quote: San Francisco businesses face many challenges, including high rents, regulatory burdens, and the rising cost of workers compensation insurance and employee health plans.
author: Gavin Newsom

quote: San Francisco is a mad city - inhabited for the most part by perfectly insane people whose women are of a remarkable beauty.
author: Rudyard Kipling

quote: Sandwiches are wonderful. You don't need a spoon or a plate!
author: Paul Lynde

quote: Sane judgment abhors nothing so much as a picture perpetrated with no technical knowledge, although with plenty of care and diligence.
author: Albrecht Durer

quote: Santa Claus has the right idea - visit people only once a year.
author: Victor Borge

quote: Sarcasm I now see to be, in general, the language of the devil for which reason I have long since as good as renounced it.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Satan, really, is the romantic youth of Jesus re-appearing for a moment.
author: James Joyce

quote: Satire lies about literary men while they live and eulogy lies about them when they die.
author: Voltaire

quote: Satirists gain the applause of others through fear, not through love.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Satisfaction consists in freedom from pain, which is the positive element of life.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Satisfaction of one's curiosity is one of the greatest sources of happiness in life.
author: Linus Pauling

quote: Saturdays and Sundays, America in the year 2009 does not in some ways differ significantly from the country that existed almost 50 years ago. This is truly sad.
author: Eric Holder

quote: Save a boyfriend for a rainy day - and another, in case it doesn't rain.
author: Mae West

quote: Save for the wild force of Nature, nothing moves in this world that is not Greek in its origin.
author: Lord Acton

quote: Save your money. You're going to need twice as much money in your old age as you think.
author: Michael Caine

quote: Saw a wedding in the church. It was strange to see what delight we married people have to see these poor fools decoyed into our condition.
author: Samuel Pepys

quote: Say not that honor is the child of boldness, nor believe thou that the hazard of life alone can pay the price of it: it is not to the action that it is due, but to the manner of performing it.
author: Akhenaton

quote: Say what you like about my bloody murderous government,' I says, 'but don't insult me poor bleedin' country.
author: Edward Abbey

quote: Say what you will, 'tis better to be left than never to have been loved.
author: William Congreve

quote: Scalded cats fear even cold water.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Scarcely one person in a thousand is capable of tasting the happiness of others.
author: Henry Fielding

quote: Scenery is fine - but human nature is finer.
author: John Keats

quote: Scepticism, that dry caries of the intelligence.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Schizophrenia beats dining alone.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: Scholarship was one thing, drudgery another. I very soon concluded that nothing would induce me to read, let alone make notes on, hundreds and hundreds of very, very, very boring books.
author: Simon Raven

quote: Scholastic learning and polemical divinity retarded the growth of all true knowledge.
author: David Hume

quote: Sci-fi films are the epic films of the day because we can no longer put 10,000 extras in the scene - but we can draw thousands of aliens with computers.
author: William Shatner

quote: Science always uses metaphor.
author: James Lovelock

quote: Science and art, or by the same token, poetry and prose differ from one another like a journey and an excursion. The purpose of the journey is its goal, the purpose of an excursion is the process.
author: Franz Grillparzer

quote: Science and religion are the two most powerful forces in the world. Having them at odds... is not productive.
author: E. O. Wilson

quote: Science and technology multiply around us. To an increasing extent they dictate the languages in which we speak and think. Either we use those languages, or we remain mute.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: Science and technology revolutionize our lives, but memory, tradition and myth frame our response.
author: Arthur M. Schlesinger

quote: Science arose from poetry... when times change the two can meet again on a higher level as friends.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Science cannot solve the ultimate mystery of nature. And that is because, in the last analysis, we ourselves are a part of the mystery that we are trying to solve.
author: Max Planck

quote: Science cannot tell theology how to construct a doctrine of creation, but you can't construct a doctrine of creation without taking account of the age of the universe and the evolutionary character of cosmic history.
author: John Polkinghorne

quote: Science does not know its debt to imagination.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Science does not permit exceptions.
author: Claude Bernard

quote: Science exists, moreover, only as a journey toward troth. Stifle dissent and you end that journey.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: Science fiction encourages us to explore... all the futures, good and bad, that the human mind can envision.
author: Marion Zimmer Bradley

quote: Science fiction films are not about science. They are about disaster, which is one of the oldest subjects of art.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: Science fiction is any idea that occurs in the head and doesn't exist yet, but soon will, and will change everything for everybody, and nothing will ever be the same again. As soon as you have an idea that changes some small part of the world you are writing science fiction. It is always the art of the possible, never the impossible.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: Science fiction is no more written for scientists that ghost stories are written for ghosts.
author: Brian Aldiss

quote: Science fiction writers foresee the inevitable, and although problems and catastrophes may be inevitable, solutions are not.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Science fiction writers, I am sorry to say, really do not know anything. We can't talk about science, because our knowledge of it is limited and unofficial, and usually our fiction is dreadful.
author: Philip K. Dick

quote: Science fiction, to me, has not only things that wouldn't happen, but other planets.
author: Margaret Atwood

quote: Science gives us a powerful vocabulary, and it is impossible to produce a vocabulary with which one can only say nice things.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: Science gives us knowledge, but only philosophy can give us wisdom.
author: Will Durant

quote: Science has always been my preoccupation and when you think a breakthrough is possible, it is terribly exciting.
author: James D. Watson

quote: Science has explained nothing the more we know the more fantastic the world becomes and the profounder the surrounding darkness.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Science has not yet mastered prophecy. We predict too much for the next year and yet far too little for the next 10.
author: Neil Armstrong

quote: Science has not yet taught us if madness is or is not the sublimity of the intelligence.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: Science has nothing to be ashamed of even in the ruins of Nagasaki. The shame is theirs who appeal to other values than the human imaginative values which science has evolved.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: Science has to be understood in its broadest sense, as a method for comprehending all observable reality, and not merely as an instrument for acquiring specialized knowledge.
author: Alexis Carrel

quote: Science in the modern world has many uses its chief use, however, is to provide long words to cover the errors of the rich.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Science investigates religion interprets. Science gives man knowledge which is power religion gives man wisdom which is control.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: Science is a differential equation. Religion is a boundary condition.
author: Alan Turing

quote: Science is a method to keep yourself from kidding yourself.
author: Edwin Land

quote: Science is a self-sufficient activity.
author: Jonathan Miller

quote: Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Science is a wonderful thing if one does not have to earn one's living at it.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Science is all metaphor.
author: Timothy Leary

quote: Science is always discovering odd scraps of magical wisdom and making a tremendous fuss about its cleverness.
author: Aleister Crowley

quote: Science is analytical, descriptive, informative. Man does not live by bread alone, but by science he attempts to do so. Hence the deadliness of all that is purely scientific.
author: Eric Gill

quote: Science is built up of facts, as a house is with stones. But a collection of facts is no more a science than a heap of stones is a house.
author: Henri Poincare

quote: Science is but an image of the truth.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Science is facts.
author: Henri Poincare

quote: Science is his forte, and omniscience his foible.
author: Sydney Smith

quote: Science is knowledge arranged and classified according to truth, facts, and the general laws of nature.
author: Luther Burbank

quote: Science is not addressed to poets.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: Science is nothing but perception.
author: Plato

quote: Science is organized knowledge.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: Science is organized knowledge. Wisdom is organized life.
author: Immanuel Kant

quote: Science is properly more scrupulous than dogma. Dogma gives a charter to mistake, but the very breath of science is a contest with mistake, and must keep the conscience alive.
author: George Eliot

quote: Science is the father of knowledge, but opinion breeds ignorance.
author: Hippocrates

quote: Science is the great antidote to the poison of enthusiasm and superstition.
author: Adam Smith

quote: Science is the highest personification of the nation because that nation will remain the first which carries the furthest the works of thought and intelligence.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: Science is the knowledge of consequences, and dependence of one fact upon another.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: Science is the systematic classification of experience.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: Science is what we understand well enough to explain to a computer. Art is everything else we do.
author: Donald Knuth

quote: Science is what you know, philosophy is what you don't know.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Science is wonderfully equipped to answer the question 'How?' but it gets terribly confused when you ask the question 'Why?'
author: Erwin Chargaff

quote: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity, and is the torch which illuminates the world.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: Science knows no country, because knowledge belongs to humanity, and is the torch which illuminates the world. Science is the highest personification of the nation because that nation will remain the first which carries the furthest the works of thought and intelligence.
author: Louis Pasteur

quote: Science knows only one commandment - contribute to science.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: Science may be described as the art of systematic over-simplification.
author: Karl Popper

quote: Science may eventually explain the world of How. The ultimate world of Why may remain for contemplation, philosophy, religion.
author: Liberty Hyde Bailey

quote: Science may have found a cure for most evils but it has found no remedy for the worst of them all - the apathy of human beings.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Science means simply the aggregate of all the recipes that are always successful. All the rest is literature.
author: Paul Valery

quote: Science moves with the spirit of an adventure characterized both by youthful arrogance and by the belief that the truth, once found, would be simple as well as pretty.
author: James D. Watson

quote: Science must begin with myths, and with the criticism of myths.
author: Karl Popper

quote: Science must have originated in the feeling that something was wrong.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Science never gives up searching for truth, since it never claims to have achieved it.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: Science never solves a problem without creating ten more.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Science rests on reason and experiment, and can meet an opponent with calmness but a belief is always sensitive.
author: James Anthony Froude

quote: Science without conscience is the death of the soul.
author: Francois Rabelais

quote: Science without religion is lame, religion without science is blind.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: Science without respect for human life is degrading to us all and reflects a hollow and deceptive philosophy, a philosophy that we as a people should never condone.
author: Nathan Deal

quote: Science, almost from its beginnings, has been truly international in character. National prejudices disappear completely in the scientist's search for truth.
author: Irving Langmuir

quote: Science, like art, religion, commerce, warfare, and even sleep, is based on presuppositions.
author: Gregory Bateson

quote: Science, my lad, is made up of mistakes, but they are mistakes which it is useful to make, because they lead little by little to the truth.
author: Jules Verne

quote: Sciences may be learned by rote, but wisdom not.
author: Laurence Sterne

quote: Scientia is knowledge. It is only in the popular mind that it is equated with facts.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: Scientific discovery and scientific knowledge have been achieved only by those who have gone in pursuit of it without any practical purpose whatsoever in view.
author: Max Planck

quote: Scientific knowledge is in perpetual evolution it finds itself changed from one day to the next.
author: Jean Piaget

quote: Scientific progress makes moral progress a necessity for if man's power is increased, the checks that restrain him from abusing it must be strengthened.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: Scientific research and other studies have demonstrated that arts education can enhance American students' math and language skills and improve test scores which in turn increase chances of higher education and good jobs in the future.
author: Thad Cochran

quote: Scientific theory is a contrived foothold in the chaos of living phenomena.
author: Wilhelm Reich

quote: Scientific views end in awe and mystery, lost at the edge in uncertainty, but they appear to be so deep and so impressive that the theory that it is all arranged as a stage for God to watch man's struggle for good and evil seems inadequate.
author: Richard P. Feynman

quote: Scientists dream about doing great things. Engineers do them.
author: James A. Michener

quote: Sculpture is the art of the intelligence.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Sculpture is the best comment that a painter can make on painting.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Second to agriculture, humbug is the biggest industry of our age.
author: Alfred Nobel

quote: Secrecy is the element of all goodness even virtue, even beauty is mysterious.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Secrecy is the freedom tyrants dream of.
author: Bill Moyers

quote: Secrecy, being an instrument of conspiracy, ought never to be the system of a regular government.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: Secret operations are essential in war upon them the army relies to make its every move.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: Secretary Powell and I agree on every single issue that has ever been before this administration except for those instances where Colin's still learning.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Secretary of War Stanton used to get out of patience with Lincoln because he was all the time pardoning men who ought to be shot.
author: Elihu Root

quote: Sectional football games have the glory and the despair of war, and when a Texas team takes the field against a foreign state, it is an army with banners.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: Security depends not so much upon how much you have, as upon how much you can do without.
author: Joseph Wood Krutch

quote: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Security... it's simply the recognition that changes will take place and the knowledge that you're willing to deal with whatever happens.
author: Harry Browne

quote: See to do good, and you will find that happiness will run after you.
author: James Freeman Clarke

quote: See, winners embrace hard work.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: Seeds of great discoveries are constantly floating around us, but they only take root in minds well prepared to receive them.
author: Joseph Henry

quote: Seeing much, suffering much, and studying much, are the three pillars of learning.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Seeing that a Pilot steers the ship in which we sail, who will never allow us to perish even in the midst of shipwrecks, there is no reason why our minds should be overwhelmed with fear and overcome with weariness.
author: John Calvin

quote: Seeing unhappiness in the marriage of friends, I was content to have chosen music and laughter as a substitute for a husband.
author: Elsa Maxwell

quote: Seek always to do some good, somewhere. Every man has to seek in his own way to realize his true worth. You must give some time to your fellow man. For remember, you don't live in a world all your own. Your brothers are here too.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: Seek not to know what must not be reveal, for joy only flows where fate is most concealed. A busy person would find their sorrows much more if future fortunes were known before!
author: John Dryden

quote: Seek the lofty by reading, hearing and seeing great work at some moment every day.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: Seize the day, and put the least possible trust in tomorrow.
author: Horace

quote: Seldom ever was any knowledge given to keep, but to impart the grace of this rich jewel is lost in concealment.
author: Wendell Phillips

quote: Seldom, very seldom, does complete truth belong to any human disclosure seldom can it happen that something is not a little disguised, or a little mistaken.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Self-confidence is the first requisite to great undertakings.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Self-education is, I firmly believe, the only kind of education there is.
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: Self-expression must pass into communication for its fulfillment.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: Self-knowledge comes from knowing other men.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: Self-pity comes so naturally to all of us. The most solid happiness can be shaken by the compassion of a fool.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Self-preservation, nature's first great law, all the creatures, except man, doth awe.
author: Andrew Marvell

quote: Self-reverence, self-knowledge, self-control these three alone lead one to sovereign power.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: Selfishness is the only real atheism aspiration, unselfishness, the only real religion.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: Selfishness must always be forgiven you know, because there is no hope of a cure.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Selling drug secrets violates a trust that is fundamental to the integrity of both scientific research and our financial markets.
author: Charles Grassley

quote: Selling out is doing something you don't really want to do for money. That's what selling out is.
author: Bono

quote: Senator Douglas was very small, not over four and a half feet height, and there was a noticeable disproportion between the long trunk of his body and his short legs. His chest was broad and indicated great strength of lungs.
author: Henry Villard

quote: Sensible and responsible women do not want to vote. The relative positions to be assumed by man and woman in the working out of our civilization were assigned long ago by a higher intelligence than ours.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: Sensual love deceives one as to the nature of heavenly love it could not do so alone, but since it unconsciously has the element of heavenly love within it, it can do so.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Serious sport has nothing to do with fair play. It is bound up with hatred, jealousy, boastfulness, disregard of all rules and sadistic pleasure in witnessing violence. In other words, it is war minus the shooting.
author: George Orwell

quote: Serious sport is war minus the shooting.
author: George Orwell

quote: Seriously, we are in the midst of the convergence of voice and data and that is challenging the infrastructure of the telephone companies. There are huge commercial interests in the basic technology, but even more so in content delivery and control of content.
author: Steve Crocker

quote: Service is the rent we pay for being. It is the very purpose of life, and not something you do in your spare time.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: Session musicians kind of respected me because what I was talking about made sense. That all came from an education. Believe me, education does you more good. Maybe that's the reason I've been around so long.
author: Bobby Vinton

quote: Set religion free, and a new humanity will begin.
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: Set up another case bartender! The best thing for a case of nerves is a case of Scotch.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Seventy percent of success in life is showing up.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Sex and beauty are inseparable, like life and consciousness. And the intelligence which goes with sex and beauty, and arises out of sex and beauty, is intuition.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Sex at age 90 is like trying to shoot pool with a rope.
author: George Burns

quote: Sex education classes are like in-home sales parties for abortions.
author: Phyllis Schlafly

quote: Sex education may be a good idea in the schools, but I don't believe the kids should be given homework.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: Sex is God's joke on human beings.
author: Bette Davis

quote: Sex is a part of nature. I go along with nature.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: Sex is the ersatz or substitute religion of the 20th Century.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: Sex is the mysticism of materialism and the only possible religion in a materialistic society.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: Sex without love is a meaningless experience, but as far as meaningless experiences go its pretty damn good.
author: Woody Allen

quote: Sex without love is merely healthy exercise.
author: Robert A. Heinlein

quote: Sex: the thing that takes up the least amount of time and causes the most amount of trouble.
author: John Barrymore

quote: Sexiness wears thin after a while and beauty fades, but to be married to a man who makes you laugh every day, ah, now that's a real treat.
author: Joanne Woodward

quote: Shadows sometimes people don't see shadows. The Chinese of course never paint them in pictures, oriental art never deals with shadow. But I noticed these shadows and I knew it meant it was sunny.
author: David Hockney

quote: Shakespeare fascinated me. He hardly ever left the country. His imagination was worldwide though reading.
author: Michael Tippett

quote: Shall I not have intelligence with the earth? Am I not partly leaves and vegetable mould myself.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: Shall I tell you what the real evil is? To cringe to the things that are called evils, to surrender to them our freedom, in defiance of which we ought to face any suffering.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Shallow men believe in luck. Strong men believe in cause and effect.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: Shallow understanding from people of good will is more frustrating than absolute misunderstanding from people of ill will.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: She belongs to a race of delightful women, who never do any harm, whom everybody calls good, and who are very severe on those who do not pretend to be good.
author: Gilbert Parker

quote: She discovered with great delight that one does not love one's children just because they are one's children but because of the friendship formed while raising them.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: She doesn't understand the concept of Roman numerals. She thought we just fought in world war eleven.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: She felt like a chess player who, by the clever handling of his pieces, sees the game taking the course intended. Her eyes were bright and tender with a smile as they glanced up into his and her lips looked hungry for the kiss which they invited.
author: Kate Chopin

quote: She gave me a smile I could feel in my hip pocket.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: She gave up beauty in her tender youth, gave all her hope and joy and pleasant ways she covered up her eyes lest they should gaze on vanity, and chose the bitter truth.
author: Christina Rossetti

quote: She generally gave herself very good advice, (though she very seldom followed it).
author: Lewis Carroll

quote: She goes through the vale of death alone, each time a babe is born. As it is the right neither of man nor the state to coerce her into this ordeal, so it is her right to decide whether she will endure it.
author: Margaret Sanger

quote: She got her looks from her father. He's a plastic surgeon.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: She had lost the art of conversation but not, unfortunately, the power of speech.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: She has no imagination and that means no compassion.
author: Michael Foot

quote: She is a friend of mind. She gather me, man. The pieces I am, she gather them and give them back to me in all the right order. It's good, you know, when you got a woman who is a friend of your mind.
author: Toni Morrison

quote: She tells enough white lies to ice a wedding cake.
author: Margot Asquith

quote: She's been married so many times she has rice marks on her face.
author: Henny Youngman

quote: She's the kind of girl who climbed the ladder of success wrong by wrong.
author: Mae West

quote: Sheer flattery got me into the theater. Flattery always works with me, particularly the flattery of women.
author: Carroll O'Connor

quote: Shelley is truth itself and honour itself notwithstanding his out-of-the-way notions about religion.
author: George Byron

quote: Ships that pass in the night, and speak each other in passing, only a signal shown, and a distant voice in the darkness So on the ocean of life, we pass and speak one another, only a look and a voice, then darkness again and a silence.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: Shoot a few scenes out of focus. I want to win the foreign film award.
author: Billy Wilder

quote: Short as life is, we make it still shorter by the careless waste of time.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Short cycle business are being impacted by credit, and are being impacted by gasoline prices, food, distribution businesses, chemical business.
author: Jack Welch

quote: Short words are best and the old words when short are best of all.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Should you shield the canyons from the windstorms you would never see the true beauty of their carvings.
author: Elisabeth Kubler-Ross

quote: Show business is my life. When I was a kid I sold insurance, but nobody laughed.
author: Don Rickles

quote: Show me a good loser, and I'll show you a loser.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: Show me a great actor and I'll show you a lousy husband. Show me a great actress, and you've seen the devil.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Show me a guy who's afraid to look bad, and I'll show you a guy you can beat every time.
author: Lou Brock

quote: Show me a man who lives alone and has a perpetually clean kitchen, and 8 times out of 9 I'll show you a man with detestable spiritual qualities.
author: Charles Bukowski

quote: Show me a thoroughly satisfied man and I will show you a failure.
author: Thomas A. Edison

quote: Show me your garden and I shall tell you what you are.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: Shrinking away from death is something unhealthy and abnormal which robs the second half of life of its purpose.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Shun no toil to make yourself remarkable by some talent or other yet do not devote yourself to one branch exclusively. Strive to get clear notions about all. Give up no science entirely for science is but one.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: Sickness, insanity and death were the angels that surrounded my cradle and they have followed me throughout my life.
author: Edvard Munch

quote: Silence at the proper season is wisdom, and better than any speech.
author: Plutarch

quote: Silence is an ornament for women.
author: Sophocles

quote: Silence is as deep as eternity, speech a shallow as time.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Silence is one of the great arts of conversation.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: Silence is the element in which great things fashion themselves together.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: Silence is the mother of truth.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Silence is the sleep that nourishes wisdom.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Silence is true wisdom's best reply.
author: Euripides

quote: Similarly, thought is a system. That system not only includes thought and feelings, but it includes the state of the body it includes the whole of society - as thought is passing back and forth between people in a process by which thought evolved from ancient times.
author: David Bohm

quote: Simplicity and repose are the qualities that measure the true value of any work of art.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: Simplicity is the final achievement. After one has played a vast quantity of notes and more notes, it is simplicity that emerges as the crowning reward of art.
author: Frederic Chopin

quote: Simplicity is the most difficult thing to secure in this world it is the last limit of experience and the last effort of genius.
author: George Sand

quote: Simply by not owning three medium-sized castles in Tuscany I have saved enough money in the last forty years on insurance premiums alone to buy a medium-sized castle in Tuscany.
author: Ludwig Mies van der Rohe

quote: Sin brought death, and death will disappear with the disappearance of sin.
author: Mary Baker Eddy

quote: Sin, guilt, neurosis they are one and the same, the fruit of the tree of knowledge.
author: Henry Miller

quote: Since God knows our future, our personalities, and our capacity to listen, He isn't ever going to say more to us than we can deal with at the moment.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: Since ancient times, people from throughout Asia have brought to Japan their talents, knowledge and energy, helping to lay the basis for Japan's existence as a country.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: Since creation of the E.U. a half century ago, Europe has enjoyed the longest period of peace in its history.
author: John Bruton

quote: Since fame is an illusion and death is in our future all we have is the next moment before we are swallowed into oblivion.
author: Al Goldstein

quote: Since love grows within you, so beauty grows. For love is the beauty of the soul.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: Since my induction into the Sports Hall of Fame, I have wanted to have my No. 3 Chevy on exhibit for sports fans to see. I hope others will enjoy the car as much as I have.
author: Junior Johnson

quote: Since my retirement, I've spent a lot of time trying to help the School of Social Work at the University of North Carolina. A society like this just can't afford an uneducated underclass of citizens.
author: Charles Kuralt

quote: Since obscenity is the truth of our passion today, it is the only stuff of art - or almost the only stuff.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: Since the composer has said everything, if you discover everything, it will be enough and you will be a happy man. Don't try to say it's your taste, and because of that you are changing this or that. And I must say this respect is still there.
author: Kurt Masur

quote: Since the day he came into office, President Bush has worked to gut more than 34 years of hard work by weakening many of our Nation's standing environmental laws, some of which were signed into law by his father.
author: Jim Jeffords

quote: Since the nature of people is bad, to become corrected they must be taught by teachers and to be orderly they must acquire ritual and moral principles.
author: Xun Zi

quote: Since the printing press came into being, poetry has ceased to be the delight of the whole community of man it has become the amusement and delight of the few.
author: John Masefield

quote: Since the reduction of risk factors is the scientific basis for primary prevention, the World Health Organization promotes the development of an integrated strategy for prevention of several diseases, rather than focusing on individual ones.
author: Gro Harlem Brundtland

quote: Since there is nothing so well worth having as friends, never lose a chance to make them.
author: Francesco Guicciardini

quote: Since this war began our sympathy has gone out to all the suffering people who have been dragged into it. Further hundreds of millions have become involved since I spoke at Limerick fortnight ago.
author: Eamon de Valera

quote: Since we cannot change reality, let us change the eyes which see reality.
author: Nikos Kazantzakis

quote: Since you cannot do good to all, you are to pay special attention to those who, by the accidents of time, or place, or circumstances, are brought into closer connection with you.
author: Augustine of Hippo

quote: Since you get more joy out of giving joy to others, you should put a good deal of thought into the happiness that you are able to give.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: Since, therefore, no man is born without faults, and he is esteemed the best whose errors are the least, let the wise man consider everything human as connected with himself for in worldly affairs there is no perfect happiness under heaven.
author: Giraldus Cambrensis

quote: Single women have a dreadful propensity for being poor. Which is one very strong argument in favor of matrimony.
author: Jane Austen

quote: Singleness of purpose is one of the chief essentials for success in life, no matter what may be one's aim.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quote: Sir, I am no sycophant or worshipper of power anywhere.
author: Benjamin F. Wade

quote: Sir, my concern is not whether God is on our side my greatest concern is to be on God's side, for God is always right.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: Sister is probably the most competitive relationship within the family, but once the sisters are grown, it becomes the strongest relationship.
author: Margaret Mead

quote: Sixty years ago I knew everything now I know nothing education is a progressive discovery of our own ignorance.
author: Will Durant

quote: Skeptical scrutiny is the means, in both science and religion, by which deep thoughts can be winnowed from deep nonsense.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Skepticism is a virtue in history as well as in philosophy.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: Skill is the unified force of experience, intellect and passion in their operation.
author: John Ruskin

quote: Skill without imagination is craftsmanship and gives us many useful objects such as wickerwork picnic baskets. Imagination without skill gives us modern art.
author: Tom Stoppard

quote: Slang is a language that rolls up its sleeves, spits on its hands and goes to work.
author: Carl Sandburg

quote: Slave to no sect, who takes no private road, But looks through Nature up to Nature's God.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: Slaves are generally expected to sing as well as to work.
author: Frederick Douglass

quote: Sleep - the most beautiful experience in life - except drink.
author: W. C. Fields

quote: Sleep is good, death is better but of course, the best thing would to have never been born at all.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Sleep is lovely, death is better still, not to have been born is of course the miracle.
author: Heinrich Heine

quote: Sleep is the interest we have to pay on the capital which is called in at death and the higher the rate of interest and the more regularly it is paid, the further the date of redemption is postponed.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: Sleeping is no mean art: for its sake one must stay awake all day.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: Sleeping together is a euphemism for people, but tantamount to marriage with cats.
author: Marge Piercy

quote: Slowly but surely, we are acquiring that famous culture of democracy, which is our objective.
author: Paul Biya

quote: Slump, and the world slumps with you. Push, and you push alone.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: Small amounts of philosophy lead to atheism, but larger amounts bring us back to God.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Small debts are like small shot they are rattling on every side, and can scarcely be escaped without a wound: great debts are like cannon of loud noise, but little danger.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Small minds are concerned with the extraordinary, great minds with the ordinary.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: Small natures require despotism to exercise their sinews, as great souls thirst for equality to give play to their heart.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: Small opportunities are often the beginning of great enterprises.
author: Demosthenes

quote: Smallness in a great man seems smaller by its disproportion with all the rest.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: Smartness runs in my family. When I went to school I was so smart my teacher was in my class for five years.
author: Gracie Allen

quote: Smatterers in learning are the most opinionated.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: Smile in the mirror. Do that every morning and you'll start to see a big difference in your life.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: Smile, for everyone lacks self-confidence and more than any other one thing a smile reassures them.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: Smiles form the channels of a future tear.
author: Lord Byron

quote: Smiles, tears, of all my life! - and, if God choose, I shall but love thee better after death.
author: Elizabeth Barrett Browning

quote: Smiling is very important. If we are not able to smile, then the world will not have peace. It is not by going out for a demonstration against nuclear missiles that we can bring about peace. It is with our capacity of smiling, breathing, and being peace that we can make peace.
author: Nhat Hanh

quote: So I had to be careful. I recognized the responsibility that, whether I liked it or not, I had to accept whatever the obligation was. That was to behave in a manner, to carry myself in such a professional way, as if there ever is a reflection, it's a positive one.
author: Sidney Poitier

quote: So I think you have to marry for the right reasons, and marry the right person.
author: Anne Bancroft

quote: So I was getting into my car, and this bloke says to me 'Can you give me a lift?' I said 'Sure, you look great, the world's your oyster, go for it.'
author: Tommy Cooper

quote: So I'm OK with myself, with history, my work, who I am and who I was.
author: Sidney Poitier

quote: So Indian policy has become institutionalized and the result has been that American people have become more dependent on government and that the American people have become more dependent on corporations.
author: Russell Means

quote: So confident am I in the intentions, as well as wisdom, of the government, that I shall always be satisfied that what is not done, either cannot, or ought not to be done.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: So during those first moments of the day, which are yours and yours alone, you can circumvent these boundaries and concentrate fully on spiritual matters. And this gives you the opportunity to plan the time management of the entire day.
author: Menachem Mendel Schneerson

quote: So far as I can remember, there is not one word in the Gospels in praise of intelligence.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: So far as discipline is concerned, freedom means not its absence but the use of higher and more rational forms as contrasted with those that are lower or less rational.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: So far as hypotheses are concerned, let no one expect anything certain from astronomy, which cannot furnish it, lest he accept as the truth ideas conceived for another purpose, and depart from this study a greater fool than when he entered it.
author: Nicolaus Copernicus

quote: So far as it depends on the course of this government, our relations of good will and friendship will be sedulously cultivated with all nations.
author: John Tyler
