quote: The fact is that I find more most men are more open, more generous, and much more stimulating than the majority of females I know.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quote: The fact is that all writers create their precursors. Their work modifies our conception of the past, just as it is bound to modify the future.
author: Jorge Luis Borges

quote: The fact is that love is of two kinds, one which commands, and one which obeys. The two are quite distinct, and the passion to which the one gives rise is not the passion of the other.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The fact is that more people have been slaughtered in the name of religion than for any other single reason. That, THAT my friends, is true perversion.
author: Harvey Milk

quote: The fact of the matter is that the most unexpected and miraculous thing in my life was the arrival in it of poetry itself - as a vocation and an elevation almost.
author: Seamus Heaney

quote: The fact that I can plant a seed and it becomes a flower, share a bit of knowledge and it becomes another's, smile at someone and receive a smile in return, are to me continual spiritual exercises.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: The fact that political ideologies are tangible realities is not a proof of their vitally necessary character. The bubonic plague was an extraordinarily powerful social reality, but no one would have regarded it as vitally necessary.
author: Wilhelm Reich

quote: The fact that the adult American Negro female emerges a formidable character is often met with amazement, distaste and even belligerance. It is seldom accepted as an inevitable outcome of the struggle won by survivors, and deserves respect if not enthusiastic acceptance.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: The fact that we are I don't know how many millions of people, yet communication, complete communication, is completely impossible between two of those people, is to me one of the biggest tragic themes in the world.
author: Georges Simenon

quote: The facts of life are that a child who has seen war cannot be compared with a child who doesn't know what war is except from television.
author: Sophia Loren

quote: The failure of academic feminists to recognize difference as a crucial strength is a failure to reach beyond the first patriarchal lesson. In our world, divide and conquer must become define and empower.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: The failure of the Russian Socialist Republic will be the defeat of the proletariat of the whole world.
author: Karl Liebknecht

quote: The fairest thing in nature, a flower, still has its roots in earth and manure.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: The faith I was born into formed me.
author: Huston Smith

quote: The faith that stands on authority is not faith.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The fame that goes with wealth and beauty is fleeting and fragile intellectual superiority is a possession glorious and eternal.
author: Sallust

quote: The family is the nucleus of civilization.
author: Will Durant

quote: The family is the test of freedom because the family is the only thing that the free man makes for himself and by himself.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: The family you come from isn't as important as the family you're going to have.
author: Ring Lardner

quote: The farther a society progresses, the more clearly the individual becomes the antithesis of the group.
author: Herbert Read

quote: The fashions of the ages vary in this direction and that, but they vary for the most part from a central road which was struck out by the imagination of Greece.
author: Gilbert Murray

quote: The fate of animals is of greater importance to me than the fear of appearing ridiculous it is indissolubly connected with the fate of men.
author: Emile Zola

quote: The faults of a superior person are like the sun and moon. They have their faults, and everyone sees them they change and everyone looks up to them.
author: Confucius

quote: The fear of becoming a 'has-been' keeps some people from becoming anything.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: The fear of burglars is not only the fear of being robbed, but also the fear of a sudden and unexpected clutch out of the darkness.
author: Elias Canetti

quote: The fear of death follows from the fear of life. A man who lives fully is prepared to die at any time.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The fear of death is the most unjustified of all fears, for there's no risk of accident for someone who's dead.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The fear of death often proves mortal, and sets people on methods to save their Lives, which infallibly destroy them.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The fear of failure is so great, it is no wonder that the desire to do right by one's children has led to a whole library of books offering advice on how to raise them.
author: Bruno Bettelheim

quote: The fear really hits you. That's what you feel first. And then it's the anger and frustration. Part of the problem is how little we understand about the ultimate betrayal of the body when it rebels against itself.
author: Charles Bronson

quote: The federal government has sponsored research that has produced a tomato that is perfect in every respect, except that you can't eat it. We should make every effort to make sure this disease, often referred to as 'progress', doesn't spread.
author: Andy Rooney

quote: The feedback that I get from my association with Gomez is heartwarming. It is very difficult for me to take anything but a positive view of the Gomez phenomenon.
author: John Astin

quote: The feeling of friendship is like that of being comfortably filled with roast beef love, like being enlivened with champagne.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The feeling remains that God is on the journey, too.
author: Saint Teresa of Avila

quote: The fellow that has no money is poor. The fellow that has nothing but money is poorer still.
author: Billy Sunday

quote: The fewer rules a coach has, the fewer rules there are for players to break.
author: John Madden

quote: The fickleness of the women I love is only equalled by the infernal constancy of the women who love me.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The fight for freedom must go on until it is won until our country is free and happy and peaceful as part of the community of man, we cannot rest.
author: Oliver Tambo

quote: The fighter loses more than his pride in the fight he loses part of his future. He's a step closer to the slum he came from.
author: Floyd Patterson

quote: The figure a poem makes. It begins in delight and ends in wisdom... in a clarification of life - not necessarily a great clarification, such as sects and cults are founded on, but in a momentary stay against confusion.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The filth and noise of the crowded streets soon destroy the elasticity of health which belongs to the country boy.
author: Rutherford B. Hayes

quote: The final wisdom of life requires not the annulment of incongruity but the achievement of serenity within and above it.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: The finest clothing made is a person's own skin, but, of course, society demands something more than this.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The finest workers in stone are not copper or steel tools, but the gentle touches of air and water working at their leisure with a liberal allowance of time.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The finest works of art are precious, among other reasons, because they make it possible for us to know, if only imperfectly and for a little while, what it actually feels like to think subtly and feel nobly.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The finite is annihilated in the presence of the infinite, and becomes a pure nothing. So our spirit before God, so our justice before divine justice.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The firmest friendship is based on an identity of likes and dislikes.
author: Sallust

quote: The first and most important is to emphasize the enduring nature of the alliance relationship particularly with Europe which does share our values and interests even if it disagrees with us on specific policies.
author: Zbigniew Brzezinski

quote: The first casualty when war comes is truth.
author: Hiram Johnson

quote: The first condition of education is being able to put someone to wholesome and meaningful work.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The first duty of government is to see that people have food, fuel, and clothes. The second, that they have means of moral and intellectual education.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The first duty of love is to listen.
author: Paul Tillich

quote: The first duty of man is to conquer fear he must get rid of it, he cannot act till then.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The first duty of society is to give each of its members the possibility of fulfilling his destiny. When it becomes incapable of performing this duty it must be transformed.
author: Alexis Carrel

quote: The first essential in writing about anything is that the writer should have no experience of the matter.
author: Isadora Duncan

quote: The first feminine feature that goes, with advancing age, is the neck.
author: Gloria Swanson

quote: The first guy who came up with the concept of religion was sitting out under a tree. I'm sure of that.
author: Tom T. Hall

quote: The first lesson of economics is scarcity: there is never enough of anything to fully satisfy all those who want it. The first lesson of politics is to disregard the first lesson of economics.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: The first magic of love is our ignorance that it can ever end.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quote: The first method for estimating the intelligence of a ruler is to look at the men he has around him.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: The first mistake in public business is the going into it.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: The first novel I wrote was a monster - clocking in at 180,000 words - but it died a death, a death it deserved. It was called 'The Gods First Make Mad.' It was a good title, but it was the only good thing about the book. I didn't let that put me off.
author: Wilbur Smith

quote: The first one, obviously, was walking into my office at eight o'clock in the morning on Wednesday, and being told there was a telephone call saying that there was an incident at Three Mile Island, and that it had shut down and that beyond that we didn't know.
author: William Scranton

quote: The first pages of memory are like the old family Bible. The first leaves are wholly faded and somewhat soiled with handling. But, when we turn further, and come to the chapters where Adam and Eve were banished from Paradise, then, all begins to grow clear and legible.
author: Max Muller

quote: The first panacea for a mismanaged nation is inflation of the currency the second is war. Both bring a temporary prosperity both bring a permanent ruin. But both are the refuge of political and economic opportunists.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The first point of wisdom is to discern that which is false the second, to know that which is true.
author: Lactantius

quote: The first pork-barrel bill that crosses my desk, I'm going to veto it and make the authors of those pork-barrel items famous all over America.
author: John McCain

quote: The first presentation of my show was given in May, 1883, at Omaha, which I had then chosen as my home. From there we made our first summer tour, visiting practically every important city in the country.
author: Buffalo Bill

quote: The first problem for all of us, men and women, is not to learn, but to unlearn.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: The first question which the priest and the Levite asked was: 'If I stop to help this man, what will happen to me?' But... the good Samaritan reversed the question: 'If I do not stop to help this man, what will happen to him?'
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The first reaction to truth is hatred.
author: Tertullian

quote: The first recipe for happiness is: avoid too lengthy meditation on the past.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: The first requisite for the happiness of the people is the abolition of religion.
author: Karl Marx

quote: The first requisite of a good citizen in this republic of ours is that he shall be able and willing to pull his own weight.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The first requisite of a sound monetary system is that it put the least possible power over the quantity or quality of money in the hands of the politicians.
author: Henry Hazlitt

quote: The first resistance to social change is to say it's not necessary.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: The first rule of business is: Do other men for they would do you.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The first sign of corruption in a society that is still alive is that the end justifies the means.
author: Georges Bernanos

quote: The first step in a person's salvation is knowledge of their sin.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The first step toward change is awareness. The second step is acceptance.
author: Nathaniel Branden

quote: The first symptom of love in a young man is timidity in a girl boldness.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The first test of a truly great man is his humility. By humility I don't mean doubt of his powers or hesitation in speaking his opinion, but merely an understanding of the relationship of what he can say and what he can do.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The first thing is that we're being attacked by both the Writers Guild and the Producers Guild. Both of these groups are trying to diminish the importance and strength of the director. They're trying to do it through both frontal and side attacks.
author: John Frankenheimer

quote: The first thing which I can record concerning myself is, that I was born. These are wonderful words. This life, to which neither time nor eternity can bring diminution - this everlasting living soul, began. My mind loses itself in these depths.
author: Groucho Marx

quote: The first time I sang in the church choir two hundred people changed their religion.
author: Fred Allen

quote: The first time I see a jogger smiling, I'll consider it.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: The first virtue in a soldier is endurance of fatigue courage is only the second virtue.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The first wealth is health.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The first-born in every family is always dreaming for an imaginary older brother or sister who will look out for them.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: The five essential entrepreneurial skills for success are concentration, discrimination, organization, innovation and communication.
author: Michael Faraday

quote: The fleet sailed to its war base in the North Sea, headed not so much for some rendezvous with glory as for rendezvous with discretion.
author: Barbara Tuchman

quote: The flesh endures the storms of the present alone the mind, those of the past and future as well as the present. Gluttony is a lust of the mind.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: The flesh, alas, is sad, and I have read all the books.
author: Stephane Mallarme

quote: The flood of money that gushes into politics today is a pollution of democracy.
author: Theodore White

quote: The flowers anew, returning seasons bring but beauty faded has no second spring.
author: Ambrose Philips

quote: The flowery style is not unsuitable to public speeches or addresses, which amount only to compliment. The lighter beauties are in their place when there is nothing more solid to say but the flowery style ought to be banished from a pleading, a sermon, or a didactic work.
author: Voltaire

quote: The folly of mistaking a paradox for a discovery, a metaphor for a proof, a torrent of verbiage for a spring of capital truths, and oneself for an oracle, is inborn in us.
author: Paul Valery

quote: The food here is terrible, and the portions are too small.
author: Woody Allen

quote: The food pyramid is very complicated. It doesn't give you as much info in a quick glance as the plate does.
author: Tom Vilsack

quote: The foolish and the dead alone never change their opinions.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The force of the advertising word and image dwarfs the power of other literature in the 20th century.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: The forgotten man... He works, he votes, generally he prays, but his chief business in life is to pay.
author: William Graham Sumner

quote: The formula for achieving a successful relationship is simple: you should treat all disasters as if they were trivialities but never treat a triviality as if it were a disaster.
author: Quentin Crisp

quote: The foundation of empire is art and science. Remove them or degrade them, and the empire is no more. Empire follows art and not vice versa as Englishmen suppose.
author: William Blake

quote: The foundation of every state is the education of its youth.
author: Diogenes

quote: The founders of a new colony, whatever Utopia of human virtue and happiness they might originally project, have invariably recognized it among their earliest practical necessities to allot a portion of the virgin soil as a cemetery, and another portion as the site of a prison.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: The four cornerstones of character on which the structure of this nation was built are: Initiative, Imagination, Individuality and Independence.
author: Eddie Rickenbacker

quote: The fox has many tricks. The hedgehog has but one. But that is the best of all.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The framers of our Constitution meant we were to have freedom of religion, not freedom from religion.
author: Billy Graham

quote: The freedom of all is essential to my freedom.
author: Mikhail Bakunin

quote: The freedom of each individual can only be the freedom of all.
author: Friedrich Durrenmatt

quote: The freethinking of one age is the common sense of the next.
author: Matthew Arnold

quote: The friend in my adversity I shall always cherish most. I can better trust those who helped to relieve the gloom of my dark hours than those who are so ready to enjoy with me the sunshine of my prosperity.
author: Ulysses S. Grant

quote: The friend who can be silent with us in a moment of despair or confusion, who can stay with us in an hour of grief and bereavement, who can tolerate not knowing... not healing, not curing... that is a friend who cares.
author: Henri Nouwen

quote: The friendship that can cease has never been real.
author: St. Jerome

quote: The frightening thought that what you draw may become a building makes for reasoned lines.
author: Saul Steinberg

quote: The function of education is to teach one to think intensively and to think critically. Intelligence plus character - that is the goal of true education.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: The function of the politician, therefore, is one of continuous watchfulness and activity, and he must have intimate knowledge of details if he would work out grand results.
author: John George Nicolay

quote: The function of wisdom is to discriminate between good and evil.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The functions of the family in a highly differentiated society are not to be interpreted as functions directly on behalf of the society, but on behalf of personality.
author: Talcott Parsons

quote: The functions of these elders, therefore, determine the power of the people for a representative is one chosen by others to do in their name what they are entitled to do in their own persons or rather to exercise the powers which radically inhere in those for whom they act.
author: Charles Hodge

quote: The fundament upon which all our knowledge and learning rests is the inexplicable.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The fundamental concept in social science is Power, in the same sense in which Energy is the fundamental concept in physics.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The fundamental defect of fathers, in our competitive society, is that they want their children to be a credit to them.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The further a mathematical theory is developed, the more harmoniously and uniformly does its construction proceed, and unsuspected relations are disclosed between hitherto separated branches of the science.
author: David Hilbert

quote: The future ain't what it used to be.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: The future author is one who discovers that language, the exploration and manipulation of the resources of language, will serve him in winning through to his way.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: The future battle on the ground will be preceded by battle in the air. This will determine which of the contestants has to suffer operational and tactical disadvantages and be forced throughout the battle into adoption compromise solutions.
author: Erwin Rommel

quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.
author: Malcolm X

quote: The future depends entirely on what each of us does every day a movement is only people moving.
author: Gloria Steinem

quote: The future enters into us, in order to transform itself in us, long before it happens.
author: Rainer Maria Rilke

quote: The future influences the present just as much as the past.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: The future is called 'perhaps,' which is the only possible thing to call the future. And the important thing is not to allow that to scare you.
author: Tennessee Williams

quote: The future is going to be boring. The suburbanisation of the planet will continue, and the suburbanisation of the soul will follow soon after.
author: J. G. Ballard

quote: The future is hidden by a dark impenetrable veil, and yet we struggle to pierce through it.
author: Joseph Barber Lightfoot

quote: The future is no more uncertain than the present.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The future is purchased by the present.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The future is something which everyone reaches at the rate of 60 minutes an hour, whatever he does, whoever he is.
author: C. S. Lewis

quote: The future is the worst thing about the present.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: The future lies in designing and selling computers that people don't realize are computers at all.
author: Adam Osborne

quote: The future which we hold in trust for our own children will be shaped by our fairness to other people's children.
author: Marian Wright Edelman

quote: The future will be the child of the past and the present, even if a rebellious child.
author: George Crumb

quote: The future, like everything else, is not what it used to be.
author: Paul Valery

quote: The game of golf would lose a great deal if croquet mallets and billiard cues were allowed on the putting green.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The game of history is usually played by the best and the worst over the heads of the majority in the middle.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: The general interest of the masses might take the place of the insight of genius if it were allowed freedom of action.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: The general public has long been divided into two parts those who think science can do anything, and those who are afraid it will.
author: Dixie Lee Ray

quote: The general tendency of things throughout the world is to render mediocrity the ascendant power among mankind.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The general who advances without coveting fame and retreats without fearing disgrace, whose only thought is to protect his country and do good service for his sovereign, is the jewel of the kingdom.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: The generality of men are naturally apt to be swayed by fear rather than reverence, and to refrain from evil rather because of the punishment that it brings than because of its own foulness.
author: Aristotle

quote: The genius of our ruling class is that it has kept a majority of the people from ever questioning the inequity of a system where most people drudge along, paying heavy taxes for which they get nothing in return.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: The genius of the United States is not best or most in its executives or legislatures, nor in its ambassadors or authors or colleges, or churches, or parlors, nor even in its newspapers or inventors, but always most in the common people.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The gift of fantasy has meant more to me than my talent for absorbing positive knowledge.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The gifts of nature are infinite in their variety, and mind differs from mind almost as much as body from body.
author: Quintilian

quote: The giving of love is an education in itself.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The glory of Christianity is to conquer by forgiveness.
author: William Blake

quote: The glory of gardening: hands in the dirt, head in the sun, heart with nature. To nurture a garden is to feed not just on the body, but the soul.
author: Alfred Austin

quote: The glow of one warm thought is to me worth more than money.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The goal of all life is death.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe, to match your nature with Nature.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: The goal to strive for is a poor government but a rich people.
author: Andrew Johnson

quote: The god whom science recognizes must be a God of universal laws exclusively, a God who does a wholesale, not a retail business. He cannot accommodate his processes to the convenience of individuals.
author: William James

quote: The gods conceal from men the happiness of death, that they may endure life.
author: Lucan

quote: The golden age is before us, not behind us.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The good die young but not always. The wicked prevail but not consistently. I am confused by life, and I feel safe within the confines of the theatre.
author: Helen Hayes

quote: The good die young, because they see it's no use living if you have got to be good.
author: John Barrymore

quote: The good ended happily, and the bad unhappily. That is what fiction means.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The good fighters of old first put themselves beyond the possibility of defeat, and then waited for an opportunity of defeating the enemy.
author: Sun Tzu

quote: The good is the beautiful.
author: Plato

quote: The good life is one inspired by love and guided by knowledge.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The good man is he who rules himself as he does his own property: his autonomous being is modelled on material power.
author: Theodor Adorno

quote: The good man is the friend of all living things.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The good opinion of mankind, like the lever of Archimedes, with the given fulcrum, moves the world.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The good parts of a book may be only something a writer is lucky enough to overhear or it may be the wreck of his whole damn life and one is as good as the other.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The good things of prosperity are to be wished but the good things that belong to adversity are to be admired.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The government I led gave ordinary people peace, security, dignity, and opportunity to progress.
author: Benazir Bhutto

quote: The government is us we are the government, you and I.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The government of Israel doesn't like the kinds of things I say, which puts them into the same category as every other government in the world.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: The government of the United States is a device for maintaining in perpetuity the rights of the people, with the ultimate extinction of all privileged classes.
author: Calvin Coolidge

quote: The government should set a goal for a clean environment but not mandate how that goal should be implemented.
author: Dixie Lee Ray

quote: The government solution to a problem is usually as bad as the problem.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: The government's War on Poverty has transformed poverty from a short-term misfortune into a career choice.
author: Harry Browne

quote: The government, which was designed for the people, has got into the hands of the bosses and their employers, the special interests. An invisible empire has been set up above the forms of democracy.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: The grand aim of all science is to cover the greatest number of empirical facts by logical deduction from the smallest number of hypotheses or axioms.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The gratification of desire is not happiness.
author: Daisaku Ikeda

quote: The great act of faith is when a man decides he is not God.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: The great advantage about telling the truth is that nobody ever believes it.
author: Dorothy L. Sayers

quote: The great advantage of a hotel is that it is a refuge from home life.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The great aim of education is not knowledge but action.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: The great and admirable strength of America consists in this, that America is truly the American people.
author: Jacques Maritain

quote: The great and important duty which is incumbent on Christians, is to guard against all appearance of evil to watch against the first risings in the heart to evil and to have a guard upon our actions, that they may not be sinful, or so much as seem to be so.
author: George Whitefield

quote: The great art of films does not consist of descriptive movement of face and body but in the movements of thought and soul transmitted in a kind of intense isolation.
author: Louise Brooks

quote: The great art of life is sensation, to feel that we exist, even in pain.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The great city is that which has the greatest man or woman: if it be a few ragged huts, it is still the greatest city in the whole world.
author: Walt Whitman

quote: The great constitutional corrective in the hands of the people against usurpation of power, or corruption by their agents is the right of suffrage and this when used with calmness and deliberation will prove strong enough.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: The great corporations of this country were not founded by ordinary people. They were founded by people with extraordinary intelligence, ambition, and aggressiveness.
author: Daniel Patrick Moynihan

quote: The great defense against the air menace is to attack the enemy's aircraft as near as possible to their point of departure.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The great end of life is not knowledge but action.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims, one turns, as it were, instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms, like a cuttlefish squirting out ink.
author: George Orwell

quote: The great fun in my life has been getting up every morning and rushing to the typewriter because some new idea has hit me.
author: Ray Bradbury

quote: The great gift of Easter is hope - Christian hope which makes us have that confidence in God, in his ultimate triumph, and in his goodness and love, which nothing can shake.
author: Basil Hume

quote: The great hope of society is in individual character.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: The great increase of our population throughout the Union will alone produce an important effect, and in no quarter will it be so sensibly felt as in those in contemplation.
author: James Monroe

quote: The great instrument of moral good is the imagination.
author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

quote: The great living experience for every man is his adventure into the woman. The man embraces in the woman all that is not himself, and from that one resultant, from that embrace, comes every new action.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: The great man is he who does not lose his child's-heart.
author: Mencius

quote: The great moments of rock 'n' roll were never off in some corner of the music world, in a self-constructed ghetto.
author: Bono

quote: The great nations have always acted like gangsters, and the small nations like prostitutes.
author: Stanley Kubrick

quote: The great object is that every man be armed.
author: Patrick Henry

quote: The great proof of madness is the disproportion of one's designs to one's means.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The great question is not whether you have failed, but whether you are content with failure.
author: Laurence J. Peter

quote: The great question that has never been answered, and which I have not yet been able to answer, despite my thirty years of research into the feminine soul, is 'What does a woman want?'
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The great questions of the day will not be settled by means of speeches and majority decisions but by iron and blood.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: The great rule of moral conduct is next to God, respect time.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: The great secret of a successful marriage is to treat all disasters as incidents and none of the incidents as disasters.
author: Harold Nicolson

quote: The great secret of success is to go through life as a man who never gets used up.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: The great strength of the totalitarian state is that it forces those who fear it to imitate it.
author: Adolf Hitler

quote: The great thing about getting older is that you don't lose all the other ages you've been.
author: Madeleine L'Engle

quote: The great use of life is to spend it for something that will outlast it.
author: William James

quote: The great work must inevitably be obscure, except to the very few, to those who like the author himself are initiated into the mysteries. Communication then is secondary: it is perpetuation which is important. For this only one good reader is necessary.
author: Henry Miller

quote: The greater intellect one has, the more originality one finds in men. Ordinary persons find no difference between men.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The greater part of our happiness or misery depends on our dispositions and not our circumstances.
author: Martha Washington

quote: The greater the obstacle, the more glory in overcoming it.
author: Moliere

quote: The greater the power, the more dangerous the abuse.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The greater the state, the more wrong and cruel its patriotism, and the greater is the sum of suffering upon which its power is founded.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quote: The greatest ability in business is to get along with others and to influence their actions.
author: John Hancock

quote: The greatest act of faith is when a man understands he is not God.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: The greatest advances of civilization, whether in architecture or painting, in science and literature, in industry or agriculture, have never come from centralized government.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: The greatest blessing of our democracy is freedom. But in the last analysis, our only freedom is the freedom to discipline ourselves.
author: Bernard Baruch

quote: The greatest crime since World War II has been U.S. foreign policy.
author: Ramsey Clark

quote: The greatest deception men suffer is from their own opinions.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The greatest destroyer of peace is abortion because if a mother can kill her own child, what is left for me to kill you and you to kill me? There is nothing between.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: The greatest discovery of my generation is that a human being can alter his life by altering his attitudes.
author: William James

quote: The greatest enemy of individual freedom is the individual himself.
author: Saul Alinsky

quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The greatest good you can do for another is not just to share your riches but to reveal to him his own.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The greatest happiness comes from being vitally interested in something that excites all your energies.
author: Walter Annenberg

quote: The greatest happiness is to know the source of unhappiness.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

quote: The greatest happiness is to transform one's feelings into action.
author: Madame de Stael

quote: The greatest happiness of life is the conviction that we are loved loved for ourselves, or rather, loved in spite of ourselves.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The greatest happiness of the greatest number is the foundation of morals and legislation.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: The greatest homage we can pay to truth, is to use it.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The greatest obstacle to being heroic is the doubt whether one may not be going to prove one's self a fool the truest heroism is to resist the doubt and the profoundest wisdom, to know when it ought to be resisted, and when it be obeyed.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: The greatest obstacle to discovery is not ignorance - it is the illusion of knowledge.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: The greatest of follies is to sacrifice health for any other kind of happiness.
author: Arthur Schopenhauer

quote: The greatest part of a writer's time is spent in reading in order to write. A man will turn over half a library to make a book.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The greatest pleasure of life is love.
author: Euripides

quote: The greatest pleasure when I started making money was not buying cars or yachts but finding myself able to have as many freshly typed drafts as possible.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: The greatest power is not money power, but political power.
author: Walter Annenberg

quote: The greatest remedy for anger is delay.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The greatest sweetener of human life is Friendship. To raise this to the highest pitch of enjoyment, is a secret which but few discover.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: The greatest test of courage on earth is to bear defeat without losing heart.
author: Robert Green Ingersoll

quote: The greatest thing a human soul ever does in this world... to see clearly is poetry, prophecy and religion all in one.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The greatest thing in family life is to take a hint when a hint is intended-and not to take a hint when a hint isn't intended.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The greatest tragedy in mankind's entire history may be the hijacking of morality by religion.
author: Arthur C. Clarke

quote: The greatest truth is honesty, and the greatest falsehood is dishonesty.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: The greatest way to live with honor in this world is to be what we pretend to be.
author: Socrates

quote: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
author: Plato

quote: The greatest weariness comes from work not done.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: The greatest writers of this age... are aware of the mystery of our existence.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: The greatness of art is not to find what is common but what is unique.
author: Isaac Bashevis Singer

quote: The greatness of man is great in that he knows himself to be wretched. A tree does not know itself to be wretched.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The gross heathenism of civilization has generally destroyed nature, and poetry, and all that is spiritual.
author: John Muir

quote: The grounding in natural sciences which I obtained in the course of my medical studies, including preliminary examinations in botany, zoology, physics, and chemistry, was to become decisive in determining the trend of my literary work.
author: Johannes Vilhelm Jensen

quote: The growth and development of people is the highest calling of leadership.
author: Harvey S. Firestone

quote: The growth of modern constitutional government compels for its successful practice the exercise of reason and considerate judgment by the individual citizens who constitute the electorate.
author: Elihu Root

quote: The guy who knows about computers is the last person you want to have creating documentation for people who don't understand computers.
author: Adam Osborne

quote: The habit of religion is oppressive, an easy way out of thought.
author: Peter Ustinov

quote: The happiest part of a man's life is what he passes lying awake in bed in the morning.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The happiest women, like the happiest nations, have no history.
author: George Eliot

quote: The happiness and peace attained by those satisfied by the nectar of spiritual tranquillity is not attained by greedy persons restlessly moving here and there.
author: Chanakya

quote: The happiness of a man in this life does not consist in the absence but in the mastery of his passions.
author: Alfred Lord Tennyson

quote: The happiness of life is made up of minute fractions - the little, soon forgotten charities of a kiss or a smile, a kind look or heartfelt compliment.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The happiness of one's own heart alone cannot satisfy the soul one must try to include, as necessary to one's own happiness, the happiness of others.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: The happiness of society is the end of government.
author: John Adams

quote: The happiness of the bee and the dolphin is to exist. For man it is to know that and to wonder at it.
author: Jacques Yves Cousteau

quote: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts: therefore, guard accordingly, and take care that you entertain no notions unsuitable to virtue and reasonable nature.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The happy Union of these States is a wonder their Constitution a miracle their example the hope of Liberty throughout the world.
author: James Madison

quote: The harder I work, the luckier I get.
author: Samuel Goldwyn

quote: The harder the conflict, the more glorious the triumph.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The harder you work, the harder it is to surrender.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: The hardest job kids face today is learning good manners without seeing any.
author: Fred Astaire

quote: The hardest thing to understand in the world is the income tax.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The harvest of old age is the recollection and abundance of blessing previously secured.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The hate of men will pass, and dictators die, and the power they took from the people will return to the people. And so long as men die, liberty will never perish.
author: Charlie Chaplin

quote: The health care industry can play a great role in this by being aware of the fact that these children form perhaps the most neglected group of people in the country, largely because it is hard to find them.
author: C. Everett Koop

quote: The health of a democratic society may be measured by the quality of functions performed by private citizens.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: The health of the eye seems to demand a horizon. We are never tired, so long as we can see far enough.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The health of the people is really the foundation upon which all their happiness and all their powers as a state depend.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The heart forgets its sorrow and ache.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The heart has its reasons of which reason knows nothing.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The heart is great which shows moderation in the midst of prosperity.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The heart never grows better by age I fear rather worse, always harder. A young liar will be an old one, and a young knave will only be a greater knave as he grows older.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: The heart of a mother is a deep abyss at the bottom of which you will always find forgiveness.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The heart of marriage is memories and if the two of you happen to have the same ones and can savor your reruns, then your marriage is a gift from the gods.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: The heart will break, but broken live on.
author: Lord Byron

quote: The heart, like the stomach, wants a varied diet.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: The heights of popularity and patriotism are still the beaten road to power and tyranny.
author: David Hume

quote: The herd seek out the great, not for their sake but for their influence and the great welcome them out of vanity or need.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The heresy of one age becomes the orthodoxy of the next.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The high-spirited man may indeed die, but he will not stoop to meanness. Fire, though it may be quenched, will not become cool.
author: Ovid

quote: The higher American patriotism, on the other hand, combines loyalty to historical tradition and precedent with the imaginative projection of an ideal national Promise.
author: Herbert Croly

quote: The higher Greek poetry did not make up fictitious plots its business was to express the heroic saga, the myths.
author: Gilbert Murray

quote: The higher the building the lower the morals.
author: Noel Coward

quote: The highest activity a human being can attain is learning for understanding, because to understand is to be free.
author: Baruch Spinoza

quote: The highest and most beautiful things in life are not to be heard about, nor read about, nor seen but, if one will, are to be lived.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: The highest art is always the most religious, and the greatest artist is always a devout person.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The highest education is that which does not merely give us information but makes our life in harmony with all existence.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: The highest glory of the American Revolution was this: it connected in one indissoluble bond the principles of civil government with the principles of Christianity.
author: John Quincy Adams

quote: The highest patriotism is not a blind acceptance of official policy, but a love of one's country deep enough to call her to a higher plain.
author: George McGovern

quote: The highest political buzz word is not liberty, equality, fraternity or solidarity it is service.
author: Arthur Hugh Clough

quote: The highest prize in a world of men is the most beautiful woman available on your arm and living there in her heart loyal to you.
author: Norman Mailer

quote: The highest purpose is to have no purpose at all. This puts one in accord with nature, in her manner of operation.
author: John Cage

quote: The highest result of education is tolerance.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The highest revelation is that God is in every man.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The highest use of capital is not to make more money, but to make money do more for the betterment of life.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The historian must have some conception of how men who are not historians behave. Otherwise he will move in a world of the dead. He can only gain that conception through personal experience, and he can only use his personal experiences when he is a genius.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: The historic ascent of humanity, taken as a whole, may be summarized as a succession of victories of consciousness over blind forces - in nature, in society, in man himself.
author: Leon Trotsky

quote: The history of all previous societies has been the history of class struggles.
author: Karl Marx

quote: The history of astronomy is a history of receding horizons.
author: Edwin Powell Hubble

quote: The history of liberty is a history of resistance.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: The history of mankind is the history of ideas.
author: Luigi Pirandello

quote: The history of mankind is the instant between two strides taken by a traveler.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: The history of men's opposition to women's emancipation is more interesting perhaps than the story of that emancipation itself.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The history of modern art is also the history of the progressive loss of art's audience. Art has increasingly become the concern of the artist and the bafflement of the public.
author: Paul Gauguin

quote: The history of philosophy is not, like the history of the sciences, to be studied with the intellect alone. That which is receptive in us and that which impinges upon us from history is the reality of man's being, unfolding itself in thought.
author: Karl Jaspers

quote: The history of philosophy is to a great extent that of a certain clash of human temperaments.
author: William James

quote: The history of progress is written in the blood of men and women who have dared to espouse an unpopular cause, as, for instance, the black man's right to his body, or woman's right to her soul.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: The history of saints is mainly the history of insane people.
author: Benito Mussolini

quote: The history of the past is but one long struggle upward to equality.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: The history of the world is none other than the progress of the consciousness of freedom.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: The history of the world is the world's court of justice.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: The history of thought may be summed up in these words: it is absurd by what it seeks and great by what it finds.
author: Paul Valery

quote: The home is the chief school of human virtues.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: The home should be the treasure chest of living.
author: Le Corbusier

quote: The hope of a secure and livable world lies with disciplined nonconformists who are dedicated to justice, peace and brotherhood.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The hottest place in Hell is reserved for those who remain neutral in times of great moral conflict.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The hours I spend with you I look upon as sort of a perfumed garden, a dim twilight, and a fountain singing to it. You and you alone make me feel that I am alive. Other men it is said have seen angels, but I have seen thee and thou art enough.
author: George Edward Moore

quote: The hours of folly are measured by the clock but of wisdom, no clock can measure.
author: William Blake

quote: The human being is in the most literal sense a political animal, not merely a gregarious animal, but an animal which can individuate itself only in the midst of society.
author: Karl Marx

quote: The human body is the best picture of the human soul.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: The human consciousness is really homogeneous. There is no complete forgetting, even in death.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: The human foot is a masterpiece of engineering and a work of art.
author: Leonardo da Vinci

quote: The human imagination has already come to conceive the possibility of recreating human society.
author: Edmund Wilson

quote: The human mind is capable of excitement without the application of gross and violent stimulants and he must have a very faint perception of its beauty and dignity who does not know this.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: The human race is governed by its imagination.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The human race's prospects of survival were considerably better when we were defenceless against tigers than they are today when we have become defenceless against ourselves.
author: Arnold J. Toynbee

quote: The human soul needs actual beauty more than bread.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: The human species, according to the best theory I can form of it, is composed of two distinct races, the men who borrow and the men who lend.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: The humblest individual exerts some influence, either for good or evil, upon others.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The humblest painter is a true scholar and the best of scholars the scholar of nature.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The hunger for love is much more difficult to remove than the hunger for bread.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: The hypothesis may be put forward, to be tested by the s subsequent investigation, that this development has been in large part a matter of the reciprocal interaction of new factual insights and knowledge on the one hand with changes in the theoretical system on the other.
author: Talcott Parsons

quote: The iPod completely changed the way people approach music.
author: Karl Lagerfeld

quote: The idea of winning a doctor's degree gradually assumed the aspect of a great moral struggle, and the moral fight possessed immense attraction for me.
author: Elizabeth Blackwell

quote: The idea that religion and politics don't mix was invented by the Devil to keep Christians from running their own country.
author: Jerry Falwell

quote: The idea that to make a man work you've got to hold gold in front of his eyes is a growth, not an axiom. We've done that for so long that we've forgotten there's any other way.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

quote: The ideal and the beautiful are identical the ideal corresponds to the idea, and beauty to form hence idea and substance are cognate.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The ideal beauty is a fugitive which is never found.
author: Joan Rivers

quote: The ideal form of government is democracy tempered with assassination.
author: Voltaire

quote: The ideal has many names, and beauty is but one of them.
author: Ninon de L'Enclos

quote: The ideal man bears the accidents of life with dignity and grace, making the best of circumstances.
author: Aristotle

quote: The ideas gained by men before they are twenty-five are practically the only ideas they shall have in their lives.
author: William James

quote: The ideas of the ruling class are in every epoch the ruling ideas, i.e., the class which is the ruling material force of society, is at the same time its ruling intellectual force.
author: Karl Marx

quote: The imagination imitates. It is the critical spirit that creates.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The imagination is the spur of delights... all depends upon it, it is the mainspring of everything now, is it not by means of the imagination one knows joy? Is it not of the imagination that the sharpest pleasures arise?
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: The imaginations which people have of one another are the solid facts of society.
author: Charles Horton Cooley

quote: The immediacy of mystic experience simply means that we know God just as we know other objects. God is not a mathematical entity or a system of concepts mutually related to one another and having no reference to experience.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: The immortality of the soul is a matter which is of so great consequence to us and which touches us so profoundly that we must have lost all feeling to be indifferent about it.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The implications of these considerations justify the statement that all empirically verifiable knowledge even the commonsense knowledge of everyday life - involves implicitly, if not explicitly, systematic theory in this sense.
author: Talcott Parsons

quote: The importance of money flows from it being a link between the present and the future.
author: John Maynard Keynes

quote: The important things are children, honesty, integrity and faith.
author: Andy Williams

quote: The important work of moving the world forward does not wait to be done by perfect men.
author: George Eliot

quote: The impressions of the spriritual experiences gave my future life its form and content.
author: Gustav Mahler

quote: The improvement of understanding is for two ends: first, our own increase of knowledge secondly, to enable us to deliver that knowledge to others.
author: John Locke

quote: The impulse to cruelty is, in many people, almost as violent as the impulse to sexual love - almost as violent and much more mischievous.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The incentive to ambition is the love of power.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The income tax created more criminals than any other single act of government.
author: Barry Goldwater

quote: The increased presence of Muslims in Italy and in Europe is directly proportional to our loss of freedom.
author: Oriana Fallaci

quote: The independence of all political and other bother is a happiness.
author: Rutherford B. Hayes

quote: The independence of the economic sphere was a tenet of faith with Liberalism.
author: Francis Parker Yockey

quote: The independent girl is a person before whose wrath only the most rash dare stand, and, they, it must be confessed, with much fear and trembling.
author: Lou Henry Hoover

quote: The individual is not accountable to society for his actions in so far as these concern the interests of no person but himself.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The infinitely little have a pride infinitely great.
author: Voltaire

quote: The infliction of cruelty with a good conscience is a delight to moralists. That is why they invented Hell.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The infrastructure for linking environmental health and public health is not working as well as it should.
author: Samuel Wilson

quote: The ingredients of health and long life, are great temperance, open air, easy labor, and little care.
author: Philip Sidney

quote: The innocent and the beautiful have no enemy but time.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: The instant formal government is abolished, society begins to act. A general association takes place, and common interest produces common security.
author: Thomas Paine

quote: The institution of chivalry forms one of the most remarkable features in the history of the Middle Ages.
author: Horatio Alger

quote: The instruction we find in books is like fire. We fetch it from our neighbours, kindle it at home, communicate it to others, and it becomes the property of all.
author: Voltaire

quote: The insufferable arrogance of human beings to think that Nature was made solely for their benefit, as if it was conceivable that the sun had been set afire merely to ripen men's apples and head their cabbages.
author: Cyrano de Bergerac

quote: The intellect of the wise is like glass it admits the light of heaven and reflects it.
author: Augustus Hare

quote: The intellectual is different from the ordinary man, but only in certain sections of his personality, and even then not all the time.
author: George Orwell

quote: The intellectual takes as a starting point his self and relates the world to his own sensibilities the scientist accepts an existing field of knowledge and seeks to map out the unexplored terrain.
author: Daniel Bell

quote: The intellectual tradition is one of servility to power, and if I didn't betray it I'd be ashamed of myself.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: The intelligence failures with respect to Iraq were massive and have damaged our credibility around the world.
author: Carl Levin

quote: The intelligence investigation under the leadership of Senator Church, which I know has helped cause this investigation by you, points out that the agencies did not disclose certain facts to us and that certain plots were going on.
author: John Sherman Cooper

quote: The intelligence of the lower forms of animal life, like a great deal of human intelligence, does not involve a self.
author: George H. Mead

quote: The intelligent man is one who has successfully fulfilled many accomplishments, and is yet willing to learn more.
author: Ed Parker

quote: The intense happiness of our union is derived in a high degree from the perfect freedom with which we each follow and declare our own impressions.
author: George Eliot

quote: The internet could be a very positive step towards education, organisation and participation in a meaningful society.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: The internet is a great way to get on the net.
author: Bob Dole

quote: The interpretation of dreams is a great art.
author: Paracelsus

quote: The interpretation of dreams is the royal road to a knowledge of the unconscious activities of the mind.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The intoxication of anger, like that of the grape, shows us to others, but hides us from ourselves.
author: John Dryden

quote: The introduction of many minds into many fields of learning along a broad spectrum keeps alive questions about the accessibility, if not the unity, of knowledge.
author: Edward Levi

quote: The invariable mark of wisdom is to see the miraculous in the common.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The investigator should have a robust faith - and yet not believe.
author: Claude Bernard

quote: The irony is that it was tougher to rent a car from Cerberus when it owned Alamo than to buy a semi-automatic. To rent a car, one had to provide ID, a drivers' license, and get insurance coverage. To buy a gun? Cash and carry, from the back of a station wagon at a gun show. No concerns about downstream liability or risk.
author: Eliot Spitzer

quote: The issue of civil rights was too much for the establishment to handle. One of the chapters of history that's least studied by historians is the 300 to 500 riots in the U.S. between 1965 and 1970.
author: Tom Hayden

quote: The jealous are possessed by a mad devil and a dull spirit at the same time.
author: Johann Kaspar Lavater

quote: The jealous are troublesome to others, but a torment to themselves.
author: William Penn

quote: The job of the Central Bank is to worry.
author: Alice Rivlin

quote: The joy of life consists in the exercise of one's energies, continual growth, constant change, the enjoyment of every new experience. To stop means simply to die. The eternal mistake of mankind is to set up an attainable ideal.
author: Aleister Crowley

quote: The joy of the mind is the measure of its strength.
author: Ninon de L'Enclos

quote: The keenest sorrow is to recognize ourselves as the sole cause of all our adversities.
author: Sophocles

quote: The key is to keep company only with people who uplift you, whose presence calls forth your best.
author: Epictetus

quote: The key to being a good manager is keeping the people who hate me away from those who are still undecided.
author: Casey Stengel

quote: The key to education is the experience of beauty.
author: Friedrich Schiller

quote: The key to organizing an alternative society is to organize people around what they can do, and more importantly, what they want to do.
author: Abbie Hoffman

quote: The key to wisdom is this - constant and frequent questioning, for by doubting we are led to question and by questioning we arrive at the truth.
author: Peter Abelard

quote: The keys to patience are acceptance and faith. Accept things as they are, and look realistically at the world around you. Have faith in yourself and in the direction you have chosen.
author: Ralph Marston

quote: The knives of jealousy are honed on details.
author: Ruth Rendell

quote: The knower and the known are one. Simple people imagine that they should see God as if he stood there and they here. This is not so. God and I, we are one in knowledge.
author: Meister Eckhart

quote: The knowledge of God is the cause of things. For the knowledge of God is to all creatures what the knowledge of the artificer is to things made by his art.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: The knowledge of God is very far from the love of Him.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The knowledge of anything, since all things have causes, is not acquired or complete unless it is known by its causes.
author: Avicenna

quote: The knowledge of the ancient languages is mainly a luxury.
author: John Bright

quote: The knowledge of the theory of logic has no tendency whatever to make men good reasoners.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

quote: The knowledge of yourself will preserve you from vanity.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

quote: The knowledge that there is a part of the psychic functions that are out of conscious reach, we did not need to wait for Freud to know this!
author: Jacques Lacan

quote: The lack of access to proper nutrition is not only fueling obesity, it is leading to food insecurity and hunger among our children.
author: Tom Vilsack

quote: The lack of money is the root of all evil.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The ladder of success in Hollywood is usually a press agent, actor, director, producer, leading man and you are a star if you sleep with each of them in that order. Crude, but true.
author: Hedy Lamarr

quote: The ladder of success is best climbed by stepping on the rungs of opportunity.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: The lake and the mountains have become my landscape, my real world.
author: Georges Simenon

quote: The language of excitement is at best picturesque merely. You must be calm before you can utter oracles.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The language of friendship is not words but meanings.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The large majority of the Negroes who have put on the finishing touches of our best colleges are all but worthless in the development of their people.
author: Carter G. Woodson

quote: The last few years have been my happiest. I'm happy in the years that most people are blue and sad and waiting to die. I don't feel that a bit. Smiling has a lot to do with it. You can just lift your spirits by smiling a little bit.
author: William Proxmire

quote: The last of human freedoms - the ability to chose one's attitude in a given set of circumstances.
author: Viktor E. Frankl

quote: The last part, the part you're now approaching, was for Aristotle the most important for happiness.
author: Charles Van Doren

quote: The last thing a woman will consent to discover in a man whom she loves, or on whom she simply depends, is want of courage.
author: Joseph Conrad

quote: The last thing one discovers in composing a work is what to put first.
author: T. S. Eliot

quote: The last time I saw him he was walking down lover's lane holding his own hand.
author: Fred Allen

quote: The law always limits every power it gives.
author: David Hume

quote: The law is an adroit mixture of customs that are beneficial to society, and could be followed even if no law existed, and others that are of advantage to a ruling minority, but harmful to the masses of men, and can be enforced on them only by terror.
author: Peter Kropotkin

quote: The law of humanity ought to be composed of the past, the present, and the future, that we bear within us whoever possesses but one of these terms, has but a fragment of the law of the moral world.
author: Edgar Quinet

quote: The law of nations is naturally founded on this principle, that different nations ought in time of peace to do one another all the good they can, and in time of war as little injury as possible, without prejudicing their real interests.
author: Charles de Secondat

quote: The law was made for one thing alone, for the exploitation of those who don't understand it, or are prevented by naked misery from obeying it.
author: Bertolt Brecht

quote: The law will never make a man free it is men who have got to make the law free.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The law, in its majestic equality, forbids the rich as well as the poor to sleep under bridges, to beg in the streets, and to steal bread.
author: Anatole France

quote: The laws of nature are but the mathematical thoughts of God.
author: Euclid

quote: The lawyer's truth is not Truth, but consistency or a consistent expediency.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The lead car is unique, except for the one behind it which is identical.
author: Murray Walker

quote: The leader is one who mobilizes others toward a goal shared by leaders and followers... Leaders, followers and goals make up the three equally necessary supports for leadership.
author: Gary Wills

quote: The leadership lost its nerve. Instead of taking the lead in the reform movement... they pulled the plug on it. They tried and are still trying to return the church to the dry ice of the previous century and a half.
author: Andrew Greeley

quote: The learned is happy, nature to explore The fool is happy, that he knows no more.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The learner always begins by finding fault, but the scholar sees the positive merit in everything.
author: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel

quote: The learning and knowledge that we have, is, at the most, but little compared with that of which we are ignorant.
author: Plato

quote: The learning process continues until the day you die.
author: Kirk Douglas

quote: The learning process is something you can incite, literally incite, like a riot.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: The least initial deviation from the truth is multiplied later a thousandfold.
author: Aristotle

quote: The least movement is of importance to all nature. The entire ocean is affected by a pebble.
author: Blaise Pascal

quote: The legal battle against segregation is won, but the community battle goes on.
author: Dorothy Day

quote: The legal difference between the sit-ins and the Freedom Riders was significant.
author: Constance Baker Motley

quote: The legal right of a taxpayer to decrease the amount of what otherwise would be his taxes, or altogether avoid them, by means which the law permits, cannot be doubted.
author: George Sutherland

quote: The legal system is often a mystery, and we, its priests, preside over rituals baffling to everyday citizens.
author: Henry Miller

quote: The length of a film should be directly related to the endurance of the human bladder.
author: Alfred Hitchcock

quote: The less I behave like Whistler's mother the night before, the more I look like her the morning after.
author: Tallulah Bankhead

quote: The less government interferes with private pursuits, the better for general prosperity.
author: Martin Van Buren

quote: The less men think, the more they talk.
author: Charles de Montesquieu

quote: The less routine the more life.
author: Amos Bronson Alcott

quote: The less we deserve good fortune, the more we hope for it.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The lesson should be constantly enforced that though the people support the Government, Government should not support the people.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: The liberties and freedoms which we hold dear and we recognize and cherish and respect guide the way we gather information in the United States.
author: John Ashcroft

quote: The lie is a condition of life.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: The life and liberty and property and happiness of the common man throughout the world are at the absolute mercy of a few persons whom he has never seen, involved in complicated quarrels that he has never heard of.
author: Gilbert Murray

quote: The life of a man consists not in seeing visions and in dreaming dreams, but in active charity and in willing service.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The life of a man who deliberately runs through his fortune often becomes a business speculation his friends, his pleasures, patrons, and acquaintances are his capital.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The life of an uneducated man is as useless as the tail of a dog which neither covers its rear end, nor protects it from the bites of insects.
author: Chanakya

quote: The life of the dead is placed in the memory of the living.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The light of lights looks always on the motive, not the deed, the shadow of shadows on the deed alone.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: The light which puts out our eyes is darkness to us. Only that day dawns to which we are awake. There is more day to dawn. The sun is but a morning star.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The limitation upon this mode of promoting peace lies in the fact that it consists in an appeal to the civilized side of man, while war is the product of forces proceeding from man's original savage nature.
author: Elihu Root

quote: The lines of poetry, the period of prose, and even the texts of Scripture most frequently recollected and quoted, are those which are felt to be preeminently musical.
author: William Shenstone

quote: The link between my experience as an entrepreneur and that of a politician is all in one word: freedom.
author: Silvio Berlusconi

quote: The little may contrast with the great, in painting, but cannot be said to be contrary to it. Oppositions of colors contrast but there are also colors contrary to each other, that is, which produce an ill effect because they shock the eye when brought very near it.
author: Voltaire

quote: The little religion that I have clung to-that what matters most is the continuity of life, and its improvement from one generation to another.
author: David O. Selznick

quote: The logic of the world is prior to all truth and falsehood.
author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quote: The long time to come when I shall not exist has more effect on me than this short present time, which nevertheless seems endless.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The long-established and noble rule of Law, one of the greatest products of the character and tradition of British history, has suffered a deadly blow. Blackmail has become respectable.
author: Robert Menzies

quote: The longer one is alone, the easier it is to hear the song of the earth.
author: Robert Anton Wilson

quote: The loss of a friend is like that of a limb time may heal the anguish of the wound, but the loss cannot be repaired.
author: Robert Southey

quote: The loss of liberty at home is to be charged to the provisions against danger, real or imagined, from abroad.
author: James Madison

quote: The love of a mother is the veil of a softer light between the heart and the heavenly Father.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The love of beauty in its multiple forms is the noblest gift of the human cerebrum.
author: Alexis Carrel

quote: The love of economy is the root of all virtue.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The love of family and the admiration of friends is much more important than wealth and privilege.
author: Charles Kuralt

quote: The love of heaven makes one heavenly.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The love of learning, the sequestered nooks, And all the sweet serenity of books.
author: Henry Wadsworth Longfellow

quote: The love of liberty is the love of others the love of power is the love of ourselves.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The love of the famous, like all strong passions, is quite abstract. Its intensity can be measured mathematically, and it is independent of persons.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: The love that lasts longest is the love that is never returned.
author: W. Somerset Maugham

quote: The lovely thing about being forty is that you can appreciate twenty-five-year-old men more.
author: Colleen McCullough

quote: The lover of life makes the whole world into his family, just as the lover of the fair sex creates his from all the lovely women he has found, from those that could be found, and those who are impossible to find.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: The lunatic, the lover, and the poet, are of imagination all compact.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The machine does not isolate man from the great problems of nature but plunges him more deeply into them.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: The magic of America is that we're a free and open society with a mixed population. Part of our security is our freedom.
author: Madeleine Albright

quote: The main business of religions is to purify, control, and restrain that excessive and exclusive taste for well-being which men acquire in times of equality.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: The main dangers in this life are the people who want to change everything... or nothing.
author: Nancy Astor

quote: The main facts in human life are five: birth, food, sleep, love and death.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: The main foundations of every state, new states as well as ancient or composite ones, are good laws and good arms you cannot have good laws without good arms, and where there are good arms, good laws inevitably follow.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: The main goal of the future is to stop violence. The world is addicted to it.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: The main object of religion is not to get a man into heaven, but to get heaven into him.
author: Thomas Hardy

quote: The main purpose of life is to live rightly, think rightly, act rightly. The soul must languish when we give all our thought to the body.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The main purpose of science is simplicity and as we understand more things, everything is becoming simpler.
author: Edward Teller

quote: The main reason Santa is so jolly is because he knows where all the bad girls live.
author: George Carlin

quote: The main thing I believe in is freedom.
author: Charles Evers

quote: The main thing is that it's nice to see these young people - 9 to 14 years old - take the opportunity to get more involved in their health and fitness. We need more kids to be more active.
author: Rafer Johnson

quote: The main thing is to make history, not to write it.
author: Otto von Bismarck

quote: The main thing that gives me hope is the media. We have radio, TV, magazines, and books, so we have the possibility of learning from societies that are remote from us, like Somalia. We turn on the TV and see what blew up in Iraq or we see conditions in Afghanistan.
author: Jared Diamond

quote: The major advances in speed of communication and ability to interact took place more than a century ago. The shift from sailing ships to telegraph was far more radical than that from telephone to email!
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: The major civilizing force in the world is not religion, it is sex.
author: Hugh Hefner

quote: The major obstacle to a religious renewal is the intellectual classes, who are highly influential and tend to view religion as primitive superstition. They believe that science has left atheism as the only respectable intellectual stance.
author: Robert Bork

quote: The majority of husbands remind me of an orangutan trying to play the violin.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The making of friends who are real friends, is the best token we have of a man's success in life.
author: Edward Everett Hale

quote: The man form is higher than the angel form of all forms it is the highest. Man is the highest being in creation, because he aspires to freedom.
author: Paramahansa Yogananda

quote: The man of genius is he and he alone who finds such joy in his art that he will work at it come hell or high water.
author: Stendhal

quote: The man of knowledge must be able not only to love his enemies but also to hate his friends.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quote: The man of science is a poor philosopher.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The man that hath no music in himself, Nor is not moved with concord of sweet sounds, is fit for treasons, stratagems and spoils.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: The man who comes up with a means for doing or producing almost anything better, faster or more economically has his future and his fortune at his fingertips.
author: J. Paul Getty

quote: The man who does not read good books has no advantage over the man who cannot read them.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The man who goes alone can start today but he who travels with another must wait till that other is ready.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The man who has done his best has done everything.
author: Charles M. Schwab

quote: The man who has no inner-life is a slave to his surroundings.
author: Henri Frederic Amiel

quote: The man who interprets Nature is always held in great honor.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: The man who is aware of himself is henceforward independent and he is never bored, and life is only too short, and he is steeped through and through with a profound yet temperate happiness.
author: Virginia Woolf

quote: The man who is swimming against the stream knows the strength of it.
author: Woodrow Wilson
