quote: The man who loves other countries as much as his own stands on a level with the man who loves other women as much as he loves his own wife.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The man who makes everything that leads to happiness depends upon himself, and not upon other men, has adopted the very best plan for living happily. This is the man of moderation, the man of manly character and of wisdom.
author: Plato

quote: The man who never in his mind and thoughts travel'd to heaven is no artist.
author: William Blake

quote: The man who radiates good cheer, who makes life happier wherever he meets it, is always a man of vision and faith.
author: Ella Wheeler Wilcox

quote: The man who throws a bomb is an artist, because he prefers a great moment to everything.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: The man who will use his skill and constructive imagination to see how much he can give for a dollar, instead of how little he can give for a dollar, is bound to succeed.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The man who writes about himself and his own time is the only man who writes about all people and about all time.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The man whose only pleasure in life is making money, weighs less on the moral scale than an angleworm.
author: Josh Billings

quote: The man with the best job in the country is the vice-president. All he has to do is get up every morning and say, 'How is the president?'
author: Will Rogers

quote: The man with the real sense of humor is the man who can put himself in the spectator's place and laugh at his own misfortune.
author: Bert Williams

quote: The manic pursuit of success cost me everything I could love: my wife, my three children, some friends I would have liked to grow old with.
author: Sammy Davis, Jr.

quote: The march of invention has clothed mankind with powers of which a century ago the boldest imagination could not have dreamt.
author: Henry George

quote: The march of science and technology does not imply growing intellectual complexity in the lives of most people. It often means the opposite.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: The mark of a good action is that it appears inevitable in retrospect.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The mark of a great player is in his ability to come back. The great champions have all come back from defeat.
author: Sam Snead

quote: The mark of a truly civilized man is confidence in the strength and security derived from the inquiring mind.
author: Felix Frankfurter

quote: The mark of fear is not easily removed.
author: Ernest Gaines

quote: The martial music of every sideburned delinquent on the face of the earth.
author: Frank Sinatra

quote: The marvel of all history is the patience with which men and women submit to burdens unnecessarily laid upon them by their governments.
author: George Washington

quote: The marvel of the Bhagavad-Gita is its truly beautiful revelation of life's wisdom which enables philosophy to blossom into religion.
author: Herman Hesse

quote: The marvelous richness of human experience would lose something of rewarding joy if there were no limitations to overcome. The hilltop hour would not be half so wonderful if there were no dark valleys to traverse.
author: Helen Keller

quote: The mass of men lead lives of quiet desperation. What is called resignation is confirmed desperation.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The mastery of nature is vainly believed to be an adequate substitute for self mastery.
author: Reinhold Niebuhr

quote: The mathematical facts worthy of being studied are those which, by their analogy with other facts, are capable of leading us to the knowledge of a physical law.
author: Henri Poincare

quote: The meaning of life is not to be discovered only after death in some hidden, mysterious realm on the contrary, it can be found by eating the succulent fruit of the Tree of Life and by living in the here and now as fully and creatively as we can.
author: Paul Kurtz

quote: The meaning of peace is the absence of opposition to socialism.
author: Karl Marx

quote: The meaning of things lies not in the things themselves, but in our attitude towards them.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupery

quote: The means by which we live have outdistanced the ends for which we live. Our scientific power has outrun our spiritual power. We have guided missiles and misguided men.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The means of defense against foreign danger historically have become the instruments of tyranny at home.
author: James Madison

quote: The measure of a man is what he does with power.
author: Plato

quote: The measure of success is not whether you have a tough problem to deal with, but whether it is the same problem you had last year.
author: John Foster Dulles

quote: The media's the most powerful entity on earth. They have the power to make the innocent guilty and to make the guilty innocent, and that's power. Because they control the minds of the masses.
author: Malcom X

quote: The mediator of the inexpressible is the work of art.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: The meek shall inherit the Earth, but not its mineral rights.
author: J. Paul Getty

quote: The megalomaniac differs from the narcissist by the fact that he wishes to be powerful rather than charming, and seeks to be feared rather than loved. To this type belong many lunatics and most of the great men of history.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The memory of my own suffering has prevented me from ever shadowing one young soul with the superstition of the Christian religion.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: The men and women who serve in our military have won for us every hour we live in freedom, sometimes at the expense of the very hours of the lifetimes they had hoped to live.
author: Bob Riley

quote: The men who followed Him were unique in their generation. They turned the world upside down because their hearts had been turned right side up. The world has never been the same.
author: Billy Graham

quote: The men who learn endurance, are they who call the whole world, brother.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The mere assemblage of peace loving people to interchange convincing reasons for their common faith, mere exhortation and argument to the public in favor of peace in general fall short of the mark.
author: Elihu Root

quote: The mere imparting of information is not education.
author: Carter G. Woodson

quote: The message of music was also the first thing what I learned from my first teacher. She was an organist too and she was very devoted to what she played, so she had a respect for every piece and she felt that she is not allowed to add something of her own.
author: Kurt Masur

quote: The message of women's liberation is that women can love each other and ourselves against our degrading education.
author: Jane Rule

quote: The method of nature: who could ever analyze it?
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The method of political science is the interpretation of life its instrument is insight, a nice understanding of subtle, unformulated conditions.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: The methods by which a trade union can alone act, are necessarily destructive its organization is necessarily tyrannical.
author: Henry George

quote: The methods of peace propaganda which aim at establishing peace doctrine by argument and by creating a feeling favorable to peace in general seem to fall short of reaching the springs of human action and of dealing with the causes of the conduct which they seek to modify.
author: Elihu Root

quote: The military don't start wars. Politicians start wars.
author: William Westmoreland

quote: The mind is never satisfied with the objects immediately before it, but is always breaking away from the present moment, and losing itself in schemes of future felicity... The natural flights of the human mind are not from pleasure to pleasure, but from hope to hope.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The mind is not a vessel to be filled but a fire to be kindled.
author: Plutarch

quote: The mind that is anxious about the future is miserable.
author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

quote: The mind that is wise mourns less for what age takes away than what it leaves behind.
author: William Wordsworth

quote: The mind uses its faculty for creativity only when experience forces it to do so.
author: Henri Poincare

quote: The mind, in proportion as it is cut off from free communication with nature, with revelation, with God, with itself, loses its life, just as the body droops when debarred from the air and the cheering light from heaven.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: The minute that you're not learning I believe you're dead.
author: Jack Nicholson

quote: The minute you got the Nobel Peace Prize, things that I said yesterday, with nobody paying too much attention, I say the same things after I got it - oh! It was quite crucial for people, and it helped our morale because apartheid did look invincible.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: The minute you try to talk business with him he takes the attitude that he is a gentleman and a scholar, and the moment you try to approach him on the level of his moral integrity he starts to talk business.
author: Raymond Chandler

quote: The miracle is not that we do this work, but that we are happy to do it.
author: Mother Teresa

quote: The miracles of the church seem to me to rest not so much upon faces or voices or healing power coming suddenly near to us from afar off, but upon our perceptions being made finer, so that for a moment our eyes can see and our ears can hear what is there about us always.
author: Willa Cather

quote: The mob spirit has grown with the increasing intelligence of the Afro-American.
author: Ida B. Wells

quote: The modern conservative is engaged in one of man's oldest exercises in moral philosophy that is, the search for a superior moral justification for selfishness.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: The modern mind is in complete disarray. Knowledge has stretched itself to the point where neither the world nor our intelligence can find any foot-hold. It is a fact that we are suffering from nihilism.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The modern mind tends to be more and more critical and analytical in spirit, hence it must devise for itself an engine of expression which is logically defensible at every point and which tends to correspond to the rigorous spirit of modern science.
author: Edward Sapir

quote: The moment I have realized God sitting in the temple of every human body, the moment I stand in reverence before every human being and see God in him - that moment I am free from bondage, everything that binds vanishes, and I am free.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: The moment a person forms a theory, his imagination sees in every object only the traits which favor that theory.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The moment for action has arrived, and I know that I can trust in you to save our country.
author: George B. McClellan

quote: The moment of change is the only poem.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: The moment someone chooses to trust in Jesus Christ, his sins are wiped away, and he is adopted into God's family. That individual is set apart as a child of God, with a sacred purpose.
author: Charles Stanley

quote: The moment we begin to fear the opinions of others and hesitate to tell the truth that is in us, and from motives of policy are silent when we should speak, the divine floods of light and life no longer flow into our souls.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: The moment you cheat for the sake of beauty, you know you're an artist.
author: David Hockney

quote: The moment you have in your heart this extraordinary thing called love and feel the depth, the delight, the ecstasy of it, you will discover that for you the world is transformed.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: The moment you think you understand a great work of art, it's dead for you.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The momentous thing in human life is the art of winning the soul to good or evil.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: The monotony and solitude of a quiet life stimulates the creative mind.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The monsters of our childhood do not fade away, neither are they ever wholly monstrous. But neither, in my experience, do we ever reach a plane of detachment regarding our parents, however wise and old we may become. To pretend otherwise is to cheat.
author: John le Carre

quote: The moral virtues, then, are produced in us neither by nature nor against nature. Nature, indeed, prepares in us the ground for their reception, but their complete formation is the product of habit.
author: Aristotle

quote: The more I have studied Lincoln, the more I have followed his thought processes, the more I am convinced that he understood leadership better than any other American president.
author: David Herbert Donald

quote: The more I live, the more I think that humor is the saving sense.
author: Jacob August Riis

quote: The more I think about it, the more I realize there is nothing more artistic than to love others.
author: Vincent Van Gogh

quote: The more I traveled the more I realized that fear makes strangers of people who should be friends.
author: Shirley MacLaine

quote: The more I work with the body, keeping my assumptions in a temporary state of reservation, the more I appreciate and sympathize with a given disease. The body no longer appears as a sick or irrational demon, but as a process with its own inner logic and wisdom.
author: George MacDonald

quote: The more a race is governed by its passions, the less it has acquired the habit of cautious and reasoned argument, the more intense will be its love of music.
author: Stendhal

quote: The more decisions that you are forced to make alone, the more you are aware of your freedom to choose.
author: Thornton Wilder

quote: The more defects a man may have, the older he is, the less lovable, the more resounding his success.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: The more elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.
author: Joseph Priestley

quote: The more extensive a man's knowledge of what has been done, the greater will be his power of knowing what to do.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The more horrifying this world becomes, the more art becomes abstract.
author: Ellen Key

quote: The more knowledge you have, the greater will be your fear of Allah.
author: Abu Bakr

quote: The more laws, the less justice.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The more man meditates upon good thoughts, the better will be his world and the world at large.
author: Confucius

quote: The more money an American accumulates, the less interesting he becomes.
author: Gore Vidal

quote: The more one does and sees and feels, the more one is able to do, and the more genuine may be one's appreciation of fundamental things like home, and love, and understanding companionship.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: The more powerful and original a mind, the more it will incline towards the religion of solitude.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The more sand has escaped from the hourglass of our life, the clearer we should see through it.
author: Niccolo Machiavelli

quote: The more specific idea of Evolution now reached is - a change from an indefinite, incoherent homogeneity to a definite, coherent heterogeneity, accompanying the dissipation of motion and integration of matter.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: The more that learn to read the less learn how to make a living. That's one thing about a little education. It spoils you for actual work. The more you know the more you think somebody owes you a living.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The more that social democracy develops, grows, and becomes stronger, the more the enlightened masses of workers will take their own destinies, the leadership of their movement, and the determination of its direction into their own hands.
author: Rosa Luxemburg

quote: The more we come out and do good to others, the more our hearts will be purified, and God will be in them.
author: Swami Vivekananda

quote: The more we elaborate our means of communication, the less we communicate.
author: J. B. Priestley

quote: The more wit the less courage.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: The more you can increase fear of drugs and crime, welfare mothers, immigrants and aliens, the more you control all the people.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: The more you observe politics, the more you've got to admit that each party is worse than the other.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The more you sweat in peace, the less you bleed in war.
author: Norman Schwarzkopf

quote: The most I can do for my friend is simply be his friend.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The most basic question is not what is best, but who shall decide what is best.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: The most beautiful as well as the most ugly inclinations of man are not part of a fixed biologically given human nature, but result from the social process which creates man.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: The most beautiful thing we can experience is the mysterious. It is the source of all true art and science.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The most certain sign of wisdom is cheerfulness.
author: Michel de Montaigne

quote: The most characteristic mark of a great mind is to choose some one important object, and pursue it for life.
author: Anna Letitia Barbauld

quote: The most cogent reason for restricting the interference of government is the great evil of adding unnecessarily to its power.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The most common error made in matters of appearance is the belief that one should disdain the superficial and let the true beauty of one's soul shine through. If there are places on your body where this is a possibility, you are not attractive - you are leaking.
author: Charles Lamb

quote: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
author: Coco Chanel

quote: The most dangerous criminal now is the entirely lawless modern philosopher. Compared to him, burglars and bigamists are essentially moral men.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: The most dangerous food is wedding cake.
author: James Thurber

quote: The most dangerous man to any government is the man who is able to think things out... without regard to the prevailing superstitions and taboos. Almost inevitably he comes to the conclusion that the government he lives under is dishonest, insane, intolerable.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The most deadly fruit is borne by the hatred which one grafts on an extinguished friendship.
author: Gotthold Ephraim Lessing

quote: The most difficult thing is the decision to act, the rest is merely tenacity. The fears are paper tigers. You can do anything you decide to do. You can act to change and control your life and the procedure , the process is its own reward.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: The most disadvantageous peace is better than the most just war.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: The most disastrous phenomenon of the current situation is the factor that imperialism is employing for its own ends all the powers of the proletariat, all of its institutions and weapons, which its fighting vanguard has created for its war of liberation.
author: Clara Zetkin

quote: The most effective way to do it, is to do it.
author: Amelia Earhart

quote: The most efficient way to live reasonably is every morning to make a plan of one's day and every night to examine the results obtained.
author: Alexis Carrel

quote: The most essential thing for us was to get the business model right, then put the world-class technology under it to support it. At Merrill, that meant not doing what people expected.
author: John McKinley

quote: The most exciting phrase to hear in science, the one that heralds new discoveries, is not 'Eureka!' but 'That's funny...'
author: Isaac Asimov

quote: The most exciting thing in the twentieth century is science.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: The most exhausting thing in life is being insincere.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: The most fundamental fact about the ideas of the political left is that they do not work. Therefore we should not be surprised to find the left concentrated in institutions where ideas do not have to work in order to survive.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: The most glorious moments in your life are not the so-called days of success, but rather those days when out of dejection and despair you feel rise in you a challenge to life, and the promise of future accomplishments.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: The most happy marriage I can picture or imagine to myself would be the union of a deaf man to a blind woman.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The most important American addition to the World Experience was the simple surprising fact of America. We have helped prepare mankind for all its later surprises.
author: Daniel J. Boorstin

quote: The most important aspect of the relationship between the president and the secretary of state is that they both understand who is president.
author: Dean Acheson

quote: The most important environmental issue is one that is rarely mentioned, and that is the lack of a conservation ethic in our culture.
author: Gaylord Nelson

quote: The most important of my discoveries have been suggested to me by my failures.
author: Humphry Davy

quote: The most important part of education is proper training in the nursery.
author: Plato

quote: The most important political office is that of the private citizen.
author: Louis D. Brandeis

quote: The most important quality in a leader is that of being acknowledged as such. All leaders whose fitness is questioned are clearly lacking in force.
author: Andre Maurois

quote: The most important single ingredient in the formula of success is knowing how to get along with people.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The most important thing a father can do for his children is to love their mother.
author: Theodore Hesburgh

quote: The most important thing for a good marriage is to learn how to argue peaceably.
author: Anita Ekberg

quote: The most important thing in the world is family and love.
author: John Wooden

quote: The most important thing is God's blessing and if you believe in God and you believe in yourself, you have nothing to worry about.
author: Mohamed Al-Fayed

quote: The most important thing is to enjoy your life - to be happy - it's all that matters.
author: Audrey Hepburn

quote: The most important thing we can do is inspire young minds and to advance the kind of science, math and technology education that will help youngsters take us to the next phase of space travel.
author: John Glenn

quote: The most important ways in which I think the Internet will affect the big issue is that it will make it more difficult for government to collect taxes.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: The most insignificant people are the most apt to sneer at others. They are safe from reprisals. And have no hope of rising in their own self esteem but by lowering their neighbors.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The most mediocre of males feels himself a demigod as compared with women.
author: Simone de Beauvoir

quote: The most merciful thing that a family does to one of its infant members is to kill it.
author: Margaret Sanger

quote: The most positive men are the most credulous.
author: Alexander Pope

quote: The most practical kind of politics is the politics of decency.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The most savage controversies are about matters as to which there is no good evidence either way.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The most seductive thing about art is the personality of the artist himself.
author: Paul Cezanne

quote: The most shocking fact about war is that its victims and its instruments are individual human beings, and that these individual beings are condemned by the monstrous conventions of politics to murder or be murdered in quarrels not their own.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The most successful men in the end are those whose success is the result of steady accretion.
author: Alexander Graham Bell

quote: The most successful war seldom pays for its losses.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The most thought-provoking thing in our thought-provoking time is that we are still not thinking.
author: Martin Heidegger

quote: The most unpardonable sin in society is independence of thought.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: The most useless are those who never change through the years.
author: James M. Barrie

quote: The most valuable of all education is the ability to make yourself do the thing you have to do, when it has to be done, whether you like it or not.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: The most violent element in society is ignorance.
author: Emma Goldman

quote: The most virtuous women have something within them, something that is never chaste.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The most wonderful discovery made by scientists is science itself.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: The most worth-while thing is to try to put happiness into the lives of others.
author: Robert Baden-Powell

quote: The mother art is architecture. Without an architecture of our own we have no soul of our own civilization.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: The mother's battle for her child with sickness, with poverty, with war, with all the forces of exploitation and callousness that cheapen human life needs to become a common human battle, waged in love and in the passion for survival.
author: Adrienne Rich

quote: The mother's heart is the child's schoolroom.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: The mother-child relationship is paradoxical and, in a sense, tragic. It requires the most intense love on the mother's side, yet this very love must help the child grow away from the mother, and to become fully independent.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: The motto of chivalry is also the motto of wisdom to serve all, but love only one.
author: Honore de Balzac

quote: The mountains are calling and I must go.
author: John Muir

quote: The mountains, the forest, and the sea, render men savage they develop the fierce, but yet do not destroy the human.
author: Victor Hugo

quote: The movies are the only business where you can go out front and applaud yourself.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The movies were custard compared to politics.
author: Nancy Reagan

quote: The moving finger writes, and having written moves on. Nor all thy piety nor all thy wit, can cancel half a line of it.
author: Omar Khayyam

quote: The musician is perhaps the most modest of animals, but he is also the proudest. It is he who invented the sublime art of ruining poetry.
author: Erik Satie

quote: The mysteriousness and mystique of space is such, that science fiction attempts to tantalize you by telling you a story that could possibly be out there and that's the appeal of science fiction.
author: William Shatner

quote: The mystic purchases a moment of exhilaration with a lifetime of confusion and the confusion is infectious and destructive. It is confusing and destructive to try and explain anything in terms of anything else, poetry in terms of psychology.
author: Basil Bunting

quote: The myth of unlimited production brings war in its train as inevitably as clouds announce a storm.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The nation that complacently and fearfully allows its artists and writers to become suspected rather than respected is no longer regarded as a nation possessed with humor or depth.
author: James Thurber

quote: The nations of the West hope that by means of steam communication all the world will become as one family.
author: Townsend Harris

quote: The natural effect of sorrow over the dead is to refine and elevate the mind.
author: Washington Irving

quote: The natural flights of the human mind are not from pleasure to pleasure, but from hope to hope.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: The natural principle of war is to do the most harm to our enemy with the least harm to ourselves and this of course is to be effected by stratagem.
author: Washington Irving

quote: The natural progress of things is for liberty to yield and government to gain ground.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quote: The nature of God is a circle of which the center is everywhere and the circumference is nowhere.
author: Empedocles

quote: The nature of rumor is known to all.
author: Tertullian

quote: The nearer people approach old age the closer they return to a semblance of childhood, until the time comes for them to depart this life, again like children, neither tired of living nor aware of death.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: The need for change bulldozed a road down the center of my mind.
author: Maya Angelou

quote: The need to write comes from the need to make sense of one's life and discover one's usefulness.
author: John Cheever

quote: The negative cost of Lewis and Clark entering the Garden of Eden is that later expeditions regardless of what they were intended to do, later expeditions did not deal with the native peoples with the intelligence with the almost kindly resolve that Lewis and Clark did.
author: William Least Heat-Moon

quote: The newest computer can merely compound, at speed, the oldest problem in the relations between human beings, and in the end the communicator will be confronted with the old problem, of what to say and how to say it.
author: Edward R. Murrow

quote: The newspapers loved pinup pictures of pretty young swimmers, and as a national champion, I got more than my share of space in the sports pages.
author: Esther Williams

quote: The next few months are critical to Pakistan's future direction as a democratic state committed to promoting peace, fighting terrorism and working for social justice.
author: Benazir Bhutto

quote: The next morning we saw nothing of the enemy, though we were still lying to.
author: John Byng

quote: The next thing I knew, I was out of the service and making movies again. My first picture was called, GI Blues. I thought I was still in the army.
author: Elvis Presley

quote: The next time some academics tell you how important diversity is, ask how many Republicans there are in their sociology department.
author: Thomas Sowell

quote: The next war... may well bury Western civilization forever.
author: Aleksandr Solzhenitsyn

quote: The nice thing about the gallery shows is that without having to pay any money you can just go and see it.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: The nineteenth century believed in science but the twentieth century does not.
author: Gertrude Stein

quote: The ninety and nine are with dreams, content but the hope of the world made new, is the hundredth man who is grimly bent on making those dreams come true.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: The noble simplicity in the works of nature only too often originates in the noble shortsightedness of him who observes it.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: The nose of a mob is its imagination. By this, at any time, it can be quietly led.
author: Edgar Allan Poe

quote: The notion that Congress can change the meaning given a constitutional provision by the Court is subversive of the function of judicial review and it is not the less so because the Court promises to allow it only when the Constitution is moved to the left.
author: Robert Bork

quote: The notion that the public accepts or rejects anything in modern art is merely romantic fiction. The game is completed and the trophies distributed long before the public knows what has happened.
author: Tom Wolfe

quote: The object of all the former voyages to the South Seas undertaken by the command of his present majesty, has been the advancement of science and the increase of knowledge.
author: William Bligh

quote: The object of life is not to be on the side of the majority, but to escape finding oneself in the ranks of the insane.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote: The object of my relationship with Vietnam has been to heal the wounds that exist, particularly among our veterans, and to move forward with a positive relationship,... Apparently some in the Vietnamese government don't want to do that and that's their decision.
author: Ho Chi Minh

quote: The object of oratory alone in not truth, but persuasion.
author: Thomas B. Macaulay

quote: The object of pure physics is the unfolding of the laws of the intelligible world the object of pure mathematics that of unfolding the laws of human intelligence.
author: James Joseph Sylvester

quote: The object of the superior man is truth.
author: Confucius

quote: The object of war is not to die for your country but to make the other bastard die for his.
author: George S. Patton

quote: The obligation of subjects to the sovereign is understood to last as long, and no longer, than the power lasteth by which he is able to protect them.
author: Thomas Hobbes

quote: The odds are always against you no matter what your previous history is. You have to overcome the tendency to relax.
author: Tom Osborne

quote: The office of government is not to confer happiness, but to give men the opportunity to work out happiness for themselves.
author: William Ellery Channing

quote: The oil companies regard nuclear power as their rival, who will reduce their profits, so they put out a lot of disinformation about nuclear power.
author: James Lovelock

quote: The old Romans all wished to have a king over them because they had not yet tasted the sweetness of freedom.
author: Titus Livius

quote: The old cathedrals are good, but the great blue dome that hangs over everything is better.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The old fun thing is when somebody typed up the first chapter of War and Peace. And then made a precis of the rest of it and sent it out and only one publisher recognized it.
author: Jim Harrison

quote: The old interests of aristocracy - the romance of action, the exalted passions of chivalry and war - faded into the background, and their place was taken by the refined and intimate pursuits of peace and civilization.
author: Lytton Strachey

quote: The older I get, the greater power I seem to have to help the world I am like a snowball - the further I am rolled the more I gain.
author: Susan B. Anthony

quote: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The older I grow the more I see the influence of my family on my life. I didn't always see it. It was up to our parents to see that we had our education in a town that hadn't yet realized what racial prejudice was but actually knew and practiced it on occasion.
author: Katherine Dunham

quote: The older generation had greater respect for land than science. But we live in an age when science, more than soil, has become the provider of growth and abundance. Living just on the land creates loneliness in an age of globality.
author: Shimon Peres

quote: The older people that one admires seem to be fearless. They go right out into the world. It's astounding. Maybe they can't see or they can't hear, but they walk out into the street and take life as it comes. They're models of courage, in a strange way.
author: James Hillman

quote: The omission of good is no less reprehensible than the commission of evil.
author: Plutarch

quote: The one charm about marriage is that it makes a life of deception absolutely necessary for both parties.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The one exclusive sign of thorough knowledge is the power of teaching.
author: Aristotle

quote: The one great principle of English law is to make business for itself.
author: Charles Dickens

quote: The one permanent emotion of the inferior man is fear - fear of the unknown, the complex, the inexplicable. What he wants above everything else is safety.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The one thing I regret was that my work required an enormous amount of my time, and a lot of travel.
author: Neil Armstrong

quote: The one thing I would hope would go on my tombstone is, 'I made my parents proud.'
author: Roger Goodell

quote: The one thing we can never get enough of is love. And the one thing we never give enough is love.
author: Henry Miller

quote: The one who cannot restrain their anger will wish undone, what their temper and irritation prompted them to do.
author: Horace

quote: The only abnormality is the incapacity to love.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The only advantage of not being too good a housekeeper is that your guests are so pleased to feel how very much better they are.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quote: The only business of the head in the world is to bow a ceaseless obeisance to the heart.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: The only certain freedom's in departure.
author: Robert Frost

quote: The only change is that baseball has turned Paige from a second class citizen to a second class immortal.
author: Satchel Paige

quote: The only cure for grief is action.
author: George Henry Lewes

quote: The only defensible war is a war of defense.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: The only difference between death and taxes is that death doesn't get worse every time Congress meets.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The only difference between the Democrats and the Republicans is that the Democrats allow the poor to be corrupt, too.
author: Oscar Levant

quote: The only difference is that religion is much better organised and has been around much longer, but it's the same story with different characters and different costumes.
author: James Randi

quote: The only excuse for war is that we may live in peace unharmed.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The only failure one should fear, is not hugging to the purpose they see as best.
author: George Eliot

quote: The only faith that wears well and holds its color in all weathers is that which is woven of conviction and set with the sharp mordant of experience.
author: James Russell Lowell

quote: The only fence against the world is a thorough knowledge of it.
author: John Locke

quote: The only force that can overcome an idea and a faith is another and better idea and faith, positively and fearlessly upheld.
author: Dorothy Thompson

quote: The only freedom which deserves the name is that of pursuing our own good, in our own way, so long as we do not attempt to deprive others of theirs, or impede their efforts to obtain it.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The only good husbands stay bachelors: They're too considerate to get married.
author: Finley Peter Dunne

quote: The only good is knowledge, and the only evil is ignorance.
author: Herodotus

quote: The only happiness a brave person ever troubles themselves in asking about, is happiness enough to get their work done.
author: Thomas Carlyle

quote: The only history is a mere question of one's struggle inside oneself. But that is the joy of it. One need neither discover Americas nor conquer nations, and yet one has as great a work as Columbus or Alexander, to do.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: The only honest art form is laughter, comedy. You can't fake it... try to fake three laughs in an hour - ha ha ha ha ha - they'll take you away, man. You can't.
author: Lenny Bruce

quote: The only instrument I can play is piano. Whenever I make songs at home, I play the piano and make them on the piano.
author: Yoko Ono

quote: The only justice is to follow the sincere intuition of the soul, angry or gentle. Anger is just, and pity is just, but judgement is never just.
author: David Herbert Lawrence

quote: The only justification for repressive institutions is material and cultural deficit. But such institutions, at certain stages of history, perpetuate and produce such a deficit, and even threaten human survival.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: The only love affair I have ever had was with music.
author: Maurice Ravel

quote: The only part of the conduct of any one, for which he is amenable to society, is that which concerns others. In the part which merely concerns himself, his independence is, of right, absolute. Over himself, over his own body and mind, the individual is sovereign.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The only people you can really share certain things with in secret are your girlfriends.
author: Shirley Knight

quote: The only place success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: The only point in making money is, you can tell some big shot where to go.
author: Humphrey Bogart

quote: The only positive finding which could be drawn from the first series, was the conclusion that the relationships obviously had a more complicated lay-out than had been thought, for the effects were so varied that no obedience to any law could be discovered.
author: Walter Rudolf Hess

quote: The only power any government has is the power to crack down on criminals. Well, when there aren't enough criminals, one makes them. One declares so many things to be a crime that it becomes impossible for men to live without breaking laws.
author: Ayn Rand

quote: The only power deserving the name is that of masses, and of governments while they make themselves the organ of the tendencies and instincts of masses.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The only prize much cared for by the powerful is power.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: The only purpose for which power can be rightfully exercised over any member of a civilized community, against his will, is to prevent harm to others. His own good, either physical or moral, is not sufficient warrant.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The only real happiness a ballplayer has is when he is playing a ball game and accomplishes something he didn't think he could do.
author: Ring Lardner

quote: The only real power comes out of a long rifle.
author: Joseph Stalin

quote: The only real progress lies in learning to be wrong all alone.
author: Albert Camus

quote: The only real security is not in owning or possessing, not in demanding or expecting, not in hoping, even. Security in a relationship lies neither in looking back to what it was, nor forward to what it might be, but living in the present and accepting it as it is now.
author: Anne Morrow Lindbergh

quote: The only real security that a man can have in this world is a reserve of knowledge, experience and ability.
author: Henry Ford

quote: The only really happy folk are married women and single men.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The only reason I'm in Hollywood is that I don't have the moral courage to refuse the money.
author: Marlon Brando

quote: The only reason anyone goes to Broadway is because they can't get work in the movies.
author: Bette Davis

quote: The only reason for time is so that everything doesn't happen at once.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The only relevant test of the validity of a hypothesis is comparison of prediction with experience.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: The only religious way to think of death is as part and parcel of life.
author: Thomas Mann

quote: The only rich person is a person who is rich in spirit. I have no money deposit. I have only beauty deposit.
author: Imelda Marcos

quote: The only security men can have for their political liberty, consists in keeping their money in their own pockets.
author: Lysander Spooner

quote: The only sense that is common in the long run, is the sense of change and we all instinctively avoid it.
author: E. B. White

quote: The only sensible ends of literature are, first, the pleasurable toil of writing second, the gratification of one's family and friends and lastly, the solid cash.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

quote: The only service a friend can really render is to keep up your courage by holding up to you a mirror in which you can see a noble image of yourself.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The only society I like is rough and tough, and the tougher the better. There's where you get down to bedrock and meet human people.
author: Robert W. Service

quote: The only solid and lasting peace between a man and his wife is, doubtless, a separation.
author: Lord Chesterfield

quote: The only source of knowledge is experience.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The only sure bulwark of continuing liberty is a government strong enough to protect the interests of the people, and a people strong enough and well enough informed to maintain its sovereign control over the goverment.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The only thing I can do is tell the truth as I see it and let the chips fall where they may.
author: Jack Kemp

quote: The only thing a golfer needs is more daylight.
author: Ben Hogan

quote: The only thing better than singing is more singing.
author: Ella Fitzgerald

quote: The only thing money gives you is the freedom of not worrying about money.
author: Johnny Carson

quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The only thing of weight that can be said against modern honor is that it is directly opposite to religion. The one bids you bear injuries with patience, the other tells you if you don't resent them, you are not fit to live.
author: Bernard de Mandeville

quote: The only thing that can save the world is the reclaiming of the awareness of the world. That's what poetry does.
author: Allen Ginsberg

quote: The only thing that could spoil a day was people. People were always the limiters of happiness except for the very few that were as good as spring itself.
author: Ernest Hemingway

quote: The only thing that interferes with my learning is my education.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The only thing that ultimately matters is to eat an ice-cream cone, play a slide trombone, plant a small tree, good God, now you're free.
author: Ray Manzarek

quote: The only thing to do with good advice is to pass it on. It is never of any use to oneself.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The only thing we have learnt from experience is that we learn nothing from experience.
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The only thing we never get enough of is love and the only thing we never give enough of is love.
author: Henry Miller

quote: The only time I ever went hunting I remembered it as a grisly experience.
author: Gloria Swanson

quote: The only time a woman really succeeds in changing a man is when he is a baby.
author: Natalie Wood

quote: The only time my prayers are never answered is on the golf course.
author: Billy Graham

quote: The only time people dislike gossip is when you gossip about them.
author: Will Rogers

quote: The only time to buy these is on a day with no 'y' in it.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: The only time you really live fully is from thirty to sixty. The young are slaves to dreams the old servants of regrets. Only the middle-aged have all their five senses in the keeping of their wits.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quote: The only true measure of success is the ratio between what we might have done and what we might have been on the one hand, and the thing we have made and the things we have made of ourselves on the other.
author: H. G. Wells

quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quote: The only way forward, if we are going to improve the quality of the environment, is to get everybody involved.
author: Richard Rogers

quote: The only way human beings can win a war is to prevent it.
author: George C. Marshall

quote: The only way marriage can work is if a man respects the woman and she is a thinking woman and he wants to work on the marriage.
author: Al Goldstein

quote: The only way not to think about money is to have a great deal of it.
author: Edith Wharton

quote: The only way that has ever been discovered to have a lot of people cooperate together voluntarily is through the free market. And that's why it's so essential to preserving individual freedom.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: The only way that we can reduce our financial dependence on the inflow of funds from the rest of the world is to reduce our trade deficit.
author: Martin Feldstein

quote: The only way to avoid being unhappy is to close yourself up in Art and to count for nothing all the rest.
author: Gustave Flaubert

quote: The only way to enjoy anything in this life is to earn it first.
author: Ginger Rogers

quote: The only way to get the best of an argument is to avoid it.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: The only way to have a friend is to be one.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quote: The only way to keep your health is to eat what you don't want, drink what you don't like, and do what you'd rather not.
author: Mark Twain

quote: The only way to make a man trustworthy is to trust him.
author: Henry L. Stimson

quote: The only way to make sense out of change is to plunge into it, move with it, and join the dance.
author: Alan Watts

quote: The only way to predict the future is to have power to shape the future.
author: Eric Hoffer

quote: The only way you get that fat off is to eat less and exercise more.
author: Jack LaLanne

quote: The only yardstick for success our society has is being a champion. No one remembers anything else.
author: John Madden

quote: The opera is to music what a bawdy house is to a cathedral.
author: H. L. Mencken

quote: The opportunity for brotherhood presents itself every time you meet a human being.
author: Jane Wyman

quote: The opportunity for doing mischief is found a hundred times a day, and of doing good once in a year.
author: Voltaire

quote: The opposite of a fact is falsehood, but the opposite of one profound truth may very well be another profound truth.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: The optimist thinks this is the best of all possible worlds. The pessimist fears it is true.
author: J. Robert Oppenheimer

quote: The ordinary man with extraordinary power is the chief danger for mankind - not the fiend or the sadist.
author: Erich Fromm

quote: The other night I ate at a real nice family restaurant. Every table had an argument going.
author: George Carlin

quote: The outward work will never be puny if the inward work is great.
author: Meister Eckhart

quote: The overwhelming majority of Americans are possessed of two great qualities a sense of humor and a sense of proportion.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The owners don't win by having a lockout. Shutting down your business is not good for anybody and it's certainly not good for the players, it's certainly not good for the fans. And that's most important to us.
author: Roger Goodell

quote: The pain passes, but the beauty remains.
author: Auguste Renoir

quote: The paradox is really the pathos of intellectual life and just as only great souls are exposed to passions it is only the great thinker who is exposed to what I call paradoxes, which are nothing else than grandiose thoughts in embryo.
author: Soren Kierkegaard

quote: The paradox of courage is that a man must be a little careless of his life even in order to keep it.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: The paradox of education is precisely this that as one begins to become conscious one begins to examine the society in which he is being educated.
author: James Baldwin

quote: The paranoiac is the exact image of the ruler. The only difference is their position in the world. One might even think the paranoiac the more impressive of the two because he is sufficient unto himself and cannot be shaken by failure.
author: Elias Canetti

quote: The parents have a right to say that no teacher paid by their money shall rob their children of faith in God and send them back to their homes skeptical, or infidels, or agnostics, or atheists.
author: William Jennings Bryan

quote: The part which American friendship played in helping us to win the freedom we enjoy in this part of Ireland has been gratefully recognized and acknowledged by our people.
author: Eamon de Valera

quote: The party in power, like Jonah's gourd, grew up quickly, and will quickly fall.
author: Davy Crockett

quote: The passion of hatred is so long lived and so obstinate a malady that the surest sign of death in a sick person is their desire for reconciliation.
author: Jean de la Bruyere

quote: The past cannot be changed. The future is yet in your power.
author: Mary Pickford

quote: The past is a ghost, the future a dream, and all we ever have is now.
author: Bill Cosby

quote: The past is a source of knowledge, and the future is a source of hope. Love of the past implies faith in the future.
author: Stephen Ambrose

quote: The past is an old armchair in the attic, the present an ominous ticking sound, and the future is anybody's guess.
author: James Thurber

quote: The past is not dead, it is living in us, and will be alive in the future which we are now helping to make.
author: William Morris

quote: The past is our definition. We may strive with good reason to escape it, or to escape what is bad in it. But we will escape it only by adding something better to it.
author: Wendell Berry

quote: The past itself, as historical change continues to accelerate, has become the most surreal of subjects - making it possible... to see a new beauty in what is vanishing.
author: Susan Sontag

quote: The past, the present and the future are really one: they are today.
author: Harriet Beecher Stowe

quote: The patience of the American public with dilatory diplomatic delays will be very limited.
author: Tom Lantos

quote: The patient's autonomy always, always should be respected, even if it is absolutely contrary - the decision is contrary to best medical advice and what the physician wants.
author: Jack Kevorkian

quote: The peculiar fascination which the South held over my imagination and my limited capital decided me in favor of Atlanta University so about the last of September I bade farewell to the friends and scenes of my boyhood and boarded a train for the South.
author: James Weldon Johnson

quote: The people I respect most behave as if they were immortal and as if society was eternal.
author: E. M. Forster

quote: The people are the government, administering it by their agents they are the government, the sovereign power.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: The people are the only legitimate fountain of power, and it is from them that the constitutional charter, under which the several branches of government hold their power, is derived.
author: James Madison

quote: The people to fear are not those who disagree with you, but those who disagree with you and are too cowardly to let you know.
author: Napoleon Bonaparte

quote: The people who have really made history are the martyrs.
author: Aleister Crowley

quote: The people who live in a golden age usually go around complaining how yellow everything looks.
author: Randall Jarrell

quote: The people who make art their business are mostly imposters.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: The people who run a university are far more qualified and intelligent in handling people than someone who inherited his money and used it to buy a pro team.
author: Hayden Fry

quote: The people who work in intelligence work are more conscious, more apt to be attentive.
author: William Hedgcock Webster

quote: The people will save their government, if the government itself will allow them.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The people's government, made for the people, made by the people, and answerable to the people.
author: Daniel Webster

quote: The perception of beauty is a moral test.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The perfect joys of heaven do not satisfy the cravings of nature.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: The perfect love affair is one which is conducted entirely by post.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The perfection of art is to conceal art.
author: Quintilian

quote: The permanent temptation of life is to confuse dreams with reality. The permanent defeat of life comes when dreams are surrendered to reality.
author: James A. Michener

quote: The person attempting to travel two roads at once will get nowhere.
author: Xun Zi

quote: The person born with a talent they are meant to use will find their greatest happiness in using it.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quote: The person interested in success has to learn to view failure as a healthy, inevitable part of the process of getting to the top.
author: Joyce Brothers

quote: The person who doesn't scatter the morning dew will not comb gray hairs.
author: Hunter S. Thompson

quote: The person who grieves suffers his passion to grow upon him he indulges it, he loves it but this never happens in the case of actual pain, which no man ever willingly endured for any considerable time.
author: Edmund Burke

quote: The person who has nothing for which he is willing to fight, nothing which is more important than his own personal safety, is a miserable creature and has no chance of being free unless made and kept so by the exertions of better men than himself.
author: John Stuart Mill

quote: The person who seeks all their applause from outside has their happiness in another's keeping .
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: The person who tries to live alone will not succeed as a human being. His heart withers if it does not answer another heart. His mind shrinks away if he hears only the echoes of his own thoughts and finds no other inspiration.
author: Pearl S. Buck

quote: The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid.
author: Jane Austen

quote: The personal life deeply lived always expands into truths beyond itself.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The philosopher has never killed any priests, whereas the priest has killed a great many philosophers.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: The philosophy of the school room in one generation will be the philosophy of government in the next.
author: Abraham Lincoln

quote: The phrase 'off with the crack of the bat', while romantic, is really meaningless, since the outfielder should be in motion long before he hears the sound of the ball meeting the bat.
author: Joe DiMaggio

quote: The physician can bury his mistakes, but the architect can only advise his client to plant vines - so they should go as far as possible from home to build their first buildings.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: The physician's highest calling, his only calling, is to make sick people healthy - to heal, as it is termed.
author: Samuel Hahnemann

quote: The pillars of truth and the pillars of freedom - they are the pillars of society.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: The pilot looked at his cues of attitude and speed and orientation and so on and responded as he would from the same cues in an airplane, but there was no way it flew the same. The simulators had showed us that.
author: Alan Shepard

quote: The place of the father in the modern suburban family is a very small one, particularly if he plays golf.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: The plain man is familiar with blindness and deafness, and knows from his everyday experience that the look of things is influenced by his senses but it never occurs to him to regard the whole world as the creation of his senses.
author: Ernst Mach

quote: The planter, the farmer, the mechanic, and the laborer... form the great body of the people of the United States, they are the bone and sinew of the country men who love liberty and desire nothing but equal rights and equal laws.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: The plays and sports of children are as salutary to them as labor and work are to grown persons.
author: Samuel Richardson

quote: The pleasure we derive from the representation of the present is due, not only to the beauty it can be clothed in, but also to its essential quality of being the present.
author: Charles Baudelaire

quote: The pleasures of the imagination are as it were only drawings and models which are played with by poor people who cannot afford the real thing.
author: Georg C. Lichtenberg

quote: The poetry of the earth is never dead.
author: John Keats

quote: The poetry of this one is called philosophical, of that one philological, of a third rhetorical, and so on. Which is then the poetic poetry?
author: Karl Wilhelm Friedrich Schlegel

quote: The poets have been mysteriously silent on the subject of cheese.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: The point I am making is that in the more primitive forms of society the individual is merely a unit in more developed forms of society he is an independent personality.
author: Herbert Read

quote: The point in history at which we stand is full of promise and danger. The world will either move forward toward unity and widely shared prosperity - or it will move apart.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quote: The point is not to take the world's opinion as a guiding star but to go one's way in life and working unerringly, neither depressed by failure nor seduced by applause.
author: Gustav Mahler

quote: The point is that I don't design stuff for myself. I'm a toolmaker. I design things that other people want to use.
author: Robert Moog

quote: The point of departure of the process to which we wish to contribute is the fact that war is the natural reaction of human nature in the savage state, while peace is the result of acquired characteristics.
author: Elihu Root

quote: The point of my work is to show that culture and education aren't simply hobbies or minor influences.
author: Pierre Bourdieu

quote: The point of power is always in the present moment.
author: Louise L. Hay

quote: The political object is the goal, war is the means of reaching it, and the means can never be considered in isolation form their purposes.
author: Karl Von Clausewitz

quote: The politician in my country seeks votes, affection and respect, in that order. With few notable exceptions, they are simply men who want to be loved.
author: Edward R. Murrow

quote: The politicians were talking themselves red, white and blue in the face.
author: Clare Boothe Luce

quote: The polls indicated that I was feisty, that I was tough, that I had a sense of humor, but they weren't quite sure if they liked me and they didn't know whether or not that I was sensitive.
author: Geraldine Ferraro

quote: The poor don't know that their function in life is to exercise our generosity.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: The poor have to labour in the face of the majestic equality of the law, which forbids the rich as well as the poor to sleep under bridges, to beg in the streets, and to steal bread.
author: Anatole France

quote: The population forecast for the United States in 1970 is 170 million. The population forecast for Russia alone in 1970 is 251 million. The implications are clear.
author: Emanuel Celler

quote: The positive testimony of history is that the State invariably had its origin in conquest and confiscation. No primitive State known to history originated in any other manner.
author: Albert J. Nock

quote: The possession of knowledge does not kill the sense of wonder and mystery. There is always more mystery.
author: Anais Nin

quote: The possibilities that are suggested in quantum physics tell us that everything that we're looking at may not be in fact there, so the underlying nature of being is weird.
author: William Shatner

quote: The possibility of a scientific treatment of history means a wider experience, a greater maturity of practical reason, and finally a fuller realization of certain basic ideas regarding the nature of life and time.
author: Muhammad Iqbal

quote: The possibility of divorce renders both marriage partners stricter in their observance of the duties they owe to each other. Divorces help to improve morals and to increase the population.
author: Denis Diderot

quote: The power of accurate observation is commonly called cynicism by those who have not got it.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: The power of an air force is terrific when there is nothing to oppose it.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The power of choosing good and evil is within the reach of all.
author: Origen

quote: The power of daring anything their fancy suggest, as always been conceded to the painter and the poet.
author: Horace

quote: The power of faith will often shine forth the most when the character is naturally weak.
author: Augustus Hare

quote: The power of fortune is confessed only by the miserable, for the happy impute all their success to prudence or merit.
author: Jonathan Swift

quote: The power of imagination makes us infinite.
author: John Muir

quote: The power of man has grown in every sphere, except over himself.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: The power of the ballot we need in sheer defense, else what shall save us from a second slavery?
author: W. E. B. Du Bois

quote: The power of the harasser, the abuser, the rapist depends above all on the silence of women.
author: Ursula K. Le Guin

quote: The power of the lawyer is in the uncertainty of the law.
author: Jeremy Bentham

quote: The power of the people and the power of reason are one.
author: Georg Buchner

quote: The power of the periodical press is second only to that of the people.
author: Alexis de Tocqueville

quote: The power that is supported by force alone will have cause often to tremble.
author: Lajos Kossuth

quote: The power to define the situation is the ultimate power.
author: Jerry Rubin

quote: The power to do good is also the power to do harm.
author: Milton Friedman

quote: The power to investigate is a great public trust.
author: Emanuel Celler

quote: The power to wage war is the power to wage war successfully.
author: Charles Evans Hughes

quote: The practice of peace and reconciliation is one of the most vital and artistic of human actions.
author: Nhat Hanh

quote: The practice of politics in the East may be defined by one word: dissimulation.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The present is the ever moving shadow that divides yesterday from tomorrow. In that lies hope.
author: Frank Lloyd Wright

quote: The present was an egg laid by the past that had the future inside its shell.
author: Zora Neale Hurston

quote: The presentations and conceptions of the average man of the world are formed and dominated, not by the full and pure desire for knowledge as an end in itself, but by the struggle to adapt himself favourably to the conditions of life.
author: Ernst Mach

quote: The preservation of health is a duty. Few seem conscious that there is such a thing as physical morality.
author: Herbert Spencer

quote: The presidents of colleges have to have some courage to step forward. You can't limit alcohol in college sports, you have to get rid of it.
author: Dean Smith

quote: The press is the hired agent of a monied system, and set up for no other purpose than to tell lies where their interests are involved. One can trust nobody and nothing.
author: Henry Adams

quote: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quote: The price of being close to the President is delivering bad news. You fail him if you don't tell him the truth. Others won't do it.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: The price of every thing rises and falls from time to time and place to place and with every such change the purchasing power of money changes so far as that thing goes.
author: Alfred Marshall

quote: The price of freedom is eternal vigilance.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: The price of success is hard work, dedication to the job at hand, and the determination that whether we win or lose, we have applied the best of ourselves to the task at hand.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: The price we have to pay for money is sometimes liberty.
author: Robert Louis Stevenson

quote: The priesthood is a marriage. People often start by falling in love, and they go on for years without realizing that love must change into some other love which is so unlike it that it can hardly be recognized as love at all.
author: Iris Murdoch

quote: The primary and most beautiful of Nature's qualities is motion, which agitates her at all times, but this motion is simply a perpetual consequence of crimes, she conserves it by means of crimes only.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: The primary distinction of the artist is that he must actively cultivate that state which most men, necessarily, must avoid the state of being alone.
author: James Baldwin

quote: The principal act of courage is to endure and withstand dangers doggedly rather than to attack them.
author: Thomas Aquinas

quote: The principal end both of my father and of myself in the conquest of India... has been the propagation of the holy Catholic faith.
author: Ignatius Loyola

quote: The principle goal of education in the schools should be creating men and women who are capable of doing new things, not simply repeating what other generations have done.
author: Jean Piaget

quote: The principle of all successful effort is to try to do not what is absolutely the best, but what is easily within our power, and suited for our temperament and condition.
author: John Ruskin

quote: The principle of the Gothic architecture is infinity made imaginable.
author: Samuel Taylor Coleridge

quote: The principle of the endless melody is the perpetual becoming of a music that never had any reason for starting, any more than it has any reason for ending.
author: Igor Stravinsky

quote: The principle part of faith is patience.
author: George MacDonald

quote: The principle that human nature, in its psychological aspects, is nothing more than a product of history and given social relations removes all barriers to coercion and manipulation by the powerful.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: The principle we call self-love never seeks anything external for the sake of the thing, but only as a means of happiness or good: particular affections rest in the external things themselves.
author: Joseph Butler

quote: The principles of a free constitution are irrecoverably lost, when the legislative power is nominated by the executive.
author: Edward Gibbon

quote: The printed page conveys information and commitment, and requires active involvement. Television conveys emotion and experience, and it's very limited in what it can do logically. It's an existential experience - there and then gone.
author: Bill Moyers

quote: The private interest of the individual would not be sufficiently provided for by reasonable and cool self-love alone therefore the appetites and passions are placed within as a guard and further security, without which it would not be taken due care of.
author: Joseph Butler

quote: The privilege of a lifetime is being who you are.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: The problem of how we finance the welfare state should not obscure a separate issue: if each person thinks he has an inalienable right to welfare, no matter what happens to the world, that's not equity, it's just creating a society where you can't ask anything of people.
author: Jacques Delors

quote: The problem of the Middle East is poverty more than politics.
author: Shimon Peres

quote: The problem of the world today is the people talk on and on about democracy, freedom, justice. But I don't give a damn about democracy if I am worried about survival.
author: Imelda Marcos

quote: The problem was to sustain at any cost the feeling you had in the theater that you were watching a real person, yes, but an intense condensation of his experience, not simply a realistic series of episodes.
author: Arthur Miller

quote: The problem with beauty is that it's like being born rich and getting poorer.
author: Joan Collins

quote: The problem with having a sense of humor is often that people you use it on aren't in a very good mood.
author: Lou Holtz

quote: The problem with leaderless uprisings taking over is that you don't always know what you get at the other end. If you are not careful you could replace a bad government with one much worse!
author: Chinua Achebe

quote: The problem with marriage is that it ends every night after making love, and it must be rebuilt every morning before breakfast.
author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

quote: The process by which banks create money is so simple that the mind is repelled.
author: John Kenneth Galbraith

quote: The process hasn't changed, but the writer has developed. I still get up every morning and go to work.
author: Mordecai Richler

quote: The process of making natural history films is to try to prevent the animal knowing you are there, so you get glimpses of a non-human world, and that is a transporting thing.
author: David Attenborough

quote: The process of philosophic and scientific enlightenment has shaken the stability of beliefs held explicitly as articles of faith.
author: Michael Polanyi

quote: The product of mental labor - science - always stands far below its value, because the labor-time necessary to reproduce it has no relation at all to the labor-time required for its original production.
author: Karl Marx

quote: The product of the scientific imagination is a new vision of relations - like that of artistic imagination.
author: Edmund Wilson

quote: The productivity now at universities is terrible. Tenure is a terrible idea. It keeps them around forever and they don't have to work hard.
author: Jack Welch

quote: The profession of book writing makes horse racing seem like a solid, stable business.
author: John Steinbeck

quote: The progress of evolution from President Washington to President Grant was alone evidence to upset Darwin.
author: Henry Adams

quote: The progress of freedom depends more upon the maintenance of peace, the spread of commerce, and the diffusion of education, than upon the labors of cabinets and foreign offices.
author: Richard Cobden

quote: The progress of society is mainly the improvement in the condition of the workingmen of the world.
author: Rutherford B. Hayes

quote: The proletarian woman fights hand in hand with the man of her class against capitalist society.
author: Clara Zetkin

quote: The prolonged slavery of women is the darkest page in human history.
author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

quote: The propensity to truck, barter and exchange one thing for another is common to all men, and to be found in no other race of animals.
author: Adam Smith

quote: The proper function of man is to live, not to exist. I shall not waste my days in trying to prolong them. I shall use my time.
author: Jack London

quote: The proper means of increasing the love we bear our native country is to reside some time in a foreign one.
author: William Shenstone

quote: The prospect of dating someone in her twenties becomes less appealing as you get older. At some point in your fife, your tolerance level goes down and you realize that, with someone much younger, there's nothing really to talk about.
author: Clint Eastwood

quote: The psychical, whatever its nature may be, is itself unconscious.
author: Sigmund Freud

quote: The public character of every public servant is legitimate subject of discussion, and his fitness or unfitness for office may be fairly canvassed by any person.
author: Charles Babbage

quote: The public is not to see where power lies, how it shapes policy, and for what ends. Rather, people are to hate and fear one another.
author: Noam Chomsky

quote: The public is wonderfully tolerant. It forgives everything except genius.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: The public sector certainly includes the Department of Labor. Those are jobs that are available. They are open and they are good paying jobs. The government as a whole has been actually retrenching under President Clinton's leadership.
author: Alexis Herman

quote: The punishment which the wise suffer who refuse to take part in the government, is to live under the government of worse men.
author: Plato

quote: The purpose of Compulsory Education is to deprive the common people of their commonsense.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: The purpose of all war is peace.
author: Augustine of Hippo

quote: The purpose of all wars, is peace.
author: Saint Augustine

quote: The purpose of art is washing the dust of daily life off our souls.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: The purpose of getting power is to be able to give it away.
author: Aneurin Bevan

quote: The purpose of human life and the sense of happiness is to give the maximum what the man is able to give.
author: Alexander Alekhine

quote: The purpose of human life is to serve, and to show compassion and the will to help others.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quote: The purpose of learning is growth, and our minds, unlike our bodies, can continue growing as we continue to live.
author: Mortimer Adler

quote: The purpose of science is not to analyze or describe but to make useful models of the world. A model is useful if it allows us to get use out of it.
author: Edward de Bono

quote: The purpose of thinking about the future is not to predict it but to raise people's hopes.
author: Freeman Dyson

quote: The purpose that brought the fourteenth amendment into being was equality before the law, and equality, not separation, was written into the law.
author: Robert Bork

quote: The purposes of the United States should not be doubted. The Security Council resolutions will be enforced - the just demands of peace and security will be met - or action will be unavoidable. And a regime that has lost its legitimacy will also lose its power.
author: Colin Powell

quote: The pursuit of happiness, which American citizens are obliged to undertake, tends to involve them in trying to perpetuate the moods, tastes and aptitudes of youth.
author: Malcolm Muggeridge

quote: The pursuit of science leads only to the insoluble.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: The pursuit of truth and beauty is a sphere of activity in which we are permitted to remain children all our lives.
author: Albert Einstein

quote: The pursuit of truth does not permit violence on one's opponent.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: The pursuit, even of the best things, ought to be calm and tranquil.
author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

quote: The qualities I most admire in women are confidence and kindness.
author: Oscar de la Renta

quote: The quality of a leader is reflected in the standards they set for themselves.
author: Ray Kroc

quote: The quality of a person's life is in direct proportion to their commitment to excellence, regardless of their chosen field of endeavor.
author: Vince Lombardi

quote: The quality of life is more important than life itself.
author: Alexis Carrel

quote: The quality of light by which we scrutinize our lives has direct bearing upon the product which we live, and upon the changes which we hope to bring about through those lives.
author: Audre Lorde

quote: The quality, not the longevity, of one's life is what is important.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

quote: The quarrels of lovers are the renewal of love.
author: Jean Racine

quote: The question of armaments, whether on land or sea, is the most immediately and intensely practical question connected with the future fortunes of nations and of mankind.
author: Woodrow Wilson

quote: The question of religion was a matter for each individual's conscience, and in a great many cases was the outcome of birth or residence in a certain geographical area.
author: James Larkin

quote: The question of the value of nationality in art is perhaps unsolvable.
author: Edward Hopper

quote: The question of whether a computer can think is no more interesting than the question of whether a submarine can swim.
author: Edsger Dijkstra

quote: The question that will decide our destiny is not whether we shall expand into space. It is: shall we be one species or a million? A million species will not exhaust the ecological niches that are awaiting the arrival of intelligence.
author: Freeman Dyson

quote: The quickest way of ending a war is to lose it.
author: George Orwell
