quote: You that would judge me, do not judge alone this book or that, come to this hallowed place where my friends' portraits hang and look thereon Ireland's history in their lineaments trace think where man's glory most begins and ends and say my glory was I had such friends.
author: William Butler Yeats

quote: You travel across the country, you visit departments, you give talks, you talk about the work at your laboratory - what's going on, what the opportunities are there - you talk about your own research.
author: Frank Press

quote: You traverse the world in search of happiness, which is within the reach of every man. A contented mind confers it on all.
author: Horace

quote: You use a glass mirror to see your face you use works of art to see your soul.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: You want people to feel something when you tell a story, whether they feel happy or whether they feel sad.
author: Harry Dean Stanton

quote: You want people walking away from the conversation with some kernel of wisdom or some kind of impact.
author: Harry Dean Stanton

quote: You want to shut up every Negro who has the courage to stand up and fight for the rights of his people, for the rights of workers, and I have been on many a picket line for the steelworkers too.
author: Paul Robeson

quote: You will also allow me to thank the Academy for inviting me to lecture in Stockholm, for its hospitality, and for the opportunity afforded me for admiring the charm of your people and the beauty of your country.
author: Guglielmo Marconi

quote: You will certainly not doubt the necessity of studying astronomy and physics, if you are desirous of comprehending the relation between the world and Providence as it is in reality, and not according to imagination.
author: Maimonides

quote: You will die but the carbon will not its career does not end with you. It will return to the soil, and there a plant may take it up again in time, sending it once more on a cycle of plant and animal life.
author: Jacob Bronowski

quote: You will find as you grow older that courage is the rarest of all qualities to be found in public life.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: You will find in politics that you are much exposed to the attribution of false motive. Never complain and never explain.
author: Stanley Baldwin

quote: You will find men who want to be carried on the shoulders of others, who think that the world owes them a living. They don't seem to see that we must all lift together and pull together.
author: Henry Ford

quote: You will find that the woman who is really kind to dogs is always one who has failed to inspire sympathy in men.
author: Max Beerbohm

quote: You will launch many projects, but have time to finish only a few. So think, plan, develop, launch and tap good people to be responsible. Give them authority and hold them accountable. Trying to do too much yourself creates a bottleneck.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life.
author: Albert Camus

quote: You will never do anything in this world without courage. It is the greatest quality of the mind next to honor.
author: Aristotle

quote: You will obtain a vision of matter that is perhaps fatiguing for your imagination, but pure and stripped of what the requirements of life make you add to it in external perception.
author: Henri Bergson

quote: You women could make someone fall in love even with a lie.
author: Georg Buchner

quote: You wouldn't have won if we'd beaten you.
author: Yogi Berra

quote: You wouldn't want to be called a sell-out by selling a product. Selling out was frowned on, whereas now you can major in it at business school.
author: Alan Alda

quote: You'll never have a quiet world till you knock the patriotism out of the human race.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: You're basing your laws and your whole outlook on natural life on mythology. It won't work. That's why you have all these problems in the world. Name them: India, Pakistan, Ireland. Name them-all these problems. They're all religious problems.
author: Jack Kevorkian

quote: You're blessed if you have the strength to work.
author: Mahalia Jackson

quote: You're going to relegate my history to a month.
author: Morgan Freeman

quote: You're in pretty good shape for the shape you are in.
author: Dr. Seuss

quote: You're never fully dressed without a smile.
author: Martin Charnin

quote: You're not supposed to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong no matter who does it or who says it.
author: Malcom X

quote: You're not supposed to be so blind with patriotism that you can't face reality. Wrong is wrong, no matter who says it.
author: Malcolm X

quote: You're only as good as the people you hire.
author: Ray Kroc

quote: You're only as young as the last time you changed your mind.
author: Timothy Leary

quote: You've done it before and you can do it now. See the positive possibilities. Redirect the substantial energy of your frustration and turn it into positive, effective, unstoppable determination.
author: Ralph Marston

quote: You've got to ask! Asking is, in my opinion, the world's most powerful - and neglected - secret to success and happiness.
author: Percy Ross

quote: You've got to eat while you dream. You've got to deliver on short-range commitments, while you develop a long-range strategy and vision and implement it. The success of doing both. Walking and chewing gum if you will. Getting it done in the short-range, and delivering a long-range plan, and executing on that.
author: Jack Welch

quote: You've got to get up every morning with determination if you're going to go to bed with satisfaction.
author: George Horace Lorimer

quote: You've got to watch the politics of AIDS. The politics of AIDS can work both for and against the victims of AIDS.
author: Bono

quote: You've gotta know what death is to know life!
author: Jack Kevorkian

quote: You, too, women, cast away all the cowards from your embraces they will give you only cowards for children, and you who are the daughters of the land of beauty must bear children who are noble and brave.
author: Giuseppe Garibaldi

quote: Young children were sooner allured by love, than driven by beating, to attain good learning.
author: Roger Ascham

quote: Young lawyers attend the courts, not because they have business there, but because they have no business.
author: Washington Irving

quote: Young love is a flame very pretty, often very hot and fierce, but still only light and flickering. The love of the older and disciplined heart is as coals, deep-burning, unquenchable.
author: Henry Ward Beecher

quote: Young man, the secret of my success is that an early age I discovered that I was not God.
author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

quote: Young men soon give, and soon forget, affronts old age is slow in both.
author: Joseph Addison

quote: Young people are fitter to invent than to judge fitter for execution than for counsel and more fit for new projects than for settled business.
author: Francis Bacon

quote: Young people ask me if this country is serious about science. They aren't thinking about the passport that they will hold, but the country that they must rely on for support and encouragement.
author: John Charles Polanyi

quote: Young people can get very discouraged and get hooked on drugs or on alcohol because of problems they perceive as insurmountable. It is important that they realize a mistake need not ruin their future, but they must also know that not everything in life is a bed of roses.
author: Maureen Forrester

quote: Your God is ever beside you - indeed, He is even within you.
author: Alphonsus Liguori

quote: Your Majesty, I took the liberty because I was so desirous of visiting alone with you for a few minutes before the rest of the other peasants arrived.
author: Walter Annenberg

quote: Your actions, and your action alone, determines your worth.
author: Evelyn Waugh

quote: Your belief in God is merely an escape from your monotonous, stupid and cruel life.
author: Jiddu Krishnamurti

quote: Your best friend and worst enemy are both in this room right now. It's not your neighbor right or left - and it's not God or the devil - it's you.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Your body is the church where Nature asks to be reverenced.
author: Marquis de Sade

quote: Your destiny is my destiny. Your happiness is my happiness.
author: Islom Karimov

quote: Your every voter, as surely as your chief magistrate, exercises a public trust.
author: Grover Cleveland

quote: Your faithfulness makes you trustworthy to God.
author: Edwin Louis Cole

quote: Your home is regarded as a model home, your life as a model life. But all this splendor, and you along with it... it's just as though it were built upon a shifting quagmire. A moment may come, a word can be spoken, and both you and all this splendor will collapse.
author: Henrik Ibsen

quote: Your idol is shattered in the dust to prove that God's dust is greater than your idol.
author: Rabindranath Tagore

quote: Your joys and sorrows. You can never tell them. You cheapen the inside of yourself if you do tell them.
author: Greta Garbo

quote: Your knowledge of what is going on can only be superficial and relative.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Your library is your paradise.
author: Desiderius Erasmus

quote: Your life is the fruit of your own doing. You have no one to blame but yourself.
author: Joseph Campbell

quote: Your life is the sum result of all the choices you make, both consciously and unconsciously. If you can control the process of choosing, you can take control of all aspects of your life. You can find the freedom that comes from being in charge of yourself.
author: Robert Foster Bennett

quote: Your lost friends are not dead, but gone before, advanced a stage or two upon that road which you must travel in the steps they trod.
author: Aristophanes

quote: Your manuscript is both good and original but the part that is good is not original, and the part that is original is not good.
author: Samuel Johnson

quote: Your mind will answer most questions if you learn to relax and wait for the answer.
author: William S. Burroughs

quote: Your net worth to the world is usually determined by what remains after your bad habits are subtracted from your good ones.
author: Benjamin Franklin

quote: Your ordinary acts of love and hope point to the extraordinary promise that every human life is of inestimable value.
author: Desmond Tutu

quote: Your patience would fail you if I should continue to relate all the disrespectful speeches and treatment which your servants have been obliged to listen to and patiently to bear.
author: Peter Stuyvesant

quote: Your performance depends on your people. Select the best, train them and back them. When errors occur, give sharper guidance. If errors persist or if the fit feels wrong, help them move on. The country cannot afford amateur hour in the White House.
author: Donald Rumsfeld

quote: Your premium brand had better be delivering something special, or it's not going to get the business.
author: Warren Buffett

quote: Your purpose is to make your audience see what you saw, hear what you heard, feel what you felt. Relevant detail, couched in concrete, colorful language, is the best way to recreate the incident as it happened and to picture it for the audience.
author: Dale Carnegie

quote: Your success and happiness lies in you. Resolve to keep happy, and your joy and you shall form an invincible host against difficulties.
author: Helen Keller

quote: Your successes and happiness are forgiven you only if you generously consent to share them.
author: Albert Camus

quote: Your talent is God's gift to you. What you do with it is your gift back to God.
author: Leo Buscaglia

quote: Your theory is crazy, but it's not crazy enough to be true.
author: Niels Bohr

quote: Your true traveller finds boredom rather agreeable than painful. It is the symbol of his liberty - his excessive freedom. He accepts his boredom, when it comes, not merely philosophically, but almost with pleasure.
author: Aldous Huxley

quote: Your vision will become clear only when you can look into your own heart. Who looks outside, dreams who looks inside, awakes.
author: Carl Jung

quote: Your words are my food, your breath my wine. You are everything to me.
author: Sarah Bernhardt

quote: Youth has no age.
author: Pablo Picasso

quote: Youth is a blunder Manhood a struggle, Old Age a regret.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Youth is a wonderful thing. What a crime to waste it on children.
author: George Bernard Shaw

quote: Youth is easily deceived because it is quick to hope.
author: Aristotle

quote: Youth is happy because it has the ability to see beauty. Anyone who keeps the ability to see beauty never grows old.
author: Franz Kafka

quote: Youth is the best time to be rich, and the best time to be poor.
author: Euripides

quote: Youth is the period in which a man can be hopeless. The end of every episode is the end of the world. But the power of hoping through everything, the knowledge that the soul survives its adventures, that great inspiration comes to the middle-aged.
author: Gilbert K. Chesterton

quote: Youth is the trustee of prosperity.
author: Benjamin Disraeli

quote: Youth smiles without any reason. It is one of its chiefest charms.
author: Thomas Gray

quote: Zeal will do more than knowledge.
author: William Hazlitt

quote: Zeal without knowledge is fire without light.
author: Thomas Fuller

quote: Zealous men are ever displaying to you the strength of their belief, while judicious men are showing you the grounds of it.
author: William Shenstone

quote: Zen does not confuse spirituality with thinking about God while one is peeling potatoes. Zen spirituality is just to peel the potatoes.
author: Alan Watts

quote: Zest is the secret of all beauty. There is no beauty that is attractive without zest.
author: Christian Dior
